data.md: Therefore will I put forth fresh dear efforts vigorously. I will search such places held by Rāvana as I have not yet seen.

data.v: आपानशालाविचितास्तथा पुष्पगृहाणि च । चित्रशालाश्च विचिता भूयः क्रीडागृहाणि च ।।
data.es: 'I have searched the banquet halls, bowers of creepers, picture galleries and gymnasiums. I have searched everywhere through the paths of gardens and mansions, harems and the Pushpaka chariot also.
data.anv: पानशालाः banquet halls, विचिताः searched, तथा so also, पुष्पगृहाणि च bowers of creepers, चित्रशालाश्च picture galleries, विचिताः searched, भूयः further, क्रीडागृहाणि च and sports galleries, निष्कुटान्तररथ्याश्च paths through the gardens and mansions, female apartments, विमानानि च of the chariot, सर्वशः everywhere.

data.v: निष्कुटान्तररथ्याश्च विमानानि च सर्वशः । इति संचिन्त्य भूयोऽपि विचेतुमुपचक्रमे ।।
भूमीगृहांश्चैत्यगृहान्गृहातिगृहकानपि । उत्पतन्निपतंश्चापि तिष्ठन्गच्छन्पुनः क्वचित् ।।
अपावृण्वंश्च द्वाराणि कपाटान्यवघट्टयन् । प्रविशन्निष्पतंश्चापि प्रपतन्नुत्पतन्नपि । सर्वमप्यवकाशं स विचचार महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The great vanara searched all over again and again jumping up and down, stopping for a while and moving, opening and closing doors, by crossing, entering and exiting, jumping up and down. Thus he moved about and searched whereever there was scope to search
data.anv: सः महाकपिः that great vanara, पुनः पुनः again and again, उत्पतन् jumping, निष्पतंश्चापि climbing down, तिष्ठन्  standing, गच्छन् going, द्वाराणि entrance, अपावृण्वन् opening, कवाटानि doors, अवघाटयन् crossing, प्रविशन् entering, निष्पतंश्चापि and coming out, प्रपतन् jumping down, उत्पतन्नपि climbing up, सर्वम् अपि and all over, अवकाशम् scope, विचचार searched.

data.v: चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि नावकाशः स विद्यते । रावणान्तःपुरे तस्मिन्यं कपिर्न जगाम सः ।।
data.es: Even a space of four fingers in the inner chambers of Ravana was not left out in his search for Sita.
data.anv: तस्मिन् in that, रावणान्तःपुरे in Ravana's inner chambers, सः कपिः monkey, यम् where, न जगाम did not go, सः he, अवकाशः scope, चतुरङ्गुलमात्रोऽपि even four fingers of space, न not विद्यते leaving.
data.md: There was not even space measuring four fingers in that inner apartment of Rāvana, to which the monkey did not repair.

data.v: प्राकरान्तररथ्याश्च वेदिकश्चैत्यसंश्रयाः । श्वभ्राश्च पुष्करिण्यश्च सर्वं तेनावलोकितम् ।।
data.es: He moved in the lanes inside the boundary walls, around the shrines, altars, wells and tanks whereever it was possible to look for.
data.anv: प्राकारान्तररथ्याश्च lanes inside the boundaries, चैत्यसंश्रयाः around shrines, वेदिकाः altars, दीर्घिकाः wells, पुष्करिण्यश्च tanks, सर्वम् everywhere, तेन by him, अवलोकितम् was seen.
data.md: And he saw the abodes of the nobility, the daises, the trees by the crossings, the holes, and the tanks.

data.v: राक्षस्यो विविधाकारा विरूपा विकृतास्तथा । दृष्टा हनूमता तत्र न तु सा जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: Hanuman could see only ogresses of different typesugly, deformed but could not find the daughter of Janaka.
data.anv: विविधाकाराः of different types, विरूपाः ugly, तथा so also, विकृताः deformed, राक्षस्यः ogresses, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, सा she, जनकात्मजा तु daughter of Janaka, न not found.
data.md: And Hanumān saw there Räksasas of various forms, frightful and deformed; but he saw not Janaka's daughter.

data.v: रूपेणाप्रतिमा लोके वरा विद्याधर स्त्रियः । दृष्टा हनूमता तत्र न तु राघवनन्दिनी ।।
data.es: Hanuman could see only ogresses of different typesugly, deformed but could not find the daughter of Janaka.
data.anv: विविधाकाराः of different types, विरूपाः ugly, तथा so also, विकृताः deformed, राक्षस्यः ogresses, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, सा she, जनकात्मजा तु daughter of Janaka, न not found.
data.md: Hanuman there the the foremost and beautiful wives of Vidyadharas; but he saw not Rāghava's beloved Sītā.

data.v: नागकन्या वरारोहाः पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाः । दृष्टा हनूमता तत्र न तु सीता सुमध्यमा ।।
data.es: Hanuman could see there moonfaced daughters of nagas with charming limbs but not the slimwaisted Sita.
data.anv: वरारोहाः lovely women with symmetrical limbs, पूर्णचन्र्दनिभाननाः moonfaced women, नागकन्याः daughters of nagas, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, सुमध्यमा a woman of lovely waist, सीता तु Sita, न not found.
data.md: Hanumān saw there transcendentally beautiful women, daughter of Nāgas, having countenances resembling the moon; but he saw not Janaka's daughter. saw

data.v: प्रमथ्य राक्षसेन्द्रेण नागकन्या बलाद्धृताः । दृष्टा हनूमता तत्र न सा जनकनन्दिनी ।।
data.es: Hanuman could see even the women of vidyadharas who were matchless in beauty among women in the world but not Janaki the beloved of Raghava.
data.anv: रूपेण in beauty, लोके in the world, अप्रतिमाः incomparable, वराः best, विद्याधरस्त्रियः Vidyadhara women, तत्र there, हनुमता by Hanuman, दृष्टाः were seen, राघवनन्दिनी तु beloved of Raghava, न not find.
data.md: And Hanumān saw there daughter of Nāgas forcibly brought by the lord of the Rākşasas; but he saw not Janaka's daughter.

data.v: सोऽपश्यंस्तां महाबाहुः पश्यंश्चान्या वरस्त्रियः । विषसाद महाबाहुर्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The longarmed Hanuman, son of the Windgod was able to see other great women but not Sita. So he became despondent.
data.anv: महाबाहुः longarmed, धीमान् wise one, मारुतात्मजः son of the Wind god, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, ताम् her, अपश्यन् while being unable to see, अन्याः other, वरस्त्रियः great women, पश्यन् while seeing, मुहुः again, विषसाद was sorrowful.
data.md: Having seen other beauteous females, and not seeing her, the mighty-armed son of the Windgod was oppressed with sandness.

data.v: उद्योगं वानरेन्द्राणं प्लवनं सागरस्य च । व्यर्थं वीक्ष्यानिलसुतश्चिन्तां पुनरुपागमत् ।।
data.es: The son of the Wind god, the great monkey realised the futility of his efforts in crossing the sea. He brooded again.
data.anv: वानरेन्द्राणाम् of the great vanara, उद्योगम् effort, सागरस्य ocean's, प्लवनं च in crossing, व्यर्थम् wasted, वीक्ष्य after seeing that, अनिलसुतः son of the Windgod, पुनः again, चिन्ताम् worry, उपागमत् experienced.
data.md: Seeing that the endeavours of the monarch of monkeys, as well as the bounding over the main, had come to nought, the offspring of the Windgod was plunged in thought.

data.v: अवतीर्य विमानाच्च हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । चिन्तामुपजगामाथ शोकोपहतचेतनः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, son of the Windgod, came out of the aerial chariot, mind stricken with grief and started thinking again.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्वादशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twelfth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अथ now, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, विमानात् from the aerialchariot, अवतीर्य after descending, शोकोपहतचेतनः mind stricken with grief, चिन्ताम् worry, उपजगाम he experienced.
data.md: Descending from the aerial car, Hanumān, son to the Wind-god, his senses deprived by sorrow, was again wrought up with anxiety.

data.v: विमानात्तु सुसंक्रम्य प्राकारं हरियूथपः । हनूमान्वेगवानासीद्यथा विद्युद्घनान्तरे ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the vanara leader, jumped from the aerial chariot to the boundary wall like a flash of lightning in the clouds.
data.anv: हरियूथपः vanara leader, हनुमान् Hanuman, विमानात् from the aerial chariot, प्राकारम् boundary wall, सुसम्क्रम्य jumped, घनान्तरे in the clouds, विद्युत् यथा like the lightning, वेगवान् speedily, आसीत् appeared.
data.md: Alighting from the car, Hanumān possessed of vigorous activity, leader of monkeybands-nearing the wall, looked like lightning within a mass of clouds.

data.v: संपरिक्रम्य हनुमान्रावणस्य निवेशनान् । अदृष्ट्वा जानकीं सीतामब्रवीद्वचनं कपिः ।।
data.es: Going round the palace of Ravana, unable to see Janaka's daughter Sita, Hanuman spoke thus to himself:
data.anv: कपिः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशनात् from the home, सम्परिक्रम्य going round, जानकीम् Janaka's daughter, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा not seeing, वचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: And having gone round the mansions of Ravana, and not seeing Janaki, the monkey Hanuman said,

data.v: भूयिष्ठं लोडिता लङ्का रामस्य चरता प्रियम् । न हि पश्यामि वैदेहीं सीतां सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम् ।।
data.es: "I have thoroughly surveyed the entire city of Lanka to please Rama, but I am unable to find Sita of flawless beauty.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, प्रियम् to please, चरता while doing, लङ्का Lanka, भूयिष्ठम् in and out, लोलिता checked thoroughly, सर्वाङ्गशोभनाम् of beautiful limbs, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, सीताम् Sita, न हि पश्यामि I have not seen.
data.md: Striving after Rāma's welfare, I have again searched through Lankā; but I do not see Vaidehi's daughter, Janaki, having all her limbs endeued with loveliness.

data.v: पल्वलानि तटाकानि सरांसि सरितस्तथा । नद्योऽनूपवनान्ताश्च दुर्गाश्च धरणीधराः । लोडिता वसुधा सर्वा न च पश्यामि जानकीम् ।।
data.es: "I have searched for Sita thoroughly in waterlogs, lakes, tanks, streams and rivers and all over the woods and among mountains that are difficult to reach. I have searched all over the land but have not been able to find Janaki.
data.anv: पल्वलानि waterlogs, तटाकानि tanks, सरांसि lakes, तथा similarly, सरितः streams, नद्यः rivers, अनूपवनान्ताश्च along the woods, दुर्गाः difficult places to reach, धरणीधराः mountains, सर्वा: all, वसुधा over the land, लोलिता searched, जानकीं तु but Janaki, न पश्यामि I have not seen.
data.md: And I have explored pools, and watery expanses, and tanks, and rivers, and streams, and marshes, and and woods, and citadels, and mountains, yea, all this earth; but Janaki I do not fimd.

data.v: इह संपातिना सीता रावणस्य निवेशने । आख्याता गृध्रराजेन न च पश्यामि तामहम् ।।
data.es: "Sampati, king of vultures had said that Sita is at Ravana's palace. But I have not been able to see her.
data.anv: सीता Sita, इह here, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने in his palace, गृध्रराजेन by the king of vultures, सम्पातिना by Sampati, आख्याता has told, अहम् I, ताम् her, न च पश्यामि but have not seen her.
data.md: The vulture-king Sampati had told that Sītā was in the mansion of Rāvaņa. But why do I not see her (here)?

data.v: किं नु सीताथ वैदेही मैथिली जनकात्मजा । उपतिष्ठेत विवशा रावणं दुष्टचारिणम् ।।
data.es: "Can it be that Mythili, daughter of Janaka, dejected and helpless succumbed to the evil intentions of Ravana.
data.anv: अथ now, वैदेही princess of Videha, मैथिली Mythili, जनकत्माजा Janaka's daughter, सीता Sita, विवशा dejected helpless, दुष्टचारिणम् a man of evilconduct, रावणम् to Ravana, किं नु उपतिष्ठेत  did she succumb?
data.md: Or dose Maithili Sītā, daughter to Janaka, sprung in the Vaidehī line, forcibly carried off (by Rāvaņa), and completely in his power, abide by the mandate (of that monarch)?

data.v: क्षिप्रमुत्पततो मन्ये सीतामादाय रक्षसः । बिभ्यतो रामबाणानामन्तरा पतिता भवेत् ।।
data.es: "Or, perhaps she might have been dropped midway from the hold of Ravana while he was flying at great speed, afraid of the deadly arrows of Rama?
data.anv: रामबाणानाम् of the arrows of Rama, बिभ्यतः out of fear, रक्षसः the demon, सीताम् Sita, आदाय having brought, क्षिप्रम् at great speed, उत्पततः while flying, अन्तरा in the middle, पतिता dropped, भवेत् may be, मन्ये I think.
data.md: I conceive that while taking Sītā, the Rākşasa darted upward, he being influenced by fear of Rāma's shafts; (and accordingly losing control over his movements), she fell off by the way.

data.v: अथ वा ह्रियमाणायाः पथि सिद्धनिषेविते । मन्ये पतितमार्याया हृदयं प्रेक्ष्य सागरम् ।।
data.es: "Or, perhaps while being borne away on the path frequented by siddhas, the beloved of Rama might have fallen down (dead), heart broken, on seeing the (vast) sea.
data.anv: अथवा or else, सिद्धनिषेविते frequented by siddhas, पथि on the path, ह्रियमाणायाः while being borne away, आर्यायाः of the noble lady, हृदयम् heart, सागरम् sea, प्रेक्ष्य on seeing, पतितम् fallen, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Or I fancy that while that noble lady was being carried away along the way ranged by Siddhas, she lost her life on beholding the ocean.

data.v: रावणस्योरुवेगेन भुजाभ्यां पीडितेन च । तया मन्ये विशालाक्ष्या त्यक्तं जीवितमार्यया ।।
data.es: "He thinks, on account of the high speed during the flight of Ravana under the pressure of his arms, the noble, largeeyed lady might have given up her life.
data.anv: रावणस्य Ravana's, उरुवेगेन by the high speed in the flight, भुजाभ्याम् with the arms, पीडितेन च being under pressure, विशालाक्ष्या by the largeeyed one, तया by her, आर्यया by the noble lady, जीवितम् life, त्यक्तम् given up, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Or I think that on account of the vehement spced assumed by Rāvana, and also oppressed with his arms, that large-eyed noble lady has been bereft of her life.

data.v: उपर्युपरि वा नूनं सागरं क्रमतस्तदा । विवेष्टमाना पतिता समुद्रे जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: "Surely, she might have fallen into the sea while wriggling in her effort to extricate herself from the hold of Ravana as he was flying over the sea.
data.anv: तदा then, सागरम् उपर्युपरि higher and higher over the sea, क्रमतः for him while he advanced, जनकात्मजा Janaki, विवेष्टमाना wriggling hard to extricate, सागरे in the sea, नूनम् surely, पतिता fallen.
data.md: For certain, while (Ravana) was soaring higher and higher, Janaka's daughter, rolling (on the car), dropped down into the sea.

data.v: आहो क्षुद्रेण चानेन रक्षन्ती शीलमात्मनः । अबन्धुर्भक्षिता सीता रावणेन तपस्विनी ।।
data.es: "Oh poor Sita, distanced from relations, while protecting her chastity helplessly she might have been devoured by cruel Ravana.
data.anv: अहो Oh, आत्मनः of her self, शीलम् chastity, रक्षन्ती while protecting, अबन्धुः distanced from relatives, तपस्विनी a helpless woman, सीता Sita, क्षुद्रेण by the cruel one, अनेन by him, रावणेन by Ravana, भक्षिता eaten.

data.v: अथ वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य पत्नीभिरसितेक्षणा । अदुष्टा दुष्टभावाभिर्भक्षिता सा भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Or else, the pious, blackeyed Sita might have been eaten by the the cruelnatured wives of the lord of demons.
data.anv: अथवा or else, अदुष्टा a pious lady, असितेक्षणा blackeyed one, सा that, दुष्टभावाभिः by the cruelnatured, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य of the lord of rakshasas, पत्नीभिः by wives also, भक्षिता eaten, भविष्यति I think.
data.md: Alas! trying to preserve her chastity, the forlorn Sītā, practising self-mortification, has been devoured by this abject-minded Rāvana. Or that darkeyed innocent one, has been eaten up by the wives of the Rākşasa chief, actuated by wicked motives.* *Jealously, according to the commentator.

data.v: संपूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमं पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् । रामस्य ध्यायती वक्त्रं पञ्चत्वं कृपणा गता ।।
data.es: "Or, she might have attained death, meditating on Rama, whose face resembles the fullmoon and eyes the lotus petals.
data.anv: कृपणा poor lady, सम्पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतिमम् like the fullmoon, पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणम् with eyes like lotus petals, रामस्य Rama's, वक्त्रम् face, ध्यायती meditating on, पञ्चत्वम् death, गता attained.
data.md: (Ever) contemplating Rāma's countenance, resembling the full Moon, with eyes like lotusleaves, she, exercised with sorrow, has breathed her last.

data.v: हा राम लक्ष्मणेत्येव हायोध्येति च मैथिली । विलप्य बहु वैदेही न्यस्तदेहा भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Or, Vaidehi, the princess of Mithila might have cast off her life grieving intensely and crying, 'Alas, Rama, alas, Lakshmana, alas, Ayodhya'. (Mithila is the name of the capital city and Videha is the country which was ruled by Janaka. Sita, the princess is known as Vaidehi, Mythili and Janaki).
data.anv: वैदेही Vaidehi, मैथिली Mythili, हा राम Alas, Rama, हा लक्ष्मण alas, Lakshmana, हा अयोध्या alas, Ayodhya, इति thus, बहु very much, विलप्य weaping, न्यस्तदेहा cast off life, भविष्यति may be.
data.md: Bewailing much with exclamations of 'Oh Rama and Laksmana!' 'Ah Ayodhya!' that lady Vaidehi has renounced her body.

data.v: अथ वा निहिता मन्ये रावणस्य निवेशने । नूनं लालप्यते मन्दं पञ्जरस्थेव शारिका ।।
data.es: "Or, I think Sita might have been imprisoned in a cage like a myna in Ravana's palace. She will be surely crying.
data.anv: अथवा or else, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने in his palace, निहिता kept, सीता Sita, पञ्जरस्था in the cage, शारिका इव like myna, नूनम् surely, लालप्यते crying, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Or secretly kept in Rāvana's mansion, that girl, like a female parrot in a cage, is weeping bitterly.

data.v: जनकस्य कुले जाता रामपत्नी सुमध्यमा । कथमुत्पलपत्राक्षी रावणस्य वशं व्रजेत् ।।
data.es: "How could Janaki, the daughter of Janaka, Rama's wife, the lady with a beautiful waist and eyes like lotus petals, come under the fold of Ravana?
data.anv: जनकस्य Janaka's, सुता daughter, रामपत्नी Rama's wife, सुमध्यमा a lady of beautiful waist, उत्पलपत्राक्षी eyes like lotus petals, सीता Sita, रावणस्य Ravana's, वशम् fold, कथम् how, व्रजेत् can come under.
data.md: How can the slender-waisted wife of Rāma, born in the race of Janaka, furnished with eyes resembling lotus petals, come under the sway of Ravana?

data.v: विनष्टा वा प्रनष्टा वा मृता वा जनकात्मजा । रामस्य प्रियभार्यस्य न निवेदयितुं क्षमम् ।।
data.es: "Whether Janaki is lost or irretrievable or dead is not known The news should not be reported to Rama, who is very fond of his wife.
data.anv: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, विनष्टा वा whether lost, प्रणष्टा वा or whether irretrievable, मृता वा or dead, प्रियभार्यस्य for him who is fond of his wife, रामस्य of Rama, निवेदयितुम् to report, न क्षमम् not proper.
data.md: I shall not be able to say of Rāma's beloved wife that she has been sullied, or that I have seen her, or yet that she is dead. To say this is censurable; not to say it is also such. *This is evidently the sense, having regard to the preceding sloku, although the commentator gives the apparent meaning of vinastha perished.

data.v: निवेद्यमाने दोषः स्याद्दोषः स्यादनिवेदने । कथं नु खलु कर्तव्यं विषमं प्रतिभाति मे ।।
data.es: "To carry or not to carry this news to Rama would be a mistake. What shall I do? I am facing a tough situation.
data.anv: निवेद्यमाने by informing this, दोषः mistake, स्यात् may be, अनिवेदने by not informing, दोषः mistake, स्यात् may be, कथम् how, कर्तव्यं नु खलु what to do, मे to me, विषमम् difficult, प्रतिभाति appears.
data.md: What is my course? I find myself in a false position. Things having drifted to this pass, what should I say, now that the time has come?'

data.v: अस्मिन्नेवंगते कर्ये प्राप्तकालं क्षमं च किम् । भवेदिति मतिं भूयो हनुमान्प्रविचारयन् ।।
data.es: "I wonder what the right course of action is when things have taken such a turn? What is proper for me to do? Hanuman once again deliberated.
data.anv: अस्मिन् in this, कार्ये in this regard, एवं गते when things took such a turn, प्राप्तकालम् right time, क्षमम् proper, किम् what, भवेत् will be, इति thus, मतम् opinion, हनुमान् Hanuman, भूयः once again, प्रविचारयत् deliberated.
data.md: Thus thinking, Hanumān again reflected, "If without seeing Sītā, I repair to the abode of the lord of monkeys, what then shall I gain as the object of my exertions?

data.v: यदि सीतामदृष्ट्वाहं वानरेन्द्रपुरीमितः । गमिष्यामि ततः को मे पुरुषार्थो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "If I return to Kishkinda without seeing Sita of what use is my effort? What have I accomplished? What will happen? (Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha are the four Purusharthas or accomplishments in life)
data.anv: अहम् I, सीताम् Sita, अदृष्ट्वा without seeing, इतः from here, वानरेन्द्रपुरीम् city of vanaras, गमिष्यामि I reach, यदि if, ततः then, कः what (has been accomplished), पुरुषार्थः accomplishment, भविष्यति will happen.
data.md: Thus thinking, Hanumān again reflected, "If without seeing Sītā, I repair to the abode of the lord of monkeys, what then shall I gain as the object of my exertions?

data.v: ममेदं लङ्घनं व्यर्थं सागरस्य भविष्यति । प्रवेशश्चिव लङ्काया राक्षसानां च दर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "My crossing the ocean, my entry into Lanka and my survey of the demons are all futile.
data.anv: मम my, इदम् this, सागरस्य of the ocean, लङ्घनम् crossing, लङ्कायाः of Lanka, प्रवेशश्च entry, राक्षसानाम् of ogres, दर्शनम् seeing, व्यर्थम् futile, भविष्यति would be.
data.md: This my bounding over the main comes to nought; as also my entry into Lank, and the sight of the Rākşasas.

data.v: किं वा वक्ष्यति सुग्रीवो हरयो व समागताः । किष्किन्धां समनुप्राप्तौ तौ वा दशरथात्मजौ ।।
data.es: "What will Sugriva or even the vanaras and the two sons of Dasaratha say when I reach Kishkinda?
data.anv: किष्किन्धाम् at Kishkinda, समनुप्राप्तम् reached, माम् to me, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, किम् what, वक्ष्यति he says, समागताः collected, हरयः वा even vanaras, तौ those two, दशरथात्मजौ वा sons of Dasaratha.
data.md: And what shall Sugrīva say? Or the assembled monkeys; or those twin sons of Dasaratha; to me when I shall have come to Kiskindhā?

data.v: गत्वा तु यदि काकुत्स्थं वक्ष्यामि परमप्रियम् । न दृष्टेति मया सीता ततस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "If I report the most unpleasant news that Sita was not found, Rama will give up his life.
data.anv: गत्वा after reaching, काकुत्स्थम् Kakutstha, मया by me, सीता Sita, न दृष्टा not seen, इति like this, परम् most, अप्रियम् unpleasant, वक्ष्यामि यदि if I say, ततः then, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति he will give up.
data.md: If going there, I should say a harsh speech to Kākutstha-'I have not seen Sitā'-he shall renounce his life.

data.v: परुषं दारुणं क्रूरं तीक्ष्णमिन्द्रियतापनम् । सीतानिमित्तं दुर्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा स न भविष्यति ।।
data.anv: परुषम् harsh, दारुणम् dreadful, क्रूरम् cruel, तीक्ष्णम् sharp, इन्द्रियतापनम् that which can scorch senses, सीतानिमित्तम् about Sita, दुर्वाक्यम् unwelcome words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सः Rama, न भविष्यति will not live.
data.md: Hearing harsh, terrible, unsufferable, fierce and foul words concerning Sītă, calculated to set the senses on fire, he shall not exist.

data.v: तं तु कृच्छ्रगतं दृष्ट्वा पञ्चत्वगतमानसं । भृशानुरक्तो मेधावी न भविष्यति लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: "Seeing Rama in such a painful state, wise Lakshmana who has given his life to Rama, to whom he is deeply devoted will also not survive.
data.anv: कृच्छ्रगतम्  in painful state, पञ्चत्वगतमानसम् one who has almost given his life, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, भृशानुरक्तः deeply devoted, मेधावी wise, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, न भविष्यति will not survive.
data.md: Seeing him come under misery, with his mind expiring, the intelligent Laksmana, firmly attached (to Rāma), shall also cease to exist.

data.v: विनष्टौ भ्रातरौ श्रुत्वा भरतोऽपि मरिष्यति । भरतं च मृतं दृष्ट्वा शत्रुघ्नो न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "On hearing the death of both the brothers Bharata will also die. On seeing this Satrughna will also not live.
data.anv: भ्रातरौ both brothers, विनष्टौ dead, श्रुत्वा after hearing, भरतोऽपि Bharata also, मरिष्यति will die, मृतम् dead, भरतम् of Bharata, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, शत्रुघ्नश्च even Satrughna, न भविष्यति will not live.
data.md: And hearing that his two brothers are dead, Bharata also shall give up existence. And seeing Bharata dead, Śatrughna shall also renounce his life.

data.v: पुत्रान्मृतान्समीक्ष्याथ न भविष्यन्ति मातरः । कौसल्या च सुमित्रा च कैकेयी च न संशयः ।।
data.anv: अथ then, मातरः mothers, कौसल्या च and Kausalya, सुमित्रा च even Sumitra, कैकेयी च even Kaikeyi, पुत्रान् of sons, मृतान् of their death, समीक्ष्य on seeing, न भविष्यन्ति will not be able to live, संशयः न no doubt.
data.md: And beholding their sons dead, their mothers, Kausalya, Sumitra and kaikayi, shall, certainly, resign their lives,

data.v: कृतज्ञः सत्यसंधश्च सुग्रीवः प्लवगाधिपः । रामं तथा गतं दृष्ट्वा ततस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "On seeing that Rama has ended his life, the grateful and truthful monkey leader, Sugriva will give up his life.
data.anv: कृतज्ञः grateful, सत्यसन्धः truthful, प्लवगाधिपः leader of monkeys, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तथा likewise, गतम् gone, रामम् Rama, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, ततः then, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति will give up.
data.md: Seeing Rāma in that plight, the lord of the monkeys, Sugrīva, grateful and having his heart fast fixed in truth, shall give up his life.

data.v: दुर्मना व्यथिता दीना निरानन्दा तपस्विनी । पीडिता भर्तृशोकेन रुमा त्यक्ष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "Distressed, disheartened, pained and grieved on account of her husband's death, the virtuous lady Ruma (wife of Sugriva) will be unhappy and die.
data.anv: भर्तृशोकेन on account of her husband's grief, पीडिता tormented, दुर्मनाः disheartened, व्यथिता pained, दीना dejected, निरानन्दा unhappy, तपस्विनी helpless, रुमा Ruma, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यति will give up.
data.md: Rumā, aggrieved, heart-wrung, distressed and bereft of happiness and assuming the garb of a female ascetic, because of grief for her husband, shall resign her existence.

data.v: वालिजेन तु दुःखेन पीडिता शोककर्शिता । पञ्चत्वगमने राज्ञस्तारापि न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Tara who is troubled by Vali's death and tortured with grief will not live when king Sugriva dies.
data.anv: वालिजेन caused by Vali, दुःखेन by sorrow, पीडिता troubled, शोककर्शिता fertured with grief, तारापि Tara too, राज्ञि when the king, पञ्चत्वम् gone to other world, गते having gone, न भविष्यति will not live
data.md: And oppressed with grief arising from Vāli, and weighed down by sorrow, the queen Tārā, also, resolving on death shall cease to exist.

data.v: मातापित्रोर्विनाशेन सुग्रीव व्यसनेन च । कुमारोऽप्यङ्गदः कस्माद्धारयिष्यति जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "On account of his parents death and also because of Sugriva's calamity, Angada will give up his life.
data.anv: कुमारः prince, अङ्गदोऽपि Angada also, मातापित्रोः of his mother and father, विनाशेन by death, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, व्यसनेन by calamity, जीवितम् life, कस्मात् why, धारयिष्यति will retain.
data.md: In consequence of the death of his father and mother and the calamity befalling Sugrīva, the prince Angada also shall next forego his existence.

data.v: भर्तृजेन तु शोकेन अभिभूता वनौकसः । शिरांस्यभिहनिष्यन्ति तलैर्मुष्टिभिरेव च ।।
data.es: "The grief due to the death of their king will make the vanaras hit their heads with their palms and fists.
data.anv: नौकसः vanaras, भर्तृजेन on account of the events affecting their king, दुःखेन by grief, अभिभूताः overpowered, तलैः with their palms, मुष्टिभिरेव च and with their fists, शिरांसि their heads, अभिहनिष्यन्ति will hit themselves.

data.v: सान्त्वेनानुप्रदानेन मानेन च यशस्विना । लालिताः कपिराजेन प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यन्ति वानराः ।।
data.es: "The vanaras who were reared by the king's kind words, gifts and care will give up their life.
data.anv: यशस्स्विना by the illustrious one, कपिराजेन by the king of vanaras, सान्त्वेन by good words, अनुप्रदानेन by offering gifts, मानेन by respecting, लालिताः reared, वानराः vanaras, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यन्ति will give up.
data.md: The dwellers of the woods overwhelmed with grief got of (the decease of) their master, shall strike at their heads with their clenched fists and hands. And the monkeys affectionately cherished by the famous lord of the monkeys with soothing words gifts and regard, shall resign there lives.

data.v: न वनेषु न शैलेषु न निरोधेषु वा पुनः । क्रीडामनुभविष्यन्ति समेत्य कपिकुञ्जराः ।।
data.es: "The chiefs among vanaras together will not enjoy their life in the forest or mountains or caves.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जराः chiefs among vanaras, समेत्य collected together, वनेषु in the forest, क्रीडाम् play, न अनुभविष्यन्ति will not enjoy, शैलेषु on the mountains, न निरोधेषु वा or in the caves, पुनः again, न not.
data.md: No more in woods, and rocks, or secret spots, shall the foremost monkeys, assembled together, indulge in sports.

data.v: सपुत्रदाराः सामात्या भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः । शैलाग्रेभ्यः पतिष्यन्ति समेत्य विषमेषु च ।।
data.es: "Tormented by their king's death the vanaras with their wives, sons and ministers will drop down from the mountain peaks on the rough ground and die.
data.anv: सपुत्रदाराः with sons and wives, सामात्याः with ministers together, भर्तृव्यसनपीडिताः tormented by the suffering of their king's death, शैलाग्रेभ्यः from the mountain peaks, समेषु on the plains, विषमेषु च and on uneven grounds, पतिष्यन्ति will fall (drop down).
data.md: They, along with their sons and wives, and counsellors, distressed on account the disaster that has overtaken their master, shall fall from the tops of mountains down to places even or uneven.

data.v: विषमुद्बन्धनं वापि प्रवेशं ज्वलनस्य वा । उपवासमथो शस्त्रं प्रचरिष्यन्ति वानराः ।।
data.es: "The vanaras will put an end to their lives by poisoning or by hanging or by selfimmolation or by killing themselves with weapons or by fasting unto death.
data.anv: वानराः vanaras, विषम् poison, उद्बन्धनं वापि or by hanging, ज्वलनस्य in the fire, प्रवेशं वा entering, उपवासम् by fasting, अथो or, शस्त्रम् weapon, प्रचरिष्यन्ति they will use to put an end.
data.md: The monkeys shall take poison, or hang themselves, or enter into flaming fire, or fast, or fall on their own weapons.

data.v: घोरमारोदनं मन्ये गते मयि भविष्यति । इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च नाशश्चैव वनौकसाम् ।।
data.es: "If I go there (without finding Sita), it will cause destruction of the Ikshvakus and vanaras would weep. It would be dreadful.
data.anv: मयि गते when I go, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनाशश्च destruction of the Ikshvakus, वनौकसाम् of vanaras, नाशश्चैव destruction, घोरम् dreadful, आरोदनम् weeping, भविष्यति will be, मन्ये I think.
data.md: I fancy that a loud wailing shall arise on my return (to that place); and the race of Iksvāku as well as the rangets of the woods shall meet with destruction.

data.v: सोऽहं नैव गमिष्यामि किष्किन्धां नगरीमितः । न हि शक्ष्याम्यहं द्रष्टुं सुग्रीवं मैथिलीं विना ।।
data.es: "I will not go to the city of Kishkinda from here or to Sugriva without finding Mythili. It will not be possible for me to face him.
data.anv: अहम् I, इतः from here, किष्किन्धां नगरीम् to the city of Kishkinda, नैव गमिष्यामि I will not go, अहम् I, मैथिलीं Mythili, विना without, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, द्रष्टुम् to see, न च शक्ष्यामि not possible for me.
data.md: Therefore I will not repair hence to the city of Kiskindhā; nor can I see Sugrīva without Mithila's daughter.

data.v: मय्यगच्छति चेहस्थे धर्मात्मानौ महारथौ । आशया तौ धरिष्येते वनराश्च मनस्विनः ।।
data.es: Both the highsouled warrior princes treading a righteous path as well as the vanaras will survive with a hope of my return if I stay back.
data.anv: मयि when I, अगच्छति not go, इहस्थे stay here, धर्मात्मानौ righteous selves, महारथौ great warriors, तौ both, आशया with hope, धरिष्येते both will survive, मनस्विनः highsouled, वानराश्च vanaras also.
data.md: On my not going there and staying here, those righteous-souled Maharathas as well as the fastfleeting monkeys, shall preserve their lives through hope (of hearing tidings concerning Sītā). And not having seen Janaka's daughter, I will lead the Vānaprastha mode of life, partaking (of fruits) falling into my hands or mouth, restraining my senses, and staying at the foot of trees.

data.v: हस्तादानो मुखादानो नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः । वानप्रस्थो भविष्यामि अदृष्ट्वा जनकात्मजाम् ।।
data.es: "If Janaki is not found I will stay here and live like a hermit subsisting on whatever is available on this sea shore, which has abundance of roots, fruits and water.
data.anv: जनकात्मजाम् Janaka's daughter, अदृष्ट्वा by not seeing, हस्तादानः food available to hand, मुखादानः and mouth, नियतः strictly, बहुमूलफलोदके filled with fruits roots and water, सागरानूपजे on the shore of the sea, देशे here, वृक्षमूलिकः surviving on roots of trees, वानप्रस्थः like a hermit, भविष्यामि I will be.
data.md: On my not going there and staying here, those righteous-souled Maharathas as well as the fastfleeting monkeys, shall preserve their lives through hope (of hearing tidings concerning Sītā). And not having seen Janaka's daughter, I will lead the Vānaprastha mode of life, partaking (of fruits) falling into my hands or mouth, restraining my senses, and staying at the foot of trees.

data.v: सागरानूपजे देशे बहुमूलफलोदके । चितां कृत्वा प्रवेक्ष्यामि समिद्धमरणीसुतम् ।।
data.md: Preparing a funereal pile on a tract bordering on the sea, abounding in fruits, and flowers, and water, I will enter into flaming fire.

data.v: उपविष्टस्य वा सम्यग्लिङ्गिनं साधयिष्यतः । शरीरं भक्षयिष्यन्ति वायसाः श्वापदानि च ।।
data.es: "I will prepare a pyre and enter the fire so that sea waves wash off the ashes or crows and beasts will eat up my body while i sit fasting unto death.
data.anv: चिताम् pyre, कृत्वा having made, समिद्धम् lit, अरणीसुतम् fire sticks (fire), प्रवेक्ष्यामि will enter, वा or else, उपविष्टस्य seated here, लिङ्गिनीम् starving, साधयिष्यतः fast unto death, शरीरम् body, वायसाः crows, श्वापदानि च wild beasts, भक्षयिष्यन्ति  will eat.
data.md: As I sit to fast, and for effecting the separation of self from my body and centring my identity in the spirit crows and beasts of prey shall feed on my body.

data.v: इदमप्यृषिभिर्दृष्टं निर्याणमिति मे मतिः । सम्यगापः प्रवेक्ष्यामि न चेत्पश्यामि जानकीम् ।।
data.es: "I shall enter water and drown myself to death if I am not able to find Janaki. I think this way of ending life has been suggested by great ascetics.
data.anv: इदम् this, महर्षिभिः by ascetics, दृष्टम्  seen, निर्याणम् ending of life, इति like this, मे my, मतिः thought, जानकीम् Janaki, न चेत्पश्यामि if I am not able to see, सम्यक् right, आपः water, प्रवेक्ष्यामि will enter.
data.md: I think the sages have enjoyed another way of exit. I shall, failing to see Janaki, enter into water.

data.v: सुजातमूला सुभगा कीर्तिमालायशस्विनी । प्रभग्ना चिररात्रीयं मम सीतामपश्यतः ।।
data.es: My glory which had a good start (in the form of bringing Rama to Sugriva) and brought fortune to Sugriva and fame to me has been snapped as I could not find Sita.
data.anv: सीताम् Sita, अपश्यतः I could not find, मम for me, चिररात्रीयं this long night, सुजातमूला started well, सुभगा lovely, यशस्विनी glorious one, कीर्तिमाला famous one, प्रभग्ना is wasted.
data.md: My illustrious and exalted garland of fame, begot of excellent acts, has perished for good in consequence of my not seeing Sītā.* *Tirtha reads chiraratriyam for chiraratrya. Then the sense is. This illustrious live-long fairrooted and auspicious night crowned with a garland of fame, has borne no fruit, in consequence of my not seeing Sītă. The commentator, I presume, refines a little too much.

data.v: तापसो वा भविष्यामि नियतो वृक्षमूलिकः । नेतः प्रतिगमिष्यामि तामदृष्ट्वासितेक्षणाम् ।।
data.es: "I will remain an ascetic and do penance under the tree practising selfcontrol and not go back without seeing the blackeyed Sita.
data.anv: नियतः strictly, वृक्षमूलिकः resting under the tree, तापसो वा or an ascetic, भविष्यामि I will remain, असितेक्षणाम् blackeyed, ताम् her, अदृष्टवा without seeing, इतः from here, न प्रतिगमिष्यामि I will not go back.
data.md: Or restraining myself, I shall become an ascetic living underneath trees; but return I will not, without obtaining a sight of that dark-eyed damsel.

data.v: यदीतः प्रतिगच्छामि सीतामनधिगम्य ताम् । अङ्गदः सहितैः सर्वैर्वानरैर्न भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "Besides, if I go back without finding Sita all the vanaras including Angada will die.
data.anv: ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अनधिगम्य without finding, इतः from this place, प्रतिगच्छामि यदि if I go back, सर्वैः by all, तै: by those, वानरैः सह along with vanaras, अङ्गदः Angada, न भविष्यति will not live.
data.md: If I return without seeing Sītā, all the monkeys with Angada shall cease to exist.

data.v: विनाशे बहवो दोषा जीवन्प्राप्नोति भद्रकम् । तस्मात्प्राणान्धरिष्यामि ध्रुवो जीवति संगमः ।।
data.es: "If I commit suicide, I will earn numerous sins. By being alive, I can witness auspicious events. Therefore, I will live, for, happiness can come only to the living.
data.anv: विनाशे by comitting suicide, बहवः many, दोषाः sins, जीवन् by living, भद्राणि auspicious events, पश्यति can be experienced, तस्मात् therefore, प्राणान् life, धरिष्यामि I will sustain, जीवितसङ्गमः only a living person, ध्रुवः is certain
data.md: Incalculable are the ills of my putting a period to my existence; (on the other hand) if I live, I imay come by good. Therefore my life I will maintain. If I live, it may conduce to happiness."

data.v: एवं बहुविधं दुःखं मनसा धारयन्मुहुः । नाध्यगच्छत्तदा पारं शोकस्य कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
data.es: The elephant among monkeys (Hanuman) worrying over and over again, holding his head for long could not reach the end of his grief.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जरः the elephant among monkeys, एवम् that way, बहुविधम् in many ways, दुःखम् grief, मुहुः over and over, मनसा in mind, धारयन् by holding, तदा then, शोकस्य sorrow, पारम् long, नाध्यगच्छात् did not reach of the end.
data.md: Having thus indulged in a variety of harassing thoughts in his mind, that foremost of monkeys could not cross over to the other shore (of the sea of distress).

data.v: रावणं वा वधिष्यामि दशग्रीवं महाबलम् । काममस्तु हृता सीता प्रत्याचीर्णं भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "I will kill Ravana, this mighty, tenheaded demon. Sita was indeed carried away by him. This (killing him) can be a fitting reply to his evil action. My desire would be fulfilled.
data.anv: वा or, दशग्रीवम् tenheaded one, महाबलम् endowed with great strength, रावणम् Ravana, वधिष्यामि I will, हृता dead, सीता Sita, कामम् अस्तु desire will be fulfilled, प्रत्याचीर्णम् fitting reply, भविष्यति will be.
data.md: Then summoning energy, that elephantine monkey endued with fortitude reflected, Or I shall slay the Ten-necked Rāvaņa possessed of great strength. Sītā has been carried off; but by this I shall avenge myself.

data.v: अथ वैनं समुत्क्षिप्य उपर्युपरि सागरम् । रामायोपहरिष्यामि पशुं पशुपतेरिव ।।
data.es: "Or else, I shall carry him across the sea and put him before Rama like a bull as if he is a sacrificial prey to lord Siva."
data.anv: अथवा otherwise, एनम् him, सागरम् उपर्युपरि over the ocean, समुत्क्षिप्य by lifting across (like a sacrificial prey), पशुपतेः to lord Siva, पशुमिव like a bull, रामाय to Rama, उपहरिष्यामि I shall offer.
data.md: Or throwing him repeatedly into the sea, I (shall take him) and present him to Rāma, even as one presents a beast to Pasupat." 'An appellation of Siva-lit. lord of beasts-in allusion to animal sacrifices to Śiva.

data.v: इति चिन्ता समापन्नः सीतामनधिगम्य ताम् । ध्यानशोका परीतात्मा चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Distressed over his inability to find Sita, Hanuman's mind was overcome with anxiety and he started thinking further.
data.anv: वानरः vanara, ताम् her, सीताम् Sita, अनधिगम्य unable to find, इति thus, चिन्ताम् worry, समापन्नः distressed, ध्यानशोकपरीतात्मा whose mind was overcome with anxiety, चिन्तयामास started thinking further.
data.md: Reflecting thus, the monkey, not finding Sītā, agitated with sorrow and anxiety, thought.

data.v: यावत्सीतां न पश्यामि रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम् । तावदेतां पुरीं लङ्कां विचिनोमि पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: "Till I find the virtuous Sita, wife of Rama in this Lanka, I shall keep searching everywhere again and again.
data.anv: रामपत्नीम् Rama's wife, यशस्विनीम् famed, सीताम् Sita, यावत् until, पश्यामि I see, तावत् till then, एताम् this, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, पुनः पुनः again and again, विचिनोमि I will keep searching.
data.md: So long as I do not find the illustrious spouse of Rāma, Sītā, I will explore the city of Lankā again and again.

data.v: संपाति वचनाच्चापि रामं यद्यानयाम्यहम् । अपश्यन्राघवो भार्यां निर्दहेत्सर्ववानरान् ।।
data.es: "Had I brought Raghava following the words of Sampati, Rama would have burnt all vanaras unable to find his wife.
data.anv: सम्पातिवचनात् on Sampati's words, अहम् I, रामम् Rama, आनयामि यदि if I had brought, राघवः Raghava, भार्याम् wife, अपश्यन् unable to see, सर्ववानरान् all vanaras, निर्दहेत् would have burnt.
data.md: If in consonance with Sampat's speech, I bring Rāma hither, Rāghava, not seeing his wife, shall burn all the monkeys.

data.v: इहैव नियताहारो वत्स्यामि नियतेन्द्रियः । न मत्कृते विनश्येयुः सर्वे ते नरवानराः ।।
data.es: "I will stay here itself, restricting my food and controlling my senses. Let not men and monkeys perish for my fault.
data.anv: नियताहारः restricting food, नियतेन्द्रियः controlling senses, इहैव here itself, वत्स्यामि I will stay, मत्कृते for my fault, ते those, नरवानराः naras and vanaras, न विनश्येयुः will not perish.
data.md: (Therefore) even here I shall stay, restraining my fare and mortifying my senses. All those principal monkeys ought not to lose their lives because of any act to which I may commit myself.

data.v: अशोकवनिका चापि महतीयं महाद्रुमा । इमामभिगमिष्यामि न हीयं विचिता मया ।।
data.es: "Here is the Ashoka grove with huge trees. I will go there. I have not looked for her in this place.
data.anv: महाद्रुमा huge trees, या such, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका Ashoka grove, दृश्यते is seen, इमाम् there, अधिगमिष्यामि I will go, इयम् here, मया by me, न विचिता हि not looked for.
data.md: This is the Asoka wood, extensive and containing mighty trees. This I shall explore, as it has not yet been searched by me.

data.v: वसून्रुद्रांस्तथादित्यानश्विनौ मरुतोऽपि च । नमस्कृत्वा गमिष्यामि रक्षसां शोकवर्धनः ।।
data.es: "I shall offer salutations to Vasus, Rudras Adityas and Aswinis and proceed to increase (cause) the sorrow of the demons. (There are eight Vasus, eleven Rudras, twelve Adityas, two Ashwins and fortynine Windgods).
data.anv: वसून् Vasus, रुद्रान् Rudras, तथा likewise, आदित्यान् Adityas, अश्विनौ Aswinis, मरुतोऽपि च Maruts also, नमस्कृत्वा after offering salutations, रक्षसाम् of  demons, शोकवर्धनः increase grief, गमिष्यामि will go.
data.md: And saluting the Vasus, the Rudras, the Aditya, the twin Asvins, (and Rāma and Laks mana), I enhancing the sorrow of the Raksas, shall go into it.

data.v: जित्वा तु राक्षसान्देवीमिक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम् । संप्रदास्यामि रामाया यथासिद्धिं तपस्विने ।।
data.es: "I will conquer all the ogres and pass them to Sita, the delight of the Ikshvaku family as an offering and give Rama to her as the fruit of her austerities."
data.anv: सर्वान् all, राक्षसान् ogres, जित्वा तु having conquered, इक्ष्वाकुकुलनन्दिनीम् delight of Ikshvaku family, तपस्विने for the ascetic, सिद्धिं यथा an offering like, रामाय to Rama, सम्प्रदास्यामि I will offer.
data.md: Having vanquished the Rākşas, I will bestow on Rāma the lady of the Ikşvāku race like the fruit of asceticism conferred on an ascetic.

data.v: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यात्वा चिन्ताविग्रथितेन्द्रियः । उदतिष्ठन्महाबाहुर्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The brilliant son of the Windgod, Hanuman, whose senses were overwhelmed with worries, regained his senses in a short while and got up.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः हनुमान् Hanuman, चिन्तावग्रथितेन्द्रियः with senses overwhelmed by worries, मुहूर्तमिव for a while, ध्यात्वा after reflecting, उदतिष्ठत् got up.

data.v: नमोऽस्तु रामाय सलक्ष्मणाय; देव्यै च तस्यै जनकात्मजायै । नमोऽस्तु रुद्रेन्द्रयमानिलेभ्यो; नमोऽस्तु चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः ।।
data.es: "My salutations to Lakshmana, Rama and divine daughter of Janaka. Salutations to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu. Salutations to Sun, Moon and Maruts"
data.anv: सलक्ष्मणाय along with Lakshmana, रामाय to Rama, नमः salutations, अस्तु I offer, देव्यै to the divine lady, तस्यै to her, जनकात्मजायै च to Janaka's daughter, रुद्रेन्द्रयमानिलेभ्यः to Rudra, Indra, Yama and Vayu, नमः salutations, अस्तु be, चन्द्रार्कमरुद्गणेभ्यः Sun, Moon and Marutas, नमः salutations, अस्तु I offer.
data.md: Having thus reflected for a space, the mightyarmed offspring of the Wind-god, his senses agitated with anxiety, arose. “I bow to Rāma with Lakşmaņa, and to the revered daughter of Janaka, I bow to Rudra, and Indra, and Yama, and Wind-god, and I bow to the Moon, to Fire and to the Maruts."

data.v: स तेभ्यस्तु नमस्कृत्वा सुग्रीवाय च मारुतिः । दिशः सर्वाः समालोक्य अशोकवनिकां प्रति ।।
data.es: Having offered salutations to all gods as well as to Sugriva, he looked at all quarters and left for the Ashoka grove.
data.anv: स: मारुतिः that son of the Windgod, तेभ्यः to them, नमस्कृत्य having saluted, सुग्रीवाय च to Sugriva, सर्वाः all, दिशः quarters, समालोक्य looking at, अशोकवनिकाम् Ashoka grove, प्रति towards.
data.md: Having bowed to them all, as also to Sugrīva, the offspring of the Wind-god, surveying all he cardinal points, mentally entered the Asoka wood.

data.v: स गत्वा मनसा पूर्वमशोकवनिकां शुभाम् । उत्तरं चिन्तयामास वानरो मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Hanuman started thinking again about his task after reaching the auspicious Ashoka grove.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः Hanuman, सः वानरः the vanara, मनसा in his mind, पूर्वम् earlier, शुभाम् auspicious, अशोकवनिकाम् grove of Ashoka, गत्वा after going, उत्तरम् again, चिन्तयामास started thinking.
data.md: Having mentally entered the Asoka wood, that monkey, son to the Wind-god, reflected as to what he should do next.

data.v: ध्रुवं तु रक्षोबहुला भविष्यति वनाकुला । अशोकवनिका चिन्त्या सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता ।।
data.es: 'This Ashoka grove filled with many trees, guarded by many demons is carefully tended. It must be sacred.
data.anv: शोकवनिका Ashoka grove, ध्रुवम् surely, रक्षोबहुला guarded by many demons, वनाकुला with trees, सर्वसंस्कारसंस्कृता carefully tended, पुण्या sacred, भविष्यति it will be.
data.md: The sacred Asoka wood, sanctified with every purifying rite and abounding in woods, needs must be full of Rāksas.

data.v: रक्षिणश्चात्र विहिता नूनं रक्षन्ति पादपान् । भगवानपि सर्वात्मा नातिक्षोभं प्रवायति ।।
data.es: "The guards posted there are surely protecting the grove. The divinity pervading all over me (the wind) must also have been controlled as it is also not blowing violently. I have turned my body small for Rama's cause and also to save myself from Ravana.
data.anv: अत्र there, विहिताः posted, रक्षिणश्च guards, पादपान् trees, नूनम् surely, रक्षन्ति they are protecting, सर्वात्मा all pervading, भगवानपि divinity also, नातिक्षोभम् not violent, प्रवाति वै is blowing, मया my, रामार्थे for Rama's sake, रावणस्य च and Ravana also, अयम् this, आत्मा my own self, संक्षिप्तः made small.
data.md: And warders, directed there to, forsooth, protect the trees, and that worshipful Soul of the universe does not breathe here vigorously.

data.v: संक्षिप्तोऽयं मयात्मा च रामार्थे रावणस्य च । सिद्धिं मे संविधास्यन्ति देवाः सर्षिगणास्त्विह ।।
data.md: I contract my person in the interests of Rāma, and in order that Rāvana may not see me. May all the deities along with the saints confer success on me.

data.v: ब्रह्मा स्वयम्भूर्भगवान्देवाश्चैव दिशन्तु मे । सिद्धिमग्निश्च वायुश्च पुरुहूतश्च वज्रधृत् ।।
वरुणः पाशहस्तश्च सोमादित्यै तथैव च । अश्विनौ च महात्मानौ मरुतः सर्व एव च ।।
सिद्धिं सर्वाणि भूतानि भूतानां चैव यः प्रभुः । दास्यन्ति मम ये चान्ये अदृष्टाः पथि गोचराः ।।
तदुन्नसं पाण्डुरदन्तमव्रणं; शुचिस्मितं पद्मपलाशलोचनम् । द्रक्ष्ये तदार्यावदनं कदा न्वहं; प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: 'Oh when and how would I behold that beautiful noble lady of stainless character, with a Moonlike face, prominent nose, white teeth, pleasant smile and with eyes like lotus petals?
data.anv: उन्नसम् with high nose, पाण्डुरदन्तम् with white teeth, अव्रणम् with no wounds, शुचिस्मितम् with pleasing smile, पद्मपलाशलोचनम् eyes like lotus petals, प्रसन्नताराधिपतुल्यदर्शनम् who appears like the pleasant Moon, तत् that, तदार्यावदनम् beautiful face of the noble lady, अहम् I, कदा when, द्रक्ष्ये नु will I see.
data.md: When shall I behold the blameless face of that noble lady, with its protruding nose; having luminous smiles, having eyes resembling lotuspetals; and bright as the complacent lord of stars?

data.v: क्षुद्रेण पापेन नृशंसकर्मणा; सुदारुणालांकृतवेषधारिणा । बलाभिभूता अबला तपस्विनी; कथं नु मे दृष्टपथेऽद्य सा भवेत् ।।
data.es: "How will I set my eyes on that gentle, frail and suffering thing now, who has been abducted by that mean, cruel sinner of dreadful look?"इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयोदशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the thirteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: क्षुद्रेण by a mean one, पापेन by a sinner, नृशंसकर्मणा a man of cruel deeds, सुदारुणालङ्कृतवेषधारिणा endowed with a dreadful look, बलाभिभूता overpowered by force, तपस्विनी a suffering lady, सा that, अबला weak, अद्य now, मे my, दृष्टिपथे in the range of my view, कथं how, भवेत् नु will I.
data.md: Ah! today how shall feeble forlorn one that has been borne down by the force of the mean, abject and grim-visaged (Ravana), fierce yet wearing (at the time of the rape), a dress tending to inspire confidence, come in my sight?

data.v: स मुहूर्तमिव ध्यत्वा मनसा चाधिगम्य ताम् । अवप्लुतो महातेजाः प्राकारं तस्य वेश्मनः ।।
data.es: Mighty Hanuman lost in thought for a moment, jumped down (the harem) to the boundary wall of the palace.
data.anv: महातेजा mighty, सः that (Hanuman), मुहूर्तमिव for a short while, ध्यात्वे lost in thought, ताम् her, मनसा in the mind, अधिगम्य reached, तस्य वेश्मनः of that palace, प्राकारम् boundary, अवप्लुतः jumped.
data.md: Having reflected for a while and mentally met with her, that highly energetic one leapt from the wall of Rāvana's mansion on to that (of the Asoka wood).

data.v: स तु संहृष्टसर्वाङ्गः प्राकारस्थो महाकपिः । पुष्पिताग्रान्वसन्तादौ ददर्श विविधान्द्रुमान् ।।
data.es: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.
data.anv: प्राकारस्थः from the boundary, सः महाकपिः great vanara, संह्रष्टसर्वाङ्गः contracting his body, वसन्तादौ begining of  spring, पुष्पिताग्रान् blossoms on top, विविधान् several kinds, द्रुमान् trees, ददर्श saw, सालान् Salas, भव्यान् Bhavyas, अशोकान् Ashokas, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, चम्पकांश्च Champakas, उद्दालकान् Uddalakas, नागवृक्षान् Naga trees, चूतान् Mangoes, कपिमुखानपि as the snout of the monkeys

data.v: सालानशोकान्भव्यांश्च चम्पकांश्च सुपुष्पितान् । उद्दालकान्नागवृक्षांश्चूतान्कपिमुखानपि ।।
data.es: Standing on the boundary wall, the great vanara contracted his body and observed the blossoms on several tree tops---- Salas, lovely Ashoka trees and blossoms of champak, uddalaka, naga, mangoes with their fruits crimson as the snout of a monkey, it being the beginning of Spring.
data.anv: प्राकारस्थः from the boundary, सः महाकपिः great vanara, संह्रष्टसर्वाङ्गः contracting his body, वसन्तादौ begining of  spring, पुष्पिताग्रान् blossoms on top, विविधान् several kinds, द्रुमान् trees, ददर्श saw, सालान् Salas, भव्यान् Bhavyas, अशोकान् Ashokas, सुपुष्पितान् blossomed, चम्पकांश्च Champakas, उद्दालकान् Uddalakas, नागवृक्षान् Naga trees, चूतान् Mangoes, कपिमुखानपि as the snout of the monkeys

data.v: अथाम्रवणसंछन्नां लताशतसमावृताम् । ज्यामुक्त इव नाराचः पुप्लुवे वृक्षवाटिकाम् ।।
data.es: He penetrated like an arrow released from a bow the cluster of trees covering mango grove and overgrown with hundreds of creepers.
data.anv: अथ and then, आम्रवणसञ्छन्नाम् filled with mango groves, लताशतसमाकुलाम् overgrown with hundreds of creepers, वृक्षवाटिकाम् cluster of trees, ज्यामुक्तः released from bow, नाराचः इव like arrow, पुप्लुवे penetrated.

data.v: स प्रविष्य विचित्रां तां विहगैरभिनादिताम् । राजतैः काञ्चनैश्चैव पादपैः सर्वतोवृताम् ।।
विहगैर्मृगसंघैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम् । उदितादित्यसंकाशां ददर्श हनुमान्कपिः ।।
वृतां नानाविधैर्वृक्षैः पुष्पोपगफलोपगैः । कोकिलैर्भृङ्गराजैश्च मत्तैर्नित्यनिषेविताम् ।।
प्रहृष्टमनुजे कले मृगपक्षिसमाकुले । मत्तबर्हिणसंघुष्टां नानाद्विजगणायुताम् ।।
मार्गमाणो वरारोहां राजपुत्रीमनिन्दिताम् । सुखप्रसुप्तान्विहगान्बोधयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: The vanara who went searching for the paragon of virtue born of a noble family, awakened the birds who were happily asleep in their nests.
data.anv: वानरः vanara, वरारोहाम् born of a noble family, अनिन्दिताम् blameless, राजपुत्रीम् princess, मार्गमाणः searching, सुखप्रसुप्तान् happily sleeping, विहगान् birds, बोधयामास awakened.
data.md: As he was searching for that surpassingly beautiful and blameless daughter of the king, that monkey awakened the monkeys that were sleeping sweetly..

data.v: उत्पतद्भिर्द्विजगणैः पक्षैः सालाः समाहताः । अनेकवर्णा विविधा मुमुचुः पुष्पवृष्टयः ।।
data.es: As the birds flew away, the trees hit by the wings of birds showered flowers of different colours.
data.anv: उत्पतद्भिः by the flying ones, द्विजगणैः by flocks of birds, पक्षैः with wings, समाहताः hit, सालाः sala, अनेकवर्णाः of different colours, विविधाः many, पुष्पवृष्टयः showers of flowers, मुमुचुः let loose.
data.md: And blown against by the wind caused by the wings of the birds as they flew upwards, various and variegated trees showered down blossoms.

data.v: पुष्पावकीर्णः शुशुभे हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः । अशोकवनिकामध्ये यथा पुष्पमयो गिरिः ।।
data.es: Covered with flowers, Hanuman shone like a mountain of flowers in the midst of Ashoka grove.
data.anv: पुष्पावकीर्णः covered with flowers, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the middle of the Ashoka grove, पुष्पमयः full of flowers, गिरिः यथा like a mountain, शुशुभे shone.
data.md: And in the midst of the Asoka wood, Hanumān, son to the Wind-god, covered over with flowers, looked lovely like a hill strewn with blossoms.

data.v: दिशः सर्वाभिदावन्तं वृक्षषण्डगतं कपिम् । दृष्ट्वा सर्वाणि भूतानि वसन्त इति मेनिरे ।।
data.es: Beholding that sprightly monkey running in all directions, its body covered with variegated blossoms fallen from the trees, all living beings there thought that it was Spring personified
data.anv: ﻿ दृष्ट्वा beholding, दिशस्सर्वाः in all directions, प्रधावन्तं running, वृक्षषण्डगतं variegated flowers shed by trees, कपिम् monkey (Hanuman), सर्वाणि all, भूतानि living beings, वसन्त spring, इति मेनिरे this is spring
data.md: All creatures, beholding that monkey embosomed among trees and darting on all sides, took him for spring.

data.v: वृक्षेभ्यः पतितैः पुष्पैरवकीर्णा पृथग्विधैः । रराज वसुधा तत्र प्रमदेव विभूषिता ।।
data.es: Strewn with flowers of various colours fallen from the trees of various kinds, the goddess of earth looked charming like a young woman profusely bedecked.
data.anv: ﻿ पुष्पैरवकीर्णा strewn with flowers of various colours, पृथग्विदैः goddess of earth, पतितैः fallen, वृक्षेभ्यः from the trees of various kinds, रराज charming, तत्र there, प्रमदेव like young woman, विभूषिता profusely bedecked
data.md: And strewn with several masses of blossoms loosened from the trees, the Earth appeared breateous like a damsel dight with ornaments.

data.v: तरस्विना ते तरवस्तरसाभिप्रकम्पिताः । कुसुमानि विचित्राणि ससृजुः कपिना तदा ।।
data.es: Shaken vigorously by Hanuman of great speed, the trees shed their blooms of variegated colours.
data.anv: ﻿ तदा then, तरस्विना endowed with speed, कपिना by the monkey, तरसा speedily, अभिप्रकम्पिताः vigorously shaken, ते those, तरवः trees, विचित्राणि colourful, कुसुमानि flowers, ससृजुः showered.
data.md: And shaken in diverse ways by the motion of the light fleeting monkey, the tree showered many-hued flowers.

data.v: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः शीर्णपुष्पफलद्रुमाः । निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणा धूर्ता इव पराजिताः ।।
data.es: The tree tops, shorn of their leaves and flowers and fruits fallen, appeared like gamblers who had lost their stakes and had to lay down their clothes and ornaments.
data.anv: निर्धूतपत्रशिखराः with top branches shorn, शीर्णपुष्पफलाः with flowers and fruits shed, द्रुमाः trees, पराजिताः defeated, निक्षिप्तवस्त्राभरणाः with clothes and ornaments lost in gambling, धूर्ता इव like a gambler.
data.md: With their leaves and tops torn, and their flowers and fruits shrivelled up, the trees looked like worsted gamblers bereft of their clothes.

data.v: हनूमता वेगवता कम्पितास्ते नगोत्तमाः । पुष्पपर्णफलान्याशु मुमुचुः पुष्पशालिनः ।।
data.es: Shaken by the swift Hanuman, even the big trees dropped flowers, fruits and leaves.
data.anv: वेगवता by the swift, हनूमता Hanuman, कम्पिताः shaken, पुष्पशालिनः full of flowers and fruits, मुमुचुः dropped.
data.md: And shaken by Hanumān vehemently moving about, those excellent trees crowned with fruits, speedily cast off fruits, flowers and foliage.

data.v: विहंगसंघैर्हीनास्ते स्कन्धमात्राश्रया द्रुमाः । बभूवुरगमाः सर्वे मारुतेनेव निर्धुताः ।।
data.es: Deserted by the flocks of birds resting on them (flowers and leaves also dropped from branches), the trees were left bare with trunks unable to move.
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते द्रुमाः those trees, मारुतेन by Hanuman, विनिर्धुताः laid bare, अगमाः इव trees unable to move, विहङ्गसङ्घै: by flocks of birds, हीनाः deserted, स्कन्धमात्राश्रयाः only resting on the trunks, बभूवुः became.
data.md: And moved by the Wind god's offspring, the trees with their trunks left, and forsaken by the fowls were incapable of harbouring any creatures.

data.v: विधूतकेशी युवतिर्यथा मृदितवर्णिका । निष्पीतशुभदन्तौष्ठी नखैर्दन्तैश्च विक्षता ।।
data.es: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail, hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).
data.anv: लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च with tail and hands, चरणाभ्यां च and with feet, मर्दिता crushed, प्रभग्नवरपादपाः prominent trees shattered, अशोकवनिका Ashoka garden, निर्धूतकेशी hair dishevelled, मृदितवर्णका circular vermilion mark effaced, निष्पीतशुभदन्तोष्ठी with bright teeth and lips kissed, नखैः with nails, दन्तैश्च with teeth also, विक्षता wounded, युवतिः young woman, यथा likewise, तथा that, बभूव appeared.
data.md: And like youthful fair ones with hair dishevelled, their paste worn off, their upper lips with fair teeth sucked of their moisture; and having their persons torn with nails, and teeth; appeared 'the Asoka wood with its trees shattered; and itself ground with the tail, hands and legs (of Hanumān).

data.v: तथा लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च चरणाभ्यां च मर्दिता । बभूवाशोकवनिका प्रभग्नवरपादपा ।।
data.es: The garden of Ashoka with trees shattered and crushed by Hanuman's tail, hands and feet, appeared like a woman with dishevelled hair, with her vermilion mark effaced, her bright teeth and lips faded for being kissed and wounded with nails and bitten with teeth (by her lover).
data.anv: लाङ्गूलहस्तैश्च with tail and hands, चरणाभ्यां च and with feet, मर्दिता crushed, प्रभग्नवरपादपाः prominent trees shattered, अशोकवनिका Ashoka garden, निर्धूतकेशी hair dishevelled, मृदितवर्णका circular vermilion mark effaced, निष्पीतशुभदन्तोष्ठी with bright teeth and lips kissed, नखैः with nails, दन्तैश्च with teeth also, विक्षता wounded, युवतिः young woman, यथा likewise, तथा that, बभूव appeared.

data.v: महालतानां दामानि व्यधमत्तरसा कपिः । यथा प्रावृषि विन्ध्यस्य मेघजालानि मारुतः ।।
data.es: Hanuman shook with tremendous speed the huge clusters of creepers hanging there just like stormy wind in rainy season scatters masses of clouds on the Vindhya mountain.
data.anv: कपिः monkey, महालतानाम् of huge creepers, दामानि hanging, तरसा with tremendous  speed, मारुतः wind, प्रावृषि in the rainy season, विन्ध्यस्य of Vindhya, मेघजालानि clusters of clouds, यथा like wise, व्यथमत् shook.
data.md: That monkey with his vehemence scattered the clusters of shrubs, like the wind violently scattering clouds in the rainy reason.

data.v: स तत्र मणिभूमीश्च राजतीश्च मनोरमाः । तथा काञ्चनभूमीश्च विचरन्ददृशे कपिः ।।
data.es: Roaming there the monkey noticed the beautiful floors paved with gems, gold and silver৷৷
data.anv: सः he, कपिः the monkey, तत्र there, विचरन् while roaming, मणिभूमीश्च floors with gems, राजतीश्च studded with silver, तथा so also, मनोरमाः pleasing to the eyes, काञ्चनभूमीश्च floors paved with gold, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And ranging there, the monkey saw beautiful pavements, jewelled, silvern and golden.

data.v: वापीश्च विविधाकाराः पूर्णाः परमवारिणा । महार्हैर्मणिसोपानैरुपपन्नास्ततस्ततः ।।
मुक्ताप्रवालसिकता स्फटिकान्तरकुट्टिमाः । काञ्चनैस्तरुभिश्चित्रैस्तीरजैरुपशोभिताः ।।
data.md: He saw there various pools filled with excellent water and having steps crusted with jewels. Their sandy soil was filled with pearls and corals, and the ground inside was made of crystal. And their banks were decked with diverse golden trees.

data.v: फुल्लपद्मोत्पलवनाश्चक्रवाकोपकूजिताः । नत्यूहरुतसंघुष्टा हंससारसनादिताः ।।
data.md: They were beautified with full blown lotuses, waterlilies, Chakravakas and Natyuhas* and filled with the notes of swans and Sarasas. *A gallinule.

data.v: दीर्घाभिर्द्रुमयुक्ताभिः सरिद्भिश्च समन्ततः । अमृतोपमतोयाभिः शिवाभिरुपसंस्कृताः ।।
data.md: They were encircled on all sides with big tanks having trees on their banks and water, clear and sweet like to nectar.

data.v: लताशतैरवतताः सन्तानकसमावृताः । नानागुल्मावृतवनाः करवीरकृतान्तराः ।।
data.md: They were entwined with hundreds of creepers, covered with Santāna* flowers and filled with diverse groves and Karaviras serving the purpose of windows. *One of the trees of heaven. 'Literally the passages means "making a gap in that forest thickly filled with trees.” But Rāmānuja interprets thus and we have adopted his interpretaion.

data.v: ततोऽम्बुधरसंकाशं प्रवृद्धशिखरं गिरिम् । विचित्रकूटं कूटैश्च सर्वतः परिवारितम् ।।
data.es: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.
data.anv: ततः then, हरिशार्दूलः a tiger among monkeys, जगति movable, रम्यं पर्वतम् delightful mountain, अम्बुधरसङ्काशम् resembling a rain cloud, प्रवृद्धशिखरम् with a tall peak, विचित्रकूटम् with a collection of wonderful peaks, सर्वतः all over, कूटै: by peaks, परिवारितम् surrounded, शिलागृहैः with caves, अवततम् extending, नानावृक्षैः with different kinds of trees, समावृतम् surrounded, गिरिम् mountain, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Thereupon that foremost of monkeys beheld there a mountain-the most picturesque in the world, resembling clouds, having high summits, covered on all sides with peaks and filled with hilly abodes and various trees.

data.v: शिलागृहैरवततं नानावृक्षैः समावृतम् । ददर्श कपिशार्दूलो रम्यं जगति पर्वतम् ।।
data.es: The tiger among monkeys beheld a delightingful mountain, resembling the raincloud with tall, pleasing peaks, wonderful peaks spread all over the mountain. There were caves built of stone, with a variety of trees.
data.anv: ततः then, हरिशार्दूलः a tiger among monkeys, जगति movable, रम्यं पर्वतम् delightful mountain, अम्बुधरसङ्काशम् resembling a rain cloud, प्रवृद्धशिखरम् with a tall peak, विचित्रकूटम् with a collection of wonderful peaks, सर्वतः all over, कूटै: by peaks, परिवारितम् surrounded, शिलागृहैः with caves, अवततम् extending, नानावृक्षैः with different kinds of trees, समावृतम् surrounded, गिरिम् mountain, ददर्श beheld.
data.md: Thereupon that foremost of monkeys beheld there a mountain-the most picturesque in the world, resembling clouds, having high summits, covered on all sides with peaks and filled with hilly abodes and various trees.

data.v: ददर्श च नगात्तस्मान्नदीं निपतितां कपिः । अङ्कादिव समुत्पत्य प्रियस्य पतितां प्रियाम् ।।
data.md: That monkey beheld there a river falling down from the mountain like to a damsel falling down from the lap of her beloved. And the branches of the trees touching the water (of the stream) resembled a fair damsel prevented by her dear companions from forsaking the company of her beloved).

data.v: जले निपतिताग्रैश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम् । वार्यमाणामिव क्रुद्धां प्रमदां प्रियबन्धुभिः ।।
data.md: That monkey beheld there a river falling down from the mountain like to a damsel falling down from the lap of her beloved. And the branches of the trees touching the water (of the stream) resembled a fair damsel prevented by her dear companions from forsaking the company of her beloved).

data.v: पुनरावृत्ततोयां च ददर्श स महाकपिः । प्रसन्नामिव कान्तस्य कान्तां पुनरुपस्थिताम् ।।
data.md: And that great monkey beheld further down the stream turning back like to the damsel, pleased, going back to her dear one.

data.v: तस्यादूरात्स पद्मिन्यो नानाद्विजगणायुताः । ददर्श कपिशार्दूलो हनुमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The son of the Windgod, Hanuman, saw a huge, spacious and excellent of all mansions in the centre of the palace.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्य his, आलयवरिष्ठस्य of the main building, मध्ये in the centre, विपुलम् spacious, आयतम् huge, भवनश्रेष्ठम् excellent among mansions, ददर्श saw.
data.md: That foremost of monkeys, Hanumăn, the son of Maruti, beheld, at some distance, ponds filled with lotuses and various birds.

data.v: कृत्रिमां दीर्घिकां चापि पूर्णां शीतेन वारिणा । मणिप्रवरसोपानां मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank. Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.
data.anv: शीतेन by cool, वारिणा with water, पूर्णाम् filled with, मणिप्रवरसोपानाम् with steps embellished with gems, मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम् spread over with pearl dust as sand, विविधैः with many kinds, मृगसङ्घैश्च with herds of animals, विचित्राम् wonderful, चित्रकाननाम् having colourful woods, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितैः constructed, सुमहद्भिः by the large, प्रासादैः mansions, कृत्रिमैः artificial, काननैश्चापि woodlands also, सर्वतः all over, समलङ्कृताम् decorated, कृत्रिमाम् artificial, दीर्घिकां चापि lakes.
data.md: He saw a big artificial pond full of cool water having stairs crusted with excellent jewels and its sandy banks filled with pearls.

data.v: विविधैर्मृगसंघैश्च विचित्रां चित्रकाननाम् । प्रासादैः सुमहद्भिश्च निर्मितैर्विश्वकर्मणा । काननैः कृत्रिमैश्चापि सर्वतः समलंकृताम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw an oblong pond, full of cool water provided with steps, embellished with gems and beautified with pearl dust as sand on its bank. Thronged with many kinds of animals, it looked colourful with large mansions constructed by Visvakarma in the artificial woodlands decorated all over.
data.anv: शीतेन by cool, वारिणा with water, पूर्णाम् filled with, मणिप्रवरसोपानाम् with steps embellished with gems, मुक्तासिकतशोभिताम् spread over with pearl dust as sand, विविधैः with many kinds, मृगसङ्घैश्च with herds of animals, विचित्राम् wonderful, चित्रकाननाम् having colourful woods, विश्वकर्मणा by Visvakarma, निर्मितैः constructed, सुमहद्भिः by the large, प्रासादैः mansions, कृत्रिमैः artificial, काननैश्चापि woodlands also, सर्वतः all over, समलङ्कृताम् decorated, कृत्रिमाम् artificial, दीर्घिकां चापि lakes.

data.v: ये केचित्पादपास्तत्र पुष्पोपगफलोपगाः । सच्छत्राः सवितर्दीकाः सर्वे सौवर्णवेदिकाः ।।
data.es: There the trees had abundance of flowers and fruits. A few trees were full of leaves and branches spread like parasols. There were raised golden platforms.
data.anv: तत्र there, पुष्पोपगफलोपगाः had abundance of flowers and fruits (easily reachable), ये केचित् those few, पादपाः trees, सर्वे all, सच्छत्राः (like) parasols, सवितर्दीकाः having raised benches, सौवर्णवेदिकाः golden platforms.

data.v: लताप्रतानैर्बहुभिः पर्णैश्च बहुभिर्वृताम् । काञ्चनीं शिंशुपामेकां ददर्श स महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The monkey leader saw one simsupa tree covered all over with canopies of many climbers and leaves. The tree was surrounded by golden platforms.
data.anv: हरियूथपः the monkey leader, बहुभिः with many, लताप्रतानैः with canopies of  climbers, बहुभिः with many, पर्णैश्च with leaves also, वृताम् covered, समन्ततः all over, हेममयीभिः with golden, वेदिकाभिः with platforms, वृताम् surrounded, काञ्चनीम् golden, एकाम् a single, शिंशुपाम् Simsupa tree, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And that great monkey beheld there one golden Singsapa* tree surrounded on all sides with golden pavements. 'A tree (Dalbergia Sisu).

data.v: सोऽपश्यद्भूमिभागांश्च गर्तप्रस्रवणानि च । सुवर्णवृक्षानपरान्ददर्श शिखिसंनिभान् ।।
data.es: He beheld several pieces of land and streams flowing out of the springs. He also noticed golden trees asresplendent as fire.
data.anv: सः he, भूमिभागांश्च pieces of land, गर्तप्रस्रवणानि च streams flowing out of springs, अपरान् other, शिखिसन्निभान् resembling fire, सुवर्णवृक्षान् golden coloured tree, अपश्यत् beheld.
data.md: And he saw the glebe, the hill streams and many a golden trees resembling the fire.

data.v: तेषां द्रुमाणां प्रभया मेरोरिव महाकपिः । अमन्यत तदा वीरः काञ्चनोऽस्मीति वानरः ।।
data.es: He saw trees resplendent with golden radiance and thought that he was in the midst of gold like the Sungod getting golden hue by the radiance of Meru, the golden mountain.
data.anv: तदा then, वीरः a hero, वानरः vanara, मेरोः of Meru, प्रभया by the radiance, दिवाकरः इव like the Sun, तेषाम् of those, द्रुमाणाम् of tree, प्रभया by the radiance, काञ्चनः golden, अस्मि was, इति thus, अमन्यत thought.
data.md: By the lustre of all those trees that heroic monkey appeared as if made of gold like to the Sun by the touch of the mount Sumeru.

data.v: तां काञ्चनैस्तरुगणैर्मारुतेन च वीजिताम् । किङ्किणीशतनिर्घोषां दृष्ट्वा विस्मयमागमत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman was wonderstruck to hear the sound produced by rows of golden trees which stood round the simsupa tree. This sound resembled the tinkling of a hundred anklets when the wind passed through (their leaves).
data.anv: काञ्चनैः तरुगणैः with golden trees, मारुतेन by the wind, वीजिताम् fanned, किङ्कणी शतनिर्घोषाम् like the tinkling of a hundred anklets, ताम् that (tree), दृष्ट्वा seeing, विस्मयम् wonder, आगमत् struck.

data.v: सुपुष्पिताग्रां रुचिरां तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम् । तामारुह्य महावेगः शिंशपां पर्णसंवृताम् ।।
data.es: Strongarmed Hanuman climbed up the simsupa tree shining with flowers on its top and surrounded by tender sprouts and leaves. (He said to himself):
data.anv: महाबाहुः strongarmed hero, सः he, पुष्पिताग्राम् with flowers blossoming on the top, रुचिराम् lovely, तरुणाङ्कुरपल्लवाम् with tender sprouts and leaves, पर्णसंवृताम् surrounded by leaves, ताम् that, आरुह्य having climbed.

data.v: इतो द्रक्ष्यामि वैदेहीं राम दर्शनलालसाम् । इतश्चेतश्च दुःखार्तां संपतन्तीं यदृच्छया ।।
data.es: "I may see by chance( from this point) Vaidehi tormented with grief anxiously waiting to see Rama while moving about here and there casually.
data.anv: रामदर्शनलालसाम् a lady eager to see Rama, वैदेहीम् at Vaidehi, इतः from this place, द्रक्ष्यामि I will see, दुःखार्ताम् a lady filled with sorrow, यदृच्छया casually, इतश्च इतश्च here and there, सम्पतन्तीम् lady moving.
data.md: And climbing that Singsapa tree enveloped with leaves that monkey, gifted with velocity, reflected— Perchance I may see Vaidehi, exercised with grief, anxious to behold Rāma and wandering hither and thither at her pleasure.

data.v: अशोकवनिका चेयं दृढं रम्या दुरात्मनः । चम्पकैश्चन्दनैश्चापि बकुलैश्च विभूषिता ।।
data.es: "Surely this beautiful Ashoka grove with delightful champak, chandan and bakula trees belongs to the wicked Ravana."
data.anv: दुरात्मनः of the wicked one, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका Ashoka grove, दृढम् surely, रम्या beautiful, चम्पकैः by Champak, चन्दनैश्च and Chandan, वकुलैश्चापि and with Bakula also, विभूषिता is decorated.

data.v: इयं च नलिनी रम्या द्विजसंघनिषेविता । इमां सा राममहिषी नूनमेष्यति जानकी ।।
data.es: "This lovely lotuspond is frequented by flocks of aquatic birds. Surely Rama's queen Janaki will come to this place.
data.anv: द्विजसङ्घनिषेविता frequented by flocks of water birds, इयम् this, नलिनी च  lotuspond, रम्या beautiful, सा she, राममहिषी Rama's queen, जानकी Janaki, नूनम् surely, इमाम् this place, एष्यति she will come.
data.md: Certainly this is the picturesque Asoka forest of that vicious-souled one, embellished with sandal Champakas and Bakulas. Here is a beautiful pond abounding in lotuses, thronged with birds and forsooth shall that royal spouse Jānaki repair hither.

data.v: सा राम राममहिषी राघवस्य प्रिया सदा । वनसंचारकुशला नूनमेष्यति जानकी ।।
data.es: "Beautiful Janaki, beloved queen of Rama loves to wander in forests. She will surely visit this grove.
data.anv: राममहिषी Rama's queen, राघवस्य Raghava's, प्रिया beloved, सती a chaste lady, रामा a beautiful woman, वनसञ्चारकुशला who loves to wander in forests, सा जानकी that Janaki, नूनम् surely, एष्यति she will visit.

data.v: अथ वा मृगशावाक्षी वनस्यास्य विचक्षणा । वनमेष्यति सा चेह रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता ।।
data.es: "Or may be that doeeyed noble lady brooding over Rama will come to this garden she is familiar with.
data.anv: अथवा or may be, मृगशाबाक्षी doeeyed lady, अस्य of this, वनस्य garden's, विचक्षणा familiar with, रामचिन्तानुकर्शिता brooding over Rama, सा that, आर्या noble woman, इह here, वनम् garden, एष्यति will come.
data.md: She is the beloved queen of Rāghava and expert in walking in the garden. And separated from Rāma, certainly shall Jānakī repair hither. Or she having the eyes of a young antelope and adept in roaming in the forest, exercised with thought touching Rāma, shall come here.

data.v: रामशोकाभिसंतप्ता सा देवी वामलोचना । वनवासरता नित्यमेष्यते वनचारिणी ।।
data.es: "That lovelyeyed queen tormented with grief over separation from Rama will be coming here to stay as she always loves strolling in the forest.
data.anv: रामशोकाभिसन्तप्ता tormented with over grief Rama's separation, वामलोचना lovelyeyed one, नित्यम् always, वनवासे in the forest, रता enjoying, सा that, देवी devi, वनचारिणी loves strolling in the forest, एष्यते will come.
data.md: Or she having beautiful eyes and fond of ranging in the forest, racked with sorrow in consequence of Rāma's separation, dose always frequent this forest.* *The commentator, Rāmānuja interprets this bloka as explaining the cause of Sītā's frequenting the Asoka forest.

data.v: वनेचराणां सततं नूनं स्पृहयते पुरा । रामस्य दयिता भार्या जनकस्य सुता सती ।।
data.es: "The daughter of Janaka, the chaste wife of Rama, used to for the company of those creatures wandering in the forest.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, दयिता dear, भार्या wife, जनकस्य Janaka's, सुता daughter, सती a chaste lady, पुरा earlier, सततम् always, वनेचराणाम् of creatures wandering in the forest, स्पृहयते she likes, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Ere this, the chaste and worshipful spouse of Rāma–Janaka's daughter, used to love always the birds and animals of the forest.

data.v: संध्याकालमनाः श्यामा ध्रुवमेष्यति जानकी । नदीं चेमां शिवजलां संध्यार्थे वरवर्णिनी ।।
data.es: Surely that lady of lovely complexion, the beautiful Janaki will come to this river flowing with sacred waters for performing the evening rituals.
data.anv: श्यामा beautiful, वरवर्णिनी a lady of lovely complexion, जानकी Janaki, सन्ध्याकालमनाः at the time of twilight, शुभजलाम् sacred waters, इमां नदीम् this river, सन्ध्यार्थे for performing evening ritual, ध्रुवम् surely, एष्यति come.
data.md: (The morning has set in) and surely the beautiful and graceful daughter of Janaka fond of performing morning ablutions, shall come to this river of pure water to perform them. "Sandhyā literally means the point of time which connect day and night. It however, generally means the period after sunset and before the night sets. But here with reference to the speech which Hanumān began by the end of night, it means the morning.

data.v: तस्याश्चाप्यनुरूपेयमशोकवनिका शुभा । शुभा या पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य पत्नी रामस्य संमिता ।।
data.es: To the auspicious Sita,the beloved of Rama, the lord of the world, this Ashoka grove is a befitting place.
data.anv: या she, पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य of the lord of the world, रामस्य Rama's, सम्मता beloved, शुभा auspicious, पत्नी wife, तस्याः her, शुभा auspicious, इयम् this, अशोकवनिका this Ashoka grove, अनुरूपापि च and  suitable place.
data.md: Truly is this beautiful forest of Asoka the worthy abode of the beloved and chaste spouse of Rāma, the lord of men.

data.v: यदि जिवति सा देवी ताराधिपनिभानना । आगमिष्यति सावश्यमिमां शिवजलां नदीम् ।।
data.es: "The moonfaced queen will certainly come to this stream of auspicious water if she is surviving."
data.anv: ताराधिपनिभानना moonfaced one, सा देवी that queen, जीवति यदि if she is surviving, सा she, अवश्यम् certainly, इमाम् this, शिवजलाम् a place  of auspicious water, नदीम् river, आगमिष्यति she will come.
data.md: If that one of moon-like countenance breathes forsooth shall she come to this river of cool water."

data.v: एवं तु मत्वा हनुमान्महात्मा; प्रतीक्षमाणो मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम् । अवेक्षमाणश्च ददर्श सर्वं; सुपुष्पिते पर्णघने निलीनः ।।
data.es: Pondering thus, the highsouled Hanuman remained concealed on the tree loaded with flowers and leaves and waited, looking eagerly for the wife of the lord of the people. इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्दशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the fourteenth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महात्मा highsouled, हनुमान् Hanuman, एवम् thus, मत्वा pondering, मनुजेन्द्रपत्नीम् wife of the lord of the people, प्रतीक्षमाणः waiting, सुपुष्पिते on a profusely bloomed, पर्णघने abundant leaves, निलीनः hid himself, अवेक्षमाणश्च looking down, सर्वम् all over, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Having arrived there and anxiously expecting the appearance of the spouse of that lord of men, the high-souled Hanumān hiding himself (on the Singsapa tree) enveloped with flowers and leaves, beheld all.

data.v: स वीक्षमाणस्तत्रस्थो मार्गमाणश्च मैथिलीम् । अवेक्षमाणश्च महीं सर्वां तामन्ववैक्षत ।।
data.es: Hanuman looked out from the simsupa tree all around for Mythili scanning the ground below.
data.anv: सः he (Hanuman), तत्रस्थः from there, वीक्षमाणः looking out, मैथिलीम् for Mythili, मार्गमाणः searching for, अवेक्षमाणः looking down all around, सर्वाम् everywhere, तां महीम् that ground, अन्ववैक्षत surveyed.
data.md: Having stationed himself on the tree, casting his looks all around in quest of Sītā and looking down on the carth he surveyed the entire forest of (Asoka).

data.v: सन्तान कलताभिश्च पादपैरुपशोभिताम् । दिव्यगन्धरसोपेतां सर्वतः समलंकृताम् ।।
data.md: It was beautified with Santdaka creepers and various trees, fragrant with celestial odours and was embellished on all sides.

data.v: तां स नन्दनसंकाशां मृगपक्षिभिरावृताम् । हर्म्यप्रासादसंबाधां कोकिलाकुलनिःस्वनाम् ।।
काञ्चनोत्पलपद्माभिर्वापीभिरुपशोभिताम् । बह्वासनकुथोपेतां बहुभूमिगृहायुताम् ।।

data.md: Having beheld Sītā in this plight, that son of the wind-god approached Rāma in mind and showered praises on his master.

data.md: No one can withstand the course of destiny since Sītā, being the spouse of the worshipful brother of Laksmana, ever obedient to his elders, has been overwhelmed with grief.

data.es: "Just as river Ganga is not agitated by the rainbearing clouds, this Sita is not perturbed as she is aware of the prowess of Rama and might of Lakshmana.
