data.anv: नवहेमाभाम् a lady shining like the fresh gold, श्रियमिव glory, लोककान्ताम् dear to the whole world, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, मनसा mentally, रामम् Rama, जगाम he reached, इदम् thise, वचनं च words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And having scen seen her, gold-hued and conducing to the happiness of the people like to the Goddess of wealth, Hanuman approached Rāma in his mind and said.

data.v: अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्या हतो वाली महाबलः । रावणप्रतिमो वीर्ये कबन्धश्च निपातितः ।।
data.es: "It was for the sake of this largeeyed Sita that the powerful Vali and the heroic Kabandha who was equal to Ravana in heroism were killed.
data.anv: विशालाक्ष्याः largeeyed one, अस्याः हेतोः for her sake, महाबलः powerful, वाली Vali, हतः was killed, वीर्ये in heroism, रावणप्रतिमः comparable to Ravana, कबन्धश्च even Kabandha, निपातितः is killed.
data.md: For this (damsel) was killed the mighty Vāli and Kabandha-Rāvana's equal in prowess.

data.v: विराधश्च हतः संख्ये राक्षसो भीमविक्रमः । वने रामेण विक्रम्य महेन्द्रेणेव शम्बरः ।।
data.es: "Rama killed Viradha of fearsome valour in the forest like Sambara by Indra.
data.anv: वने in the forest, सङ्ख्ये in a war, रामेण by Rama, विक्रम्य by advancing with valour, महेन्द्रेण by Indra, शम्बरः Sambara , इव like, भीमविक्रमः a hero of  fearsome valour, विराधः Viradha, हतः slayed.
data.md: For her (too) was destroyed in battle, the terribly powerful Rākşasa-Viradha, by Rāma putting forth his energy, like to ſambara killed by Mahendra.

data.v: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् । निहतानि जनस्थाने शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः ।।
data.anv: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, अग्निशिखोपमैः equal to flames of fire, शरैः with arrows, भीमकर्मणाम् warriors of fierce valour, रक्षसाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, निहतानि were killed.
data.md: (It was for her) that fourteen thousand Rākşasas of terrible deeds were destroyed at Janasthāna with arrow resembling the flame of fire. And Khara was killed in battle, and Trisirā was discomfited and the mighty Dūşaņa by Rāma, knowing his ownself.

data.v: खरश्च निहतः संख्ये त्रिशिराश्च निपातितः । दूषणश्च महातेजा रामेण विदितात्मना ।।
data.es: "Ogres like Khara and Trisira and the powerful Dooshana were kileed in battle by Rama endowed with selfknowledge.
data.anv: विदितात्मना by one who knows the self, रामेण by Rama, सङ्ख्ये in a battle, खरश्च Khara, निहतः destroyed, त्रिशिराश्च and Trisira, निपातितः was killed, महातेजाः highly powerful, दूषणश्च Dooshana also.
data.md: (It was for her) that fourteen thousand Rākşasas of terrible deeds were destroyed at Janasthāna with arrow resembling the flame of fire. And Khara was killed in battle, and Trisirā was discomfited and the mighty Dūşaņa by Rāma, knowing his ownself.

data.v: ऐश्वर्यं वानराणां च दुर्लभं वालिपालितम् । अस्या निमित्ते सुग्रीवः प्राप्तवाँल्लोकसत्कृतम् ।।
data.es: On her account Sugriva obtained the coveted kingdom ruled by Vali which was a difficult proposition, and retained supremacy in the world.
data.anv: अस्याः निमित्ते on account of her, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वालिपालितम् ruled by Vali, दुर्लभम् difficult to obtain, लोकसत्कृतम् retained supremacy in the world, वानराणाम् of vanaras, ऐश्वर्यम् prosperity, प्राप्तवान् obtained.
data.md: And it was on her account that Sugrīva, known all over the world, came by the wealth of the monkeys hard to acquire and amassed by Vali.

data.v: सागरश्च मया क्रान्तः श्रीमान्नदनदीपतिः । अस्या हेतोर्विशालाक्ष्याः पुरी चेयं निरीक्षिता ।।
data.es: "On account of the largeeyed Sita I ventured to cross the lord of rivers, the sea, and came to this city.
data.anv: विशालाक्ष्याः largeeyed lady, अस्याः हेतोः on her account, मया by me, नदनदीपतिः lord of rivers and rivulets, सागरश्च ocean also, क्रान्तः crossed, इयम् this, पुरी च and city, अवेक्षिता surveyed.
data.md: And it is for this (damsel) of expansive eyes that I have crossed the effulgent lord of rivers and have seen this city.

data.v: यदि रामः समुद्रान्तां मेदिनीं परिवर्तयेत् । अस्याः कृते जगच्चापि युक्तमित्येव मे मतिः ।।
data.es: "Even if Rama turns this land stretching to the ocean upside down or even the entire world on account of her, it is justifiable, according to me.
data.anv: रामः Rama, अस्याः कृते on account of her, समुद्रान्ताम् stretching to the ocean, मेदिनीम् land, जगच्चापि or even the whole world, परिवर्तयेद्यदि if he turns upside down, युक्तमित्येव that is justified only, मे to me, मतिः strikes my mind.
data.md: And methinks it would have been all proper had Rāma turned on her account the whole earth bounded by oceans.

data.v: राज्यं वा त्रिषु लोकेषु सीता वा जनकात्मजा । त्रैलोक्यराज्यं सकलं सीताया नाप्नुयात्कलाम् ।।
data.es: "The sovereignty over the three worlds will weigh less than one sixteenth part of Janaka's daughter, Sita.
data.anv: त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु in worlds, राज्यं वा or kingdom, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, सीता वा for Sita, सकलम् everything, त्रैलोक्यराज्यम् all the three worlds, सीतायाः or Sita's, कलाम् one sixteenth part, नाप्नुयात् not equal.
data.md: If the kingdom over the three worlds and the daughter of Janaka be compared together, the former is not equal to one hundredth part of Sītā.

data.v: इयं सा धर्मशीलस्य मैथिलस्य महात्मनः । सुता जनकराजस्य सीता भर्तृदृढव्रता ।।
data.es: She had risen from the land when tilled by the plough and was covered with auspicious paddy dust resembling the pollen grains of lotuses, this daughter of Janaka, the great righteous ruler of Mithila, This lady with unswerving devotion to her husband.
data.anv: इयम् this lady, क्षेत्रे in the field, हलमुखक्षते tilled by plough, पद्मरेणुनिभैः resembling the pollen dust of lotus, शुभैः by the auspicious, केदारपाम्सुभिः with dust particles of paddy, कीर्णा covered, मेदिनीम् land, भित्त्वा breaking, उत्थिता risen up, धर्मशीलस्य  of the righteous, महात्मनः  great self, मैथिलस्य of Mithila, जनकराजस्य king Janaka's, सुता daughter, भर्तृदृढव्रता a lady of unswerving devotion to her husband, सा that, सीता Sita.

data.v: उत्थिता मेदिनीं भित्त्वा क्षेत्रे हलमुखक्षते । पद्मरेणुनिभैः कीर्णा शुभैः केदारपांसुभिः ।।
data.es: She had risen from the land when tilled by the plough and was covered with auspicious paddy dust resembling the pollen grains of lotuses, this daughter of Janaka, the great righteous ruler of Mithila, This lady with unswerving devotion to her husband.
data.anv: इयम् this lady, क्षेत्रे in the field, हलमुखक्षते tilled by plough, पद्मरेणुनिभैः resembling the pollen dust of lotus, शुभैः by the auspicious, केदारपाम्सुभिः with dust particles of paddy, कीर्णा covered, मेदिनीम् land, भित्त्वा breaking, उत्थिता risen up, धर्मशीलस्य  of the righteous, महात्मनः  great self, मैथिलस्य of Mithila, जनकराजस्य king Janaka's, सुता daughter, भर्तृदृढव्रता a lady of unswerving devotion to her husband, सा that, सीता Sita.
data.md: This Sītā, the daughter of the high-souled Janaka, the pious King of Mithilā, firmly attached to her husband, rose, covered with dust, out of the earth, in a field delved by a furrow.

data.v: विक्रान्तस्यार्यशीलस्य संयुगेष्वनिवर्तिनः । स्नुषा दशरथस्यैषा ज्येष्ठा राज्ञो यशस्विनी ।।
data.es: "This celebrated lady is the eldest daughterinlaw of the noble, valiant king Dasaratha who never returned from the battleground without being victorious.
data.anv: विक्रान्तस्य of the valiant, आर्यशीलस्य of a man of noble conduct, संयुगेषु in battles, अनिवर्तिनः of a person who never returned, राज्ञः king's, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, यशश्विनी celebrated lady, ज्येष्ठा eldest, स्नुषा daughterin law, एषा she is.
data.md: She is the well-known eldest daughter-in-law of the king Dasaratha, of an adorable character and unchecked prowess.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य कृतज्ञस्य रामस्य विदितात्मनः । इयं सा दयिता भार्या राक्षसी वशमागता ।।
data.es: "She is the loving wife of the righteous, grateful, wise and selfrealised Rama. She has fallen into the hands of these shedemons.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञस्य who is righteous, कृतज्ञस्य of the grateful, विदितात्मनः of one armed with selfknowledge, रामस्य Rama's, दयिता dear, भार्या wife, इयम् she is, राक्षसीवशम् under the control of the demonesses, आगता has fallen.
data.md: And She is the beloved spouse of the pious and grateful Rāma, knowing his ownself, and has been brought under the control of the Raksasis.

data.v: सर्वान्भोगान्परित्यज्य भर्तृस्नेहबलात्कृता । अचिन्तयित्वा दुःखानि प्रविष्टा निर्जनं वनम् ।।
data.md: Renouncing all luxuries, and considering not the least about miseries, she actuated by her husband's love entered the solitary forest.

data.v: संतुष्टा फलमूलेन भर्तृशुश्रूषणे रता । या परां भजते प्रीतिं वनेऽपि भवने यथा ।।
data.md: And satisfied with fruits and roots and ever engaged in her husband's service, she lived in the forest as much delighted as she was in her house.

data.v: सेयं कनकवर्णाङ्गी नित्यं सुस्मितभाषिणी । सहते यातनामेतामनर्थानामभागिनी ।।
data.md: And that one of a golden hue, never used to afflictions and who was wont to converse always with a delighted countenance, has now been suffering incomparable miseries.

data.v: इमां तु शीलसंपन्नां द्रष्टुमिच्छति राघवः । रावणेन प्रमथितां प्रपामिव पिपासितः ।।
data.es: "Rama deserves to see her.Just as a thirsty man longs for the source of water, Rama pines for this highly virtuous lady who is tormented by Ravana.
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, शीलसम्पन्नाम् a highly virtuous lady, रावणेन by Ravana, प्रमथिताम् tormented, इमाम् her, पिपासितः a thirsty man, प्रपामिव like the source of water, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हति he deserves.
data.md: Like to a thirsty wight longing for an abode where he might get a drink, Rāghava pants after seeing her, gifted with an exalted character and oppressed by Rāvana.

data.v: अस्या नूनं पुनर्लाभाद्राघवः प्रीतिमेष्यति । राजा राज्यपरिभ्रष्टः पुनः प्राप्येव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: "Just as a king who had lost his kingdom feels happy on regaining it, surely Raghava will feel exhilarated when he gets her back.
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, पुनः again, अस्याः her, लाभात् by finding her, राज्यपरिभ्रष्टः exiled from the kingdom, राजा king, मेदिनीम् land, पुनः again, प्राप्येव as if gained back, नूनम् surely, प्रीतिम् happiness, एष्यति he will get.
data.md: As a monarch who had lost his kingdom, is greatly delighted when he regain it, forsooth shall Rāghava, in like manner, be pleased when he shall come by her.

data.v: कामभोगैः परित्यक्ता हीना बन्धुजनेन च । धारयत्यात्मनो देहं तत्समागमकाङ्क्षिणी ।।
data.es: Deprived of all sensual pleasures, and separated from her relatives, she is surviving with the hope of meeting them.
data.anv: कामभोगैः with sensual pleasures, परित्यक्ता deprived, बन्धुजनेन च and also with relatives, हीना she is separated, तत्समागमकाङ्क्षिणी one who is eagerly waiting to meet them, देहम् body, धारयति she is holding.
data.md: She too has been maintaining her being in the hope of seeing Rāma again, separated as she is from her friends and deprived of all comforts and luxuries.

data.v: नैषा पश्यति राक्षस्यो नेमान्पुष्पफलद्रुमान् । एकस्थहृदया नूनं राममेवानुपश्यति ।।
data.es: She is looking at neither the shedemons nor these trees full of flowers and fruits. She is surely thinking of Rama with a singleminded attention.
data.anv: एषा this lady, राक्षस्यः at the shedemons, न पश्यति she is not looking, इमान् these, पुष्पफलद्रुमान् trees full of flowers and fruits, न not seeing, एकस्थहृदया with singleminded attention, राममेव only Rama, अनुपश्यति thinking, नूनम् surely.
data.md: These Rākşasīs, and these trees enveloped with fruits and flowers-forsooth she dose not behold, but is engaged with all her heart in medidations only touching Rāma.

data.v: भर्ता नाम परं नार्या भूषणं भूषणादपि । एषा हि रहिता तेन शोभनार्हा न शोभते ।।
data.es: "Indeed, the husband is the greatest ornament for a married woman. Hence though deserving adornment she does not like it, bereft of her husband who is her only ornament.
data.anv: भर्ता नाम husband, indeed, नार्याः for a lady, भूषणादपि more than ornaments, परम् supreme, भूषणम् ornament, भूषणार्हा who though deserve ornaments, एषा तु she on her part, तेन with him, रहिता separated, न शोभते does not look nice
data.md: Husband enhance the beauty of a female more than the dress (and therefore Sītā) beautiful as she is, dose not appear graceful, in her husband's absence.

data.v: दुष्करं कुरुते रामो हीनो यदनया प्रभुः । धारयत्यात्मनो देहं न दुःखेनावसीदति ।।
data.es: "Lord Rama had accomplished a difficult task in sustaining the body this way without allowing it to sink and perish during separation from her.
data.anv: प्रभुः lord, रामः Rama, अनया with her, हीनः separated, आत्मनः his, देहम् body, धारयति इति यत् held in this way, शोकेन with grief, न अवसीदति is not perishing, दुष्करम् a task (difficult), कृतवान् accomplished.
data.md: Indeed my master Rāma has performed a mighty task for breathes he still in her separation, without consuming himself in grief.”

data.v: इमामसितकेशान्तां शतपत्रनिभेक्षणाम् । सुखार्हां दुःखितां दृष्ट्वा ममापि व्यथितं मनः ।।
data.es: Sita who is endowed with beautiful dark hair and eyes like a hundredpetalled lotus, who deserves to be happy is in sorrow. I grieve to see her in this state.
data.anv: असितकेशान्ताम् one who has dark hair, शतपत्रनिभेक्षणाम् endowed with eyes resembling a hundredpetalled lotus, सुखार्हाम् she deserves to be happy, इमाम् her, दुःखिताम् sorrowful lady, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, मम my, मनः अपि mind also, व्यथितम् is worried.
data.md: My heart is greatly pained knowing that she, having dark-blue eyes, resembling lotus petals, worthy of happiness, has been possessed by grief.

data.v: क्षितिक्षमा पुष्करसंनिभाक्षी; या रक्षिता राघवलक्ष्मणाभ्याम् । सा राक्षसीभिर्विकृतेक्षणाभिः; संरक्ष्यते संप्रति वृक्षमूले ।।
data.es: She who has beautiful eyes like lotus petals, was protected by the arms of both Rama and Lakshmna, who is tolerant like the earth and is guarded by the female demons of hideous appearance under a tree.
data.anv: क्षितिक्षमा tolerant like the earth, पुष्करसन्निभाक्षी lotuseyed lady, या she who, राघवलक्ष्मणाभ्याम् both by Raghava and Lakshmana, रक्षिता was protected, सा that lady, विकृतेक्षणाभिः by women who have hideous appearance, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, सम्प्रति presently, वृक्षमूले under a tree, संरक्ष्यते she is guarded.
data.md: She, patient as the Earth, having eyes resembling lotuses, who was ere this protected by Rāghava and Lakşmaņa, is now being guarded by Rākşasīs having terrible eyes, under the trees.

data.v: हिमहतनलिनीव नष्टशोभा; व्यसनपरम्परया निपीड्यमाना । सहचररहितेव चक्रवाकी; जनकसुता कृपणां दशां प्रपन्ना ।।
data.es: "Deprived of her charm, she resembles a lotuscreeper blasted by frost. This daughter of Janaka has reached a pitiable condition afflicted by series of calamities. She resembles a famale Chakravaka separated from her mate.
data.anv: हिमहतनलिनीव like the lotus afflicted by snow, नष्टशोभा devoid of charm, व्यसनपरम्परया by continuous experience of sorrow, निपीड्यमाना afflicted, जनकसुता daughter of Janaka, सहचर रहिता away from her companion, चक्रवाकीव like the female Chakravaka, कृपणाम् pitiable, दशाम् state, प्रपन्ना has landed.
data.md: Being harassed with continued miseries, the daughter of Janaka has lost all her beauty like to a water-lily crushed with frost, and has come by a miserable plight like to a doe separated from her mate.

data.v: अस्या हि पुष्पावनताग्रशाखाः; शोकं दृढं वै जनयत्यशोकाः । हिमव्यपायेन च मन्दरश्मि;रभ्युत्थितो नैकसहस्ररश्मिः ।।
data.es: "The top branches of Ashoka trees bent down with blossoms and the Moon rising with thousands of cool rays at the end of winter (when spring sets in) beholding which she should be delighted intensfy her sorrow."
data.anv: पुष्पावनताग्रशाखाः with topmost branches bent down by the heaviness of blossoms, अशोकाः Ashoka trees, अस्याः her, दृढम् firmly, शोकम् sorrow, जनयन्ति are creating, हिमव्यपायेन by the onset of spring, अभ्युत्थितः risen, नैकसहस्ररश्मि: thousandrayed (Sun), शीतरश्मि: च the Moon.
data.md: The branches of the Asoka trees, lowered down with flowers are as if enhancing her grief as also the Moon of many thousand rays, at the expire of the winter."

data.v: इत्येवमर्थं कपिरन्ववेक्ष्य; सीतेयमित्येव निविष्टबुद्धिः । संश्रित्य तस्मिन्निषसाद वृक्षे; बली हरीणामृषभस्तरस्वी ।।

data.anv: सीतादर्शनसंहृष्टः joyful for having seen Sita, वीर्यवान् heroic one, हनुमान् Hanuman, रामाय to Rama, लक्ष्मणाय च and Lakshmana, नमस्कृत्वा having offered salutations, संवृतः covered himself, अभवत् remained.
data.md: Having offered his obeisance to Räma and Lakşmaņa the powerful Hanumān, greatly delighted in seeing Sītā, remained there hidden.

data.v: तथा विप्रेक्षमाणस्य वनं पुष्पितपादपम् । विचिन्वतश्च वैदेहीं किंचिच्छेषा निशाभवत् ।।
data.es: The night came to a close while Hanuman went searching and looking for Sita at Ashoka grove full of flowering trees.
data.anv: पुष्पितपादपम् flowering trees, वनम् grove, तथा likewise, विप्रेक्ष्यमाणस्य of the observer, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, विचिन्वतश्च while searching, निशा night, किञ्चिच्छेषा a small part, अभवत् was left.
data.md: Beholding the forest filled with flowery trees and desiring to have a full view of her, he, wellnigh, spent the night.

data.v: षडङ्गवेदविदुषां क्रतुप्रवरयाजिनाम् । शुश्राव ब्रह्मघोषांश्च विरात्रे ब्रह्मरक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: At dawn sounds of recitation of Vedas and the six auxillary sciences, (i.e .grammar, prosody, etymology, phonetics, astronomy and the science of rituals) by the brahmins among demons wellversed in performing exalted sacrificial ceremonies were heard.
data.anv: सः he, विरात्रे at the end of the night, षडङ्गवेदविदुषाम् of those who were knowledgeable of Vedas and its six auxillary branches of sciences, क्रतुप्रवरयाजिनाम् those who were experts in performing exalted sacrificial ceremonies, ब्रह्मरक्षसाम् of brahmins among demons, ब्रह्मघोषान् sounds of Vedas, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: At that late hour of the night, he heard the chantings of the Vedas by the Rákşasas, conversant with the six supplementary parts of the Vedas,* engaged in the performance of sacrificial rites and knowing Brahmā. *Grammar, Prosody, astronomy, pronounciation, the meaning of the unusual terms and the ritual of the Hindu religion.

data.v: अथ मङ्गलवादित्रैः शब्दैः श्रोत्रमनोहरैः । प्राबोध्यत महाबाहुर्दशग्रीवो महाबलः ।।
data.es: By that time the strongarmed, powerful, tennecked Ravana was awakened by the delightful sounds of auspicious musical instruments.
data.anv: अथ at that time, महाबाहुः strongarmed, महाबलः powerful, दशग्रीवः tennecked one, श्रुतिमनोहरैः with sounds delighting ears, मङ्गलवादित्रशब्दै: with auspicious sounds of musical instruments, प्राबुध्यत was awakened.
data.md: And thereupon the mighty Ten-headed Rākṣasa, having huge arms, awoke with the sounds of those auspicious instruments, pleasant to ears.

data.v: विबुध्य तु यथाकालं राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतावपान् । स्रस्तमाल्याम्बरधरो वैदेहीमन्वचिन्तयत् ।।
data.es: The chivalrous lord of demons woke up as usual.His raiment and garland were still in disarray and he thought of Vaidehi.
data.anv: प्रतापवान् chivalrous person, राक्षसेन्द्रः lord of demons, यथाकालम् at the usual time, विबुध्य after waking , स्रस्तमाल्याम्बरधरः with disarrayed garland and raiment, वैदेहीम्  of Vaidehi, अन्वचिन्तयत् thought.
data.md: Awaking, that great and powerful lord of Rākşasas, having his cloth and garlands loosened, began to think of Vaidehi.

data.v: भृशं नियुक्तस्तस्यां च मदनेन मदोत्कटः । न स तं राक्षसः कामं शशाकात्मनि गूहितुम् ।।
data.es: The demon king who was unable to hide his great passion and control his senses was drawn towards Sita, in his state of intoxication.
data.anv: तस्यां at her, मदनेन on account of his passion, भृशम् exceedingly, नियुक्तः gripped, मदोत्कटः overwhelmed with intoxication, सः he, राक्षसः demon, तं कामम् his passion, आत्मनि in himself, गूहितुम् to hide, न शशाक was not able.
data.md: That Raksasa, puffed up with pride, was passionately attached to her and so he could not restrain his amour in him.

data.v: स सर्वाभरणैर्युक्तो बिभ्रच्छ्रियमनुत्तमाम् । तां नगैर्विविधैर्जुष्टां सर्वपुष्पफलोपगैः ।।
data.es: Adorned with all ornaments and glowing with excellent splendour he went through the path filled with trees flourishing with all kinds of flowers and fruits.
data.anv: सर्वाभरणैः with all ornaments, युक्तः adorned with, अनुत्तमाम् excellent, श्रियम् splendour, बिभ्रत् hearing, सः he, सर्वपुष्पफलोपगैः filled with all kinds of flowers and fruits, बहुभिः with many, नगैः with trees, जुष्टाम् flourishing, ताम् such.

data.v: वृतां पुष्करिणीभिश्च नानापुष्पोपशोभिताम् । सदामदैश्च विहगैर्विचित्रां परमाद्भुताम् ।।
data.es: Ponds covered with a variety of beautiful flowers and colourful birds always cheerful looked very wonderful.
data.anv: पुष्करिणीभिः with ponds, वृताम् covered, नानापुष्पोपशोभिताम् beautiful with different kinds of flowers, सदा मदैः always elated, विहगैः with birds, विचित्राम् colourful, परमाद्भुताम् very wonderful.

data.v: ईहामृगैश्च विविधैश्वृतां दृष्टिमनोहरैः । वीथीः संप्रेक्षमाणश्च मणिकाञ्चनतोरणाः ।।
data.es: Watching the garden filled with trees, gateways ornamented with gold and gems, he entered through the pleasant pathways in the Ashoka garden. There were wonderful wolves and several herds of animals in the garden. Fruits dropped from trees were strewn all over.
data.anv: मणिकाञ्चनतोरणाः gateways ornamented with gold and gems, वीथीः pathways, सम्प्रेक्षमाणश्च observing, दृष्टिमनोहरैः with those pleasant to see, विविधैः with several, ईहामृगैश्च with wolves, जुष्टाम् occupies (with pleasure), नानामृगगणाकीर्णाम् filled with several kinds of animals herds, प्रपतितैः dropped from the trees, फलैः with fruits, वृताम् surrounded, सन्ततद्रुमाम् filled with a long stretch trees, अशोकवनिकामेव into the Ashoka garden, प्राविशत् entered.

data.v: नानामृगगणाकीर्णां फलैः प्रपतितैर्वृताम् । अशोकवनिकामेव प्राविशत्संततद्रुमाम् ।।
data.es: Watching the garden filled with trees, gateways ornamented with gold and gems, he entered through the pleasant pathways in the Ashoka garden. There were wonderful wolves and several herds of animals in the garden. Fruits dropped from trees were strewn all over.
data.anv: मणिकाञ्चनतोरणाः gateways ornamented with gold and gems, वीथीः pathways, सम्प्रेक्षमाणश्च observing, दृष्टिमनोहरैः with those pleasant to see, विविधैः with several, ईहामृगैश्च with wolves, जुष्टाम् occupies (with pleasure), नानामृगगणाकीर्णाम् filled with several kinds of animals herds, प्रपतितैः dropped from the trees, फलैः with fruits, वृताम् surrounded, सन्ततद्रुमाम् filled with a long stretch trees, अशोकवनिकामेव into the Ashoka garden, प्राविशत् entered.

data.v: अङ्गनाशतमात्रं तु तं व्रजन्तमनुव्रजत् । महेन्द्रमिव पौलस्त्यं देवगन्धर्वयोषितः ।।
data.es: Ravana, son of sage Paulasti, was followed by a hundred women, just as Indra is trailed by the females of gods and gandharvas.
data.anv: व्रजन्तम् while sauntering, तम् him, पौलस्त्यम् Poulastya, अङ्गनाशतमात्रम् only a hundred maidens, महेन्द्रम् Mahendra, देवगन्धर्वयोषितः females of gods and gandharvas, अनुव्रजत् were following.
data.md: And one hundred damsels followed in the train of the son of Pulastya like to the damsels of the celestials and Gandharvas following mahendra. 'Refers to Rāvana, Pulastya being his father.

data.v: दीपिकाः काञ्चनीः काश्चिज्जगृहुस्तत्र योषितः । बालव्यजनहस्ताश्च तालवृन्तानि चापराः ।।
data.es: Some women carried golden lamps, some held yalk tail fans in their hands while others bore palmleaf fans.
data.anv: तत्र there, काश्चित् a few, योषितः women, काञ्चनीः golden, दीपिकाः lamps, जगृहु held, अपराः others, तालवृन्तानि plamleaf fans, जगृहुः were holding, वालव्यजन हस्ताश्च some women held fans of the hair of yaktail.
data.md: There among those fair ones, some carried torches with gold handles, chowries and some fans.

data.v: काञ्चनैरपि भृङ्गारैर्जह्रुः सलिलमग्रतः । मण्डलाग्रानसींश्चैव गृह्यान्याः पृष्ठतो ययुः ।।
data.es: Some moved ahead of him carrying water in golden pitchers. Others followed him carrying circular couches (to be used as seats).
data.anv: काञ्चनैः golden, भृङ्गारैः pitchers, अग्रतः ahead of him, सलिलम् water, जह्रुः they carried, अन्याः others, मण्डलाग्रा: circular, बृसी: च अपि couches (rolls of twisted grass used as seats), गृह्य by holding, पृष्ठतः behind, ययुः moved.
data.md: Some carrying water in golden jars headed the train while others carrying the golden throne covered with a coverlet followed it.

data.v: काचिद्रत्नमयीं पात्रीं पूर्णां पानस्य भामिनी । दक्षिणा दक्षिणेनैव तदा जग्राह पाणिना ।।
data.es: One glorious and compassionate lady carried in her right hand a gemstudded jar filled with wine.
data.anv: काचित् one, भामिनी a glowing lady, दक्षिणा a compassionate lady, रत्नमयीम् bejewelled, पूर्णाम् filled completely, पानस्य wine, स्थालीम् jar, दक्षिणेनैव पाणिना with her right hand only, जग्राह carried.
data.md: And a favourite damsel carried in her right hand a jewelled drinking bowl filled with wine.

data.v: राजहंसप्रतीकाशं छत्रं पूर्णशशिप्रभम् । सौवर्णदण्डमपरा गृहीत्वा पृष्ठतो ययौ ।।
data.es: Another shedemon moved behind him holding an umbrella with a golden handle which was white like a royal swan and bright like the fullmoon.
data.anv: अपरा another lady, राजहंसप्रतीकाशम् resembling a royal swan, पूर्णशशिप्रभम् bright like fullmoon, सौवर्णदण्डम् having a golden handle, छत्रम् umbrella, गृहीत्वा taking, पृष्ठतः behind, ययौ went.
data.md: Another carrying the white umbrella having golden ribs resembling the full moon and goose, followed in the train.

data.v: निद्रामदपरीताक्ष्यो रावणस्योत्तमस्त्रियः । अनुजग्मुः पतिं वीरं घनं विद्युल्लता इव ।।
data.es: The chief wives of Ravana with eyes dizzy with sleep and drinking followed their heroic husband like streaks of lightning follow a thunder cloud. (Ravana who was dark looked like a cloud and the women with dazzling golden complexion appeared like lightning.)
data.anv: निद्रामदपरीताक्ष्यः with eyes dizzy with sleep and intoxication, रावणस्य Ravana's, उत्तमाः prime, स्त्रियः wives, विद्युल्लताः like streaks of lightning, घनमिव like the the cloud, वीरम् heroic, पतिम् husband, अनुजग्मुः followed.
data.md: And in this wise the excellent wives, of Rāvaņa, having their eyes rendered sleepy with sleep and wine, followed their heroic husband like to lightings following the cloud.

data.v: ततः काञ्चीनिनादं च नूपुराणां च निःस्वनम् । शुश्राव परमस्त्रीणां स कपिर्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, heard their jingling golden girdles and anklets.
data.anv: ततः then, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, सः कपिः that vanara, परमस्त्रीणाम् of those chief wives, काञ्चीनिनादं च the sound of golden girdles with small bells, नूपुराणाम् of their anklets, निस्वनं च sound, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: And that monkey, son of Maruta, heard the sound of kāñcīs and nūpuras of those excellent damsels.

data.v: तं चाप्रतिमकर्माणमचिन्त्यबलपौरुषम् । द्वारदेशमनुप्राप्तं ददर्श हनुमान्कपिः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman, the Vanara saw Ravana of extraordinary deeds, and of unimaginable strength and valour at the entrance (of Ashoka garden)
data.anv: कपिः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman, अप्रतिमकर्माणम् one who does incomparable deeds, अचिन्त्यबलपौरुषम् a hero of unimaginable strength and valour, द्वारदेशम् the entrance, अनुप्राप्तम् reached, तं च him, ददर्श saw.
data.md: And the monkey Hanumān also beheld Rāvana, of extraordinary deeds and of inconceivable prowess and strength, at the gate.

data.v: दीपिकाभिरनेकाभिः समन्तादवभासितम् । गन्धतैलावसिक्ताभिर्ध्रियमाणाभिरग्रतः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw him in the glow of lamps wet with fragrant oil carried by many shedemons all over.
data.anv: गन्धतैलावसिक्ताभिः wet with fragrant oil, अग्रतः in front, ध्रियमाणाभिः held, अनेकाभिः by many, दीपिकाभिः with lamps, समन्तात् everywhere, अवभासितम् was shining.
data.md: His whole body was seen on all sides by the light of the lamps lighted with perfumed oil and carried by the Rākşasīs before.

data.v: कामदर्पमदैर्युक्तं जिह्मताम्रायतेक्षणम् । समक्षमिव कन्दर्पमपविद्ध शरासनम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw him, who was possessed of lust, arrogance and intoxication. He appeared like Cupid setting aside his quiver and arrows with his curved, big, red eyes.
data.anv: कामदर्पमदैः by lust, pride and intoxication, युक्तम् endowed, जिह्मताम्रायतेक्षणम् possesed of long curved bloodshot eyes, अपविद्धशरासनम् who set aside his quiver, समक्षम् directly, कन्दर्पमिव like god of love.
data.md: He was inflamed with amour, pride and haughtiness and his expansive eyes were coppery and idle. And he appeared like Cupid himself just appearing in view, leaving behind his bow and arrows.

data.v: मथितामृतफेनाभमरजो वस्त्रमुत्तमम् । सलीलमनुकर्षन्तं विमुक्तं सक्तमङ्गदे ।।
data.es: He was playfully pulling up his upper garment that slipped and stuck to his armlet. This excellent unsoiled robe was looking like the foam of churned nectar.
data.anv: मथितामृतफेनाभम् looking like the foam of churned nectar, अरजः without any dust, विमुक्तम् slipped, अङ्गदे in his armlet, सक्तम् stuck, उत्तमम् best, वस्त्रम् cloth, सलीलम् sportively, अनुकर्षन्तम् dragging.
data.md: Holding his excellent robe, covered with flowers, washed, set with jewels and white as the foam of the churned nectar, he placed it in its proper place.

data.v: तं पत्रविटपे लीनः पत्रपुष्पघनावृतः । समीपमुपसंक्रान्तं निध्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Hanuman seated on a leafy branch (of the simsupa tree) thickly covered with leaves and flowers started scanning the identity of Ravana who was drawing nearer.
data.anv: समीपम् close by, संक्रान्तमिव drawn nearer, तम् him, पत्रविटपे on a branch covered with leaves, लीनः concealed, पत्रपुष्पघनावृतः thickly covered with leaves and flowers, निध्यातुम् to scan the identity, उपचक्रमे started.
data.md: Hanumăn, hiding himself on the tree, in the midst of many leaves and flowers, tried to recognise him as he approached.

data.v: अवेक्षमाणश्च ततो ददर्श कपिकुञ्जरः । रूपयौवनसंपन्ना रावणस्य वरस्त्रियः ।।
data.es: The leader of the monkeys started gazing at the chief wives of Ravana endowed with youth and beauty৷৷
data.anv: ततः then, कपिकुञ्जरः leader of the monkeys, अवेक्षमाणः while looking carefully, रावणस्य Ravana's, रूपयौवनसम्पन्नाः endowed with youth and beauty, वरस्त्रियः chief wives, ददर्श saw.

data.v: ताभिः परिवृतो राजा सुरूपाभिर्महायशाः । तन्मृगद्विजसंघुष्टं प्रविष्टः प्रमदावनम् ।।
data.es: Surrounded by beauties, the glorious king entered the grove meant for women, reverberating with the sounds of beasts and birds.
data.anv: महायशाः glorious one, राजा king, सुरूपाभिः with charming ones, ताभिः with those women, परिवृतः  surrounded, मृगद्विजसङ्घुष्टम् echoed with sounds of beasts and birds, तत् that, प्रमदावनम् grove for women, प्रविष्टः entered.
data.md: Beholding him, that foremost of monkeys saw that highly famous king Rāvana, surrounded by his excellently beautiful and youthful wives, enter that forest of enjoyment filled with birds and animals.

data.v: क्षीबो विचित्राभरणः शङ्कुकर्णो महाबलः । तेन विश्रवसः पुत्रः स दृष्टो राक्षसाधिपः ।।
data.es: The brilliant vanara looked at the son of Visravas (Ravana), the demon king adorned with wonderful ornaments. He had long tapering ears. He was intoxicated with drink. Encircled by damsels, he was looking like the Moon surrounded by stars.
data.anv: क्षीबः excited by drinking, विचित्राभरणः wore wonderful ornaments, शङ्कुकर्णः with long tapering ears, विश्रवसः of Visravas, पुत्रः son, ताराभिः with stars, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, परमनारीभिः with damsels, वृतः surrounded, सः he, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, तेन by him, दृष्टः seen, महातेजाः brilliant, महाकपिः great vanara, तेजोवन्तम् splendid, तम् him, ददर्शे saw.
data.md: There was a warder by name Sankukarņa in that forest—highly powerful, wearing various ornaments and addicted to drinking. And by him was seen that lord of Rākşasas—the son of Visrava.

data.v: वृतः परमनारीभिस्ताराभिरिव चन्द्रमाः । तं ददर्श महातेजास्तेजोवन्तं महाकपिः ।।
data.es: The brilliant vanara looked at the son of Visravas (Ravana), the demon king adorned with wonderful ornaments. He had long tapering ears. He was intoxicated with drink. Encircled by damsels, he was looking like the Moon surrounded by stars.
data.anv: क्षीबः excited by drinking, विचित्राभरणः wore wonderful ornaments, शङ्कुकर्णः with long tapering ears, विश्रवसः of Visravas, पुत्रः son, ताराभिः with stars, चन्द्रमाः इव like the Moon, परमनारीभिः with damsels, वृतः surrounded, सः he, राक्षसाधिपः king of demons, तेन by him, दृष्टः seen, महातेजाः brilliant, महाकपिः great vanara, तेजोवन्तम् splendid, तम् him, ददर्शे saw.

data.es: The brilliant vanara (Hanuman), son of the Windgod recognising the strongarmed Ravana got down a little, saying 'This is truly the strongarmed Ravana.'

data.es: Hanuman, possessed of extraordinary energy, was taken aback at the might of Ravana. He remained hiding covered over with leaves.

data.md: And effulgent as he was, that highly intelligent monkey hid himself on a branch covered with leaves, being unable to stand before the effulgence of that Rākșasa.
