data.anv: पद्मनिभेक्षणा a lady with eyes like lotus petals, सीता Sita, राक्षसीनाम् of the ogresses, वचः words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् those filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् with both eyes, इदम् this way, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of those Rākşasīs, the lotus-eyed Sītā, with her eyes full of tears said.

data.v: यदिदं लोकविद्विष्टमुदाहरथ संगताः । नैतन्मनसि वाक्यं मे किल्बिषं प्रतितिष्ठति ।।
data.anv: सङ्गताः joined together, लोकविद्विष्टम् not acceptable to the world, यत् such, इदम् this, मे my, वाक्यम् words, उदाहरथ you spoke, एतत् this way, वः addressed by you, मनसि in mind, किल्बिषम् sinful, न प्रतिभाति not thought.
data.md: What you have all said and which is against human usage and vicious, dose not find place in my mind.

data.v: न मानुषी राक्षसस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हति । कामं खादत मां सर्वा न करिष्यामि वो वचः । दीनो वा राज्यहीनो वा यो मे भर्ता स मे गुरुः ।।
data.anv: मानुषी a human being, राक्षसस्य ogre's, भार्या wife, भवितुम् to become, न अर्हति ought not to be, सर्वाः all of you, कामम् freely, माम् me, खादत eat, वः addressed by you, वचः words, न करिष्यामि I will not do.
data.md: A woman can never be the wife of a Räksasa. Eat ine up if you will, I shall never follow your words.

data.v: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः । भर्त्सयन्ति स्म परुषैर्वाक्यै रावणचोदिताः ।।
data.es: Hearing the reply of Sita, the ogresses ordered by Ravana and overtaken by anger again began to threaten Sita using harsh words.
data.anv: रावणचोदिताः ordered by Ravana, राक्षस्यः by the ogresses, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, क्रोधमूर्छिताः overtaken by anger, परुषैः with harsh, वाक्यैः with statements, भर्त्सयन्ति स्म threatened.
data.md: Hearing the words of Sītā, all those Rākşasīs despatched by Rāvana, almost beside themselves with ire, again covered her with reproaches rough and rude.

data.v: अवलीनः स निर्वाक्यो हनुमाञ्शिंशपाद्रुमे । सीतां संतर्जयन्तीस्ता राक्षसीरशृणोत्कपिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman who kept himself concealed on the simsupa tree speechlessly listened to the ogresses threatening Sita.
data.anv: कपिः monkey, स: he, हनुमान् Hanuman, निर्वाक्यः speechless, शिंशुपाद्रुमे Simsupa tree, अवलीनः kept concealed, सीताम् Sita, सन्तर्जयन्तीः listened threatening, ताः those, राक्षसीः ogresses, अशृणोत् listened.
data.md: Hanumān remained all along speechless and hidden on the ſinsapā tree. And that monkey heard all those demons remonstrate with Sītā in this way.

data.v: तामभिक्रम्य संरब्धा वेपमानां समन्ततः । भृशं संलिलिहुर्दीप्तान्प्रलम्बदशनच्छदान् ।।
data.es: Sita was trembling in fear. The enraged ogresses went on licking their lips hanging, again and again.
data.anv: वेपमानाम् trembling in fear, ताम् her, समन्ततः from all around, अभिक्रम्य approaching, सङ्कृद्धाः enraged, दीप्तान् glowing, प्रलम्बान् hanging, दशनच्छदान् lips, भृशम् again and again, संलिलिहुः were licking.
data.md: Those, influenced with ire, approached the trembling Sītā and encircling her, licked again and again their long a burning lips.

data.v: ऊचुश्च परमक्रुद्धाः प्रगृह्याशु परश्वधान् । नेयमर्हति भर्तारं रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: The enraged ogresses immediately picked up the axes and rose up saying, 'she is unfit to have the demon king, Ravana as her husband'.
data.anv: परमक्रुद्धाः very angry women, आशु immediately, परश्वधान् axes, प्रगृह्य taking up, ऊचुश्च spoke, इयम् this, राक्षसाधिपम् to the demon king, रावणम् Ravana, भर्तारम् as husband, नार्हति not fit to be.
data.md: Taking up instantly spears, they exceedingly wroth, menaced her, saying— "she is not worthy of having Rāvana, the lord of the Rākşasas, as her lord."

data.v: सा भर्त्स्यमाना भीमाभी राक्षसीभिर्वरानना । सा बाष्पमपमार्जन्ती शिंशपां तामुपागमत् ।।
data.es: As the charming Sita was threatened by the fierce ogresses, she moved towards the simsupa tree with eyes full of tears.
data.anv: भीमाभिः राक्षसीभिः by fierce ogresses, भर्त्स्यमाना threatened, सा she, वरानना charming one, सबाष्पम् with tears, अपसर्पन्ती moved away, ताम् that, शिंशुपाम् Simsupa, उपागमत् reached.
data.md: Being thus remonstrated with by those terrible Raksasis, that excellent damsel, shedding tears, neared the ſinsapa tree.

data.v: ततस्तां शिंशपां सीता राक्षसीभिः समावृता । अभिगम्य विशालाक्षी तस्थौ शोकपरिप्लुता ।।
data.es: Then the largeeyed Sita, drowned in sorrow surrounded by the ogresses went near the simsupa tree and stood there.
data.anv: ततः then, विशालाक्षी largeeyed one, सीता Sita, तां शिंशुपाम् that Simsupa, अभिगम्य having reached, राक्षसीभिः by the ogresses, समावृता surrounded, शोकपरिप्लुता drowned in sorrow, तस्थौ stayed.
data.md: The large eyed Sītā, encircled by the Rākşasīs, remained there sunk in grief. And all those hideous demons, showered reproaches, from all sides, on her, greatly reduced, of a poorly countenance, and wearing a soiled cloth.

data.v: तां कृशां दीनवदनां मलिनाम्बरधारिणीम् । भर्त्सयां चक्रिरे भीमा राक्षस्यस्ताः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: The ogresses started intimidating Sita who was dressed in soiled clothes and emaciated with a dejected look on her face.
data.anv: ताः the, राक्षस्यः ogresses, कृशाम् shrunken, दीनवदनाम् dejected face, मलिनाम्बरधारिणीम् clad in soiled clothes, तां सीताम् that Sita, समन्ततः surrounded, भर्त्सयाञ्चक्रिरे started abusing.
data.md: The large eyed Sītā, encircled by the Rākşasīs, remained there sunk in grief. And all those hideous demons, showered reproaches, from all sides, on her, greatly reduced, of a poorly countenance, and wearing a soiled cloth.

data.v: ततस्तां विनता नाम राक्षसी भीमदर्शना । अब्रवीत्कुपिताकारा कराला निर्णतोदरी ।।
data.es: Then a dark ogress called Vinata with a terryfying look, loathsome appearance and a large sunken belly said to Sita:
data.anv: ततः then, भीमदर्शना of terrifying looks, कुपिताकारा of loathsome appearance, कराला a dark one, निर्णतोदरी with a large sunken belly, विनतानाम called Vinata, राक्षसी ogress, ताम् her, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thereupon a grim-visaged demon, angry, having hideous teeth and a huge belly extending downwards, by name Vinatā, spoke, saying:

data.v: सीते पर्याप्तमेतावद्भर्तृस्नेहो निदर्शितः । सर्वत्रातिकृतं भद्रे व्यसनायोपकल्पते ।।
data.es: 'O Sita you have shown your love for your husband to this extent. It is enough. O auspicious lady anything carried to excess leads to adversity.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, भर्तुः  your husband, स्नेहः love, निदर्शितः is shown, एतावत् to this extent, पर्याप्तम् it is enough, भद्रे auspicious lady, सर्वत्र everywhere, अतिकृतम् excess, व्यसनाय to adversity, उपकल्पते leads.
data.md: O Sītā, you had shown enough of attachment towards your husband. But, O gentle dame, excess of any thing tends to evil.

data.v: परितुष्टास्मि भद्रं ते मानुषस्ते कृतो विधिः । ममापि तु वचः पथ्यं ब्रुवन्त्याः कुरु मैथिलि ।।
data.es: "O Mythili I beseech you (to oblige Ravana). You have discharged your duty as a human being. Be happy. But you should also heed my advice which is, after all, salutary.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Mythili, परितुष्टा beseech, अस्मि I am, ते your, मानुषः human, विधिः duty, कृतः is done, ते to you, भद्रम् be happy, ब्रुवन्त्याः मम my, पथ्यम् wishingwell, वच:words, अपि also, कुरु follow.
data.md: We are satisfied. And may good betide you! You had acted worthily like a woman. do you hear, O Maithili, what I say for your welfare.

data.v: रावणं भज भर्तारं भर्तारं सर्वरक्षसाम् । विक्रान्तं रूपवन्तं च सुरेशमिव वासवम् ।।
data.anv: सर्वरक्षसाम् of all ogres, भर्तारम् lord विक्रान्तम् courageous, रूपवन्तं च handsome too, सुरेशम् the lord of gods, वासवमिव like Indra, दक्षिणम् a generous one, त्यागशीलं च sacrificing, सर्वस्य of all, प्रियदर्शनम् pleasing in appearance, रावणम् Ravana, भर्तारम् as husband, भज accept.

data.v: दक्षिणं त्यागशीलं च सर्वस्य प्रियवादिनम् । मानुषं कृपणं रामं त्यक्त्वा रावणमाश्रय ।।
data.md: Do you accept, Rāvana, the lord of the Rākşasa host, as your husband. He withstands powerfully his enemies like to Vāsava, the lord of the celestials, charitable, kind to all, and sweet-speeched. And forsaking Rāma, a poor wight, do you take Rāvana (as your husband)

data.v: दिव्याङ्गरागा वैदेहि दिव्याभरणभूषिता । अद्य प्रभृति सर्वेषां लोकानामीश्वरी भव । अग्नेः स्वाहा यथा देवी शचीवेन्द्रस्य शोभने ।।
data.es: 'Leave the helpless human Rama and seek Ravana's refuge. O Vaidehi, using the heavenly unguents and adorned with imposing ornaments from now on, be the queen of all people.
data.anv: मानुषम् a human, कृपणम् helpless, रामम् Rama, त्यक्त्वा leave, रावणम् Ravana, आश्रय seek refuge, वैदेहि Vaidehi, दिव्याङ्गरागा have heavenly unguents, दिव्याभरणभूषिता wearing imposing ornaments, अद्यप्रभृति from today, सर्वेषाम् for all, लोकानाम् people, ईश्वरी queen,भव you become
data.md: Having your person sprinkled with celestial paste and adorned with excellent ornaments, do you from today O Vaidehī, O you of comely presence, become the queen of all the worlds, like to Sachee of the lord of the celestials and svāhā (An exclamation used in making an oblation to the Gods. A personification of the preceding as the wife of fire and Goddess presiding over burnt offerings.) of the fire. What shall you do with Rama, O Vaidehi, poor and of limited life?

data.v: किं ते रामेण वैदेहि कृपणेन गतायुषा ।।
data.es: 'O beautiful Sita Just like Swaha, queen to the Firegod and Sachi to Indra, accept Ravana. Why are you still thinking of Rama who is helpless and whose life span is coming to an end soon.
data.anv: शोभने O beautiful one, अग्नेः for fire, देवी queen, स्वाहा यथा like Swaha, इन्द्रस्य Indra's, शचीव like Sachi, वैदेहि Vaidehi, कृपणेन a pitiable, गतायुषा whose life span is to end soon, रामेण with Rama, किम् what is the use?

data.v: एतदुक्तं च मे वाक्यं यदि त्वं न करिष्यसि । अस्मिन्मुहूर्ते सर्वास्त्वां भक्षयिष्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: 'If you do not heed our words of advice, all of us will eat you at this very moment.'
data.anv: उक्तम् spoken, मे my, एतत् this, वाक्यम् word, त्वम् you, न करिष्यसि you do not accept, यदि if, वयम् we, सर्वाः all of us, अस्मिन् at this, मुहूर्ते moment, त्वाम् you, भक्षयिष्यामहे we will eat you.
data.md: This is what I say and if do you not follow it we shall all instantly banquet on you.

data.v: अन्या तु विकटा नाम लम्बमानपयोधरा । अब्रवीत्कुपिता सीतां मुष्टिमुद्यम्य गर्जती ।।
data.es: Now Vikata another ogress with hanging breasts raised her fist up in anger and roared at Sita.
data.anv: लम्बमानपयोधरा lady with hanging breasts, विकटानाम called Vikata, अन्या तु another woman also, मुष्टिम् fist, उद्यम्य raised, कुपिता angry one, गर्जती roaring, सीताम् at Sita, अब्रवीत् she said.
data.md: Thereupon another Rākşasi named Vikață. having her breast hanging long, exercised with ire, and clinching her fist, addressed, roaring, Sita.

data.v: बहून्यप्रतिरूपाणि वचनानि सुदुर्मते । अनुक्रोशान्मृदुत्वाच्च सोढानि तव मैथिलि । न च नः कुरुषे वाक्यं हितं कालपुरस्कृतम् ।।
data.es: 'O wicked Mythili we have tolerated many unpleasant words uttered by you due to our kindness and mildness৷৷
data.anv: सुदुर्मते O wicked, मैथिलि Mythili, अप्रियरूपाणि of unpleasant, बहूनि many, तव your वचनानि words, अनुक्रोशात् out of kindness, मृदुत्वाच्च of and due to mildness, सोढानि are put up with.
data.md: O foolish daughter of the king of Mithilā, we have put up with all your foolish words only out of compassion, and because you are a feeble being.

data.v: आनीतासि समुद्रस्य पारमन्यैर्दुरासदम् । रावणान्तःपुरं घोरं प्रविष्टा चासि मैथिलि ।।
data.es: 'O Mythili you have heeded not our good and timely advice tendered in your interest. You have been brought to the other shore of the ocean and to the inner chambers of Ravana which is very difficult for others to access.
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, कालपुरस्कृतम् timely, हितम् wishing you well, नः our, वाक्यम् word, न कुरुषे च you do not accept, अन्यैः by others, दुरासदम् not approachable, समुद्रस्य ocean's, पारम् to the shore, आनीता brought, असि you are, घोरम् dreadful, रावणान्तःपुरम् Ravana's inner chambers, प्रविष्टा entered, असि you are.
data.md: It will not lead to your well-being if you do not hear our words. You had been brought here, the other side of the ocean, difficult of being approached by others. You had come within the terrible abode of Rāvana O Maithili, and had been shut up in his room guarded by us all.

data.v: रावणस्य गृहे रुधा अस्माभिस्तु सुरक्षिता । न त्वां शक्तः परित्रातुमपि साक्षात्पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: 'You are in Ravana's house, wellguarded by us. It is not possible even for Indra, destroyer of citadels, to come to your rescue (let alone Rama).
data.anv: रावणस्य Ravana's, गृहे in home, रुद्धाम् arrested, अस्माभिः by us, सुरक्षिताम् very well guarded, त्वाम् you, परित्रातुम् to rescue, साक्षात् even if, पुरन्दरः अपि even the destroyer of citadels, (Indra) also, न शक्तः not able.

data.v: कुरुष्व हितवादिन्या वचनं मम मैथिलि । अलमश्रुप्रपातेन त्यज शोकमनर्थकम् ।।
data.es: 'Mythili, act according to our advice. I am your wellwisher. Give up sorrow and stop shedding useless tears.
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, हितवादिन्याः of a wellwisher, मम my, वचनम् word, कुरुष्व you may heed, अश्रुप्रपातेन by shedding tears, अलम् enough, अनर्थकम् useless, शोकम् sorrow, त्यज give up.

data.v: भज प्रीतिं प्रहर्षं च त्यजैतां नित्यदैन्यताम् । सीते राक्षसराजेन सह क्रीड यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: 'O Sita offer your love to Ravana, adore him and be happy. Give up this continuous dejection. Enjoy all pleasures along with the king of demons.
data.anv: सीते O Sita, प्रीतिं च and love, हर्षं च happiness, भज adopt, एताम् this, नित्यदैन्यताम् being dejected always, त्यज give up, राक्षसराजेन सह along with the demon king, यथासुखम् as you please, क्रीड you enjoy.

data.v: जानासि हि यथा भीरु स्त्रीणां यौवनमध्रुवम् । यावन्न ते व्यतिक्रामेत्तावत्सुखमवाप्नुहि ।।
data.es: 'O timid Sita know that youth of women is fleeting and transient. Before it is over, enjoy all kinds of pleasures.
data.anv: भीरु O timid lady, स्त्रीणाम् for women, यौवनम् youth, यथा since, अध्रुवम् not stable, जानासि हि you know, ते you, यावत् until, न व्यतिक्रामेत् before it is over, तावत् सुखम् till then all pleasures, अवाप्नुहि enjoy.

data.v: उद्यानानि च रम्याणि पर्वतोपवनानि च । सह राक्षसराजेन चर त्वं मदिरेक्षणे ।।
data.es: 'O lady of intoxicating eyes range in the company of the demon king, the delightful gardens and mountain ranges filled with gardens.
data.anv: मदिरेक्षणे O lady of intoxicating eyes, त्वम् you, राक्षसराजेन with the demon king, रम्याणि delightful, उद्यानानि gardens, पर्वतोपवनानि and gardens surrounding mountain ranges, चर range

data.v: स्त्रीसहस्राणि ते सप्त वशे स्थास्यन्ति सुन्दरि । रावणं भज भर्तारं भर्तारं सर्वरक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: 'O beautiful Sita seven thousand ogresses will be at your beck and call. (Therefore) accept Ravana, the lord of all ogres as your husband.
data.anv: सुन्दरि O beautiful one, सप्त seven, स्त्री सहस्राणि a thousand women, ते your, वशे under your control, स्थास्यन्ति will remain, सर्वरक्षसाम् for all the ogres, भर्तारम् lord, रावणम् Ravana, भर्तारम् as your husband, भज accept.

data.v: उत्पाट्य वा ते हृदयं भक्षयिष्यामि मैथिलि । यदि मे व्याहृतं वाक्यं न यथावत्करिष्यसि ।।
data.es: 'O Mythili if you heed not my words of advice, I will pluck out your heart and eat it up'.
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, व्याहृतम् spoken, मे me, वाक्यम् word, यथावत् faithfully, न करिष्यसि if you do not obey यदि if, ते हृदयम् your heart, उत्पाट्य वा pluck out, भक्षयिष्यामि eat up.
data.md: If do you not follow, what I say, O Maithili, I shall taking out your heart, banquet on it.

data.v: ततश्चण्डोदरी नाम राक्षसी क्रूरदर्शना । भ्रामयन्ती महच्छूलमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then an ogress named Praghasa, overwhelmed with anger, deriding Sita said these terrible words:
data.anv: ततः then, प्रघसा नाम named Praghasa, राक्षसी ogress, क्रोधमूर्छिता overwhelmed with anger, तदा then, भर्त्सयन्ती deriding, घोरम् terrific manner, इदम् these, वचनं तु words also, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: इमां हरिणलोकाक्षीं त्रासोत्कम्पपयोधराम् । रावणेन हृतां दृष्ट्वा दौर्हृदो मे महानभूत् ।।
data.es: 'I have developed a morbid desire to feast upon this woman with eyes flashing like doe's, whose breasts heave with stress and fear after she was abducted by Ravana.
data.anv: हरिणलोलाक्षीम् eyes flashing like doe's, त्रासोत्कम्पिपयोधराम् her breasts heaving in stress, रावणेन by Ravana, हृताम् abducted, इमाम् this lady, दृष्ट्वा seeing you, मे my, महान् great, दौहृदः desire in my heart, अभूत् developed.

data.v: यकृत्प्लीहमथोत्पीडं हृदयं च सबन्धनम् । अन्त्राण्यपि तथा शीर्षं खादेयमिति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: 'I thought of feasting on your spleen, liver, heart, all the joints, head and intestines.'
data.anv: यकृत् liver, प्लीहम् spleen, उत्पीडम् pressing out, सबन्धनम् including all joints, हृदयं च heart also, अन्त्राण्यपि च intestines, तथा similarly, शीर्षम् head, खादेयम् इति I may eat up, मे my, मतिः thought.

data.v: ततस्तु प्रघसा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । कण्ठमस्या नृशंसायाः पीडयामः किमास्यते ।।
data.es: Next spoke an ogress called Praghasa, saying 'Why not we twist and squeeze the neck of this heartless lady. Why are you sitting idle still? Come on.'
data.anv: ततः then, प्रघसा नाम called Praghasa, राक्षसी ogress,, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, अस्याः her, नृशंसायाः of the heartless lady, कण्ठम् throat, पीडयाम we will twist, किम् why, आस्यते are you sitting idle.
data.md: Thereupon another Rākşasī named Praghasă and-"I shall grind the throat of this cruel woman. What are you doing, sitting here? You shall then relate to the king that the woman is dead. And undoubtedly he shall say 'Do you eat her up."

data.v: निवेद्यतां ततो राज्ञे मानुषी सा मृतेति ह । नात्र कश्चन संदेहः खादतेति स वक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Thereafter we will announce that such a human being is dead. Then Ravana will simply say 'eat her up'. There is no doubt .'
data.anv: सा she, मानुषी that human being, मृतेति is dead, ततः then, राज्ञे to the king, निवेद्यताम् let it be announced, खादत you may eat her, इति thus, सः he, वक्ष्यति he will say, अत्र here, कश्चन even a little, सन्देहः doubt, न not.
data.md: Thereupon another Rākşasī named Praghasă and-"I shall grind the throat of this cruel woman. What are you doing, sitting here? You shall then relate to the king that the woman is dead. And undoubtedly he shall say 'Do you eat her up."

data.v: ततस्त्वजामुखी नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । विशस्येमां ततः सर्वान्समान्कुरुत पीलुकान् ।।
data.es: Then an ogress called Harijata said this in anger, her cateyes rolling:
data.anv: ततः then, मार्जारसदृशेक्षणा cateyed, हरिजटा नाम called Harijata, राक्षसी ogress, कोपात् with anger, नयने both eyes, विवर्त्य rolling, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: And thereupon another Räkşasi named Ajāmukhi said, “I do not like quarrels. Let us all divide her into equal portions. Bring soon our favourite drink and various garlands."

data.v: विभजाम ततः सर्वा विवादो मे न रोचते । पेयमानीयतां क्षिप्रं माल्यं च विविधं बहु ।।
data.es: 'We shall share them. I do not like disputes in this regard. Go swiftly and get drinks and food to lick. Let the accompanying dishes of all variety and quality be brought.'
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सर्वाः all, विभजाम we will share, मे to me, विवादः dispute, न रोचते it is disliked, क्षिप्रम् swiftly, पेयम् drink, उच्चावचम् of all types, बहु many, लेह्यम् licking food, आनीयताम् may be brought.
data.md: And thereupon another Räkşasi named Ajāmukhi said, “I do not like quarrels. Let us all divide her into equal portions. Bring soon our favourite drink and various garlands."

data.v: ततः शूर्पणखा नाम राक्षसी वाक्यमब्रवीत् । अजामुखा यदुक्तं हि तदेव मम रोचते ।।
data.es: Then an ogress called Surpanakha said, 'I too like the proposal of Ajamukhi.'
data.anv: ततः then, शूर्पणखा नाम called Soorpanakha, राक्षसी rakshasi, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said, अजामुख्या Ajamukhi, यत्  what ever, उक्तम् was said, तदेव that alone, मम to me, रोचते is acceptable.

data.v: सुरा चानीयतां क्षिप्रं सर्वशोकविनाशिनी । मानुषं मांसमासाद्य नृत्यामोऽथ निकुम्भिलाम् ।।
data.es: 'Get the wine quickly, destroyer of all sorrows. After relishing the human flesh we will start Nikumbhila dance.'
data.anv: क्षिप्रम् quickly, सर्वशोकविनाशिनी destroyer of all sorrows, सुरा च wine also, आनीयताम् may be brought, मानुषम् humans, मांसम् flesh, आस्वाद्य after relishing, अथ then, निकुम्भिलाम् Nikumbhila, नृत्यामः we will dance.
data.md: Then followed another Rākşasí by name Śūrpanakha, I do fully concur with what Ajāmukhi has said. Bring soon wine, the remover of all griefs. Banqueting on human flesh I shall dance before the queen Nikumbhilă.

data.v: एवं संभर्त्स्यमाना सा सीता सुरसुतोपमा । राक्षसीभिः सुघोराभिर्धैर्यमुत्सृज्य रोदिति ।।
data.es: Threatened by the ogresses in that manner, Sita who was like the daughter of a god, cried aloud.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुर्विंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: सुघोराभिः by the highly dreadful ones, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, एवम् in that manner, संभर्त्स्यमाना being threatened, सुरसुतोपमा like the daughter of a god, सा सीता that Sita, धैर्यम् courage, उत्सृज्य after giving up, रोदिति she cried aloud.
data.md: Being thus threatened by those grim-visaged Rākṣasīs Sītā, resembling the daughter of a celestial, renouncing patience, began to weep.

data.v: तथा तासां वदन्तीनां परुषं दारुणं बहु । राक्षसीनामसौम्यानां रुरोद जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: On hearing the many harsh words of dire threat by the ugly ogresses, the daughter of Janaka wept.
data.anv: अथ then, असौम्यानाम्  ugly, तासाम् of them, राक्षसीनाम् of the ogresses, परुषम् harsh, दारुणम् terrific, बहु much, वदन्तीनाम् they spoke, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, रुरोद cried.
data.md: Those hideous Rākşasīs thus threatening her with reproaches rude and rough, the daughter of the king Janaka began to weep.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही राक्षसीभिर्मनस्विनी । उवाच परमत्रस्ता बाष्पगद्गदया गिरा ।।
data.es: In reply to the ogresses who thus spoke, noble Vaidehi, terribly frightened, said in a voice choked with tears.
data.anv: राक्षसीभिः by the ogresses, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having spoken, मनस्विनी a noble lady, वैदेही Vaidehi, परमत्रस्ता terribly afraid, भाष्पगद्गदया throat choked, with tears, गिरा with a word, उवाच said.
data.md: And being thus addressed by those Rākşasīs, Vaidehi, of subdued soul, being greatly terrified, said, having her voice choked with vapour.

data.v: न मानुषी राक्षसस्य भार्या भवितुमर्हति । कामं खादत मां सर्वा न करिष्यामि वो वचः ।।
data.anv: मानुषी a human being, राक्षसस्य ogre's, भार्या wife, भवितुम् to become, न अर्हति ought not to be, सर्वाः all of you, कामम् freely, माम् me, खादत eat, वः addressed by you, वचः words, न करिष्यामि I will not do.
data.md: A woman can never be the wife of a Räksasa. Eat ine up if you will, I shall never follow your words.

data.v: सा राक्षसी मध्यगता सीता सुरसुतोपमा । न शर्म लेभे दुःखार्ता रावणेन च तर्जिता ।।
data.es: Surrounded by the ogresses, distressed Sita, who was like the daughter of a divine, did not get any solace.
data.anv: राक्षसीमध्यगता surrounded by ogresses, सुरसुतोपमा like the daughter of a divine, रावणेन च by Ravana, तर्जिता threatened, सा सीता that Sita, दुःखार्ता distressed, शर्म solace, न लेभे could not get.
data.md: And being surrounded by the Rākṣasīs and threatened by Rāvana, Sītă, resembling the daughter of a celestial, stricken with grief, could not console herself.

data.v: वेपते स्माधिकं सीता विशन्तीवाङ्गमात्मनः । वने यूथपरिभ्रष्टा मृगी कोकैरिवार्दिता ।।
data.es: 'Like a doe that strayed from the herd in the forest and tormented by wolves around, Sita had withdrawn into herself all her limbs through fear, she was trembling excessively.
data.anv: वने in the forest, यूथपरिभ्रष्टा strayed from the herd, कोकैः by wolves, अर्दिता tormented, मृगीव like a doe, सीता Sita, आत्मनः herself, अङ्गम् her limbs, विशन्तिः withdrawing herself, अधिकम् excessively, वेपते स्म trembled.
data.md: And trembling, she shrank from their presence like to a strayed fawn surrounded by wolves.

data.v: सा त्वशोकस्य विपुलां शाखामालम्ब्य पुष्पिताम् । चिन्तयामास शोकेन भर्तारं भग्नमानसा ।।
data.es: Laying hold on a large blossoming branch of the Ashoka tree, Sita thought of her husband with a broken heart.
data.anv: शोकेन with grief, भग्नमानसा with a broken heart, सा she, अशोकस्य Ashoka tree, पुष्पिताम् flowered, विपुलाम् large, शाखाम् branch, आलम्ब्य laying hold on, भर्तारम् of her husband, चिन्तयामास thought.
data.md: And resorting to a flowery branch of an Asoka tree, she sunk in grief, thought upon her lord.

data.v: सा स्नापयन्ती विपुलौ स्तनौ नेत्रजलस्रवैः । चिन्तयन्ती न शोकस्य तदान्तमधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: Her large breasts bathed with the flow of tears, she continued to brood over her plight and found no end to it.
data.anv: तदा then, सा she, नेत्रजलस्रवैः with the flow of tears, विपुलौ large, स्तनौ breasts, स्नापयन्ती bathing them, चिन्तयन्ती brooding, शोकस्य of sorrow, अन्तम् end, न अधिगच्छति could not find.
data.md: With tears she bathed her beautiful breast and oppressed with woe, she could not reach the other bank of the ocean of grief.

data.v: सा वेपमाना पतिता प्रवाते कदली यथा । राक्षसीनां भयत्रस्ता विवर्णवदनाभवत् ।।
data.es: Trembling like a banana tree uprooted by the stormy wind, Sita who was seized with fear of the ogresses looked pale and desperate.
data.anv: सा she, प्रवाते to stormy wind, पतिता fallen, कदली यथा like a banana plant, वेपमाना trembling, राक्षसीनां of the ogresses, भयंत्रस्ता frightened, विवर्णवदना palefaced, अभवत् became.
data.md: Like a plantain tree shaken by the breeze, she shook and fell down trembling (on the earth). And being afraid of the Rākşasīs, her cheeks forsook their native hue.

data.v: तस्या सा दीर्घविपुला वेपन्त्याः सीतया तदा । ददृशे कम्पिनी वेणी व्यालीव परिसर्पती ।।
data.es: The long, luxuriant braid of hair of the trembling Sita waving (in the wind), appeared like a crawling female serpent.
data.anv: वेपन्त्याः of the trembling Sita, तस्याः her, दीर्घविपुला long and luxuriant, कम्पिनी shaking, सा that, सीतया by Sita, वेणी braid, परिसर्पती moving, व्यालीव like a female serpent, ददृशे appeared.
data.md: And herself trembling, her pretty long lock of hair also shook and appeared like a serpent moving this way and that.

data.v: सा निःश्वसन्ती दुःखार्ता शोकोपहतचेतना । आर्ता व्यसृजदश्रूणि मैथिली विललाप ह ।।
data.es: The distressed Mythili, her consciousness drowned in grief, sighing, shed streams of tears.
data.anv: दुःखार्ता distressed lady, शोकोपहतचेतना consciousness drowned in tears, आर्ता afflicted, सा she, मैथिली Mythili, निःश्वसन्ती while sighing, अश्रूणि tears, व्यसृजत् shedding, विललाप ह cried.

data.v: हा रामेति च दुःखार्ता पुनर्हा लक्ष्मणेति च । हा श्वश्रु मम कौसल्ये हा सुमित्रेति भाविनि ।।
data.es: 'The bright, beautiful Sita began to wail, alas, "Rama alas, Lakshmana alas, my motherinlaw, Kausalya alas, Sumitra
data.anv: भामिनी beautiful lady, दुःखार्ता afflicted, हा रामेति alas, Rama, पुनः again, हा लक्ष्मणेति alas, Lakshmana, मम my, श्वश्रु motherinlaw, हा कौसल्ये alas, Kausalya, हा सुमित्रेति alas, Sumitra.

data.v: लोकप्रवादः सत्योऽयं पण्डितैः समुदाहृतः । अकाले दुर्लभो मृत्युः स्त्रिया वा पुरुषस्य वा ।।
data.es: 'There is a famous popular saying among the learned that untimely death is not possible either for a woman or a man.It is true that I am living in this miserable condition, deprived of Rama's company and tormented by these cruel ogresses here. Living in such conditions even for a moment is impossible. But nobody dies an untimely death.
data.anv: अहम् I, एवम् in this way, क्रूराभिः by cruel, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, अर्दिता tormented, इह here, रामेण from Rama, हीना separated from, दुःखार्ता afflicted, मुहूर्तमपि even a moment, यदा such being the fact, जीवामि I live, स्त्रिया वा by a woman or, पुरुषस्य वा or for a man, अकाले untimely, मृत्युः death, दुर्लभः is difficult, पण्डितैः by the learned, समुदाहृतः quoted, लोकप्रवादः among people, सत्यः truth.

data.v: यत्राहमाभिः क्रूराभी राक्षसीभिरिहार्दिता । जीवामि हीना रामेण मुहूर्तमपि दुःखिता ।।
data.es: 'There is a famous popular saying among the learned that untimely death is not possible either for a woman or a man.It is true that I am living in this miserable condition, deprived of Rama's company and tormented by these cruel ogresses here. Living in such conditions even for a moment is impossible. But nobody dies an untimely death.
data.anv: अहम् I, एवम् in this way, क्रूराभिः by cruel, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, अर्दिता tormented, इह here, रामेण from Rama, हीना separated from, दुःखार्ता afflicted, मुहूर्तमपि even a moment, यदा such being the fact, जीवामि I live, स्त्रिया वा by a woman or, पुरुषस्य वा or for a man, अकाले untimely, मृत्युः death, दुर्लभः is difficult, पण्डितैः by the learned, समुदाहृतः quoted, लोकप्रवादः among people, सत्यः truth.
data.md: Or else I would not have lived for a moment, separated from Rama and oppressed by the Raksasis as I am.

data.v: एषाल्पपुण्या कृपणा विनशिष्याम्यनाथवत् । समुद्रमध्ये नौ पूर्णा वायुवेगैरिवाहता ।।
data.es: 'I am a woman of low merit, a wretched woman, an orphan. I will be ruined like the loaded boat that gets hit in the midst of the ocean by the stormy wind.
data.anv: अल्पपुण्या a lowly women, कृपणा a wretched, एषा here I am, अनाथवत् like an orphan, समुद्रमध्ये in the midst of ocean, वायुवेगैः by the speed of the wind, आहता hit, पूर्णा full, नौः इव like a boat, विनशिष्यामि will be ruined.
data.md: Limited is my virtue, and therefore I am to die the death of a poor deserted thing like to a bark driven by the blast in the midst of the ocean.

data.v: भर्तारं तमपश्यन्ती राक्षसीवशमागता । सीदामि खलु शोकेन कूलं तोयहतं यथा ।।
data.es: 'Unable to find my husband and seized by these ogresses, I am collapsing on account of grief like a riverbank under the current of water.
data.anv: भर्तारम् husband, तम् him, अपश्यन्ती not finding, राक्षसीवशम् under control of the ogresses, आगता reached, तोयहतम् eroded by water, तीरं यथा like the bank of a river, शोकेन on account of grief, सीदामि खलु I am collapsing indeed.
data.md: Debarred from my husband's sight and tortured by the hideous demons, I shall sink, oppressed with woes, like to the banks of a river, washed by the water.

data.v: तं पद्मदलपत्राक्षं सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् । धन्याः पश्यन्ति मे नाथं कृतज्ञं प्रियवादिनम् ।।
data.es: 'Blessed are those who are in touch with my husband with eyes like lotus petals, whose walk is majestic like a lion's, who has a sense of gratitude and is pleasing in words.
data.anv: पद्मदलपत्राक्षं one who has eyes like lotus petals, सिंहविक्रान्तगामिनम् one who walks majestically like a lion, कृतज्ञम् grateful one, प्रियवादिनम् sweet in his talk, तम् him, मे my, नाथम् lord, धन्याः blessed, पश्यन्ति can see.
data.md: Oh blest are they who have been resting their eyes upon my grateful and sweet-speeched lord of leonine gaits, having eyes resembling lotus petals!

data.v: सर्वथा तेन हीनाया रामेण विदितात्मना । तीष्क्णं विषमिवास्वाद्य दुर्लभं मम जीवितम् ।।
data.es: 'Separated from Rama endowed with selfknowledge, it is impossible for me to live like one who has drunk venom.
data.anv: विदितात्मना endowed with selfknowledge, तेन by him, रामेण by Rama, हीनायाः separated, मम my, तीक्ष्णम् deadly, विषम् poison, आस्वाद्येव like one who has drunk, जीवितम् life, सर्वथा by all means, दुर्लभम् impossible.
data.md: And separated from Rāma of subdued soul, it is as difficult for me to breathe as for him who has drank up virulent poison.

data.v: कीदृशं तु मया पापं पुरा देहान्तरे कृतम् । येनेदं प्राप्यते दुःखं मया घोरं सुदारुणम् ।।
data.es: 'I do not know what great sin I have committed in my past life for which I experience this terrific, cruel affliction?
data.anv: येन by such a manner, मया by me, घोरम् terrific, सुदारुणम् very cruel, इदम् this, दुःखम् sorrow, प्राप्यते experienced, कीदृशम् what type of, महापापम्  great sin, मया by me, जन्मान्तरे in my past life, कृतम् is done.
data.md: What mighty iniquity had I perpetrated in my previous existence that I have met with this terrible disaster!

data.v: जीवितं त्यक्तुमिच्छामि शोकेन महता वृता । राक्षसीभिश्च रक्षन्त्या रामो नासाद्यते मया ।।
data.es: 'I long to give up my life, afflicted with great grief, as I, wellguarded by these ogresses, have no hope to reach Rama.
data.anv: महता with great, शोकेन by sorrow, अवृता filled, जीवितम् life, त्यक्तुम् to give up, इच्छामि I long, रामः Rama, मया by me, नासाद्यते reach, राक्षसीभिः by ogresses, सुरक्षिता I am wellguarded.
data.md: I wish to renounce my life under this load of grief-but alas! I am surrounded by the Raks asis and cannot meet Rāma.

data.v: धिगस्तु खलु मानुष्यं धिगस्तु परवश्यताम् । न शक्यं यत्परित्यक्तुमात्मच्छन्देन जीवितम् ।।
data.es: 'Fie upon this human life. Fie upon this dependence. What a pitiable situation I am placed in. It is not possible for me, a human, to give up life at my free will.' इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चविंशस्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मानुष्यम् human, धिक् अस्तु what a pitiable situation, परवश्यताम् dependance, धिक् अस्तु fie upon, यत् since, आत्मच्छन्देन although I wish, जीवितम् life, परित्यक्तुम् to give up, न शक्यम् खलु not able.
data.md: Oh! cursed is this subject human life, that they cannot renounce it even at their pleasure!

data.v: प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखीत्येवं ब्रुवन्ती जनकात्मजा । अधोमुखमुखी बाला विलप्तुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: The young daughter of king Janaka thus speaking, began to cry, her face bent down.
data.anv: प्रसक्ताश्रुमुखी shedding tears on this account, बाला young lady, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, एवम् in this way, ब्रुवन्ती speaking, अधोगतमुखी with a face bending low, विलप्तुम् to cry, उपचक्रमे started.

data.v: उन्मत्तेव प्रमत्तेव भ्रान्तचित्तेव शोचती । उपावृत्ता किशोरीव विवेष्टन्ती महीतले ।।
data.es: Bewildered or distracted or intoxicated, this young lady wailed, wallowing round on the ground like a young female horse:
data.anv: उन्मत्तेव like a bewildered person, प्रमत्तेव like an intoxicated one, भ्रान्तचित्तेव with distracted mind, शोचती worrying, उपावृत्ता wallowing, किशोरीव like an young horse, महीतले on the ground, विवेष्टन्ती coiled round.
data.md: Saying this, the daughter of the king Janaka, bathed her countenance with tears and hanging down her head began to lament. And she began to roll on the earth like to a colt as if she was mad, possessed by a devil and had lost her sense.

data.v: राघवस्याप्रमत्तस्य रक्षसा कामरूपिणा । रावणेन प्रमथ्याहमानीता क्रोशती बलात् ।।
data.es: "When Rama was engaged (in deer hunt) and I was screaming, I was brought forcibly by Ravana who can assume any form at his will.
data.anv: राघवस्य Rama's, प्रमत्तस्य engaged, कामरूपिणा who can assume any form at his will, रक्षसा by a demon, रावणेन by Ravana, प्रमथ्य tormented, क्रोशती screaming, अहम् I, बलात् forcibly, आनीता I was brought.
data.md: I, the spouse of Rāma, who was drawn away at a distance by the Rākşasa (Mārīca) assuming shapes at will, was seized and borne away by Rāvana.

data.v: राक्षसी वशमापन्ना भर्त्यमाना सुदारुणम् । चिन्तयन्ती सुदुःखार्ता नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: "Having fallen under the clutches of the dreadful demonesses and threatened by them, I am so full of woes and worries that I don't want to live.
data.anv: राक्षसीवशम् fallen under the clutches of the ogresses, आपन्ना I have been, सुदारुणम् very dreadful, भर्त्स्यमाना  threatened, चिन्तयन्ती worrying, सुदुःखार्ता overcome with terrible grief, अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे I have no interest.
data.md: A captive of the Rākşasis, subject to their terrible threats and taunts, sunk in grief and anxiety, I desire not to keep my life.

data.v: न हि मे जीवितेनार्थो नैवार्थैर्न च भूषणैः । वसन्त्या राक्षसी मध्ये विना रामं महारथम् ।।
data.es: "In the absence of the great charioteer Rama, of what use is my living in the midst of ogresses? I need no wealth, no ornaments.
data.anv: महारथम् great charioteer, रामं विना without Rama, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of ogresses, वसन्त्याः while living, मे my, जीवितेन with life, अर्थः use, न not, अर्थैः with wealth, न no, भूषणैश्च with ornaments, न no need.
data.md: Of what avail are wealth, ornament and life to me, who am living in the midst of the Răkşasas and separated from Ráma, of the mighty car?

data.v: धिङ्मामनार्यामसतीं याहं तेन विना कृता । मुहूर्तमपि रक्षामि जीवितं पापजीविता ।।
data.es: "I am preserving this sinful life like this though separated from Rama. Fie on me, for this wretched, infidel life
data.anv: पापजीविता a woman of sinful life, या since, अहम् I, तेन विना कृता I am separated from Rama, मुहूर्तमपि even for a moment, जीवितम् life, रक्षामि I am preserving, अनार्याम् a wrteched, असतीम्  infidel, माम् me, धिक् fie upon
data.md: Woe to me! who am unchaste and vile and my life is vicious, since breathe I still in the absence of my lord.

data.v: का च मे जीविते श्रद्धा सुखे वा तं प्रियं विना । भर्तारं सागरान्ताया वसुधायाः प्रियं वदम् ।।
data.es: "How can I have interest in any kind of pleasure without my sweettongued husband, the lord of the whole earth extending up to the ocean.
data.anv: सागरान्तायाः extending upto the ocean, वसुधायाः of the earth, भर्तारम् husband, प्रियंवदम् of pleasing words, तम् him, विना without, मे my, जीविते in life, सुखे वा in pleasure, श्रद्धा interest, का why?

data.v: भिद्यतां भक्ष्यतां वापि शरीरं विसृजाम्यहम् । न चाप्यहं चिरं दुःखं सहेयं प्रियवर्जिता ।।
data.es: "I will give up my body. Break me into pieces or eat me up. I cannot bear the sorrow of separation from my dear Rama any longer.
data.anv: अहम् I, शरीरम् my body, विसृजामि I will leave, भिद्यताम् you cut me to pieces, भक्ष्यतां वापि or you eat me up, प्रियवर्जिता separated from my dear lord, अहम् I, चिरम् for long, दुःखम् sorrow, न च सहेयम् I cannot bear.

data.v: चरणेनापि सव्येन न स्पृशेयं निशाचरम् । रावणं किं पुनरहं कामयेयं विगर्हितम् ।।
data.es: "I will not even touch that vile nightranger Ravana with my left foot. What to speak of loving him.
data.anv: निशाचरम् nightranger, विगर्हितम् vile, रावणम् Ravana, अहम् I, सव्येन with the left, चरेणेन अपि even with feet, न स्पृशेयम् will not touch, किं what, पुनः again, काममेयं can I love him.
data.md: What of fixing my fancy on that night-ranger Rāvaņa, my meaner foot even shall not touch him?

data.v: प्रत्याख्यातं न जानाति नात्मानं नात्मनः कुलम् । यो नृशंस स्वभावेन मां प्रार्थयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.anv: यः he who, नृशंसस्वभावेन due to cruel nature, माम् me, प्रार्थयितुम् for pleading, इच्छति hopes, आत्मानम् his own, प्रत्याख्यातम् loss of fame, न जानाति is not aware, आत्मनः of himself, कुलम् family, न not.
data.md: That (demon) who is courting me in this terrible way, does not know himself, his own race and that I loathe him so much.

data.v: छिन्ना भिन्ना विभक्ता वा दीप्ते वाग्नौ प्रदीपिता । रावणं नोपतिष्ठेयं किं प्रलापेन वश्चिरम् ।।
data.es: "Even if I am cut, broken to pieces or burnt in glowing fire, I will not accept Ravana. Why do you shout for so long?
data.anv: छिन्ना वा whether cut, भिन्ना broken into pieces, दीप्ते as if burnt, अग्नौ by fire, प्रदीपिता वा or burnt by others, रावणम् Ravana, नोपतिष्ठेयम् I will not accept, चिरम् for long, विभक्ता: or else share, प्रलापेन by empty words, किम् what is the use.
data.md: What more shall I speak to you, I shall never consent to Rāvana's prayer, I might be rent from limb to limb or burnt in fire.

data.v: ख्यातः प्राज्ञः कृतज्ञश्च सानुक्रोशश्च राघवः । सद्वृत्तो निरनुक्रोशः शङ्के मद्भाग्यसंक्षयात् ।।
data.es: "Rama is renowned, wise, grateful and kindly. It is due to my misfortune that he has turned pitiless to me. There is no doubt.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, ख्यातः renowned, प्राज्ञःwise, कृतज्ञ grateful, सानुक्रोशश्च a kind hearted one, सद्वृत्तः well behaved, मद्भाग्यसङ्क्षयात् due to my misfortune, निरनुक्रोशः turned pitiless, शङ्के I doubt.
data.md: Rāghava is grateful, true, wise and kind. I fear it is through my ill-luck that he dose not feel pity for me.

data.v: राक्षसानां जनस्थाने सहस्राणि चतुर्दश । येनैकेन निरस्तानि स मां किं नाभिपद्यते ।।
data.es: "He who destroyed fourteen thousand demons singlehanded has not come to protect me. I do not know why.
data.anv: एकेन by single one, येन by whom, जनस्थाने at Jansthana, राक्षसानाम् of demons, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, निरस्तानि destroyed, सः he, माम् my, किम् why, नाभिपद्यते not protect me.
data.md: Will he not take me back who alone slew the thousands of the Rākşasas in Janasthāna?

data.v: निरुद्धा रावणेनाहमल्पवीर्येण रक्षसा । समर्थः खलु मे भर्ता रावणं हन्तुमाहवे ।।
data.es: "Rama, my husband, for sure, is capable of killing in battle this Ravana who has held me captive and who is a demon of inferior valour.
data.anv: अहम् I, अल्पवीर्येण of inferior valour, रक्षसा by the demon, रावणेन by Ravana, निरुद्धा I am held captive, मे भर्ता my husband, आहवे in battle, रावणम् Ravana, हन्तुम् killing, समर्थः खलु is surely capable.
data.md: I have been captured by Rāvana, a Rākşasa of feeble prowess. Forsooth my lord is capable of slaying this Rāvana in conflict.

data.v: विराधो दण्डकारण्ये येन राक्षसपुंगवः । रणे रामेण निहतः स मां किं नाभिपद्यते ।।
data.es: "Why is Rama who killed Viradha, a bull among demons, in Dandaka forest in the fight not coming to rescue me?
data.anv: येन by whom, रामेण by Rama, दण्डकारण्ये in Dandaka forest, रणे in fight, राक्षसपुङ्गवः a bull among demons, विराध: Viradha, निहतः killed, सः that Rama, माम् me, किम् why, नाभिपद्यते not protecting me.
data.md: Will not that Rāma regain me, by whom was killed in the forest of Dandaka, Virādha, the foremost of the Rākṣasa crew?

data.v: कामं मध्ये समुद्रस्य लङ्केयं दुष्प्रधर्षणा । न तु राघवबाणानां गतिरोधी ह विद्यते ।।
data.es: "This Lanka in the middle of the ocean is unassailable. But there is nothing which can resist the arrows of Rama.
data.anv: समुद्रस्य ocean's, मध्ये in the middle, इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, दुष्प्रधर्षणा unassailable, तु but, राघवबाणानाम् by the arrow of Rama, गतिरोध: resist, न भविष्यति will not be.
data.md: Although situated in the midst of the ocean, Lankā is unapproachable by others, but Raghava's arrows shall also reach here.

data.v: किं नु तत्कारणं येन रामो दृढपराक्रमः । रक्षसापहृतां भार्यामिष्टां नाभ्यवपद्यते ।।
data.es: "What may be the reason that my loving husband, Rama who is highly powerful has not reached this place to which I was abducted by the demon.
data.anv: तत् such, कारणम् reason, किं नु what can be, येन by which, दृढपराक्रमः highly powerful, रामः Rama, रक्षसा by the demon, अपहृताम् abducted, इष्टाम् dear, भार्याम् wife, नाभ्यवपद्यते not reach.
data.md: (I am at a loss to ascertain) why Rāma of firm prowess, dose not regain me, his beloved spouse who have been borne away by the Räkşasa.

data.v: इहस्थां मां न जानीते शङ्के लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । जानन्नपि हि तेजस्वी धर्षणां मर्षयिष्यति ।।
data.es: "The elder brother of Lakshamana does not know that I am here. Or, I'm afraid, the glorious Rama knows and yet tolerates such an outrageous act.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, माम् me, इहस्थाम् that I am here, न जानीते he does not know, शङ्के I doubt, जानन्नपि even if he had known, तेजस्वी glorious, धर्षणम् such an outrageous act, मर्षयिष्यति he is tolerating.
data.md: Methinks Rāma dose not know that I am here, or else, powerful as he is, he would not have put up with this insult.

data.v: हृतेति योऽधिगत्वा मां राघवाय निवेदयेत् । गृध्रराजोऽपि स रणे रावणेन निपातितः ।।
data.es: "Even the king of vultures knows I was borne away. He could have informed Rama. But he has also been thrashed down on the earth by Ravana in the fight.
data.anv: यः he who, अधिगत्वा after knowing, हृतेति  is borne away, राघवाय to Raghava, निवेदयेत् inform, सः he, गृध्रराजोऽपि even the king of vultures, रावणेन by Ravana, रणे in fight, निपातितः is thrashed down.
data.md: That lord of vultures, who could have informed Rāghava, of my being born away by the Rākṣasa, was killed by Rāvana in the battle.

data.v: कृतं कर्म महत्तेन मां तदाभ्यवपद्यता । तिष्ठता रावणद्वन्द्वे वृद्धेनापि जटायुषा ।।
data.es: "Though old, Jatayu did a great help to me by resisting Ravana in the duel and advancing (to confront him.).
data.anv: माम् me, तथा then, अभ्यवपद्यता by advancing,  वृद्धेनापि  even being old, रावणद्वन्द्वे in the duel with Ravana, तिष्ठता stood, तेन जटायुषा by that Jatayu, महत् great, कर्म help, कृतम् did.
data.md: O great was the work done by him, who, old as he was, for my sake, addressed himself to bring about Rāvana's destruction.

data.v: यदि मामिह जानीयाद्वर्तमानां स राघवः । अद्य बाणैरभिक्रुद्धः कुर्याल्लोकमराक्षसं ।।
data.es: "Had only Raghava known that I was here he would have freed this world of demons with his anger.
data.anv: सः he, राघवः Raghava, माम् me, इह here, वर्तमानाम् being here, जानीयाद्यदि if he knew, अभिक्रुद्धः angry, लोकम् this world, बाणैः with arrows, अद्य now, अराक्षसम् free of demons, कुर्यात् he would have made.
data.md: If Rāghava could know that I was here, he, exceedingly wroth, would have cleared the earth with his arrows, of the Raksasas.

data.v: विधमेच्च पुरीं लङ्कां शोषयेच्च महोदधिम् । रावणस्य च नीचस्य कीर्तिं नाम च नाशयेत् ।।
data.es: "Had Rama known that I am in Lanka he would have blown up this city, dried up the ocean and destroyed the name and fame of the mean Ravana.
data.anv: लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, विधमेच्च he will blow away, महोदधिम् this great ocean, शोषयेच्च will drain it dry, नीचस्य of the mean fellow, रावणस्य Ravana's, कीर्तिम् fame, नाम च and name, नाशयेत् he would have destroyed.
data.md: He would have then burnt down the city of Lankā, dried up the deep and blotted out the name and fame of Rāvana.

data.v: ततो निहतनथानां राक्षसीनां गृहे गृहे । यथाहमेवं रुदती तथा भूयो न संशयः । अन्विष्य रक्षसां लङ्कां कुर्याद्रामः सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: "Like me weeping, the cry of ogresses with lost husbands will be heard in every house in Lanka. There is no doubt.
data.anv: ततः then, अहम् I, यथा like the way, एवम् in that way, रुदती while crying, तथा similarly, गृहे गृहे in every home, निहतनाथानाम् of those women who lost husbands, राक्षसीनाम् of the ogresses, भूयः again, संशयः no doubt.
data.md: And from each ruined home would have risen the Rākşasa widow's groans and cries like to those of mine.

data.v: न हि ताभ्यां रिपुर्दृष्टो मुहूतमपि जीवति । चिता धूमाकुलपथा गृध्रमण्डलसंकुला । अचिरेण तु लङ्केयं श्मशानसदृशी भवेत् ।।
data.es: "Very soon this Lanka will be enveloped with smoke from funeral pyres and thronged with flocks of vultures moving in circles. It will be like a burial ground.
data.anv: इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, अचिरेण without delay, चिताधूमकुलपथा with its atreets enveloped with smoke from funeral pyres, गृध्रमण्डलसङ्कुला thronged with flocks of vultures, श्मशानसदृशी like the burial ground, भवेत् will be.

data.v: अचिरेणैव कालेन प्राप्स्याम्येव मनोरथम् । दुष्प्रस्थानोऽयमाख्याति सर्वेषां वो विपर्ययः ।।
data.es: "Your bad behaviour forebodes illluck for you.I shall have my desire fulfilled in a short time.
data.anv: अचिरेण कालेनैव in a short time, मनोरथम् my desire, प्राप्स्याम्येव I will gain, अयम् this, दुष्प्रस्थानः behaving badly, सर्वेषाम् of all of you, वः you people, विपर्ययम् a reversal of fate, आख्याति  indicates
data.md: And soon shall this desire of mine be fulfilled. All these words of mine do sound improbable now but they all indicate your misfortune.

data.v: यादृशानि तु दृश्यन्ते लङ्कायामशुभानि तु । अचिरेणैव कालेन भविष्यति हतप्रभा ।।
data.es: "Inauspicious signs are seen here in Lanka. In a short time this city will lose its splendour.
data.anv: इह here, लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, यादृशानि such, अशुभानि inauspicious signs, दृश्यन्ते are seen, अचिरेणैव कालेन in a short while, हतप्रभा lose its splendour, भविष्यति will be.
data.md: Besides from these bad omens, that are to be seen here, it appear, that Lankä shall soon be shorn of her grace.

data.v: नूनं लङ्का हते पापे रावणे राक्षसाधिपे । शोषं यास्यति दुर्धर्षा प्रमदा विधवा यथा ।।
data.es: "Surely this impregnable Lanka will wither up (lose its splendour) and appear like a widow when this sinful Ravana, a mean demon is killed.
data.anv: पापे when the sinner, राक्षसाधमे mean demons, रावणे when Ravana, हते is killed, दुर्धर्षा impregnable, लङ्का Lanka, नूनम् surely, विधवा widow, प्रमदा यथा like a woman, शोषम् wither up, यास्यति truly.
data.md: The lord of the Rākşasas, the vicious Rāvana being killed, forsooth shall Lankā, divested of wealth, appear like a widow.

data.v: पुष्योत्सवसमृद्धा च नष्टभर्त्री सराक्षसा । भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का नष्टभर्त्री यथाङ्गना ।।
data.es: "This city of Lanka with many auspicious celebrations will lose its king and all mean ogresses will remain like widows.
data.anv: नष्टभर्त्री with the death of the king, लङ्कापुरी the city of Lanka, सराक्षसी along with the ogresses, नष्टभर्त्री with the death of her lord, अङ्गना यथा like a women, पुण्योत्सवसमुत्था च with several auspicious celebrations, भविष्यति will remain.

data.v: नूनं राक्षसकन्यानां रुदन्तीनां गृहे गृहे । श्रोष्यामि नचिरादेव दुःखार्तानामिह ध्वनिम् ।।
data.es: "I shall surely hear very soon sounds of distressful cry of young ogresses in every household.
data.anv: नचिरादेव very soon, इह here, गृहे गृहे at every house, दुःखार्तानाम् distressful cry of women, रुदन्तीनाम् crying, राक्षरकन्यानाम् young ogresses, ध्वनिम् sound, नूनम् surely, श्रोष्यामि I will hear.
data.md: For certain, shall I soon hear the cries and groans in every house, of the daughters of the Rākşasas worn with grief.

data.v: सान्धकारा हतद्योता हतराक्षसपुंगवा । भविष्यति पुरी लङ्का निर्दग्धा रामसायकैः ।।
data.es: "Totally burnt by Rama's arrows, this Lanka will be filled with darkness, and its splendour lost and preeminent demons destroyed.
data.anv: लङ्कापुरी the state of Lanka, रामसायकैः with Rama's arrows, निर्दग्धा burnt totally, सान्धकारा  filled with darkness, हतद्योता lost splendour, हतराक्षसपुङ्गवा with powerful demons killed, भविष्यति will be
data.md: If that heroic Rāma, having dark-blue eyes, comes to know that I am in the abode of the Rākşasas, the city of Lankā shall be burnt down with his arrows and shall be stricken with darkness and shorn of grace and all the foremost of the Rākşasas shall be destroyed.

data.v: यदि नाम स शूरो मां रामो रक्तान्तलोचनः । जानीयाद्वर्तमानां हि रावणस्य निवेशने ।।
data.es: "If the heroic Rama of bloodshot eyes comes to know that I am here at Ravana's, the expiry of time limit fixed by this cruel, lowly, foolish Ravana has arrived, this wicked fellow's death is inevitable.
data.anv: शूरः heroic, रक्तान्तलोचनः with bloodshot eyes, सः रामः that Rama, माम् me, रावणस्य Ravana's, निवेशने at home, वर्तमानाम् present, यदि that, नाम जानीयात् knows I am here.  नृशंसेन by the cruel one, अधमेन by the lowly person, अनेन by this one, रावणेन by Ravana, यः whichever, समयः time limit, मे to me, निर्दिष्टः is fixed, तस्य its, अयम् this, कालः time, आगतः has arrived, मे to me, विहितः fixed, सः that, मृत्युः death, अस्मिन् in him, दुष्टेन by this wicked fellow, वर्तते is fixed.
data.md: If that heroic Rāma, having dark-blue eyes, comes to know that I am in the abode of the Rākşasas, the city of Lankā shall be burnt down with his arrows and shall be stricken with darkness and shorn of grace and all the foremost of the Rākşasas shall be destroyed.

data.v: अनेन तु नृशंसेन रावणेनाधमेन मे । समयो यस्तु निर्दिष्टस्तस्य कालोऽयमागतः ।।
data.md: The time which was appointed by the vile and cruel Rāvana, has arrived.

data.v: अकार्यं ये न जानन्ति नैरृताः पापकारिणः । अधर्मात्तु महोत्पातो भविष्यति हि साम्प्रतम् ।।
data.es: "Nothing is forbidden for sinful demons. A calamity will befall now due to this adharma. The flesheating ogres are aware of neither dharma nor adharma
data.anv: पापकारिणः sinners, ये those, नैर्ऋताः demons, अकार्यम् a forbidden act, न जानन्ति they know not अधर्मात्तु due to adharma, सांप्रतम् presently, महोत्पातः calamity, भविष्यति will befall, पिशिताशनाः flesheating, एते these, राक्षसाः demons, धर्मम् dharma,न जानन्ति they are not aware.

data.v: नैते धर्मं विजानन्ति राक्षसाः पिशिताशनाः । ध्रुवं मां प्रातराशार्थे राक्षसः कल्पयिष्यति ।।
साहं कथं करिष्यामि तं विना प्रियदर्शनम् । रामं रक्तान्तनयनमपश्यन्ती सुदुःखिता ।।
data.es: "This demon is determined to make me his morning meal. How can I do anything in the absence of my lord of pleasing countenance. I am distressed very much by not seeing Rama, possessed of eyes with a reddish tinge in the corners.
data.anv: राक्षसः ogre, ध्रुवम् determined, माम् me, प्रातराशार्थे for morning meal, कल्पयिष्यति will make it, सा such, अहम् I, प्रियदर्शनम्  who has pleasing countenance, तं विना without him, कथम् how, करिष्यामि I will  do, रक्तान्तनयनम् one whose eyes have a reddish tinge in the corners, रामम् Rama, अपश्यन्ती without seeing, सुदुःखिता  distressed very much.

data.v: यदि कश्चित्प्रदाता मे विषस्याद्य भवेदिह । क्षिप्रं वैवस्वतं देवं पश्येयं पतिना विना ।।
data.anv: अद्य now, मे to me, विषस्य of poison, प्रदाता donor, कश्चित् some one, इह here, भवेद्यदि can give, पतिना  husband विना devoid, क्षिप्रम् soon, देवम् divine, वैवस्वतम् lord of death, पश्येयम् I will see.
data.md: Debarred from my husband's presence, stricken with grief and not beholding Rāma, having dark-blue eyes, I shall soon meet with death.

data.v: नाजानाज्जीवतीं रामः स मां लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः । जानन्तौ तौ न कुर्यातां नोर्व्यां हि मम मार्गणम् ।।
data.es: "Neither Lakshmana nor his elder brother knows that I am here alive. (Had they known) both of them would have ransacked this earth.
data.anv: लक्ष्मणपूर्वजः elder brother of Lakshmana, सः रामः that Rama, माम् me, जीवतीम् living, नाजानात् he is not aware तौ both of them, जानन्तौ if they had known, मम my, मार्गणम् search, उर्व्याम् on earth, न कुर्याताम् इति न not undertake.
data.md: Rāma, the elder brother of Bharata, dose not know that I am still alive or else he and Lakşmaņa would have ransacked the whole world for me.

data.v: नूनं ममैव शोकेन स वीरो लक्ष्मणाग्रजः । देवलोकमितो यातस्त्यक्त्वा देहं महीतले ।।
data.es: "Would it be that the heroic elder brother of Lakshmana has gone to the abode of gods unable to find me on this earth?
data.anv: वीरः heroic one, लक्ष्मणाग्रजःLakshmna's elder brother, सः he, मम my, शोकेनैव suffering, महीतले on this earth, देहम् body, त्यक्त्वा  giving up, इतः from here, देवलोकम् to the abode of gods, यातः gone, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Or renouncing his body on this earth for my grief, the heroic elder brother of Lakşmaņa, has repaired to the celestial region.

data.v: धन्या देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । मम पश्यन्ति ये नाथं रामं राजीवलोचनम् ।।
data.es: Then the gods, gandharvas, siddhas and great sages approached Surasa, the mother of nagas, who was glowing like the Sungod and said:.
data.anv: ततः then, सगन्धर्वाः including gandharvas, देवाः gods, सिद्धाश्च and siddhas, परमर्षयः great sages, सूर्यसङ्काशाम् shining like the Sun, नागमातरम् mother of nagas, सुरसाम् Surasa, अब्रुवन् said.
data.md: Blessed the celestials, Gandharvas, Siddhās and mighty ascetics who are beholding my heroic lotus-eyed Rāma.

data.v: अथ वा न हि तस्यार्थे धर्मकामस्य धीमतः । मया रामस्य राजर्षेर्भार्यया परमात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Or that royal sage, wise Rama who always seeks dharma having become one with the supreme spirit has no longer any interest in me?
data.anv: अथवा or else, धर्मकामस्य one who is ever seeking dharma, धीमतः wise, राजर्षेः royal sage, परमात्मनः the supreme self, तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, भार्यया by wife, मया by me, अर्थः interest, न हि dispassion.
data.md: Or that highly intelligent royal ascetic desirous of securing piety and freed from the troubles of life, has no need of a wife like me.

data.v: दृश्यमाने भवेत्प्रीतः सौहृदं नास्त्यपश्यतः । नाशयन्ति कृतघ्रास्तु न रामो नाशयिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Love attaches itself to one who remains before one's eyes.Friendship fades with separation. The ungrateful destroy love and friendship (as their love is conditioned by frequent meetings). But it cannot happen in case of Rama.
data.anv: दृश्यमाने remains before seeing, प्रीतिः love, भवेत् will be, अपश्यतः not see, सौहृदम् friendship, नास्ति does not last, कृतघ्नाः ungrateful one, नाशयन्ति will be destroyed, रामस्तु Rama too, न नाशयिष्यति will not persih.
data.md: Or people have fancy for what they see and are which disappear as soon as the object is out of sight. The ungrateful are capable of renouncing their love, but not Rāma.

data.v: किं नु मे न गुणाः केचित्किं वा भाग्य क्षयो हि मे । याहं सीता वरार्हेण हीना रामेण भामिनी ।।
data.es: "Do I, a charming lady, not have any good fortune because of my past deeds? I wonder how a foremost woman like me seperated from my husband is sinking in grief without Rama. Has my fortune diminished?
data.anv: भामिनी charming lady, या whoever, अहम् I, मुख्येन foremost, रामेण विना without Rama, सीदामि  sinking, मे for me, केचित्  some, गुणाः qualities, न किं नु are they not found, किं वा or else, मम my, भाग्यक्षयः fortune is diminished.
data.md: Or there might be some folly in me. Or on the wane of my good luck have been separated from the excellent Rāma.

data.v: श्रेयो मे जीवितान्मर्तुं विहीना या महात्मना । रामादक्लिष्टचारित्राच्छूराच्छत्रुनिबर्हणात् ।।
data.es: "Instead of living separated from noble and brave Rama, a blemishless character and a destroyer of enemies, it is better for me to die.
data.anv: अक्लिष्टचारित्रात् of blemishless character, शूरात् from the brave, शत्रुनिबर्हणात् who can destroy his enemy, महात्मनः great self, रामात् from Rama, विहीनायाः seperated, मे me, जीवितात् with life, मर्तुम् to die, श्रेयः it is better for me.
data.md: Death is more preferable to me than life since. I have been separated from the high-souled heroic Rāma, of unblemished character and the slayer of foes.

data.v: अथ वा न्यस्तशस्त्रौ तौ वने मूलफलाशनौ । भ्रातरौ हि नर श्रेष्ठौ चरन्तौ वनगोचरौ ।।
data.es: "May be both the brothers, foremost among men, have laid down their arms, and taken to asceticism, subsisting on roots and fruits.
data.anv: अथवा or else, नरश्रेष्ठौ both foremost among men, तौ both, भ्रातरौ brothers, न्यतशत्रौ laid down their arms, वने in the forest, मूलफलाशनौ eating roots and fruits, वनगोचरौ roaming in the forest as ascetics, संवृत्तौ become.
data.md: Or those two brothers, the foremost of men, laying aside their weapons, and living on fruits and roots, have been wandering in the forest.

data.v: अथ वा राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन दुरात्मना । छद्मना घातितौ शूरौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: "Or else, has this wicked demon king slain both the brothers Rama and Lakshmana by some deceptive means?
data.anv: अथवा or else, शूरौ two heroes, भ्रातरौ both brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, दुरात्मना by the wicked one, राक्षसेन्द्रेण by the demon king, रावणेन by Ravana, छद्मना by some clever deceptive means, घातितौ are slain.
data.md: Or those two heroic brothers Rāma and Laksmana, have been, by treachery, put to death, by the vicious-souled Rāvana, the lord of Raksasas.

data.v: साहमेवंगते काले मर्तुमिच्छामि सर्वथा । न च मे विहितो मृत्युरस्मिन्दुःखेऽपि वर्तति ।।
data.es: "By all means I wish to die in these circumstances. However, death is not ordained for me even in this sorrowful state.
data.anv: एवङ्गते in the circumstances, काले  at this time, सा such, अहम् I, सर्वथा by all means, मर्तुम् to die, इच्छामि I wish, अस्मिन् in this, दुःखेऽपि in sorrwful state, मे to me, मृत्युः death, विहितः ordained, न वर्तते does not exist.
data.md: At this time of distress, I do with all my heart long for death, (but alas!) even death is not approaching me is this my misery.

data.v: धन्याः खलु महात्मानो मुनयः सत्यसंमताः । जितात्मानो महाभागा येषां न स्तः प्रियाप्रिये ।।
data.es: "Blessed are the exhalted sages who have not committed any sin. They have selfcontrol and have subdued their senses. There is no pleasure or displeasure for them.
data.anv: महात्मानः great men, त्यक्तकिल्बिषाः who have given up all sins, जितात्मानः those who have selfcontrol, महाभागाः exhalted ones, मुनयः sages, धन्याः खलु are surely blessed, येषाम् for whom, प्रियाप्रिये pleasure or displeasure, न स्तः none.
data.md: Oh blessed are those high-souled, great ascetics abiding by truth and having their senses in control, who have no objects of love or displeasure.

data.v: प्रियान्न संभवेद्दुःखमप्रियादधिकं भयम् । ताभ्यां हि ये वियुज्यन्ते नमस्तेषां महात्मनाम् ।।
data.es: "Salutations to those exalted souls who have distanced themselves from pleasure and displeasure. Pleasures may not lead to suffering or displeasure to excessive, meaningless fear for such great souls.
data.anv: प्रियात् from a pleasing act, दुःखम् sorrow, अप्रियात् from an unpleasant act, अधिकम् excessive, भयम् fear, न संभवेत् may not result, ये those, ताभ्याम् from both of them, वियुज्यन्ते those who have distanced themselves, तेषाम् for them, महात्मानाम् of the great sages, नमः salutations to them.
data.md: They are not distressed with misery for their objects of love or grief for them whom they do not love. They are freed from them and I do bow to those high-souled ones.

data.v: साहं त्यक्ता प्रियेणेह रामेण विदितात्मना । प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि पापस्य रावणस्य गता वशम् ।।
data.es: "Separated from the wise Rama who deserves pleasant things I will give up life being under the clutches of the sinful Ravana.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षडिवंश स्सर्गः।Thus ends the twentysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: प्रियेणैव who deserves pleasant things, विदितात्मना by the knower of the self, रामेण by Rama, त्यक्ता separated, पापस्य sinner's, रावणस्य Ravana's, वशम् clutches, गता reached, सा अहम् that I am, प्राणान् life, त्यक्ष्यामि I will give up.
data.md: Being forsaken by the beloved Rāma, knowing his ownself, and brought under the control of Ravana, I shall renounce my life.

data.v: इत्युक्ताः सीतया घोरं राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः । काश्चिज्जग्मुस्तदाख्यातुं रावणस्य तरस्विनः ।।
data.es: Hearing the reply of Sita, the ogresses ordered by Ravana and overtaken by anger again began to threaten Sita using harsh words.
data.anv: सीतया by Sita, इति thus, उक्ताः spoken, राक्षस्यः rakshasis, घोरम् of terrible, क्रोधमूर्छिताः overwhelmed with anger, काश्चित् some, तत् that, तरस्विनः of the swift, रावणस्य to Ravana, आख्यातुम् to inform, जग्मुः went
data.md: Being thus addressed angrily by Sītā, some of those Raksasis, beside themselves with ire, proceeded to relate this to the vicious-souled Ravana.

data.v: ततः सीतामुपागम्य राक्षस्यो घोरदर्शनाः । पुनः परुषमेकार्थमनर्थार्थमथाब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: The demonesses, overcome with anger, approached Sita and harshly said:
data.anv: ततः then, राक्षस्यः demonesses, सीताम् to Sita, उपागम्य went near, क्रोधमूर्छिताः  senses lost in anger, परम् very, परुषया harsh, वाचा words, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, इदम् thus, अब्रुवन् spoke.
data.md: And approaching Sītā that terrible host, almost faint with ire, addressed Vaidehī with the following harsh words.

data.v: हन्तेदानीं तवानार्ये सीते पापविनिश्चये । राक्षस्यो भक्षयिष्यन्ति मांसमेतद्यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: "O vile one you are determined in your evil ways. Today these shedemons will eat away your flesh to their heart's content ".
data.anv: अनार्ये vile one, पापविनिश्चये O woman determined in evil ways, सीते O Sita, अद्य today, इदानीम् these, तव your, एतत मांसम् your flesh, राक्षस्यः rakshasa women, यथासुखम् heart's content, भक्षयिष्यन्ति will eat.
data.md: O vile Sītă, O you bent on committing sin, we Rākşasīs shall today devour your flesh to the best of our satisfaction.

data.v: सीतां ताभिरनार्याभिर्दृष्ट्वा संतर्जितां तदा । राक्षसी त्रिजटावृद्धा शयाना वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then seeing the ignoble shedemons threatening Sita, an old demoness called Trijata, who was lying down there, said:
data.anv: तदा then, अनार्याभिः by ignoble women, ताभिः by them, सन्तर्जिताम् threatened, सीताम् Sita, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, शयाना while lying down, वृद्धा old, त्रिजटा Trijata, राक्षसी a demoness, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Beholding those vile demons threaten Sītā, a Raksasa matron, wise and old, named, Trijata cried.

data.v: आत्मानं खादतानार्या न सीतां भक्षयिष्यथ । जनकस्य सुतामिष्टां स्नुषां दशरथस्य च ।।
data.es: "Devour yourselves now, O ignoble ones, if you will. Do not eat Janaka's favourite daughter, the daughterinlaw of Dasaratha.
data.anv: अनार्याः O ignoble ones, आत्मानम् yourselves, खादत devour, जनकस्य Janaka's, इष्टाम् favourite, सुताम् daughter, दशरथस्य Dasaratha's, स्नुषां च and daughterinlaw, सीताम् Sita, न भक्षयिष्यथ do not eat.
data.md: O vile demons, do youeat your own persons (The proper expression, I think, should be-“Eat me.” The commentator Rāmānuja explains Atmanam as your own bodies.) but do not devour Sītā, the daughter of Janaka and the esteemed daughter-in-law of the king Dasaratha.

data.v: स्वप्नो ह्यद्य मया दृष्टो दारुणो रोमहर्षणः । राक्षसानामभावाय भर्तुरस्या भवाय च ।।
data.es: "Tonight I had a terrific, horriplating nightmare in which I saw the annihilation of all demons and the triumph of Sita's husband".
data.anv: अद्य today, दारुणः terrific, रोमहर्षणः horripilating, स्वप्नः dream, राक्षसानाम् all the demons, अभावाय for the destruction, अस्याः her, भर्तुः husband's, भवाय  triumph, मया by myself, दृष्टः was seen.
data.md: I dreamt a terrible dream last night which made my down stand on their end. And in that dream I foresaw the overthrow of the Rāksasa race and the conquest of her husband.

data.v: एवमुक्तास्त्रिजटया राक्षस्यः क्रोधमूर्छिताः । सर्वा एवाब्रुवन्भीतास्त्रिजटां तामिदं वचः ।।
data.es: Hearing Sita's words, some terrifying demonesses, overwhelmed with anger, went to inform Ravana, who was quick to act.
data.anv: सीतया by Sita, इति thus, उक्ताः spoken, राक्षस्यः rakshasis, घोरम् of terrible, क्रोधमूर्छिताः overwhelmed with anger, काश्चित् some, तत् that, तरस्विनः of the swift, रावणस्य to Ravana, आख्यातुम् to inform, जग्मुः went
data.md: And being thus addressed by Trijatā, those demons, exercised with wrath and terrified, accosted her with the following words.

data.v: कथयस्व त्वया दृष्टः स्वप्नेऽयं कीदृशो निशि ।।
तासां श्रुत्वा तु वचनं राक्षसीनां मुखोद्गतम् । उवाच वचनं काले त्रिजटास्वप्नसंश्रितम् ।।
data.es: "O Trijata, tell us the kind of dream you dreamt last night", they insisted. Hearing the words from the mouth of the shedemons, Trijata told them all about her dream.
data.anv: निशि night, त्वया by you, दृष्टः seen, अयम् this, स्वप्नः dream, कीदृशः what did you see, कथयस्व tell, तासाम् of them, राक्षसीनाम् of shedemons, मुखात् from their mouth, च्युतम् slipped, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, त्रिजटा Trijata, काले early morning time, स्वप्नसंश्रितम् all about the dream, वचनम् words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: "Do you relate (to us) what sort of dream didst you dream last night." And hearing those words proceeding from the mouths of the Rākşasīs, Trijatā began to describe the dream she had at the latter end of the night,

data.v: गजदन्तमयीं दिव्यां शिबिकामन्तरिक्षगाम् । युक्तां वाजिसहस्रेण स्वयमास्थाय राघवः ।।
data.es: "Rama, in white attire, wearing a garland of white flowers, ascending a palanquin made of ivory drawn by a thousand swans and coursing through the sky with Lakshmana arrived.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरः wearing a garland of white flowers and clad in white attire, गजदन्तमयीम् made of ivory, अन्तरिक्षगाम् coursing through the sky, हंससहस्रेण by a thousand swans, युक्ताम् yoked, शिबिकाम् palanquin, स्वयम् himself, आस्थाय having ascended, लक्ष्मणेन सह accompanied by Lakshmana, आगतः arrived.
data.md: I saw Rāma, wearing garlands and clothed in white, ride in a celestial chariot, along with Lakşmaņa, made of ivory, traversing the etherial regions and drawn by a hundred steeds.

data.v: स्वप्ने चाद्य मया दृष्टा सीता शुक्लाम्बरावृता । सागरेण परिक्षिप्तं श्वेतपर्वतमास्थिता । रामेण संगता सीता भास्करेण प्रभा यथा ।।
data.es: "I also saw Sita in my dream wearing white robes and perched on a white mountain surrounded by the ocean.
data.anv: सीता च Sita also, शुक्लाम्बरावृता wearing white robes, सागरेण by the ocean, परिक्षिप्तम् surrounded by, श्वेतम् white, पर्वतम् mountain, आस्थिता perched, मया by me, अद्य now, स्वप्ने in the dream, दृष्टा was seen.
data.md: I saw in my dream to-night, that Sītā, clad in the purest white, appearing on a snow-white hill beaten by the waves of the ocean, had at last met Rāma, like to light joined to the Sun.

data.v: राघवश्च मया दृष्टश्चतुर्दन्तं महागजम् । आरूढः शैलसंकाशं चचार सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: "Just as light is united with the Sun, I saw Sita united with Rama. I saw Rama with Lakshmana riding a huge, mountainlike elephant having four tusks.
data.anv: सीता Sita, रामेण with Rama, प्रभा  light, भास्करेण with the Sun, यथा like, सङ्गता united, रामश्च Rama also, चतुर्द्रंष्ट्रम् having four tusks, शैलसङ्काशम् resembling a mountain, महगजम् huge elephant, आरूढः ascended, मया by me, दृष्टः seen, सहलक्ष्मणः along with Lakshmana, चचार went.
data.md: I again saw Rāma and Lakşmaņa appear in effulgence, seated on a huge elephant, having four tusks and resembling a bull.

data.v: ततस्तौ नरशार्दूलौ दीप्यमानौ स्वतेजसा । शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरौ जानकीं पर्युपस्थितौ ।।
data.es: "Dressed in white garlands and clothes, the two brothers, tigers among men, glowing in their effulgence approached Janaki.
data.anv: ततः then, स्वतेजसा by their selfeffulgence, दीप्यमानौ glowing, शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरौ wearing white garlands and clothes, तौ both, नरशार्दूलौ tigers among men, जानकीम् Janaki, पर्युपस्थितौ came near.
data.md: Thereupon those two (brothers), resplendent like to the Sun by their own effulgence, and wearing white garlands and clothes, appeared near Janaka's daughter.

data.v: ततस्तस्य नगस्याग्रे आकाशस्थस्य दन्तिनः । भर्त्रा परिगृहीतस्य जानकी स्कन्धमाश्रिता ।।
data.es: "Then from the front of the mountain Janaki shifted to the back of the elephant held by her husband waiting in the sky.
data.anv: ततः then, जानकी Janaki, तस्य of that, नगस्य mountain's, अग्रे front, भर्त्रा by husband, परिगृहीतस्य held, आकाशस्थस्य waiting in the sky, दन्तिनः of the elephant, स्कन्धम् mounted, आश्रिता took seat.

data.v: भर्तुरङ्कात्समुत्पत्य ततः कमललोचना । चन्द्रसूर्यौ मया दृष्टा पाणिभ्यां परिमार्जती ।।
data.es: "Then I saw the lotuseyed Sita springing up from the lap of her husband and playfully caressing the Moon and Sun with her palms.
data.anv: ततः then, कमललोचना lotus eyed Sita, भर्तुः husband's, अङ्कात् from his lap, समुत्पत्य springing up, पाणिना with palms, चन्द्रसूर्यौ Moon and Sun, परिमार्जती as she was caressing, मया me, दृष्टा was seen.
data.md: And the lotus-eyed Jānakī, on the top of the hill situate on the welkin, first fell on the lap of her husband and then stationed herself on the neck of the elephant guided by her husband. Then I saw Sītā rubbing the Sun and the Moon with her two hands.

data.v: ततस्ताभ्यां कुमाराभ्यामास्थितः स गजोत्तमः । सीतया च विशालाक्ष्या लङ्काया उपरि स्थितः ।।
data.es: "Then the excellent elephant was seen halted in the city of Lanka with both princes and the largeeyed Sita mounted on the elephant.
data.anv: ततः then, ताभ्याम् by both of them, कुमाराभ्याम् by both the princes, विशालाक्ष्या largeeyed, सीतया च by Sita, आस्थितः held, सः he, गजोत्तमः best of elephants, लङ्कायाः Lanka's, उपरि over, स्थितः stood.
data.md: Then that best of the elephants, with those two princes and the large eyed Sītā on him, stood high above Lanka. I again saw Rāma, clad in white, and adorned with garlands, ride along with Lakşmaņa in a chariot drawn by eight white bullocks.

data.v: पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन रथेनाष्टयुजा स्वयम् । शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरो लक्ष्मणेन समागतः । लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया सह भार्यया ।।
data.es: "Rama accompanied by his wife Sita came on a chariot yoked to eight white oxen.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Rama, भार्यया accompanied by wife, सीतया सह along with Sita, पाण्डुरर्षभयुक्तेन yoked by white oxen, अष्टयुजा eight of them, रथेन by a chariot, स्वयम् himself, इह here, उपयातः came.

data.v: विमानात्पुष्पकादद्य रावणः पतितो भुवि । कृष्यपाणः स्त्रिया दृष्टो मुण्डः कृष्णाम्बरः पुनः ।।
data.es: "Tonight I saw (in another dream) Ravana with shaven head, clad in black clothes, fallen down on the ground from the Pushpaka chariot, being dragged by a woman.
data.anv: अद्य today, पुष्पकात् विमानात् from the Pushpaka chariot, भुवि on earth, पतितः fallen down, मुण्डः with shaven head, कृष्णाम्बरः clad in black clothes, रावणः Ravana, स्त्रिया by  a woman, कृष्यमाणः being dragged, पुन: again, दृष्टः saw.

data.v: रथेन खरयुक्तेन रक्तमाल्यानुलेपनः । प्रयातो दक्षिणामाशां प्रविष्टः कर्दमं ह्रदम् ।।
कण्ठे बद्ध्वा दशग्रीवं प्रमदा रक्तवासिनी । काली कर्दमलिप्ताङ्गी दिशं याम्यां प्रकर्षति ।।
data.anv: रक्तवासिनी a woman clad in red clothes, काली a dark one, कर्दमलिप्ताङ्गी a woman smeared with wet mud, प्रमदा woman, दशग्रीवम् tennecked Ravana, कण्ठे neck, बद्ध्वा having bound, याम्यां दिशम् towards the abode of Yama in the southerly direction, प्रकर्षति was dragging.

data.v: वराहेण दशग्रीवः शिंशुमारेण चेन्द्रजित् । उष्ट्रेण कुम्भकर्णश्च प्रयातो दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: "The tennecked Ravana was seen (this time) riding on a boar, Indrajit on a crocodile and Kumbhakarna on a camel all set towards the southerly direction.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः tennecked one, वराहेण by boar, इन्द्रजित् Indrajit, श्शिंशुमारेण च crocodile, कुम्भकर्ण Kumbhakarna, उष्ट्रेण च on a camel, दक्षिणां दिशम् towards the southern direction, प्रयाताः were travelling.

data.v: समाजश्च महान्वृत्तो गीतवादित्रनिःस्वनः । पिबतां रक्तमाल्यानां रक्षसां रक्तवाससाम् ।।
data.anv: पिबताम् of those drinking, रक्तमाल्यानाम् of those putting on flower garlands, रक्तवाससाम् of those wearing red clothes, रक्षसाम् of rakshasas, गीतवादित्रनिःस्वनः sound of singing and playing musical instruments, समाजश्च a group, मया by me, दृष्टः was seen.
data.md: And there was audible in the large assembly sound of music and stringed instruments. And all the Rākşasa wearing crimson clothes and garlands, were quaffing oil, I saw the royal and picturesque city Lankā with her steeds, cars and elephants, drowned in the ocean, having her gateways and ornamented arches broken.

data.v: लङ्का चेयं पुरी रम्या सवाजिरथसंकुला । सागरे पतिता दृष्टा भग्नगोपुरतोरणा ।।
data.es: "I saw this delightful Lanka teeming with horses, chariots and elephants, archways and towers crumbling and falling into the ocean.
data.anv: रम्या delightful, इयम् this, लङ्का पुरी च city of Lanka, सवाजिरथकुञ्जरा with horses chariots and elephants, भग्नगोपुरतोरणा crumbling archways and towers, सागरे in the ocean, पतिता fallen, दृष्टा seen.

data.v: पीत्व तैलं प्रनृत्ताश्च प्रहसन्त्यो महास्वनाः । लङ्कायां भस्मरूक्षायां सर्वा राक्षसयोषितः ।।
data.anv: भस्मरूक्षायाम् in a dry place turned into ashes, लङ्कायाम् in this Lanka, सर्वाः all, राक्षसस्त्रियः demonesses, तैलम् oil, पीत्वा after drinking, प्रहसन्त्यः laughing away, महास्वनाः shouting in a loud voice, प्रनृत्ताः च danced.
data.md: And in Lanka, covered with dust, Raksasa women laughing and making terrible sound, were engaged in quaffing oil.

data.v: कुम्भकर्णादयश्चेमे सर्वे राक्षसपुंगवाः । रक्तं निवसनं गृह्य प्रविष्टा गोमयह्रदे ।।
data.es: "Kumbhakarna and other demon leaders wearing red clothes entered into a pool of cow dung.
data.anv: कुम्भकर्णादयः Kumbhakarna and others, इमे these, सर्वे राक्षसपुङ्गवाः all demon leaders, रक्तम् red coloured, निवसनम् clothes, गृह्य wearing, गोमयह्रदे in a pool of cowdung, प्रविष्टाः entered.
data.md: I saw all the leading Raksasas-Kumbhakarņā and others, dark-hued and wearing crimson clothes, emerged in an abyss of cow dung.

data.v: अपगच्छत नश्यध्वं सीतामाप्नोति राघवः । घातयेत्परमामर्षी सर्वैः सार्धं हि राक्षसैः ।।
data.es: "(Therefore) go away from here. You will be totally destroyed by Rama who will secure his wife and will kill all of you along with others in great anger.
data.anv: अपगच्छत go away from here, नश्यध्वम् you will be destroyed, राघवः Raghava, सीताम् Sita, आप्नोति he will secure, परमामर्षी a very angry man, राक्षसैः सार्थम् along with the demons totally, युष्मान् you, घातयेत् will kill.
data.md: Do youtherefore fly at some distance, and will find that Rāghava shall regain Sītā. And exercised with ire he shall destroy you all along with the Raksasas.

data.v: प्रियां बहुमतां भार्यां वनवासमनुव्रताम् । भर्त्सितां तर्जितां वापि नानुमंस्यति राघवः ।।
data.es: 'Even renouncing his highly respectable, favourite wife among all, mighty Ravana is prepared to accept you.
data.anv: राजा king, महाबलः mighty, रावणःRavana, प्रियाम् his dear, बहुमताम् favourrite lady, सर्वासाम् of all, महाभागाम् highly respectable, भार्याम् wife, त्यक्त्वा renouncing, त्वाम् you, उपैष्यति he is desirous
data.md: Rāghava shall never brook, his esteemed and beloved spouse, living in the forest, being taunted and threatened by you.

data.v: तदलं क्रूरवाक्यैर्वः सान्त्वमेवाभिधीयताम् । अभियाचाम वैदेहीमेतद्धि मम रोचते ।।
data.es: "Give up these cruel taunts. Speak to her in a cordial manner. We will beg Vaidehi's forgiveness. I like this kind of action.
data.anv: तत् then, क्रूरवाक्यैः cruel taunts, अलम् enough, सान्त्वमेव peacefully, अभिधीयताम् it may be said, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अभियाचाम we will beg, एतद्धि this itself, मे to me, रोचते is liked.
data.md: No more with rough words therefore; do you console the lady and humbly pray her to forgive you. This I think proper.

data.v: यस्या ह्येवं विधः स्वप्नो दुःखितायाः प्रदृश्यते । सा दुःखैर्बहुभिर्मुक्ता प्रियं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: "When any demoness in a sorrowful state dreams this kind of dream, she will be relieved of sorrow and will obtain supreme joy.
data.anv: यस्याम् when any woman, दुःखितायाम् when she is sorrowful, एवंविधः this kind of, स्वप्नः dream, प्रदृश्यते is seen, सा she, विविधैः with all kinds of, दुःखैः sorrows, मुक्ता she is relieved, अनुत्तमम् supreme, प्रियम् joy, प्राप्नोति will attain.
data.md: Surely shall she, divested of misfortune, he reconciled to her beloved and excellent husband, regarding whom, in her misery, I have dreamt such a dream.

data.v: भर्त्सितामपि याचध्वं राक्षस्यः किं विवक्षया । राघवाद्धि भयं घोरं राक्षसानामुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: "O demonesses beg her (pardon) now even though you had threatened her earlier. Where is the need to hesitate? There is cause for concern for demons from Rama.
data.anv: राक्षस्यः O demonesses, भर्त्सितामपि even if she is threatened this way, याचध्वम् beg her, किम् विवक्षया where is the need to say something, राक्षसानाम् of demons, राघवात् from Rama, घोरम् terrific, भयम् fear, उपस्थितम् will come.
data.md: YouRaksasis! You have threatened her, do youimplore her forgiveness—no more with harsh words. Forsooth, from Rāghava shall proceed the mighty disaster of the Rākṣasas.

data.v: प्रणिपात प्रसन्ना हि मैथिली जनकात्मजा । अलमेषा परित्रातुं राक्षस्यो महतो भयात् ।।
data.es: "O shedemons, this Janaka's daughter from Mithila who is capable of protecting you against great dangers will be pleased by your submission.
data.anv: राक्षस्यः O shedemons, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, एषा this, मैथिली Mythili, प्रणिपातप्रसन्ना while pleased with your salutations, महतः great, भयात् fear, परित्रातुम् to save, अलम् able.
data.md: If Maithili, the daughter of the king Janaka, be pleased with you (for your imploring her forgiveness) you might be saved from the mighty disaster.

data.v: अपि चास्या विशालाक्ष्या न किंचिदुपलक्षये । विरुद्धमपि चाङ्गेषु सुसूक्ष्ममपि लक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: "Look at the signs on her body. There is not a little inauspiciousness in the limbs of the largeeyed princess from Mithila.
data.anv: अपि च and not only that, विशालाक्ष्याः of the largeeyed one, अस्याः her, अङ्गेषु in her limbs, सुसूक्ष्ममपि even a little, विरूपम् distortioninauspiciousness, लक्षणम् sign, किञ्चिदपि even a little, न उपलक्षये I do not see.
data.md: I do not perceive any inauspicious mark on the person of this large-eyed dame. It appears from the paleness of her countenance that she has been overcome by misfortune.

data.v: छाया वैगुण्य मात्रं तु शङ्के दुःखमुपस्थितम् । अदुःखार्हामिमां देवीं वैहायसमुपस्थिताम् ।।
data.anv: छायावैगुण्यमात्रं तु only a change in her complexion, वैहायसम् is changed, उपस्थिताम् which she has, अदुःखार्हाम् not deserve to suffer, इमाम् this, देवीम् this queen, दुःखम् grief, उपस्थितम् has befallen, शङ्के I think.
data.md: And I saw in my dreams) this worshipful damsel, unworthy of any misfortune, stationed in the welkin.

data.v: अर्थसिद्धिं तु वैदेह्याः पश्याम्यहमुपस्थिताम् । राक्षसेन्द्रविनाशं च विजयं राघवस्य च ।।
data.es: "I see the day of fulfilment for Vaidehi has drawn near. I can also foresee the destruction of the demon king and the triumph of Rama.
