data.anv: महायशाः a highly renowned, सः he, महार्हाणि luxurious, उत्तरीयाणि upper garments, विहाय cast off, मनसा whole heartedly, राज्यम् kingdom, विसृज्य having given up, माम् me, जनन्यै to his mother, समादिशत् entrusted.
data.md: Leaving aside his costly attire, the highly glorious (Rāma) renounced with all his heart the kingdom and gave me over to his mother.

data.v: साहं तस्याग्रतस्तूर्णं प्रस्थिता वनचारिणी । न हि मे तेन हीनाया वासः स्वर्गेऽपि रोचते ।।
data.es: "I, however resolved to live in the forest, marched ahead of him quickly as I did not prefer even heaven without him.
data.anv: सा अहम् I myself, वनचारिणी a forestdweller, तूर्णम् quickly, तस्य his, अग्रतः ahead of him, प्रस्थिता started, तेन by him, हीनायाः separated, मे  me, स्वर्गेऽपि न रोचते did not prefer even heaven.
data.md: But myself wearing the garb of an ascetic, repaired speedily before him. Separated from him, I do not like to live even in the celestial region.

data.v: प्रागेव तु महाभागः सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः । पूर्वजस्यानुयात्रार्थे द्रुमचीरैरलंकृतः ।।
data.anv: महाभागः a noble one, मित्रनन्दनः a delight to friends, सौमित्रिः Saumitri, प्रागेव already, पूर्वजस्य eldest brother's, अनुयात्रार्थे to follow him, द्रुमचीरैः an bark, अलङ्कृतः dressed.
data.md: The great son of Sumitrā, the enhancer of friends' joys, to follow his elder brother, dressed himself in bark and kusa.

data.v: ते वयं भर्तुरादेशं बहु मान्यदृढव्रताः । प्रविष्टाः स्म पुराद्दृष्टं वनं गम्भीरदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "Respecting the king's order and determined firmly, we entered the impenetrable forest.
data.anv: ते then वयम् we, भर्तुः king's, आदेशम् order, बहुमान्य respecting, दृढव्रताः resolved firmly, पुरा in the past, अदृष्टम् not seen, गम्भीरदर्शनम् impenetrable, वनम् forest, प्रविष्टाः स्मः we entered.
data.md: Thus abiding by our sire's behest, and taking firm vows we entered a dreary forest never seen before.

data.v: वसतो दण्डकारण्ये तस्याहममितौजसः । रक्षसापहृता भार्या रावणेन दुरात्मना ।।
data.es: "While the most valiant Rama was living in the Dandaka forest, I, his wife was borne away by the evilminded Ravana.
data.anv: दण्डकारण्ये in the Dandaka forest, वसतः while living, अमितौजसः the most valiant, तस्य his, भार्या wife, अहम् am, दुरात्मना by evilminded, रावणेन by Ravana, अपहृता was abducted.
data.md: While that one, of unmitigated effulgence was thus living in the forest of Dandaka, I, his consort, was stolen by the vicious-souled Rākşasa—Rāvaņa.

data.v: द्वौ मासौ तेन मे कालो जीवितानुग्रहः कृतः । ऊर्ध्वं द्वाभ्यां तु मासाभ्यां ततस्त्यक्ष्यामि जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "He has allowed me two months time to live. After two months I will have to give up my life."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रयस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: तेन by him, द्वौ two, मासौ months, मे to me, जीवितानुग्रहः grant of time to live, कृतः given, ततः then, द्वाभ्याम् after the two, मासाभ्याम् months, ऊर्ध्वम् after that, जीवितम् life, त्यक्ष्यामि I will give up.
data.md: He has kindly allowed me two months respite after which I shall be slain.

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनूमान्हरियूथपः । दुःखाद्दुःखाभिभूतायाः सान्तमुत्तरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Sita who was overwhelmed with grief, the monkey leader Hanuman felt sad and thus spoke comforting her:
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गवः monkey leader, हनुमान् Hanuman, दुःखात् with sadness, दुःखाभिभूतायाः overwhelmed with grief, तस्याः to her, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सान्त्वम् comforting, उत्तरम् reply, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of Sītā stricken with grief, Hanumān, the foremost of the monkeys, replied in soothing words, O worshipful lady, by Rāma's decree I come as a messenger to these. He is sale and sound, O Vaidehi, and has asked of your welfare.

data.v: अहं रामस्य संदेशाद्देवि दूतस्तवागतः । वैदेहि कुशली रामस्त्वां च कौशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "By the command of Rama I am here as a messenger. He is keeping well. He is well and wishes you well.
data.anv: देवि O queen, वैदेहि Vaidehi, अहम् I am, रामस्य Rama's, सन्देशात् by order, तव your, दूतः messenger, आगतः reached, कुशली is well, रामः Rama, त्वां च and you, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् wished you.

data.v: यो ब्राह्ममस्त्रं वेदांश्च वेद वेदविदां वरः । स त्वां दाशरथी रामो देवि कौशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "O godlike lady Rama, son of Dasaratha, master of the Vedas, wielder of Brahmastra wishes you well.
data.anv: देवि O godlike lady, वेदविदाम् mastered the Vedas, वरः choicest, यः he is, ब्रह्मम् अस्त्रम् weapon of Brahma (Brahmastra), वेदांश्च and Vedas, वेद knows, सः he, दाशरथिः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् conveyed.
data.md: O worshipful dame, Rāma, the son of Dasaratha, the master of the Vedas, and the foremost of those conversant with Vedas has enquired of your welfare.

data.v: लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजा भर्तुस्तेऽनुचरः प्रियः । कृतवाञ्शोकसंतप्तः शिरसा तेऽभिवादनम् ।।
data.es: "The mighty Lakshmana too, a dear brother and follower of your husband is immersed in grief, and sends salutations to you."
data.anv: महातेजाः very mighty, ते भर्तुः your husband, प्रियः dear, अनुचरः follower, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, शोकसन्तप्तः immersed in grief, शिरसा with his head in obeisance, ते to you, अभिवादनम् offers salutations, कृतवान् has done.
data.md: And the highly effulgent Lakşmaņa, the beloved follower of your husband, worn with grief, bows his reverential head to you.

data.v: सा तयोः कुशलं देवी निशम्य नरसिंहयोः । प्रीतिसंहृष्टसर्वाङ्गी हनूमान्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing the wellbeing of Rama and Lakshman, lions among men, Sita experienced thrill all over her body. She then spoke to Hanuman:
data.anv: सा देवी that queen, तयोः of both of them, नरसिंहयोः of lions among men, कुशलम् wellbeing, निशम्य on hearing, प्रीतिसंहृष्टसर्वाङ्गी overtaken by joy experienced in all her limbs, अथ then, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing of the welfare of those two lions among men, the worshipful dame, with all her frame worked up with rapture, again spake to Hanumān, saying.

data.v: कल्याणी बत गथेयं लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मे । एहि जीवन्तमानदो नरं वर्षशतादपि ।।
data.es: "The adage that 'joy comes to a living being even though it be at the end of a hundred years' is popular. It appears true in my case".
data.anv: जीवन्तम् who lives, नरम् human being, वर्षशतादपि a hundred years, आनन्दः happiness, एति comes, इयम् this, लौकिकी popular, गाथा adage, कल्याणी is auspicious, मा to me, प्रतिभाति appears.
data.md: Verily the wise saw of the people appears to me to be true that once in a hundred years true joy appears to a living man.

data.v: तयोः समागमे तस्मिन्प्रीतिरुत्पादिताद्भुता । परस्परेण चालापं विश्वस्तौ तौ प्रचक्रतुः ।।
data.es: Hanuman thus created a sense of wonderful joy in her as they came together. Both of them started to converse restoring confidence in each other.
data.anv: समागते when the meeting took place, तस्मिन् in him, तथा like that, अद्भुता wonderful, प्रीतिः pleasure, उत्पादिता was created, तौ in both, विश्वस्तौ confiding in the other, परस्परेण each to the other, आलापं च converse, चक्रतुः started.
data.md: Sītā, at that time, attained such a wonderful joy, as would have been acquired by her in the company (of Rama and Laksmana). And they confidingly conversed with each other.

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनूमान्हरियूथपः । सीतायाः शोकदीनायाः समीपमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Hearing the words of Sita who was overwhelmed with grief, the monkey leader Hanuman felt sad and thus spoke comforting her:
data.anv: हरिपुङ्गवः monkey leader, हनुमान् Hanuman, दुःखात् with sadness, दुःखाभिभूतायाः overwhelmed with grief, तस्याः to her, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, सान्त्वम् comforting, उत्तरम् reply, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of $ītā, racked with sorrow, Hanumān, the son of the Wind-god drew a little nearer to her.

data.v: यथा यथा समीपं स हनूमानुपसर्पति । तथा तथा रावणं सा तं सीता परिशङ्कते ।।
data.es: As Hanuman started slowly drawing close, Sita suspected he might be Ravana.
data.anv: सः हनुमान् Hanuman, यथा यथा slowly that way, समीपम् near, उपसर्पति started moving, तथा तथा in the same way, सा सीता that Sita, तम् him, रावणम् Ravana, परिशङ्कते suspected.
data.md: The more Hanumān approached her the more Sītā suspected him as Rāvaņa.

data.v: अहो धिग्धिक्कृतमिदं कथितं हि यदस्य मे । रूपान्तरमुपागम्य स एवायं हि रावणः ।।
data.es: "Ohshame on me. I have told him my story which should not have been said. This is verily Ravana come in a disguise".
data.anv: अहो Oh, धिक् fie upon, मे to myself, इदम् this, अस्य to him, कथितम् story, दुष्कृतम् that which should not have been said, अयम् he, रूपान्तरम् in cognito, उपागम्य has come, सः रावणः हि verily he is Ravana.
data.md: Alas! Alas! why have I spoken to him? It is the Rāvaņa, who has appeared again in a new disguise.

data.v: तामशोकस्य शाखां सा विमुक्त्वा शोककर्शिता । तस्यामेवानवद्याङ्गी धरण्यां समुपाविशत् ।।
data.es: So saying Sita of flawless limbs, emaciated with grief, left the branch of Ashoka tree held by her and squatted on the ground.
data.anv: अनवद्याङ्गी who has flawless limbs, सा she, अशोकस्य Ashoka tree's, ताम् that, शाखाम् branch, विमुक्त्वा later leaving, शोककर्शिता emaciated out of sorrow, तस्याम् on that, धरण्यामेव on the ground, समुपाविशत् sat near.
data.md: And leaving off the Asoka branch, that one having a blameless person, overwhelmed with grief, sat down on the earth.

data.v: अवन्दत महाबाहुस्ततस्तां जनकात्मजाम् । सा चैनं भयवित्रस्ता भूयो नैवाभ्युदैक्षत ।।
data.es: The longarmed Hanuman saw Sita, who was stricken with grief and deluded with fear. He prostrated to her. But out of fear she did not look at him.
data.anv: महाबाहुः longarmed one, हनुमानपि Hanuman too, दुःखार्ताम् sorrowful lady, भयमोहिताम् deluded with fear, ताम् her, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, ततः then, तां जनकात्मजाम् the daughter of Janaka, अवन्दत prostrated, सा च and she, भयवित्रस्ता trembling with fear, एनम् him, भूयः again, नाभ्युदैक्षत did not look at him.
data.md: In the meantime the mighty-armed monkey bowed to Janaka's daughter, but she, worked up with fear, did not cast again her looks towards him.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा वन्दमानं तु सीता शशिनिभानना । अब्रवीद्दीर्घमुच्छ्वस्य वानरं मधुरस्वरा ।।
data.es: On seeing the vanara prostrated, the moonfaced lady, sighed deeply and spoke to him in a sweet voice:
data.anv: शशिनिभानना moonfaced lady, सीता Sita, तम् him, वन्दमानम् prostrating, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, दीर्घम् deep, उच्छवस्य after breathing out, मधुरस्वरा in a sweet voice, वानरम् to vanara, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Beholding him bow to her, Sítā, having a moon-like countenance, sighing, spoke to that monkey in sweet accents.

data.v: मायां प्रविष्टो मायावी यदि त्वं रावणः स्वयम् । उत्पादयसि मे भूयः संतापं तन्न शोभनम् ।।
data.es: "If you are that trickster Ravana who appears incognito before me, it is not good for you. You are causing grief again.
data.anv: त्वम् you, मायाम् disguised, प्रविष्टः entered, मायावी trickster, स्वयम् yourself, रावणः यदि if you are Ravana, मे to me, भूयः again, सन्तापम् grief, उत्पादयसि you have created, तत् that, शोभनम् न not good.
data.md: If you are that Ravana's self, who, changing your shape by magic art, want to distress me again— this your vile deed dose not behove you.

data.v: स्वं परित्यज्य रूपं यः परिव्राजकरूपधृत् । जनस्थाने मया दृष्टस्त्वं स एवासि रावणः ।।
data.es: "You are the same Ravana who took the guise of a mendicant, giving up your real form and came to Janasthana.
data.anv: यः रावणः that Ravana, स्वं रूपम् his own form, परित्यज्य after giving up, परिव्राजकरूपवान् taking the form of a mendicant, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, मया by me, दृष्टः seen, त्वं you, स एव असि you are the same one.
data.md: You are surely that Rāvana, whom I saw at Janasthāna, in a mendicant's guise, renouncing his own shape.

data.v: उपवासकृशां दीनां कामरूप निशाचर । संतापयसि मां भूयः संतापं तन्न शोभनम् ।।
data.es: "Oh you are one who can assume any form at will. You are a nightstalker. It is not good for you to cause pain to me who is already emaciated through fasting, who is pitiable and who is already afflicted.
data.anv: कामरूप one who can assume any form, निशाचर nightstalker, उपवासकृशां an emaciated lady, सन्तप्तां a lady stricken with grief, दीनां pitiable, माम् me, भूयः again, सन्तापं grief, सन्तापयसि you are making me sorrowful, तत् that, शोभनं न not good for you.
data.md: O night-ranger, O you wearing shapes at will! it dose not behove you to distress me who am poorly and famished with fasts.

data.v: यदि रामस्य दूतस्त्वमागतो भद्रमस्तु ते । पृच्छामि त्वां हरिश्रेष्ठ प्रिया राम कथा हि मे ।।
data.es: "O great vanara, If on the other hand you have come here as Rama's messenger I wish you well. I love Rama's story. Tell me.
data.anv: त्वम् you, रामस्य Rama's, दूतः messenger, आगतः यदि if you have come here, ते to you, भद्रम् be auspicious, अस्तु be, हरिश्रेष्ठ O great vanara, मे to me, रामकथा Rama'story, प्रिया हि dear, त्वाम् you, पृच्छामि I ask you.
data.md: And may good betide you if you are Rāma's messenger. I do ask you, O foremost of monkeys, something about Rāma that is pleasant to me.

data.v: गुणान्रामस्य कथय प्रियस्य मम वानर । चित्तं हरसि मे सौम्य नदीकूलं यथा रयः ।।
data.es: "O vanara Rama's virtues are dear to me to hear. O gentle one just as the current of the river wears away its banks, my mind is lured by your presence.
data.anv: वानर vanara, मम my, प्रियस्य dear lord's, रामस्य Rama's, गुणान् virtues, कथय you may tell me, सौम्य O gentle one, नदीकूलम् river bank, रयः यथा like the current of water, मे my, चित्तम् mind, हरसि you are luring.
data.md: O monkey, do you relate the glories of my dear Rama. You are (thus) shaking my mind O gentle one, like to water breaking down the banks of a river.

data.v: अहो स्वप्नस्य सुखता याहमेवं चिराहृता । प्रेषितं नाम पश्यामि राघवेण वनौकसं ।।
data.es: "Oh I have been seeing the person sent by Rama in my dream for a long time. This is a pleasant dream to me.
data.anv: स्वप्नस्य of a dream, सुखता pleasure, अहो Oh, चिराहृता kept dreaming for a long time, या that, राघवेण by Rama, प्रेषितं नाम  person sent, वनौकसम् vanara, एवम् that way, पश्यामि I am seeing.
data.md: Alas! this dream has afforded me immense pleasure since, I, who have been separated from my lord for so long a time, have beheld this monkey sent by Rāghava.

data.v: स्वप्नेऽपि यद्यहं वीरं राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम् । पश्येयं नावसीदेयं स्वप्नोऽपि मम मत्सरी ।।
data.es: "Even if I can see the heroic Rama together with Lakshmana in my dream my pain will be gone. Even the dream is inimical to me (I cannot sleep and thus cannot dream.)
data.anv: अहम् I, स्वप्नेऽपि even in a dream, सहलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, वीरम् heroic, राघवम् Rama, पश्येयं यदि if I can see, नावसीदेयम् I will not be despondent, मम my, स्वप्नोऽपि even the dream, मत्सरी inimical to me.
data.md: I do not sink even if I can behold in dream the heroic Raghava. along with Laksmana-but dream even is Jealous of my well-being.

data.v: नाहं स्वप्नमिमं मन्ये स्वप्ने दृष्ट्वा हि वानरम् । न शक्योऽभ्युदयः प्राप्तुं प्राप्तश्चाभ्युदयो मम ।।
data.es: "I do not think it is a dream. Pleasure cannot be experienced by seeing a vanara in a dream. I experience pleasure now (seeing a monkey in a dream is a bad omen).
data.anv: अहम् I am, इमम् this, स्वप्नम् dream, न मन्ये I do not think so, स्वप्ने in a dream, वानरम् vanara, दृष्ट्वा having seen, अभ्युदयः welfare, प्राप्तुम् to attain, न शक्यः not possible, मम to me, अभ्युदयः pleasure, प्राप्तश्च is experienced.
data.md: Nor do I regard this as dream. To behold a monkey in a dream dose not lead to prosperity whereas I have attained it. (Here prosperity means joy-Sītā attained an immense treasure of joy on beholding Rāma's messengerHanumãn.)

data.v: किं नु स्याच्चित्तमोहोऽयं भवेद्वातगतिस्त्वियम् । उन्मादजो विकारो वा स्यादियं मृगतृष्णिका ।।
data.es: "Can this be a delusion of my mind or a mental imbalance (resulting in movement of the mind in the body). Is it a malady born of my madness? Or is it a mirage?
data.anv: अयम् this, चित्तमोहः delusion in the mind, स्यात् किं नु why do I feel like this? इयम् this kind of, वातगतिः mental inbalance, भवेत् may be, उन्मादजः developed due to madness, विकारो वा or else is it a change?, इयम् this, मृगतृष्णिका a mirage, स्यात् may be.
data.md: Or is it mental derangement? Or have I been possessed by a devil? Or have I run mad? Or is it the sultry vapour noating over sands and appearing at a distance like water?

data.v: अथ वा नायमुन्मादो मोहोऽप्युन्मादलक्ष्मणः । संबुध्ये चाहमात्मानमिमं चापि वनौकसं ।।
data.es: "No, this cannot be insanity. nor even delusion. But I recognise this vanara well"
data.anv: अथवा if not, अयम् this, उन्मादः insanity, उन्मादलक्षणः sign of insanity, मोहोऽपि delusion also, न not, अहम् I, आत्मानम् myself, इमम् this, वनौकसम् vanara, सम्बुध्ये recognise.
data.md: No, it is not madness-for derangement of mind is the sign of madness, I have not lost sense and I do distinctly perceive me and the monkey.

data.v: इत्येवं बहुधा सीता संप्रधार्य बलाबलम् । रक्षसां कामरूपत्वान्मेने तं राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: Considering the strength and weakness of demons in that manner Sita thought that Hanuman was none other than the king of demons who can asume any form at will.
data.anv: सीता Sita, इत्येवम् in this manner, बलाबलम् strength and weakness, बहुधा in many ways, सम्प्रधार्य after considering, रक्षसाम् of demons, कामरूपत्वात्  taking any form at will, तम् him, राक्षसाधिपम् king of demons, मेने he thought.
data.md: Thinking thus in many a way and ascertaining the strength of the monkey and the Rākṣasa) Sītā took him for the lord of the Raksasas, wearing shapes at will. And having arrived at this decision, Janaka's daughter-Sītā, ceased from talking with that monkey.

data.v: एतां बुद्धिं तदा कृत्वा सीता सा तनुमध्यमा । न प्रतिव्याजहाराथ वानरं जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: Having entertained such thoughts, Sita, the lady with a fairwaist, daughter of Janaka, did not respond to the vanara.
data.anv: तदा then, तनुमध्यमा lady with a fair waist, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, सा सीता that Sita, एताम् in this way, बुद्धिम् thought, कृत्वा having entertained, अथ then, वानरम् to vanara, न प्रतिव्याजहार did not respond.
data.md: Thinking thus in many a way and ascertaining the strength of the monkey and the Rākṣasa) Sītā took him for the lord of the Raksasas, wearing shapes at will. And having arrived at this decision, Janaka's daughter-Sītā, ceased from talking with that monkey.

data.v: सीतायाश्चिन्तितं बुद्ध्वा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । श्रोत्रानुकूलैर्वचनैस्तदा तां संप्रहर्षयत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, son of the Windgod understood what was going on in Sita's mind and spoke pleasing words that brought joy in her.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, चिन्तितम् thought, बुद्ध्वा understood, तदा then, ताम् her, श्रोत्रानुकूलैः pleasing to hear, वचनैः by the words, सम्प्रहर्षयत् pleased.
data.md: And apprised of Sītā's thought, Hanumān, the Wind-god's son, (replied) in words sweet to her and enhancing her delight.

data.v: आदित्य इव तेजस्वी लोककान्तः शशी यथा । राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवो वैश्रवणो यथा ।।
data.es: "Rama is glorious as the Sun, brings delight to the whole world like the Moon, is the king of kings like Vaisravana, and renowned like Visnu endowed with valour.
data.anv: आदित्य इव like the Sun, तेजस्वी glorious, शशी यथा like the Moon, लोककान्तः brings delight to the whole world, देवः god, वैश्रवणो यथा like Vaisravana, सर्वस्य of all, लोकस्य of the worlds, राजा king, महायशाः is renowned, विष्णुः यथा like Visnu, विक्रमेण in valour, उपपन्नश्च endowed .
data.md: Bright as the sun that lights the sky and dear as the moon to every eye, he pleases all his subjects with bounties like to those of as Vaisravana. (Another name of Kubera, the god of gold.)

data.v: विक्रमेणोपपन्नश्च यथा विष्णुर्महायशाः । सत्यवादी मधुरवाग्देवो वाचस्पतिर्यथा ।।
data.md: He is gifted with prowess like to the greatly famed Vişnu, truthful and sweet-speeched like to Vacaspati. (The god of speech)

data.v: रूपवान्सुभगः श्रीमान्कन्दर्प इव मूर्तिमान् । स्थानक्रोधप्रहर्ता च श्रेष्ठो लोके महारथः । बाहुच्छायामवष्टब्धो यस्य लोको महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "He shows anger to one who deserves it, he is the foremost charioteer of the world and he is a great self under the shadow of whose shoulders the whole world takes refuge.
data.anv: स्थानक्रोधः who shows anger to the proper person, प्रहर्ता च who punishes, लोके the world, श्रेष्ठः supreme, महारथः great charioteer, लोकः in the world, यस्य whose, महात्मनः of the great self, बाहुच्छायामवष्टब्धो under the shadow of whose shoulders refuge is taken.
data.md: Graceful, grateful to the eye and beautiful like to Kandarva's (Cupid or the god of love in Hindu mythology described the most beautiful of the celestials) Self, he displays his wrath in a proper quarter-the foremost of men and of a mighty car.

data.v: अपकृष्याश्रमपदान्मृगरूपेण राघवम् । शून्ये येनापनीतासि तस्य द्रक्ष्यसि यत्फलम् ।।
data.es: "You will see the consequences of the action of Ravana who abducted you deceitfully in the form of deer when Rama was away from the hermitage.
data.anv: येन since, राघवम् Rama, मृगरूपेण in the form of a deer, आश्रमपदात् from the hermitage, अपकृष्य were abducted, शून्ये isolated place, अपनीता you are borne away, असि you, तस्य its, यत्फलम् result, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: The whole world of creation (live safe) in the shadow of the arms of that high-souled one. You shall soon see the consequences he shall reap by whom, assuming the shape of a dear, Rāghava was taken away from the hermitage and you wert stolen away from that lonely place.

data.v: नचिराद्रावणं संख्ये यो वधिष्यति वीर्यवान् । रोषप्रमुक्तैरिषुभिर्ज्वलद्भिरिव पावकैः ।।
data.es: "Heroic Rama will soon release many scorching, fiery arrows in anger and kill Ravana. I seek your permission as an envoy of Rama. Filled with grief by your separation, he has made inquiries about your welfare.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् heroic, यः who, नचिरात् soon, रोषप्रमुक्तै: released in great anger, ज्वलद्भिः by burning, पावकैः इव like fire, इषुभि with arrows, संख्ये in war, रावणम् Ravana, वधिष्यति would slay, तेन therefore, दूतः envoy, प्रेषितः sent, इह here, त्वत्सकाशम् your presence, आगतः I have come, त्वद्वियोगेन due to separation from you, दुःखार्तः filled with sorrow, सः he, त्वाम् to you, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् asking.
data.md: And soon shall that powerful (hero) destroy Ravana in the battle, with fiery arrows, discharged angrily.

data.v: तेनाहं प्रेषितो दूतस्त्वत्सकाशमिहागतः । त्वद्वियोगेन दुःखार्तः स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "Heroic Rama will soon release many scorching, fiery arrows in anger and kill Ravana. I seek your permission as an envoy of Rama. Filled with grief by your separation, he has made inquiries about your welfare.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् heroic, यः who, नचिरात् soon, रोषप्रमुक्तै: released in great anger, ज्वलद्भिः by burning, पावकैः इव like fire, इषुभि with arrows, संख्ये in war, रावणम् Ravana, वधिष्यति would slay, तेन therefore, दूतः envoy, प्रेषितः sent, इह here, त्वत्सकाशम् your presence, आगतः I have come, त्वद्वियोगेन due to separation from you, दुःखार्तः filled with sorrow, सः he, त्वाम् to you, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् asking.
data.md: I have been sent by him as a messenger to you. Worn with grief in your separation he has enquired of your welfare, as well the highly effulgent Lakşmaņa, the enhancer of Sumitrā's joy, bowing reverentially to you.

data.v: लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजाः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः । अभिवाद्य महाबाहुः सोऽपि कौशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "The brilliant, longarmed Lakshmana, delight of Sumitra enquires about your welfare and offers salutations to you.
data.anv: महातेजाः brilliant, सुमित्रानन्दस्सवर्धनः delight of Sumitra, महाबाहुः longarmed one, सः लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmna, त्वाम् to you, अभिवाद्य offering salutations, कौशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् enquired.

data.v: रामस्य च सखा देवि सुग्रीवो नाम वानरः । राजा वानरमुख्यानां स त्वां कौशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "O goddess like lady Rama's friend Sugriva, king of vanara chieftans inquires about your wellbeing.
data.anv: देवि O queen, वैदेहि Vaidehi, अहम् I am, रामस्य Rama's, सन्देशात् by order, तव your, दूतः messenger, आगतः reached, कुशली is well, रामः Rama, त्वां च and you, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् wished you.
data.md: The king of monkey host, by name SugrīvaRama's friend, has also enquired of your welfare, O worshipful dame. Rāma, Sugrīva and Laksmana, have you always in their minds.

data.v: नित्यं स्मरति रामस्त्वां ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः । दिष्ट्या जीवसि वैदेहि राक्षसी वशमागता ।।
data.es: "O Vaidehi Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva always remember you. Luckily you are alive even though you are under the clutches of shedemons.
data.anv: ससुग्रीवः together with Sugriva, सलक्ष्मणः and Lakshmna, रामः Rama, त्वाम् you, नित्यम् always, स्मरति remembers, वैदेहि Vaidehi, राक्षसीवशम् under the clutches of shedemons, आगता come, दिष्ट्या luckily, जीवसि you are alive.

data.v: नचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे रामं लक्ष्मणं च महारथम् । मध्ये वानरकोटीनां सुग्रीवं चामितौजसं ।।
data.es: "Very soon you will see mighty Rama, Lakshmana and Sugriva of unlimited prowess surrounded by crores of vanaras.
data.anv: रामम् Rama, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं Lakshmana, वानरकोटीनाम् among crores of vanaras, मध्ये in the midst, अमितौजसम् of a hero of unlimited prowess, सुग्रीवं च also Sugriva, नचिरात् very soon, द्रक्ष्यसे you will see.
data.md: Blessed are we, O Vaidehi, that you do still live, subject as you are to the Raksasis. You shall soon behold Rāma, and Lakşmaņa of a mighty car, and Sugrīva of unmitigated prowess in the midst of the million of monkey hosts. I am Sugrīva's minister, by name Hanumān.

data.v: अहं सुग्रीवसचिवो हनूमान्नाम वानरः । प्रविष्टो नगरीं लङ्कां लङ्घयित्वा महोदधिम् ।।
data.es: "I am Sugriva's minister known as Hanuman, a vanara who entered the city of Lanka after leaping over the great ocean.
data.anv: अहम् I am, सुग्रीवसचिवः minister of Sugriva, हनुमान्नाम called Hanuman, वानरः a vanara, महोदधिम् great ocean, लङ्घयित्वा having leaped, लङ्कां नगरीम् city of Lanka, प्रविष्टः I have entered.

data.v: कृत्वा मूर्ध्नि पदन्यासं रावणस्य दुरात्मनः । त्वां द्रष्टुमुपयातोऽहं समाश्रित्य पराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: "Setting my foot with my valour on the head of the cruelminded Ravana, using my valour, I came here to see you.
data.anv: दुरात्मनः cruelminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, मूर्ध्नि: on the head, पदन्यासम् placing my foot, कृत्वा of having done, पराक्रमम् valour, समाश्रित्य using, अहम् I, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, उपयातः came here.

data.v: नाहमस्मि तथा देवि यथा मामवगच्छसि । विशङ्का त्यज्यतामेषा श्रद्धत्स्व वदतो मम ।।
data.es: "O goddesslike lady I am not a deceitful person as you suppose me to be. Shake off your suspicion as I speak to you and trust me."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुस्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: देवि O goddesslike lady, माम् me, यथा as, अवगच्छसि you suppose, अहम् I, तथा like that, नास्मि I am not, एषा such, विशङ्का suspicion, त्यज्यताम् shake off, वदतः as I speak, मम my, श्रद्धत्स्व you may trust.
data.md: I have come here to see you I am not he (Ravana) for whom you are taking me, O worshipful dame. Do you renounce your suspicion and rely on my words.

data.v: तां तु राम कथां श्रुत्वा वैदेही वानरर्षभात् । उवाच वचनं सान्त्वमिदं मधुरया गिरा ।।
data.es: On hearing about Rama from the bull among vanaras, thus spoke Vaidehi politely in a sweet voice:
data.anv: वैदेही Vaidehi, वानरर्षभात् from the bull among vanaras, ताम् that, रामकथाम् Rama's story, श्रुत्वा heard, मधुरया in sweet, गिरा word, सान्त्वम् polite, इदम् these, वचनम् words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Hearing the tale of Rāma from that best of monkeys, Vaidehī, spoke in sweet accents, soft and low.

data.v: क्व ते रामेण संसर्गः कथं जानासि लक्ष्मणम् । वानराणां नराणां च कथमासीत्समागमः ।।
data.es: "Where did you come in contact with Rama? How did you assess Lakshmana? How did an alliance of vanaras and humans take place?
data.anv: ते to you, रामेण with Rama, संसर्गः contact, क्व where, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, कथम् how, जानासि do you assess, वानराणाम् of vanaras, नराणां च a human, समागमः union, कथम् how, आसीत् took place.
data.md: Where didst you meet Rāma, how didst you come to know Lakşmaņa? How did the monkeys and men meet on terms of brother-hood?

data.v: यानि रामस्य लिङ्गानि लक्ष्मणस्य च वानर । तानि भूयः समाचक्ष्व न मां शोकः समाविशेत् ।।
data.es: "O vanara tell me all about the identification marks of Rama and Lakshmana again so that grief does not enter my mind.
data.anv: वानर O vanara, रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, यानि those, लिङ्गानि identification marks, तानि those, समाचक्ष्व you may tell, माम् to me, भूयः again, शोकः sorrow, न not, समाविशेत् entire account.
data.md: Do you again relate to me, O monkey, the regal signs that deck the persons of Rāma and Lakşmaņa-and I shall then relinquish all grief.

data.v: कीदृशं तस्य संस्थानं रूपं रामस्य कीदृशम् । कथमूरू कथं बाहू लक्ष्मणस्य च शंस मे ।।
data.es: "What does Rama look like? And Laksmana? How are his thighs, arms? Tell me".
data.anv: तस्य his, रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, संस्थानम् form, कीदृशम् how, रूपम् form, कीदृशम् how does his look, ऊरू thighs, कथम् how, बाहू arms, कथम् how, मे to me, शंस tell.
data.md: Do you relate to me the form and grace of Rāma, his thighs and arms and as well as those of Laksmana.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु वैदेह्या हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । ततो रामं यथातत्त्वमाख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ।।
data.es: Questioned thus by Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod started describing Rama's physique as it is.
data.anv: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः thereafter, रामम् Rama, यथातत्त्वम् as it is, आख्यातुम् to describe, उपचक्रमे he started telling.
data.md: Being thus addressed by Vaidehi, Hanuman, the Wind-god's son, began to give an exact description of Rāma.

data.v: जानन्ती बत दिष्ट्या मां वैदेहि परिपृच्छसि । भर्तुः कमलपत्राक्षि संख्यानं लक्ष्मणस्य च ।।
data.es: "O Vaidehi with eyes like lotus petals although you know your husband's and Lakshmana's form and distinguishing marks, it is my good fortune that you asked me (to describe them).
data.anv: कमलपत्त्राक्षि eyes like lotus petals, वैदेहि Vaidehi, जानन्ती even though you know, दिष्ट्या by good fortune, भर्तुः husband's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, संस्थानम् form and distinguishing marks, परिपृच्छसि have asked, बत indeed.
data.md: If do you, by my good luck, O Vaidehi, O you having eyes like lotus-petals, knowing me (as his messenger) ask me to describe your lord's person as well as that of Lakşmaņa, I shall relate them to you. Do you hear, O large-eyed dame, what regal signs I have marked on the persons of Rama and Laksmana.

data.v: यानि रामस्य चिह्नानि लक्ष्मणस्य च यानि वै । लक्षितानि विशालाक्षि वदतः शृणु तानि मे ।।
data.es: "O largeeyed lady I will describe those distinguishing marks of Rama and Lakshmana Listen.
data.anv: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, रामस्य Rama's, यानि लक्षणानि those distinguishing marks, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, यानि those, लक्षितानि signs, तानि them, वदतः as I describe, मे myself, शृणु listen.

data.v: रामः कमलपत्राक्षः सर्वभूतमनोहरः । रूपदाक्षिण्यसंपन्नः प्रसूतो जनकात्मजे ।।
data.es: "O daughter of Janaka Rama with eyes like lotus petals is a person born with a delightful form, richly endowed with indescribable charm and politeness.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे O Janaka's daughter, रामः Rama, कमलपत्त्राक्षः one who has eyes like lotus petals, सर्वसत्त्वमनोहरः one who delights all beings, रूपदाक्षिण्यसम्पन्नः endowed richly with charm and politeness, प्रसूतः born with.
data.md: O daughter of Janaka, Rāma has eyes like lotus-petals and a countenance resembling the full-moon and is gifted with great beauty and goodness.

data.v: तेजसादित्यसंकाशः क्षमया पृथिवीसमः । बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या यशसा वासवोपमः ।।
data.es: "He vies with the Sun in effulgence, with earth in forbearance, with Brihaspati in intelligence, and in fame with Indra.
data.anv: तेजसा in effulgence, आदित्यसङ्काशः vies with the Sun, क्षमया in tolerance, पृथिवीसमः equals the earth, बुद्ध्या in intelligence, बृहस्पतिसमः equal to Brihaspathi, यशसा in fame, वासवोपमः equals Indra.
data.md: In effulgence he is like the Sun, in patience like the earth, in intellect like BỊhaspati (The god of wisdom) and in fame like Vāsava. (The lord of celestials) He is the protector of the world of creation and his own kinsmen. He follows right in all his ways and never swerves from his royal duties and is the slayer of foes.

data.v: रक्षिता जीवलोकस्य स्वजनस्य च रक्षिता । रक्षिता स्वस्य वृत्तस्य धर्मस्य च परंतपः ।।
data.es: "The scourage of enemies, he is a protector of righteousness and of his kins and all living creatures. He is an embodiment of righteousness.
data.anv: परन्तपः scourage of foes, स्वस्य his, धर्मस्य of righteousness, रक्षिता a  protector, स्वजनस्य of his kins, रक्षिता a protector, जीवलोकस्य of all living creatures, धर्मस्य च and of righteousness, रक्षिता protector.
data.md: In effulgence he is like the Sun, in patience like the earth, in intellect like BỊhaspati (The god of wisdom) and in fame like Vāsava. (The lord of celestials) He is the protector of the world of creation and his own kinsmen. He follows right in all his ways and never swerves from his royal duties and is the slayer of foes.

data.v: रामो भामिनि लोकस्य चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य रक्षिता । मर्यादानां च लोकस्य कर्ता कारयिता च सः ।।
data.es: "O beautiful lady Rama is a protector of the four classes of society (Brahmana, Kshatriya, Vaisya and Sudra) in the world. He follows codes of conduct and makes others follow them.
data.anv: भामिनि O beautiful lady, रामः Rama, लोकस्य world's, चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य of the four classes of society, रक्षिता protector, सः he, लोकानाम् of all the worlds, मर्यादानाम् code and conduct, कर्ता maker, कारयिताचैव will make others follow.
data.md: O dame, he upholds the dignity of the people of four-castes— he confers honours on the people and preserves them.

data.v: अर्चिष्मानर्चितोऽत्यर्थं ब्रह्मचर्यव्रते स्थितः । साधूनामुपकारज्ञः प्रचारज्ञश्च कर्मणाम् ।।
data.es: "He is luminous and highly revered. He observes vow of selfcontrol. He is steadfast and recognises services rendered by sages. He is aware of the rites and the ways of administration.
data.anv: अर्चिष्मान् luminous, अत्यर्थम् intensely, अर्चितः worshipped, ब्रह्मचर्यव्रते observing the vow of selfcontrol, स्थितः one who is steadfast, साधूनाम् for the holy men, उपकारज्ञः recognises right action, कर्मणाम् rites, प्रचारज्ञश्च  of the ways of  administration.
data.md: He is worshipped by all like the Sun, observes ascetic vows, know well the time when the saints should be honoured and is conversant with the nature and procedure of actions.

data.v: राजविद्याविनीतश्च ब्राह्मणानामुपासिता । श्रुतवाञ्शीलसंपन्नो विनीतश्च परंतपः ।।
data.es: "He is welltrained in statecraft. He is devoted to brahmins. Endowed with an excellent conduct, he is learned in scriptures and a scorcher of enemies.
data.anv: राजविद्याविनीतश्च welltrained in statecraft, ब्राह्मणानाम् of the brahmins, उपासिता a devotee, श्रुतवान् learned in scriptures, शीलसम्पन्नः endowed with excellent conduct, विनीतः is disciplined, परन्तपः  is a scorcher of enemies.
data.md: He is well acquainted with royal duties and abode by the commandments of the Brāhmaṇas is wise, gifted with a good character, humble and the slayer of foes.

data.v: यजुर्वेदविनीतश्च वेदविद्भिः सुपूजितः । धनुर्वेदे च वेदे च वेदाङ्गेषु च निष्ठितः ।।
data.es: "He is versed in Yajurveda and is respected by Vedic scholars. He has mastered Dhanurveda and other Vedas and auxillary Vedas as well.
data.anv: यजुर्वेदविनीतश्च versed in Yajurveda, वेदविद्भिः by the knowers of the Vedas, सुपूजितः respected, धनुर्वेदे च and in Dhanurveda also, वेदेषु in other Vedas also, वेदाङ्गेषु च Vedangas (auxillary Vedas) also, निष्ठितः is an expert.
data.md: He is the master of Yajurvedas and is adored by those who are well-versed in Vedas—is proficient in the science of bended bow, Vedas and Vedāngas. (A sacred science considered as subordinate to and in some sense a part of the Vedas six sciences come under this denimination-Siksha (pronunciation); Kalp. (religious rite) Vyakarana (grammar) Chandas (prosody) Jyotis (astronomy) and and Nirukti explanation of difficult words.)

data.v: विपुलांसो महाबाहुः कम्बुग्रीवः शुभाननः । गूढजत्रुः सुताम्राक्षो रामो देवि जनैः श्रुतः ।।
data.es: "O godlike lady Rama has broad shoulders, strong arms, conchshaped neck and an auspicious countenance. With his fleshy round arms and copperyred eyes, he is renowned in all the worlds.
data.anv: देवि goddess like lady, रामः Rama, विपुलां सः broadshouldered, महाबाहुः strongarmed, कम्बुग्रीवः with conchshaped neck, शुभाननः with an auspicious countenance, गूढजत्रुः has round shoulders, सुताम्राक्षः copperyred eyes  जनैः in all worlds, श्रुतः renowned.
data.md: He is broad-shouldered, large-armed, has a conch-like neck and a beautiful countenance. His throat is plump and his eyes are red-and he is famed all over the world under the name of Rāma.

data.v: दुन्दुभिस्वननिर्घोषः स्निग्धवर्णः प्रतापवान् । समः समविभक्ताङ्गो वर्णं श्यामं समाश्रितः ।।
data.es: "His tone is resonant like drums, he has a beautiful, dark, shining complexion. He has symmetrical, well proportioned limbs. He is neither too tall nor too short.
data.anv: दुन्दुभिस्वननिर्घोषः his tone is resonant like the drums, स्निग्धवर्णः has beautiful shining complexion, प्रतापवान् full of valour, समः not too tall or short, समविभक्ताङ्गः his limbs are symmetrical, श्यामम् dark, वर्णम् colour, समाश्रितः has proportionate limbs.
data.md: He has the voice of a bugle, is of a cool hue and highly powerful, has equally proportioned limbs and a green colour.

data.v: त्रिस्थिरस्त्रिप्रलम्बश्च त्रिसमस्त्रिषु चोन्नतः । त्रिवलीवांस्त्र्यवणतश्चतुर्व्यङ्गस्त्रिशीर्षवान् ।।
data.es: "He has three stiff parts, three long parts, three even parts, three shining parts, elevated in three parts, has three raised parts, his body has lines in three parts and is of coppery reddish colour in three parts. He has a majestic look.
data.anv: त्रिस्थिरः has the three stiff limbs (chest, fist and wrists), त्रिप्रलम्बश्च long in three (arms, eyebrows and scrotum), त्रिसमः has three even parts (locks of hair, knees and testicles), त्रिषु elevated in three parts (abdomen, navel and chest), उन्नतः raised, त्रिषु च all the three parts (soles, nails and eyes), स्निग्धः has coppery reddish colour, नित्यशः all over, त्रिषु in the three parts (the underlines of feet, the hair and the reproductive  organs), गम्भीरः is majestic.
data.md: His three limbs (thigh, fist and wrist) are hard and three others (brow arins and scrotum) are long; and three (tops of the hairs, scrotums and knee-joints) equal and three (navel, abdomen and breast) high. And three (the angles of the or three are cool and three (voice, navel and gait) are grave.

data.v: चतुष्कलश्चतुर्लेखश्चतुष्किष्कुश्चतुःसमः । चतुर्दशसमद्वन्द्वश्चतुर्दष्टश्चतुर्गतिः ।।
महौष्ठहनुनासश्च पञ्चस्निग्धोऽष्टवंशवान् । दशपद्मो दशबृहत्त्रिभिर्व्याप्तो द्विशुक्लवान् । षडुन्नतो नवतनुस्त्रिभिर्व्याप्नोति राघवः ।।
data.es: "Ten limbs of the body resemble lotuses. He has proportionate limbs. He is known by the virtue of his spledour, fame and glory. Both his teeth and eyes are fair. Six parts of his body are elevated, nine parts of his body are fine and sharp. He pursues spiritual merit, worldly comfort and sensual delight in three periods of the dayforenoon, midday and evening. He always adopts the righteous way of life.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, दशपद्मः ten lotuslike limbs (eyes, face, mouth, tongue, lips, cheeks, nipples, nails, feet and hands), दशबृहत् he is one with ten wellproportioned limbs (head, forehead, ears, neck, chest, heart, belly, hands, legs, buttocks), त्रिभिः covered with three aspects (splendour, fame and glory), व्याप्तः well known, द्विशुक्लवान् two white limbs teeth and eyes, षडुन्नतः he has six elevated  limbs (nose, shoulders, forehead, chest and arm pits), नवतनुः has nine fine features (moustache, nails, knuckles, beard, skin, hair, penis, acumen, perception), त्रिभिः he pursues spiritual merit, worldly comforts and sensual delight in three periodsforenoon, middday and evening of the day, व्याप्नोति follows righteous principles.

data.v: सत्यधर्मपरः श्रीमान्संग्रहानुग्रहे रतः । देशकालविभागज्ञः सर्वलोकप्रियंवदः ।।
data.es: "He is ever established in truth and righteousness. He is prosperous and desires to accumulate wealth in order to shower favour on others. He knows the right use of time and place in discharging his duties. He has endeared himself to all by his words.
data.anv: सत्यधर्मपरः established in truth and righteousness, श्रीमान् prosperous, सङ्ग्रहानुग्रहे रतः he is involved in both accumulation and favourable disposition towards others, देशकालविभागज्ञः who discharges his duties at proper time and place, सर्वलोकप्रियंवदः who is loved by all for his endearing words.
data.md: He is truthful and graceful, amasses wealth and thereby protects his subjects. He is cognisant of the divisions of time and country and dear to all.

data.v: भ्राता च तस्य द्वैमात्रः सौमित्रिरपराजितः । अनुरागेण रूपेण गुणैश्चैव तथाविधः ।।
data.es: "His invincible brother Saumitri born of a different mother is a replica of Rama in affection, charm and virtues.
data.anv: तस्य his, द्वैमात्रः born of a different mother, भ्राता brother, अपराजितः one who has never been defeated, सौमित्रिः Saumitri, अनुरागेण in affection, रूपेण in charm, गुणैश्चैव in virtues, तथाविधः similar to him.
data.md: His step brother Saumitri is gifted with incomparable prowess and is his equal in attachment, beauty and accomplishments.

data.v: त्वामेव मार्गमाणो तौ विचरन्तौ वसुंधराम् । ददर्शतुर्मृगपतिं पूर्वजेनावरोपितम् ।।
data.es: "While both of them were wandering, searching for you all over the earth they saw Sugriva, the lord of animals who had been thrown out of kingship by his elder brother and was living on the mountain Rshyamuka frightened of him.
data.anv: त्वामेव for you, मार्गमाणौ while searching, वसुन्धराम् all over the earth, विचरन्तौ while both were wandering, तौ they both, बहुपादपसङ्कुले filled with many trees, ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे on the mountain Rshyamuka, आसीनम् seated, पूर्वजेन by the elder brother, अवरोपितम् one who has been thrown out, भ्रातुः brother's, भयार्तम् frightened, प्रियदर्शनम् one who is pleasing to see, मृगपतिम् lord of animals, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्शतुः both of them saw.
data.md: And ranging the earth for you they beheld Sugriva, of comely presence, the lord of monkeys, at the foot of the mount Rsyamūka covered with trees, banished by his elder brother and resorting there in his fear.

data.v: ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे तु बहुपादपसंकुले । भ्रातुर्भार्यार्तमासीनं सुग्रीवं प्रियदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "While both of them were wandering, searching for you all over the earth they saw Sugriva, the lord of animals who had been thrown out of kingship by his elder brother and was living on the mountain Rshyamuka frightened of him.
data.anv: त्वामेव for you, मार्गमाणौ while searching, वसुन्धराम् all over the earth, विचरन्तौ while both were wandering, तौ they both, बहुपादपसङ्कुले filled with many trees, ऋश्यमूकस्य पृष्ठे on the mountain Rshyamuka, आसीनम् seated, पूर्वजेन by the elder brother, अवरोपितम् one who has been thrown out, भ्रातुः brother's, भयार्तम् frightened, प्रियदर्शनम् one who is pleasing to see, मृगपतिम् lord of animals, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, ददर्शतुः both of them saw.

data.v: वयं तु हरिराजं तं सुग्रीवं सत्यसंगरम् । परिचर्यामहे राज्यात्पूर्वजेनावरोपितम् ।।
data.es: "Sugriva, king of vanaras who is committed to defend truth has been deposed from the kingdom by his elder brother. We keep attending on him.
data.anv: वयं तु we too, पूर्वजेन by his elder brother, राज्यात् from the kingdom, अवरोपितम् deposed, सत्यसङ्गरम् one who is committed to truth, हरिराजम् king of vanaras, तम् him, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिचर्यामहे we serve him.
data.md: We wears serving that truthful Sugrīva, the lord of monkeys, driven from the kingdom by his elder brother.

data.v: ततस्तौ चीरवसनौ धनुःप्रवरपाणिनौ । ऋश्यमूकस्य शैलस्य रम्यं देशमुपागतौ ।।
data.es: "Both the princes clad in bark robes and armed with powerful bows reached the beautiful location of Rshyamukha mountain.
data.anv: ततः then, चीरवसनौ clad in bark robes, धनुःप्रवरपाणिनौ armed with powerful bows, तौ both, ऋश्यमूकस्य शैलस्य on the Rshyamukha mountain, रम्यम् beautiful, देशम् location, उपागतौ both reached.

data.v: स तौ दृष्ट्वा नरव्याघ्रौ धन्विनौ वानरर्षभः । अभिप्लुतो गिरेस्तस्य शिखरं भयमोहितः ।।
data.es: "On seeing the tigers among men armed with bows, Sugriva, the bull among vanaras jumped from the mountain deluded with fear and reached the peak.
data.anv: सः he, वानरर्षभः bull among vanaras, धन्विनौ armed with bows, तौ both of them, नरव्याघ्रौ tigers among men, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, भयमोहितः deluded with fear, तस्य from that, गिरेः mountain, शिखरम् top, अभिप्लुतः jumped.
data.md: Beholding those two best of men, wearing bark and with bows in their hands, that best of monkeys, stricken with fear, leaped above and stationed himself on the crest of the hill.

data.v: ततः स शिखरे तस्मिन्वानरेन्द्रो व्यवस्थितः । तयोः समीपं मामेव प्रेषयामास सत्वरः ।।
data.es: "Thereafter the lord of vanaras staying on the mountain top quickly sent me to meet both of them.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सः he, वानरेन्द्रः lord of vanaras, तस्मिन् on that, शिखरे mountain top, व्यवस्थितः staying there, मामेव me only, तयोः of both of them, समीपम् towads, सत्वरम् quickly, प्रेषयामास sent.
data.md: He then sent me to them. And thereupon by Sugrīva's decree I, approached with joined palms, those two foremost of men gifted with beauty and royal marks.

data.v: तावहं पुरुषव्याघ्रौ सुग्रीववचनात्प्रभू । रूपलक्षणसंपन्नौ कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थितः ।।
data.anv: अहम् I, सुग्रीववचनात् according to the instruction of Sugriva, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, प्रभू two lords, रूपलक्षणसम्पन्नौ both endowed with charming appearance and auspicious marks, तौ both, कृताञ्जलिः joined palms in salutation, उपस्थितः approached.
data.md: He then sent me to them. And thereupon by Sugrīva's decree I, approached with joined palms, those two foremost of men gifted with beauty and royal marks.

data.v: तौ परिज्ञाततत्त्वार्थौ मया प्रीतिसमन्वितौ । पृष्ठमारोप्य तं देशं प्रापितौ पुरुषर्षभौ ।।
data.es: "I recognised the true status of both the mighty men who were filled with joy, placed them on my back, and reached the mountaintop.
data.anv: परिज्ञाततत्त्वर्थौ realised the true position, प्रीतिसमन्वितौ filled with pleasure, पुरुषर्षभौ two bulls among men, तौ both, मया by me, पृष्ठम् back, आरोप्य placing, तं देशम् to that place, प्रापितौ carried.
data.md: They were pleased by me, being informed of the real facts. And then placing those two best of men on my back I arrived at the top of the hill and communicated the truth to the high-souled Sugriva.

data.v: निवेदितौ च तत्त्वेन सुग्रीवाय महात्मने । तयोरन्योन्यसंभाषाद्भृशं प्रीतिरजायत ।।
data.es: "I reported faithfully about both the highsouled men to Sugriva. As they got to know each other through conversation a fast friendship developed between them.
data.anv: महात्मने to the great self, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, तत्त्वेन faithfully, निवेदितौ reported by me, तयोः of both of them, अन्योन्यसल्लापात् got to know each other through conversation, भृशम् fond, प्रीतिः friendship, अजायत developed.

data.v: तत्र तौ कीर्तिसंपन्नौ हरीश्वरनरेश्वरौ । परस्परकृताश्वासौ कथया पूर्ववृत्तया ।।
data.anv: ततः then, प्रीतिसम्पन्नौ full of joy, तौ both, हरीश्वरनरेश्वरौ king of monkeys and the king of people, पूर्ववृत्तया with their past, कथया with account, परस्परकृताश्वासौ they consoled each other.
data.md: And conversing with each other those two lords of men and monkeys attained great delight. And they consoled each other narrating their respective misfortunes.

data.v: तं ततः सान्त्वयामास सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणाग्रजः । स्त्रीहेतोर्वालिना भ्रात्रा निरस्तमुरु तेजसा ।।
data.es: "Then Rama, consoled Sugriva who was dethroned and abandoned on acount of a woman by his brother Vali, endowed with great prowess.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सः he, लक्ष्मणाग्रजः the elder brother of Lakshmana, उरुतेजसा with great prowess, भ्रात्रा by the brother, वालिना by Vali, स्त्रीहेतो on account of a woman, निरस्तम्  deposed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सान्त्वयामास consoled.
data.md: And Rāma then consoled Sugrīva, driven away by his greatly powerful elder brother Vāli on his wife's account.

data.v: ततस्त्वन्नाशजं शोकं रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । लक्ष्मणो वानरेन्द्राय सुग्रीवाय न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: "Then Lakshmana spoke to the lord of vanaras, Sugriva about your loss and the grief caused to Rama, who is adept in accomplishing difficult deeds with ease.
data.anv: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः one who is adept in accomplishing tasks with ease, रामस्य Rama's, त्वन्नाशजम् on account of your loss, शोकम् grief, वानरेन्द्राय to the lord of vanaras, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, न्यवेदयत् revealed.
data.md: Thereupon Lakşmaņa related to Sugrīva, the lord of monkeys, the grief, of Rāma of unwearied actions, in consequence of your being borne away (by Rāvana).

data.v: स श्रुत्वा वानरेन्द्रस्तु लक्ष्मणेनेरितं वचः । तदासीन्निष्प्रभोऽत्यर्थं ग्रहग्रस्त इवांशुमान् ।।
data.es: "Having heard the words of Lakshmana, the king of vanaras became extremely lustreless like the Sun overshadowed by the planet Rahu.
data.anv: सः he, वानरेन्द्रस्तु to the king of vanaras, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, ईरितम् spoken वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, तदा then, ग्रहग्रस्तः overshadowed by the planet, अंशुमानिव like the Sun, अत्यर्थम् extremely, निष्प्रभः lustreless, आसीत् became.
data.md: And hearing Laksmana's words, the lord of monkeys became pale, like to the radiant Sun possessed by Rāhu.

data.v: ततस्त्वद्गात्रशोभीनि रक्षसा ह्रियमाणया । यान्याभरणजालानि पातितानि महीतले ।।
data.anv: ततः at that time, रक्षसा by the demon, ह्रियमाणया when you were borne away, त्वद्गात्रशोभिनी adorned your limbs, यानि those, आभरणजालानि bundle of ornaments, पातितानि dropped down, तानि सर्वाणि all of them, आनीय brought, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, संहृष्टाः with great joy, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामासुः showed, तव your, गतिं तु whereabouts, न विदुः did not know.
data.md: And collecting all those ornaments which were thrown off by you on the earth when you were borne away, the leaders of the monkey hosts, delighted brought them before Räma. But they could not make out your whereabouts.

data.v: तानि सर्वाणि रामाय आनीय हरियूथपाः । संहृष्टा दर्शयामासुर्गतिं तु न विदुस्तव ।।
data.anv: ततः at that time, रक्षसा by the demon, ह्रियमाणया when you were borne away, त्वद्गात्रशोभिनी adorned your limbs, यानि those, आभरणजालानि bundle of ornaments, पातितानि dropped down, तानि सर्वाणि all of them, आनीय brought, हरियूथपाः vanara leaders, संहृष्टाः with great joy, रामाय to Rama, दर्शयामासुः showed, तव your, गतिं तु whereabouts, न विदुः did not know.
data.md: And collecting all those ornaments which were thrown off by you on the earth when you were borne away, the leaders of the monkey hosts, delighted brought them before Räma. But they could not make out your whereabouts.

data.v: तानि रामाय दत्तानि मयैवोपहृतानि च । स्वनवन्त्यवकीर्णन्ति तस्मिन्विहतचेतसि ।।
data.es: "I collected the ornaments and gave them to Rama. He lost his senses on seeing the jingling ornaments scattered.
data.anv: मयैव by me, उपहृतानि collected, तानि those ornaments, रामाय to Rama, दत्तानि gave, तस्मिन् them, विगतचेतसि lost senses, स्वनवन्ति making jingling sound, अवकीर्णानि having scattered.
data.md: All those ornaments, which were handed over to Rāma, were collected by me when they fell tinkling on the ground, Rāma being beside himself with grief. And placing them on his lap, the god-like Rāma bewailed in various accents.

data.v: तान्यङ्के दर्शनीयानि कृत्वा बहुविधं ततः । तेन देवप्रकाशेन देवेन परिदेवितम् ।।
data.es: "The divine self who is effulgent like god wailed in many ways placing the beautiful ornaments on his lap.
data.anv: दर्शनीयानि beautiful ones, तव your, तानि those, अङ्के on his lap, कृत्वा having placed, देवप्रकाशेन by an effulgent one looking like the divine, तेन by him, देवेन divine self, बहुविधम् in many ways, परिदेवितम् wailed.
data.md: All those ornaments, which were handed over to Rāma, were collected by me when they fell tinkling on the ground, Rāma being beside himself with grief. And placing them on his lap, the god-like Rāma bewailed in various accents.

data.v: पश्यतस्तस्या रुदतस्ताम्यतश्च पुनः पुनः । प्रादीपयन्दाशरथेस्तानि शोकहुताशनम् ।।
data.es: "Rama looked at them and wept clasping them again and again in grief which inflamed like fire.
data.anv: तानि them, पश्यतः as looked at, रुदतः while he wept, पुनः पुनः again and again, ताम्यतश्च  regretting, दाशरथेः Dasaratha's son Rama's, शोकहुताशनम् fire in the form of grief, तानि them, प्रादीपयन् inflamed.

data.v: शयितं च चिरं तेन दुःखार्तेन महात्मना । मयापि विविधैर्वाक्यैः कृच्छ्रादुत्थापितः पुनः ।।
data.es: "Rama, the great self, immersed in sorrow lay down on the ground. I also consoled him with great difficulty and helped him to get up.
data.anv: दुःखार्तेन immersed in sorrow, तेन by him, महात्मना by the great self, शयितं च lay down, मयापि by me also, विविधैः by many, वाक्यैः by words, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, पुनः again, उत्थापितः helped to get up.
data.md: They inflamed the more Dasarathi's (Son of Dasaratha-Rāma) grief. And being overwhelmed with grief that high-souled one laid himself low on the ground. And consoling him in various words, I raised him up again.

data.v: तानि दृष्ट्वा महार्हाणि दर्शयित्वा मुहुर्मुहुः । राघवः सहसौमित्रिः सुग्रीवे स न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: "Longarmed Rama along with Lakshmana looked at them again and again and gave them to the care of Sugriva.
data.anv: महाबाहुः longarmed one, सः राघवः that Rama, सहसौमित्रिः along with Lakshmana, तानि those, मुहुः मुहुः again and again, दर्शयित्वा after showing, सुग्रीवे to Sugriva, न्यवेदयत् presented.
data.md: Looking again and again with Saumitri, at those costly ornaments, Rāghava handed them over to Sugriva.

data.v: स तवादर्शनादार्ये राघवः परितप्यते । महता ज्वलता नित्यमग्निनेवाग्निपर्वतः ।।
data.es: "O divine lady on account of your separation he is ever blazing like a mountain of fire (Samvartaka).
data.anv: आर्ये O divine lady, सः राघवः that Rama, तव your, अदर्शनात् separation from you, नित्यम् always, ज्वलता burning, महता great, अग्निना in fire, अग्निपर्वतः इव like a mountain of fire, परितप्यते  ever blazing.
data.md: Rāghava burns in grief, O worshipful dame, in your absence, like to a volcanic mountain burning with a perpetual fire.

data.v: त्वत्कृते तमनिद्रा च शोकश्चिन्ता च राघवम् । तापयन्ति महात्मानमग्न्यगारमिवाग्नयः ।।
data.es: "Rama is burning like a furnace by (three fires) sleeplessness, grief and intense anxiety just as the three sacred fires keep a firesanctuary intensely heated.
data.anv: त्वत्कृते on account of, महात्मानम् the great one, तं राघवम् that Rama, अनिद्रा च not sleeping, शोकः grief, चिन्ता च intense anxiety, अग्न्यगारम् like a furnace, अग्नयः इव like the three fires, तापयन्ति keep intensely heated.
data.md: For you, sleeplessness, grief and anxiety are distressing Rāghava like to three fires, (The aggregate of the three fires maintained by the Brāhmaṇa house-holder) burning down the fire temple.

data.v: तवादर्शनशोकेन राघवः प्रविचाल्यते । महता भूमिकम्पेन महानिव शिलोच्चयः ।।
data.es: "On account of sorrow caused by not being able to see you, Rama of Raghu dynasty is shaken up like a lofty mountain is shaken by earthquake.
data.anv: तव your, अदर्शनशोकेन by the sorrow of not being able to see you, राघवः Rama of Raghu dynasty, महता with great, भूमिकम्पेन by earthquake, महान् great, शिलोच्छयः lofty mountain, प्रविचाल्यते is shaken.
data.md: Rāghava is moved by your separation like to a huge mountain shaken by a terrible earth-quake.

data.v: कानानानि सुरम्याणि नदीप्रस्रवणानि च । चरन्न रतिमाप्नोति त्वमपश्यन्नृपात्मजे ।।
data.es: "Oh princess unable to see you, Rama has found no joy in roaming delightful forests, rivers and streams.
data.anv: नृपात्मजे daughter of a king, त्वाम् you, अपश्यन् unable to see, सुरम्याणि very delightful, काननानि forests, नदीः rivers, प्रस्रवणानि च and streams, चरन् while moving, रतिम् happiness, न आप्नोति not finding.
data.md: O daughter of a king, he is ranging at large in many a beautiful forest, river and fountain-but he finds delight nowhere.

data.v: स त्वां मनुजशार्दूलः क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यति राघवः । समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं जनकात्मजे ।।
data.es: "Oh daughter of Janaka after killing Ravana, along with his friends and relatives Rama, the tiger among men, will meet you.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे Oh daughter of Janaka, मनुजशार्दूलः a tiger among men, सः राघवः that Rama, समित्रबान्धवम् along with his friends and relatives, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, त्वाम् you, क्षिप्रम् soon, प्राप्स्यति will attain.
data.md: O daughter of the king Janaka bringing about the destruction of Rāvaņa, with all his kith and kin, Rāghava, the foremost of men, shall soon regain you.

data.v: सहितौ रामसुग्रीवावुभावकुरुतां तदा । समयं वालिनं हन्तुं तव चान्वेषणं तथा ।।
data.es: "(Having become friends) Rama and Sugriva together reached an agreement to kill Vali and search for you.
data.anv: तदा then, रामसुग्रीवौ Rama and Sugriva, उभौ both, सहितौ together with, वालिनम् Vali, हन्तुम् to kill, तथा likewise, तव your, अन्वेषणम् search, समयम् agreement, अकुरुताम् reached.
data.md: Thus Rāma and Sugrīva entered into a friendly covenant, to encompass Vali's destruction and to institute enquiries about you.

data.v: ततो निहत्य तरसा रामो वालिनमाहवे । सर्वर्क्षहरिसंघानां सुग्रीवमकरोत्पतिम् ।।
data.es: "Then Rama quickly killed Vali in a combat and made Sugriva the lord of all troops of vanaras and bears.
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, आहवे in a combat, तरसा quickly, वालिनम् Vali, निहत्य killed, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, सर्वर्क्षहरिसङ्घानाम् for all troops of vanaras, पतिम् king, अकरोत् made.
data.md: And destroying Vāli by his prowess in battle, Rāma made Sugrīva king over all monkeys and bears.

data.v: रामसुग्रीवयोरैक्यं देव्येवं समजायत । हनूमन्तं च मां विद्धि तयोर्दूतमिहागतम् ।।
data.es: "Oh Illustrious lady In that manner alliance was established between Rama and Sugriva. Know me to be Hanuman, arrived here as their messenger.
data.anv: देवि Oh Illustrious lady, रामसुग्रीवयोः of both Rama and Sugriva, ऐक्यम् alliance, एवम् in that way, समजायत established, माम् me, तयोः their, दूतम् messenger, आगतम् came here, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, विद्धि you may know.
data.md: In this way, O dame, the alliance between Rāma and Sugrīva was made. And know me as Hanumān, their messenger who has come to you.

data.v: स्वराज्यं प्राप्य सुग्रीवः समनीय महाहरीन् । त्वदर्थं प्रेषयामास दिशो दश महाबलान् ।।
data.es: "Having obtained his kingdom Sugriva despatched the vanara leaders to all ten directions (to search for you).
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्राप्य having obtained, महाबलान् great army, हरीश्वरान् monkey leaders, समानीय after collecting, त्वदर्थम् for your sake, दश ten, दिशः directions, प्रेषयामास sent.
data.md: Regaining his kingdom, Sugrīva summoned all the mighty monkeys and despatched them in various quarters in quest of you.

data.v: आदिष्टा वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण महौजसः । अद्रिराजप्रतीकाशाः सर्वतः प्रस्थिता महीम् ।।
data.es: "Following Sugriva's orders, the powerful monkey leaders huge as the Himalayas, king of mountains went all over the earth (searching).
data.anv: वानरेन्द्रेण by the monkey leaders, महौजसा very powerful one, सुग्रीवेण by Sugriva, आदिष्टाः ordered, अद्रिराजप्रतीकाशाः huge as the Himalayas, king of mountains, सर्वतः all over, महीम् the earth, प्रस्थिता started moving.
data.md: The highly powerful monkeys, resembling mountains, commanded by that lord of monkeys, proceeded to all the regions of the earth.

data.v: अङ्गदो नाम लक्ष्मीवान्वालिसूनुर्महाबलः । प्रस्थितः कपिशार्दूलस्त्रिभागबलसंवृतः ।।
data.anv: लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous, वालिसूनुः Vali's son, महाबलः mighty, अङ्गदो नाम called Angada, हरिशार्दूलः a tiger among vanaras, त्रिभागबलसंवृतः together with one third of the army, प्रस्थितः departed.
data.md: Own I am one of them And the beautiful and mighty son of Vali, by name Angada, has proceeded with three armies under him.

data.v: तेषां नो विप्रनष्टानां विन्ध्ये पर्वतसत्तमे । भृशं शोकपरीतनामहोरात्रगणा गताः ।।
data.es: "We wasted many nights and days immersed in disappointment (for not being able to find you) and we missed our path in the great Vindhya mountain.
data.anv: विन्ध्ये in Vindhya, पर्वतसत्तमे in the great mountain, विप्रणष्टानाम् of those who were lost, भृशम् greatly, शोकपरीतानाम् of those immersed in sorrow, तेषाम् of all of them, नः of us, अहोरात्रगणाः many nights and days, गताःpassed
data.md: Many were the days and nights that we spent, overwhelmed with grief and having lost our way on that best of mountains Vindhya.

data.v: ते वयं कार्यनैराश्यात्कालस्यातिक्रमेण च । भयाच्च कपिराजस्य प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं व्यवस्थिताः ।।
data.es: "We decided to give up our lives due to disappointment, transgression of the time limit fixed for us and fear of the monkey lord (fear of facing the king without finding you).
data.anv: ते वयम् we were, कार्यनैराश्यात् disappointed, कालस्य of the time limit, अतिक्रमेण च exceeding, कपिराजस्य of monkey king's, भयाच्च out of fear also, प्राणान् life also, त्यक्तुम् to give up, व्यवस्थिताः decided.
data.md: We gave up all our hopes for the accomplishment of our end and our appointed time was well-nigh spent. And in fear of that lord of monkeys we addressed ourselves to put au end to our live.

data.v: विचित्य वनदुर्गाणि गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च । अनासाद्य पदं देव्याः प्राणांस्त्यक्तुं व्यवस्थिताः ।।
data.es: "We decided to give up our lives since we were unable to see the feet of the queen (Sita) even after searching the forest fortresses and the (banks of) mountain streams.
data.anv: वनदुर्गाणि impenetrable forest forts, गिरिप्रस्रवणानि च mountain streams, विचित्य having searched, देव्याः the queen's, पदम् feet, अनासाद्य by not getting, प्राणान् life, त्यक्तुम् to give up, समुद्यताः we decided.
data.md: Ranging the mountain strongholds, rivers and fountains and not finding your reverence, we were ready to do away with our existence.

data.v: भृशं शोकार्णवे मग्नः पर्यदेवयदङ्गदः । तव नाशं च वैदेहि वालिनश्च तथा वधम् । प्रायोपवेशमस्माकं मरणं च जटायुषः ।।
data.anv: वैदेहि oh Vaidehi, प्रायोपविष्टान् when we decided to die, सर्वान् all, वानरपुङ्गवान् vanara leaders, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, अङ्गदः Angada, भृशम् intensely, शोकार्णवे in the sea of sorrow, मग्नः plunged, तव yourself, नाशं च not found, तथा वालिनः similarly Vali's, वधं च and his killing, जटायुषः Jatayu's, मरणं च death also, अस्माकम् all of us, प्रायोपवेशम् decision to die, पर्यदेवयत् he was grieved.

data.v: तेषां नः स्वामिसंदेशान्निराशानां मुमूर्षताम् । कार्यहेतोरिवायातः शकुनिर्वीर्यवान्महान् ।।
data.es: "When we were disappointed (in tracing you) and were at the point of death having been commanded by the king (that whosoever overstays would be killed) a gigantic powerful bird appeared to fulfil our task.
data.anv: स्वामिसन्देशात् according to the king's cmmand (that who ever overstays would be killed), निराशानाम् disappointed, मुमूर्षताम् when we were desiring to die, तेषाम् for such of us, नः to us, कार्यहेतोरिव as if to fulfil the task, वीर्यवान् powerful, महान् gigantic, शकुनिः bird, आयातः came.

data.v: गृध्रराजस्य सोदर्यः संपातिर्नाम गृध्रराट् । श्रुत्वा भ्रातृवधं कोपादिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "That king of vultures, Sampati was the brother of king of birds Jatayu. Hearing about the death of his younger brother Sampati felt distresed and spoke in anger:
data.anv: गृध्रराजस्य of the king of vultures, सोदर्यः brother, सम्पातिर्नाम called Sampati, गृध्रराट् king of birds, भ्रातृवधम् death of Jatayu, श्रुत्वा on hearing, कोपात् with anger, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: यवीयान्केन मे भ्राता हतः क्व च विनाशितः । एतदाख्यातुमिच्छामि भवद्भिर्वानरोत्तमाः ।।
data.es: 'O best of vanaras by whom was my younger brother killed? Where was he dropped down? I wish you to tell me all about that.
data.anv: मे my, यवीयान् younger, भ्राता brother, केन by whom, हतः was killed, क्व where, निपातितः was he dropped, वानरोत्तमाः of best of vanaras, भवद्भिः by you, एतत् this, आख्यातुम् to tell, इच्छामि I desire.
data.md: Hearing of the destruction of his brother, he in wrath, said-'By whom and where has my younger brother been killed? I wish to hear this from you, the foremost of monkeys.

data.v: अङ्गदोऽकथयत्तस्य जनस्थाने महद्वधम् । रक्षसा भीमरूपेण त्वामुद्दिश्य यथातथम् ।।
data.anv: त्वाम् you, उद्दिश्य aiming at, भीमरूपेण by a dreadful person, रक्षसा by the demon, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, महद्वधम् great killing, यथातथम् as it happened faithfully, अङ्गदः Angada, तस्य to him, अकथयत् told.
data.md: Angada related to him verily Jațāyu's destruction at Janasthāna, for you, by that grimvisaged Rākṣasa.

data.v: जटायोस्तु वधं श्रुत्वा दुःखितः सोऽरुणात्मजः । त्वामाह स वरारोहे वसन्तीं रावणालये ।।
data.es: "Having heard about the death of Jatayu, O charming lady that Sampati Aruna's son felt sad and told us that you are at Ravana's palace.
data.anv: वरारोहे oh charming lady, सः he, अरुणात्मजः Aruna's son, जटायुषः Jatayu's, वधं death, श्रुत्वा having heard, दुःखितः became sad, त्वाम् yourself, रावणालये in Ravana's palace, वसन्तीम् living, शशंस narrated to us.
data.md: Hearing of Jatayu's death, Aruna's son became afflicted with sorrow and informed us, O you exquisitely fine damsel, of your stay in the abode of Rāvaņa.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा संपातेः प्रीतिवर्धनम् । अङ्गदप्रमुखाः सर्वे ततः संप्रस्थिता वयम् । त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहा हृष्टास्तुष्टाः प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.es: "Having heard Sampati's encouraging words all of us led by Angada departed immediately.
data.anv: तस्य his, सम्पातेः Samapati's, प्रीतिवर्धनम् that which was pleasing, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada and others, वयम् all of us, तूर्णम् quickly, ततः from there, प्रस्थिताः departed.
data.md: Hearing those words of Sampāti, enhancing our delight, we all, headed by Angada, left that place. And leaping from the crest of Vindhya mountain we reached the excellent brink of the Ocean. Being greatly anxious to behold you and delighted, those plump monkeys headed by Angada, arrived at the banks of the main.

data.v: अथाहं हरिसैन्यस्य सागरं दृश्य सीदतः । व्यवधूय भयं तीव्रं योजनानां शतं प्लुतः ।।
data.es: "When the vanara army was feeling despondent at the sight of the ocean, I leaped across the sea, a hundred yojanas, pushing aside all my fear.
data.anv: अथ then, अहम् I, सागरम् ocean, प्रेक्ष्य after looking at, सीदतः in desperate mood, हरिसैन्यस्य Vanara army's, तीव्रम् intense, भयम् fear, व्यवधूय after pushing aside, योजनानाम् of yojanas, शतम् one hundred, प्लुतः leaped.

data.v: लङ्का चापि मया रात्रौ प्रविष्टा राक्षसाकुला । रावणश्च मया दृष्टस्त्वं च शोकनिपीडिता ।।
data.es: "I entered at night the city of Lanka teeming with demons and saw Ravana and saw you immersed in sorrow.
data.anv: राक्षसाकुला filled with demons, लङ्का चापि Lanka also, मया by me, रात्रौ at night, प्रविष्टा entered, मया by me, रावणश्च Ravana also, दृष्टः is seen, शोकपरिप्लुता immersed in sorrow, त्वं च you also.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथावृत्तमनिन्दिते । अभिभाषस्व मां देवि दूतो दाशरथेरहम् ।।
data.es: "O sinless lady I have given you a faithful account. I am a messenger of Dasaratha's son. And you may speak now, O divine lady
data.anv: अनिन्दिते O sinless lady, देवि O divine lady, एतत् this, सर्वम् everything, यथावृत्तम् as it happened, ते to you, आख्यातम् narrated, माम् me, अभिभाषस्व you may speak, अहम् I, दाशरथेः Dasaratha's son, दूतः messenger.
data.md: O you of a blameless person, I have related all to you in regular order. Do you speak to me, O worshipful dame, I am Dasarathi's messenger.

data.v: त्वं मां रामकृतोद्योगं त्वन्निमित्तमिहागतम् । सुग्रीव सचिवं देवि बुध्यस्व पवनात्मजम् ।।
data.es: "O divine lady Know that I have come here for your cause carrying out the mission of Rama. I am Sugriva'a minister and son of the Windgod.
data.anv: देवि O divine lady, तं माम् such me, रामकृतोद्योगम् have taken up Rama's mission, त्वन्निमित्तम् on your account, इह here, आगतम् came, सुग्रीवसचिवम् minister of Sugriva, पवनात्मजम् son of Vayu, बुद्ध्यस्व you may know.
data.md: Do you know me as the Wind-god's son, the counsellor of Sugrīva, who am engaged in Rāma's service and have come here for you.

data.v: कुशली तव काकुत्स्थः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः । गुरोराराधने युक्तो लक्ष्मणश्च सुलक्षणः ।।
data.es: "Your lord Rama of Kakutstha race, supreme among wielders of weapons is doing well. So is venerable Lakshmana endowed with auspicious signs engaged in serving him.
data.anv: सर्वशस्त्रभृताम् among all wielders of weapons, वरः supreme, तव your, काकुत्स्थ Rama of the Kakutstha race, कुशली he is keeping well, गुरोः of his venerable teacher, आराधने in service, युक्तः engaged, सुलक्षणः a man of auspicious signs, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also.
data.md: It is all well with your Kākuthstha, the foremost of those using weapons, as well as with Laksmana, O worshipful dame, gifted with auspicious marks, engaged in the worship of his superiors and in the well being of your lord.

data.v: तस्य वीर्यवतो देवि भर्तुस्तव हिते रतः । अहमेकस्तु संप्राप्तः सुग्रीववचनादिह ।।
data.es: "O queen seeking the welfare of your Valiant husband I came here at the behest of Sugriva all alone.
data.anv: देवि O queen, वीर्यवतः of valourous, तव your, भर्तुः husband's, तस्य his, हिते seeking welfare, रतः engaged, अहम् I, सुग्रीववचनात् at the behest of Sugriva, इह here, एकः alone, प्राप्तः reached.

data.v: मयेयमसहायेन चरता कामरूपिणा । दक्षिणा दिगनुक्रान्ता त्वन्मार्गविचयैषिणा ।।
data.es: "I can assume any form at my will. I searched for you without any help moving in the southern direction and reached this place .
data.anv: त्वन्मार्गविचयैषिणा while searching for your location, कामरूपिणा by a person who can take any form at will, असहायेन without any help, चरता while moving, मया by myself, इयम् this, दक्षिणा दिक् southern direction, अनुक्रान्ता reached.
data.md: By Sugrīva's decree, I alone have reached here. And I, ranging alone and wearing shapes at will, have come to this southern quarter, to find out your where abouts.

data.v: दिष्ट्याहं हरिसैन्यानां त्वन्नाशमनुशोचताम् । अपनेष्यामि संतापं तवाभिगमशंसनात् ।।
data.es: "Fortunately for me I can finally dispel the fear of the vanara chiefs who are regretting your loss, by letting them know that you have been found.
data.anv: दिष्ट्या fortunately for me, अहम् I, त्वन्नाशम् your loss, अनुशोचताम् regretting, हरिसैन्यानाम् of the vanara army, सन्तापम् grief, तव your, अभिगमशंसनात् by letting them know, अपनेष्यामि I will dispel their sorrow.
data.md: By my good luck I shall be able, with your news, to remove the grief of those monkey hosts who are lamenting for you.

data.v: दिष्ट्या हि न मम व्यर्थं देवि सागरलङ्घनम् । प्राप्स्याम्यहमिदं दिष्ट्या त्वद्दर्शनकृतं यशः ।।
data.es: "Oh queen luckily for me, crossing the ocean has not gone in vain. I am fortunate because I will attain fame of finding you.
data.anv: देवि oh queen, दिष्ट्या luckily, मम my, सागरलङ्घनम् crossing the ocean, न व्यर्थम् is not wasted, दिष्ट्या fortunately, अहम् I, त्वद्दर्शनकृतम् by the act of seeing you, इदम् thus, यशः fame, प्राप्स्यामि I will attain.
data.md: By my good fortune, my crossing over the main, has not become fruitless. I shall be praised there, O worshipful dame, for I have been able to see you.

data.v: राघवश्च महावीर्यः क्षिप्रं त्वामभिपत्स्यते । समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: "Oh daughter of Janaka after killing Ravana, along with his friends and relatives Rama, the tiger among men, will meet you.
data.anv: जनकात्मजे Oh daughter of Janaka, मनुजशार्दूलः a tiger among men, सः राघवः that Rama, समित्रबान्धवम् along with his friends and relatives, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, त्वाम् you, क्षिप्रम् soon, प्राप्स्यति will attain.
data.md: O daughter of the king Janaka bringing about the destruction of Rāvaņa, with all his kith and kin, Rāghava, the foremost of men, shall soon regain you.

data.v: कौरजो नाम वैदेहि गिरीणामुत्तमो गिरिः । ततो गच्छति गोकर्णं पर्वतं केसरी हरिः ।।
data.es: "Oh Vaidehi there is a famous mountain called Malyavan. From there a monkey called Kesari went to mount Gokarna.
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, गिरीणाम् among the mountains, उत्तमः the best one, माल्यवान्नाम Malyavan, गिरिः mountain, ततः from there, केसरी Kesari, हरिः monkey, गोकर्णम् Gokarna, पर्वतम् mountain, गच्छति went.

data.v: स च देवर्षिभिर्दृष्टः पिता मम महाकपिः । तीर्थे नदीपतेः पुण्ये शम्बसादनमुद्धरत् ।।
data.es: "He (Kesari) is said to be my father by the divine sages. He retrieved a piece of land in a holy spot of that sea shore and killed Sambasadana, a demon who was oppressing righteous people.
data.anv: देवर्षिभिः by the divine sages, दिष्टः predicted, मम my, पिता father, सः महाकपिः that great monkey, नदीपतेः of lord of rivers, ocean, पुण्ये holy, तीर्थे in a place, शम्बसादनम् Sambasadanam, उद्धरत् raised.

data.v: तस्याहं हरिणः क्षेत्रे जातो वातेन मैथिलि । हनूमानिति विख्यातो लोके स्वेनैव कर्मणा । विश्वासार्थं तु वैदेहि भर्तुरुक्ता मया गुणाः ।।
data.es: "O Mythili I was born in that land retrieved by the Windgod. I am known as Hanuman by virtue of my own action.
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, अहम् I, तस्य his, हरिणः monkey's, क्षेत्रे in the land, वातेन by the Windgod, जातः born, स्वेन कर्मणा एव by my own act, लोके by people, हनुमानिति Hanuman, विख्यातः came to be known.

data.v: एवं विश्वासिता सीता हेतुभिः शोककर्शिता । उपपन्नैरभिज्ञानैर्दूतं तमवगच्छति ।।
data.es: The griefstricken Sita trusted him by his logical presentation of reasons as well as identifications. She believed that he was a messenger (of Rama).
data.anv: शोककर्शिता tormented by grief, सीता Sita, एवम् in that way, हेतुभिः with possible reasons, विश्वासिता having trusted, उपपन्नैः by the evidences, अभिज्ञानैः with identification, तम् him, दूतम् as a messenger, अवगच्छति she understood.

data.v: अतुलं च गता हर्षं प्रहर्षेण तु जानकी । नेत्राभ्यां वक्रपक्ष्माभ्यां मुमोचानन्दजं जलम् ।।
data.es: Janaki experienced immeasurable happiness and shed tears of joy through her curved eyes.
data.anv: जानकी Janaki, अतुलम् immeasurable, हर्षम् happiness, गता च experienced, प्रहर्षेण in her joy, वक्रपक्ष्माभ्याम् through her curved eyelashes, नेत्राभ्याम् from both eyes, आनन्दजम् arising out of joy, जलम् tears, मुमोच shed.
data.md: Jānakī attained an excess of delight and shed tears of joy from her eyes having curling eyelashes.

data.v: चारु तच्चाननं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् । अशोभत विशालाक्ष्या राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट् । हनूमन्तं कपिं व्यक्तं मन्यते नान्यथेति सा ।।
data.es: Her face with large eyes with a tinge of red corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.
data.anv: विशालाक्ष्याः of largeeyed lady, तस्याः her, चारु lovely, ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् having wide white eyes with tinge of red corners, तत् that, वदनम् face, राहुमुक्तः released from Rahu, उडुराडिव like the Moon, अशोभत shone.
data.md: The beautiful countenance of that large-eyed dame, having spacious eyes, appeared like the Moon released from the hold of Rāhu.

data.v: अथोवाच हनूमांस्तामुत्तरं प्रियदर्शनाम् ।।
data.es: She realised that the monkey was none other than Hanuman. Then he looked at her who was pleasing to see and spoke again:
data.anv: सा she, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, व्यक्तम् clearly, कपिम् the monkey, मन्यते realised, अन्यथा इति none other than, अथ then, हनूमान् Hanuman, प्रियदर्शनाम् a lady pleasing to see, ताम् her, उत्तराम् later, उवाच spoke.
data.md: She then took him for a real monkey and none else. Thereupon Hanumān again spoke to her, having a comely presence,

data.v: हतेऽसुरे संयति शम्बसादने; कपिप्रवीरेण महर्षिचोदनात् । ततोऽस्मि वायुप्रभवो हि मैथिलि; प्रभावतस्तत्प्रतिमश्च वानरः ।।
data.es: "(My father) a mighty monkey killed Sambasadana in a battle on the command of a great seer. I am a vanara (born to a monkey) by the impact of the Windgod. I am equal to the Windgod in power."इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चत्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मैथिलि Maithili, संयति in a fight, शम्बसादने Sambasadana, असुरे when the demon, कपिप्रवरेण mighty monkey, महर्षिचोदनात् by the command of great sage, हते सति where he was slain, अथ then, वायुप्रभवः by the spread of wind, प्रभावतः by his prowess, तत्प्रतिमः equal to him, वानरः vanara, अस्मि I am.
data.md: When the Asura Śambasādana was destroyed in conflict by that best of monkeys at the desire of the celestial ascetics, I was born of the Wind, O Maithili. I look like a monkey but am his equa's in prowess.

data.v: भूय एव महातेजा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । अब्रवीत्प्रश्रितं वाक्यं सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् ।।
data.es: Mighty Hanuman, the son of the Windgod again spoke to Sita humbly to inspire confidence in her.
data.anv: महातेजाः mighty, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् in order to inspire trust in Sita, भूय एव again this way, प्रश्रितम् humbly, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: The highly effulgent son of the Wind-god, Hanumān, to create Sītā's confidence, again addressed her with the following words.

data.v: वानरोऽहं महाभागे दूतो रामस्य धीमतः । रामनामाङ्कितं चेदं पश्य देव्यङ्गुलीयकम् । समाश्वसिहि भद्रं ते क्षीणदुःखफला ह्यसि ।।
data.es: "O noble lady I am a vanara, an envoy of learned Rama. You see this ring with Rama's name inscribed on it, O godlike lady
data.anv: महाभागे O noble lady, अहम् I am, धीमतः learned, रामस्य Rama's, दूतः envoy, वानरः vanara, देवि O godlike lady, रामनामाङ्कितम् which has the name of Rama inscribed, इदम् this, अङ्गुलीयकं च ring also, पश्य you see.
data.md: O great dame, I am a monkey, the messenger of the highly intelligent Rāma. Behold this precious ring with Rāma's name engraven on it, given by your high-souled lord and brought as a token to create your confidence. Do you take heart and may good betide you, there will be an end of your grief soon.

data.v: गृहीत्वा प्रेक्षमाणा सा भर्तुः करविभूषणम् । भर्तारमिव संप्राप्ता जानकी मुदिताभवत् ।।
data.es: She received the ornament that adorned her husband's hand and gazed at it and felt delighted as though her husband had arrived.
data.anv: भर्तुः husband, करविभूषणम् ornament that adorned his hand, गृहीत्वा having received, प्रेक्षमाणा gazing, सा जानकी Janaki, भर्तारम् husband, सम्प्राप्ता इव as if reached, मुदिता delighted, अभवत् became.
data.md: Taking the ring that used to deck her lord's finger and looking at it, Jānaki seemed to have actually got her lord.

data.v: चारु तद्वदनं तस्यास्ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् । बभूव प्रहर्षोदग्रं राहुमुक्त इवोडुराट् ।।
data.es: Her face with large eyes with a tinge of red corners shone like the Moon released from Rahu.
data.anv: विशालाक्ष्याः of largeeyed lady, तस्याः her, चारु lovely, ताम्रशुक्लायतेक्षणम् having wide white eyes with tinge of red corners, तत् that, वदनम् face, राहुमुक्तः released from Rahu, उडुराडिव like the Moon, अशोभत shone.
data.md: The beautiful countenance of that large-eyed dame, having spacious eyes, appeared like the Moon released from the hold of Rāhu.

data.v: ततः सा ह्रीमती बाला भर्तुः संदेशहर्षिता । परितुट्षा प्रियं श्रुत्वा प्राशंसत महाकपिम् ।।
data.es: Young Sita felt delighted about her husband's news and blushed. By praising him for his action, she pleased the great monkey.
data.anv: ततः then, बाला young lady, सा that Sita, भर्तृसन्देशहर्षिता delighted at the news of her husband, ह्रीमती blushing lady, परितुष्टा felt happy, प्रियम् pleasing, कृत्वा action, महाकपिम् by the great monkey, प्रशशंस praised.
data.md: And greatly delighted at her husband's news that modest damsel, affectionately welcoming Hanumăn, applauded that great monkey.

data.v: विक्रान्तस्त्वं समर्थस्त्वं प्राज्ञस्त्वं वानरोत्तम । येनेदं राक्षसपदं त्वयैकेन प्रधर्षितम् ।।
data.es: "O foremost among the vanaras you have trespassed the abodes of demons all alone. You are mighty and capable and wise.
