data.anv: वानरोत्तम O foremost among the vanaras, एकेन single handed, येन by which, त्वया by you, इदम् this, राक्षसपदम् demon's abode, प्रधर्षितम् assailed, त्वम् you, विक्रान्तः you are very brave, त्वम् you, समर्थः are able, त्वम् you, प्राज्ञः are wise.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, you are brave, powerful and wise, since you had alone smitten this abode of the Rākşasas.

data.v: शतयोजनविस्तीर्णः सागरो मकरालयः । विक्रमश्लाघनीयेन क्रमता गोष्पदीकृतः ।।
data.es: "You with your admirable prowess have reduced this ocean which is an abode of crocodiles stretching over a hundred yojanas to a cow's hoof mark.
data.anv: विक्रमश्लाघनीयेन by your admirable prowess, क्रमता advancing, शतयोजनविस्तीर्णः extended over a hundred yojanas, मकरालयः abode of crocodiles, सागरः ocean, गोष्पदीकृतः is reduced to calf's hoof mark.
data.md: You had, with they laudable prowess, leaped, a hundred leagues, across the ocean, the abode of marine mousters, taking it for Gospada. (A measure as much as a cow's foot-step will hold.)

data.v: न हि त्वां प्राकृतं मन्ये वनरं वनरर्षभ । यस्य ते नास्ति संत्रासो रावणान्नापि संभ्रमः ।।
data.es: "I do not think you are an ordinary monkey. You have no fear or excitement about Ravana. You are a bull among vanaras.
data.anv: वानरर्षभ O bull among vanaras, यस्य of whom, ते to you, रावणात् from Ravana, सन्त्रासः fear, नास्ति not there, सम्भ्रमः अपि even excitement, न not, त्वाम् for you, प्राकृतम् ordinary, वानरम् monkey, न मन्ये I do not think.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, I do not consider you as an ordinary monkey, since you do not care or fear Ravana.

data.v: अर्हसे च कपिश्रेष्ठ मया समभिभाषितुम् । यद्यसि प्रेषितस्तेन रामेण विदितात्मना ।।
data.es: "O best of monkeys As you have been sent by Rama, the knower of the self, it is proper for me to converse with you.
data.anv: कपिश्रेष्ठ O best among monkeys, विदितात्मना by a knower of self, तेन by him, रामेण by Rama, प्रेषितः sent, असि यदि you are, मया by me, समभिभाषितुम् to converse, अर्हसे you deserve.
data.md: O best of monkeys, you are worthy of my welcome, since you had been despatched by Rāma, knowing self, Rāma, hard of being got at, has not sent you, specially to me, without a trial of your prowess.

data.v: प्रेषयिष्यति दुर्धर्षो रामो न ह्यपरीक्षितम् । पराक्रममविज्ञाय मत्सकाशं विशेषतः ।।
data.es: "The formidable Rama will not send any one specially to me without testing him or knowing his valour.
data.anv: दुर्धर्षः formidable, रामः Rama, पराक्रमम् valour, अविज्ञाय without knowing, अपरीक्षितम् without testing, न प्रेषयिष्यति हि would not send any body, विशेषतः specially, मत्सकाशम् to me.
data.md: O best of monkeys, you are worthy of my welcome, since you had been despatched by Rāma, knowing self, Rāma, hard of being got at, has not sent you, specially to me, without a trial of your prowess.

data.v: दिष्ट्या च कुशली रामो धर्मात्मा धर्मवत्सलः । लक्ष्मणश्च महातेजाः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः ।।
data.es: "To my luck, righteous Rama who abides in truth and glorious Lakshmana who enhances the joy of Sumitra are keepng well.
data.anv: दिष्ट्या luckily, धर्मात्मा righteous, सत्यसङ्गरः one who follows truth, रामः Rama, महातेजाः glorious, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of Sumitra's joy, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, कुशली well.
data.md: By my good luck, is it all well with the virtuous-souled and truthful Rāma and the highly powerful Lakşmaņa the enhancer of Sumitra's joy?

data.v: कुशली यदि काकुत्स्थः किं नु सागरमेखलाम् । महीं दहति कोपेन युगान्ताग्निरिवोत्थितः ।।
data.es: "Indeed if Kakutstha is well wherefore does he not burn the oceangirdled earth in his rage as (the earth is burnt) at the time of dissolution of the era?
data.anv: काकुत्स्थः Kakutsthas, कुशली यदि if he is keeping well, उत्थितः generated, युगान्ताग्निरिव at the time of dissolution of the era, सागरमेखलाम् oceangirdled, महीम् earth, कोपेन with his rage, किम् why, न दहति not burning?
data.md: And if Kākutstha lives untouched by ill, then why does he not burn the earth, encircled by the ocean with his ire like to the fire of dissolution?

data.v: अथ वा शक्तिमन्तौ तौ सुराणामपि निग्रहे । ममैव तु न दुःखानामस्ति मन्ये विपर्ययः ।।
data.es: "Both of them are capable of subduing even the gods. I think the reversal of my fate is reason for their inaction.
data.anv: अथवा or else, तौ both, सुराणामपि even gods, निग्रहे in subduing, शक्तिमन्तौ both are capable, तु but, मम my, दुःखानामेव for my sorrow, विपर्ययः disaster, नास्ति not there, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Or they are capable of discomfiting the celestials in a battle but me-thinks by my illluck, the end of my miseries has not arrived as yet.

data.v: कच्चिच्च व्यथते रामः कच्चिन्न परिपत्यते । उत्तराणि च कार्याणि कुरुते पुरुषोत्तमः ।।
data.es: "Is Rama the greatest among men not depressed? Does he not feel helpless? He is (perhaps) taking necessary steps (for my recovery).
data.anv: रामः Rama, न व्यथितः कच्चित् whether not depressed, न परितप्यते कच्चित् indeed not suffering, पुरुषोत्तमः great among men, उत्तराणि necessary steps, कार्याणि action, कुरुते will be carrying out perhaps?
data.md: Is Rāma greatly pained? Does he grieve? Is that foremost of men making preparations of my rescue?

data.v: कच्चिन्न दीनः संभ्रान्तः कार्येषु च न मुह्यति । कच्चिन्पुरुषकार्याणि कुरुते नृपतेः सुतः ।।
data.es: "I suppose prince Rama is not too depressed or perplexed to attend to his work. He will (perhaps) be doing the duties expected of a manly person.
data.anv: नृपतेः सुतः king's son, दीनः depressed, सम्भ्रान्तः perplexed, न कच्चित् not indeed, कार्येषु at work, न च मुह्यति is not spoiling, पुरुषकार्याणि the actions of men of achievement, कच्चित् कुरुते surely he is doing I trust
data.md: Has he forgotten his work being overwhelmed with fear and poorliness of heart? Is that son of the king performing still his manly duties?

data.v: द्विविधं त्रिविधोपायमुपायमपि सेवते । विजिगीषुः सुहृत्कच्चिन्मित्रेषु च परंतपः ।।
data.es: "Tell me if Rama, scorcher of enemies, desirous of victory is following a twofold policy (confrontation and conciliation) A tough enemy cannot be defeated by following this method. A threefold strategy has to be adopted in this case (confrontation, conciliation and creation of dissension among his foes) to be victorious. I hope he is welldisposed to his friends and has a good team
data.anv: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, द्विविधम् two kinds, उपायम् strategies, त्रिविधोपायमपि even three kinds of trategies, सेवते following, विजगीषुः he who desires to be victorious, मित्रेषु with friends, सुहृत् कच्चित् has a good team indeed
data.md: Is that slayer of foes, desirous of acquiring victory, pleasing his friends still with forgiveness and gifts and dealing his enemies with punishment, sowing dassensions among them, and with other expedients?

data.md: Is that son of the king invoking the blessings of the celestials? Has he attained manliness and assistance from the celestials?

data.es: "I hope Rama is not devoid of love towards me by my separation. O Vanara, hope he will liberate me from this misery.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, प्रवासात् due to separation, मयि in me विगतस्नेहः devoid of love, न कच्चित् suppose not, वानर vanara, माम् me, अस्मात् from this, व्यसनात् worry, मोक्षयिष्यति कच्चित् will liberate me from this
data.md: Has Rāghava lost all his affection for me for my living at a distance from him? Will he save me from this disaster?

data.es: "I hope Rama who deserves happiness and not suffering has not become depressed now , having experienced a spate of sorrows.

data.md: Has not Rāma, ever used to happiness and unused to misery, been enfeebled by this disaster?

data.md: Is he informed always of the welfare of Kauslyā, Sumitrā and Bharata?

data.es: "I hope respectable Rama is not too absentminded for being immersed in sorrow on my account. Hope he will save me.

data.md: Is not Rāghava, worthy of honours, beside himself with grief in my absence? Will not Rāma rescue me?

data.md: Will not Bharata, ever devoted to his brother, send out one Akşauhiņī of terrible soldiers under the command of his ministers for my rescue?

data.v: वानराधिपतिः श्रीमान्सुग्रीवः कच्चिदेष्यति । मत्कृते हरिभिर्वीरैर्वृतो दन्तनखायुधैः ।।
data.es: "I trust that the illustrious Sugriva surrounded by valiant vanaras who use their teeth and nails as weapons will reach this place.
data.anv: मत्कृते for my sake, श्रीमान् illustrious, वानराधिपतिः king of vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, दन्तनखायुधै: those who use their teeth and nails as weapons, वीरैः with valiant ones, हरिभिः with vanaras, वृतः surrounded, एष्वति कच्चित् trust he will reach.
data.md: Will not the graceful Sugrīva, the lord of the monkeys come to help ine with hosts of monkeys having huge teeth and nails?

data.v: कच्चिच्च लक्ष्मणः शूरः सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः । अस्त्रविच्छरजालेन राक्षसान्विधमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Hope heroic Lakshmana, enhancer of the joy of Sumitra, who has mastered the use of weapons will blow away the demons through a network of arrows.
data.anv: शूरः hero, सुमित्रानन्दवर्धनः who enhances Sumitra's delight, अस्त्रवित् a master of weapons, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, शरजालेन by network of arrows, राक्षसान् demons, कच्चित् विधमिष्यति trust he will blow away.
data.md: Will not the heroic Lakşmaņa, the enhancer of Sumitrā's joy, conversant with the use of weapons, burn down the Rākşasas with this shafts?

data.es: "Can I hope to see Ravana and his relatives slain in the battle by fiery weapons in a short time?
data.anv: ज्वलता burning, रौद्रेण with anger, अस्त्रेण by weapon, रणे in the battle, ससुहृज्जनम् along with his relatives, निहतम् slain, रावणम् Ravana, अल्पेन कालेन  in a short time, द्रक्ष्यामि कच्चित् hope to see.
data.md: Shall I not behold soon that Rāvana with his kinsmen has been destroyed in battle by Rāma with terrible weapons?

data.v: कच्चिन्न तद्धेमसमानवर्णं; तस्याननं पद्मसमानगन्धि । मया विना शुष्यति शोकदीनं; जलक्षये पद्ममिवातपेन ।।
data.es: "Hope, Rama's moonlike face without me with its golden complexion and lotus fragrance must not have been pale and withered with tears like the lotus in a pond scorched by the heat.
data.anv: तस्य his, हेमसमानवर्णम् complexion like gold, पद्मसमानगन्धि fragrance  like  lotus, तत् that, आननम् face, मया विना without me, शोकदीनम् pale with grief, जलक्षये when water dries up, आतपेन due to heat, पद्ममिव like a lotus, न शुष्यति कच्चित् not scorched
data.md: Is not the gold-hued and lotus-smelling countenance (of Rāma) dried up my absence like to lotus dried up by the rays of the sun in shallow water?

data.v: धर्मापदेशात्त्यजतश्च राज्यां; मां चाप्यरण्यं नयतः पदातिम् । नासीद्व्यथा यस्य न भीर्न शोकः; कच्चित्स धैर्यं हृदये करोति ।।
data.es: "Rama has given up sovereignty for the sake of establishing righteousness and led me into the forest on foot.He had not then felt any fear, anxiety or grief at heart.Rama showed patience, instead. Hope he retains them.
data.anv: धर्मापदेशात् for the cause of establishing righteousness, राज्यम् sovereignty, त्यजतः given up, मां चापि including me, पदातिम् on foot, अरण्यम् to the forest, नयतः conducted, यस्य whose, व्यथा agony, नासीत् not shown, भीः fear, न not, शोकः grief, न not, सः he, हृदये at heart, धैर्यम् courage, करोति कच्चित् will sustain I hope.
data.md: Does he still hold patience in his heart, who, renouncing his kingdom for virtue and repairing, on foot with me even to the forest, was not stricken with fear and grief?

data.v: न चास्य माता न पिता न चान्यः; स्नेहाद्विशिष्टोऽस्ति मया समो वा । तावद्ध्यहं दूतजिजीविषेयं; यावत्प्रवृत्तिं शृणुयां प्रियस्य ।।
data.es: "His love for me is superior to his love for his father, mother or any one else. O messenger, I wish to survive till I hear any news from my dear lord."

data.md: His love for his mother, father or any other person is not greater than or equal to his love for me. O messenger, I shall keep my life so long I do not hear anything about my dear one.

data.v: इतीव देवी वचनं महार्थं; तं वानरेन्द्रं मधुरार्थमुक्त्वा । श्रोतुं पुनस्तस्य वचोऽभिरामं; रामार्थयुक्तं विरराम रामा ।।
data.es: The godlike lady, having spoken to the vanara leader in a very meaningful and sweet manner about her beloved Rama, she remained silent, waiting to hear Hanuman's attractive words of description of Rama once again.
data.anv: देवी queen, तं वानरेन्द्रम् that vanara leader, महार्थम् very meaningful, मधुरार्थम् sweet, वचनम् word, उक्त्वा having spoken, तस्य his, अभिरामम्  loving Rama, रामार्थयुक्तम् said for Rama's cause, वचः word, पुनः again, श्रोतुम् to hear, विरराम stopped.
data.md: Having addressed that lord of monkeys with these highly sound and sweet accents, that graceful and worshipful dame ceased, with a view to hear again from him pleasant tales regarding Rāma.

data.es: Having heard Sita, Hanuman endowed with fearsome power placed his folded hands on his head and said this:

data.md: Hearing the words of Sītā the terribly powerful Măruti, placing his joined palms on his head said,

data.v: न त्वामिहस्थां जानीते रामः कमललोचनः । श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः ।।
data.es: "O lotuseyed one Rama knows not that you are here. Therefore he has not taken you away immediately as did Indra to rescue his wife Sachi.
data.anv: कमललोचने lotuseyed, त्वाम् you, इहस्थाम् being here, रामः Rama, न जानीते he does not know, तेन therefore, पुरन्दरः Indra, शचीमिव like Sachi, त्वाम् you, आशु immediately, नानयति he is not taking away.

data.v: चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृष्कगणसंकुलाम् । विष्टम्भयित्वा बाणौघैरक्षोभ्यं वरुणालयम् । करिष्यति पुरीं लङ्कां काकुत्स्थः शान्तराक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: "Kakutstha Rama will still the imperturbable abode of Varuna (ocean) by the torrent of his arrows and rid the city of Lanka of all the demons.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, अक्षोभ्यम् imperturbable, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, बाणौघैः by torrent of arrows, विष्टम्भयित्वा make still, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, शान्तराक्षसाम् all the demons, करिष्यति will make.
data.md: Impeding the course of the unagitated deep and building by means of his terrible shafts, a bridge across it, Kākutstha, shall divest the city Lankā of all the Rākşasas.

data.v: तत्र यद्यन्तरा मृत्युर्यदि देवाः सहासुराः । स्थास्यन्ति पथि रामस्य स तानपि वधिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Thereafter, whoever comes Rama's way, be it gods or demons or even death or any one else he will destroy them.
data.anv: तत्र there, रामस्य Rama's, पथि on his way, अन्तरा in between, मृत्युः death, सहासुराः including all demons, देवाः gods, स्थास्यन्ति यदि if they obstruct, सः he, तानपि even them, वधिष्यति will slay.
data.md: And forsooth shall Rāma destroy them, even if the celestials, or Death himself stand in his way.

data.v: तवादर्शनजेनार्ये शोकेन स परिप्लुतः । न शर्म लभते रामः सिंहार्दित इव द्विपः ।।
data.es: "O noble lady not being able to see you, Rama is immersed in an ocean of sorrow, he has no solace like an elephant tormented by a lion.
data.anv: आर्ये O noble lady, सः रामः that Rama, तव your, अदर्शनजेन on account of not seeing you, शोकेन in sorrow, परिप्लुतः immersed, सिंहार्दितः tormented by a lion, द्विपः इव like an elephant, शर्म न लभते is not happy.
data.md: O worshipful dame, stricken with grief in your absence, Rāma is restless like to an elephant smitten by a lion.

data.v: दर्दरेण च ते देवि शपे मूलफलेन च । मलयेन च विन्ध्येन मेरुणा मन्दरेण च ।।
यथा सुनयनं वल्गु बिम्बौष्ठं चारुकुण्डलम् । मुखं द्रक्ष्यसि रामस्य पूर्णचन्द्रमिवोदितम् ।।
data.es: "O Sita I swear in the name of mountains like Malaya, Vindhya, Meru, and Dardura (the abodes of monkeys and bears) and by the roots and fruits as well (which are the food of vanaras). you will soon behold Rama with beautiful eyes, red lips like bimba fruit, lovely earrings and a countenance resembling the full moon.
data.anv: देवि O Sita, मलयेन च by Malaya mountain, विन्ध्येन by Vindhya, मेरुणा by Meru, दर्दुरेण by Dardura, मूलफलेन by roots and fruits, ते to you, शपे I swear, यथा as, सुनयनम्  with beautiful eyes, वल्गु बिम्बोष्ठम् lips like bimba fruit, चारु कुण्डलम् with lovely earrings, उदितम् risen, पूर्णचन्द्रमिव like the fullmoon, रामस्य Rama's, मुखम् face, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: I can swear, O worshipful dame, by the mounts Mandara, Malaya, Vindhya, Sumeru, Dardura and all the fruits and roots, that you shall behold like to the rising of the full moon, the countenance of Rāma having beautiful eyes, graceful, Bimba-like lips and beautified with beautiful kundalas.

data.v: क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि वैदेहि रामं प्रस्रवणे गिरौ । शतक्रतुमिवासीनं नाकपृष्ठस्य मूर्धनि ।।
data.es: "O Vaidehi, you will soon see Rama seated on the Prasravana mountain just as Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) seated on the back of the king of elephants.
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, प्रस्रवणे गिरौ on mount Prasravana, रामम् Rama, नागराजस्य elephant's, मूर्धनि on the back, आसीनम् seated, शतक्रतुम् इव like Indra who has performed a hundred sacrifices, क्षिप्रम् soon, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: You shall soon behold, O Vaidehī, Rāma, on the mount Prasravana, like to the performer of hundred sacrifices seated on the back of the elephant (Airăvata).

data.v: न मांसं राघवो भुङ्क्ते न चापि मधुसेवते । वन्यं सुविहितं नित्यं भक्तमश्नाति पञ्चमम् ।।
data.es: "Rama is not eating meat, nor drinking wine. He takes only the one fifth of a meal (sanctioned for an ascetic) available in the forest.
data.anv: राघवः Rama, मांसम् meat, न भुङक्ते not eating, मधुचापि even wine, न सेवते he is not taking, नित्यम् always, पञ्चमम् fifth meal, सुविहितम् prescribed for, वन्यम् available in the forest, भुक्तम् food, अश्नाति eats.
data.md: Rāghava dose not take meat nor drink honeyế he takes every day in the evening boiled rice and such wild fruits as are sanctioned by the Sastras.

data.v: नैव दंशान्न मशकान्न कीटान्न सरीसृपान् । राघवोऽपनयेद्गत्रात्त्वद्गतेनान्तरात्मना ।।
data.es: "Since you left, Rama has been always thinking sincerely of you, no longer drives away flies or mosquitoes nor insects or serpents from his body (his mind entirely fixed on you).
data.anv: राघवः Rama, त्वद्गतेन thinking of you, अन्तरात्मना with heart, गात्रात् from his limbs, दंशान् flies, नैव अपनयेत् will not drive away, मशकान् mosquitoes, न not, कीटान् insects, न not, सरीसृपान् serpents, न not.
data.md: His heart is so much attached to you, that he does not drive away even flies, insects and snakes from his body.

data.v: नित्यं ध्यानपरो रामो नित्यं शोकपरायणः । नान्यच्चिन्तयते किंचित्स तु कामवशं गतः ।।
data.es: "Rama is always lost in thought. He is totally given to grief. Absorbed in love for you, he thinks of none else৷৷
data.anv: रामः Rama, नित्यम् ever, ध्यानपरः reflecting on you, नित्यम् ever, शोकपरायणः totally given to grief, सः he, कामवशं गतः absorbed in love for you, अन्यत् no other thoughts, न चिन्तयते he is not thinking.
data.md: Rāma is always engaged in meditations, overwhelmed with grief, and he has no other thought but seeing you.

data.v: अनिद्रः सततं रामः सुप्तोऽपि च नरोत्तमः । सीतेति मधुरां वाणीं व्याहरन्प्रतिबुध्यते ।।
data.es: "Rama, the best of men never goes to sleep and even if he drops off to sleep he mutters 'Sita, Sita' in a sweet voice in his sleep.
data.anv: रामः Rama, सततम् always, अनिद्रः he does not sleep, नरोत्तमः best of men, सुप्तोऽपि even if he sleeps, सीतेति calling out 'Sita', मधुराम् sweet, वाणीम् voice, व्याहरन् uttering, प्रतिबुध्यते he wakes up.
data.md: Rāma has no sleep and even when asleep that best of men awakes exclaiming in sweep accents, 'O Sītā!'

data.v: दृष्ट्वा फलं वा पुष्पं वा यच्चान्यत्स्त्रीमनोहरम् । बहुशो हा प्रियेत्येवं श्वसंस्त्वामभिभाषते ।।
data.es: "Sighing deeply whenever Rama sees a fruit or a flower or any such delightful thing, he remembers you and calls you out again and again, saying, 'alas, my darling '
data.anv: फलं वा fruit or, पुष्पं वा or flowers, यद्वा such similar, सुमनोहरम् delightful, अन्यत् any other thing, दृष्ट्वा seeing, श्वसन् while, हा प्रियेत्येवम् alas, darling, त्वाम् you, बहुशः in many, अभिभाषते speaks.
data.md: He always welcomes you sighing and saying “O my dear love!", whenever he beholds any fruit, flower or any object liked by the ladies.

data.v: स देवि नित्यं परितप्यमान;स्त्वामेव सीतेत्यभिभाषमाणः । धृतव्रतो राजसुतो महात्मा; तवैव लाभाय कृतप्रयत्नः ।।
data.es: "O divine lady prince Rama is ceaselessly suffering. He keeps talking to you in air. The determined Rama is only thinking of your recovery ".
data.anv: देवि godlike lady, महात्मा great self, सः Rama, राजसुतः son of a king, नित्यम् always, परितप्यमानः suffering, सीतेति saying Sita, त्वामेव you only, अभिभाषमाणः keeps talking in the air, धृतव्रतः firm in his decision, तव your, लाभाय to secure you only, कृतप्रयत्नः makes efforts.
data.md: O worshipful dame, he is always lamenting, exclaiming "O Sītā!, and that high-souled son of the king, to regain you, has resorted to ascetic observances."

data.v: सा रामसंकीर्तनवीतशोका; रामस्य शोकेन समानशोका । शरन्मुखेनाम्बुदशेषचन्द्रा; निशेव वैदेहसुता बभूव ।।
data.es: Her sorrow was mitigated by references made by Hanuman about Rama.She felt equally sad when she heard about Rama's agony. The princess from Videha appeared like a night at the advent of autumn, with the Moon looking partly muffled by clouds and partly bright.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्त्रिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the thirtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: रामस्य Rama's, शोकेन because of  his sorrow, समानशोका equally sad, रामसङ्कीर्तनवीतशोका devoid of sorrow on hearing about Rama, सा she, वैदेहसुता the daughter of Videha, शरन्मुखे at the advent of autumn, साम्बुदशेषचन्द्रा Moon muffled by clouds, निशेव like the night, बभूव appeared.
data.md: On hearing about Rāma, Sītā was greatly delighted and she was equally grieved on hearing of his sorrow. And it appeared like the rising of the moon and the appearance of the clouds at the same time in an autumnal night.

data.v: सीता तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा पूर्णचन्द्रनिभानना । हनूमन्तमुवाचेदं धर्मार्थसहितं वचः ।।
data.es: To the righteous words (about Rama's grief) of Hanuman, Sita with a face like the full moon replied :
data.anv: पूर्णचन्द्रनिभानना face like the full moon, सीता Sita, तद्वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा having heard, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, इदम् this, धर्मार्थसहितम् full of righteousness, वचः word, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words, Sītā having a moon-like countenance, again spoke to Hanuman, words, sound and pious:

data.v: अमृतं विषसंसृष्टं त्वया वानरभाषितम् । यच्च नान्यमना रामो यच्च शोकपरायणः ।।
data.es: "O vanara you have told me that Rama has his mind always fixed on me, not on others and you have also said that he is sad. It is like offering me poison mixed with nectar.
data.anv: वानर O vanara, रामः Rama, अन्यमनाः न not thinking of others,  इति यत् that way, इति च यत् and this way also (that he is sad), त्वया by you, भाषितम् spoken, विषसंसृष्टम् mixed with poison, अमृतम् nectar.
data.md: O monkey, what you had said that Rāma is not attached to any other thing and is worn with grief, is like nectar mixed with poison.

data.v: ऐश्वर्ये वा सुविस्तीर्णे व्यसने वा सुदारुणे । रज्ज्वेव पुरुषं बद्ध्वा कृतान्तः परिकर्षति ।।
data.es: "Death snatches a man tied with a cord, whether he is rolling in luxury or sinking in adversity.
data.anv: कृतान्तः death, पुरुषम् a man, रज्ज्वा with a cord, बद्ध्वा इव like tying, सुविस्त्रीर्णे in the great, ऐश्वर्ये वा in fortune, सुदारुणे deeply sunk, व्यसने वा  in adversity, परिकर्षति will snatch.
data.md: Whether in the enjoyment of vast riches, or emerged in the abyss of miseries, Death is pulling a man, binding him roughly with a chord.

data.v: विधिर्नूनमसंहार्यः प्राणिनां प्लवगोत्तम । सौमित्रिं मां च रामं च व्यसनैः पश्य मोहितान् ।।
data.es: "O best of vanaras surely it is not possible for living beings to overcome destiny. You see how Sri Rama, Saumitri, and my own self are all afflicted with grief.
data.anv: प्लवगोत्तम O best of vanaras, प्राणिनाम् for living beings, नूनम् surely, विधिः destiny, असंहार्यः it cannot be overcome, व्यसनैः with sorrows, मोहितान् afflicted, सौमित्रिम् Saumitri, मां च me too, रामं च Rama also, पश्य you see.
data.md: O best of monkey, people cannot thwart the course of de tiny. Behold me, Rāma and Saumitri, therefore sunk in miseries.

data.v: शोकस्यास्य कदा पारं राघवोऽधिगमिष्यति । प्लवमानः परिश्रान्तो हतनौः सागरे यथा ।।
data.es: "When will Raghava reach the shore of this ocean of grief? He is like a man who has suffered a ship wreck, trying to swim?
data.anv: सागरे in the ocean, हतनौः in shipwreck, प्लवमानः while getting drowned, परिश्रान्तः यथा  who has suffered, राघवः Rama, अस्य of this, शोकस्य from grief, पारम् the shore, कदा when, अधिगमिष्यति will he reach.
data.md: I do not know when shall Rāghava get at the other end of the ocean of grief, by displaying his prowess, like to one, swimming across the ocean when the boat is sunk.

data.v: राक्षसानां क्षयं कृत्वा सूदयित्वा च रावणम् । लङ्कामुन्मूलितां कृत्वा कदा द्रक्ष्यति मां पतिः ।।
data.es: "When will my husband see me after killing the demons including Ravana and uprooting Lanka?
data.anv: पतिः husband, राक्षसानाम् of all the demons, वधम् killing, कृत्वा after doing, रावणं च and Ravana, सूदयित्वा after killing, लङ्काम् Lanka, उन्मूलिताम् uprooting, कृत्वा after doing, माम् कदा when me, द्रक्ष्यति he will see.
data.md: I do not know when shall my lord see me, destroying the Rākşasas, killing Rāvana and devastating the city of Lankā.

data.v: स वाच्यः संत्वरस्वेति यावदेव न पूर्यते । अयं संवत्सरः कालस्तावद्धि मम जीवितम् ।।
data.es: "One year's time has been given (by Ravana) to me. Rama should be informed to be quick in reaching before the completion of the time limit and that I will survive till then only.
data.anv: अयम् this, संवत्सरः कालः one year's time, यावदेव until then, न पूर्यते before it is completed, संत्वरस्वेति you may be quick, सः he, वाच्यः he should be informed, मम I, जीवितम् life, तावद्धि till then only.
data.md: Do you tell him to come before this year expires for till then I shall live.

data.v: वर्तते दशमो मासो द्वौ तु शेषौ प्लवंगम । रावणेन नृशंसेन समयो यः कृतो मम ।।
data.es: "O vanara this is the end of the tenth month. Only two more months are left. This is the condition laid by the wicked Ravana in my case.
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम O vanara, नृशंसेन रावणेन by the wicked Ravana, मम to me, यः such, समयः time, कृतः given, दशमः tenth, मासः month, वर्तते is running, द्वौ तु two only, शेषौ remain.
data.md: This is the tenth month and two months still remain, O monkey and that is the time appointed by the cruel Rāvaņa.

data.v: विभीषणेन च भ्रात्रा मम निर्यातनं प्रति । अनुनीतः प्रयत्नेन न च तत्कुरुते मतिम् ।।
data.es: "Vibhisana made efforts to advise Ravana for my restoration. But Ravana has not agreed to that.
data.anv: भ्रात्रा by the brother, विभीषणेन by Vibhisana, मम my, निर्यातनं प्रति for my restoration, प्रयत्नेन made efforts, अनुनीतः he was advised gently, तत् such, मतिम् thought, न कुरुते he has not agreed.
data.md: He was entreated very much by his brother Vibhīşaņa to restore me but he paid no need to his requests.

data.v: मम प्रतिप्रदानं हि रावणस्य न रोचते । रावणं मार्गते संख्ये मृत्युः कालवशं गतम् ।।
data.es: "Ravana did not like to return me having fallen into the death trap. Death lies in wait for him in battle.
data.anv: मम my, प्रतिप्रदानम् returning, रावणस्य to Ravana, न रोचते is not liked, कालवशं गतम् fallen into the trap of time, रावणम् Ravana, संख्ये in a battle, मृत्युः death, मार्गते  is searching.
data.md: Rāvana dose not desire to restore me (to Rāma) for he has been brought under the influence of Death who is seeking him in battle.

data.v: ज्येष्ठा कन्यानला नम विभीषणसुता कपे । तया ममैतदाख्यातं मात्रा प्रहितया स्वयम् ।।
data.es: "O vanara Nala the eldest daughter of Vibhisana sent by her mother came here personally and reported this to me.
data.anv: कपे O vanara, नला Nala, ज्येष्ठा eldest daughter, विभीषणसुता daughter of Vibhisana, मात्रा प्रहितया sent by her mother, तया by her, स्वयम् personally, इदम् here, मम to me, आख्यातम् reported.
data.md: Vibhisana's eldest daughter, O monkey, by name Kalā, has related this to me, being appointed by her mother.

data.v: अविन्ध्यो नाम मेधावी विद्वान्राक्षसपुंगवः । धृतिमाञ्शीलवान्वृद्धो रावणस्य सुसंमतः ।।
data.md: There is a leading, steady, old, intelligent and educated Rākşasa, gifted with a good character, named Avindhya and highly respected of Rāvana who told him that the destruction of the Rākṣasa race would proceed from Rāma, but the vicious-souled one paid no attention to his wellmeaning words. is my

data.v: रामात्क्षयमनुप्राप्तं रक्षसां प्रत्यचोदयत् । न च तस्यापि दुष्टात्मा शृणोति वचनं हितम् ।।
data.md: There is a leading, steady, old, intelligent and educated Rākşasa, gifted with a good character, named Avindhya and highly respected of Rāvana who told him that the destruction of the Rākṣasa race would proceed from Rāma, but the vicious-souled one paid no attention to his wellmeaning words. is my

data.v: आशंसेति हरिश्रेष्ठ क्षिप्रं मां प्राप्स्यते पतिः । अन्तरात्मा हि मे शुद्धस्तस्मिंश्च बहवो गुणाः ।।
data.es: "O eminent vanara no doubt my lord will soon reach this place. My pure conscience tells me that Rama has many virtues.
data.anv: हरिश्रेष्ठ O eminent vanara, पतिः my lord, क्षिप्रम् soon, माम् me, असंशयम् no doubt, प्राप्स्यति he will reach, मे my, अन्तरात्मा च inner self also, शुद्धः pure, तस्मिंश्च in that, बहवः many, गुणाः are virtues.
data.md: I hope, O foremost of monkeys, that my husband shall soon regain me for pure soul and he is gifted with many accomplishments.

data.v: उत्साहः पौरुषं सत्त्वमानृशंस्यं कृतज्ञता । विक्रमश्च प्रभावश्च सन्ति वानरराघवे ।।
data.es: "O vanara Rama is endowed with perseverance, manliness, prowess, kindness, gratitude, competence and power.
data.anv: वानरvanara, राघवे in Rama, उत्साहः perseverance, पौरुषम् manliness, सत्त्वम् prowess, अनृशंस्यम् kindness, कृतज्ञता gratitude, विक्रमश्च competence, प्रभावश्च power, सन्ति endowed.
data.md: Rāghava has in him, O monkeys, energy, manliness, strength, kindness, gratitude and prowess.

data.v: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि राक्षसानां जघान यः । जनस्थाने विना भ्रात्रा शत्रुः कस्तस्य नोद्विजेत् ।।
data.anv: यः whoever, जनस्थाने in Janasthana, विना भ्रात्रा without his brother also, राक्षसानाम् demons, चतुर्दशसहस्राणि fourteen thousand, जघान slew, तस्य his, कः who, शत्रुः enemy, नोद्विजेत् will not tremble.
data.md: He brought about without his brother's aid, the destruction of the fourteen thousand Rākṣasas at Janasthāna. What enemy is not troubled at this?

data.v: न स शक्यस्तुलयितुं व्यसनैः पुरुषर्षभः । अहं तस्यानुभावज्ञा शक्रस्येव पुलोमजा ।।
data.es: "O bull among men he will not be shaken by calamities. Just as Sachi, the daughter of Puloma knows Indra's might I know Rama's.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभः bull among men, सः he, व्यसनैः in calamities, तुलयितुम् shaken, न शक्यः not possible, पुलोमजा daughter of Puloma, शक्रस्येव just as Indra, अहम् I, तस्य his, प्रभावज्ञा know his might.
data.md: The disaster-creating Rākşasas can never be compared with that best of men. I am cognizant of his prowess as Sacī is of Indra's.

data.v: शरजालांशुमाञ्शूरः कपे रामदिवाकरः । शत्रुरक्षोमयं तोयमुपशोषं नयिष्यति ।।
data.es: "O monkey the valiant Rama is like the Sungod shoofing a dazzling volley of arrows which will dry up the sea of enemy forces."
data.anv: कपे O monkey, शूरः valiant, रामदिवाकर: Rama the Sun, शरजालांशुमान् with his volley of dazzling arrows, शत्रुरक्षोमयम् enemy forces of the demons, तोयम् water, उपशोषम् will dry up, नयिष्यति will effect.
data.md: O monkey, Rāma the Sun, with his arrow-like rays, shall dry up the water-the inimical Rākşasas.

data.v: इति संजल्पमानां तां रामार्थे शोककर्शिताम् । अश्रुसंपूर्णवदनामुवाच हनुमान्कपिः ।।
data.es: While Sita, tormented with grief on account of Rama was thus speaking, her eyes filled with tears, the monkey said:
data.anv: इति thus, सञ्जल्पमानाम् while she was speaking freely, रामार्थे on account of Rama, शोककर्शिताम् emaciated with sorrow, अश्रु सम्पूर्णनयनाम् her eyes filled with tears, ताम् her, कपिः vanara, वचनम् word, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Saying this she was overwhelmed with grief on Rāma's account, and Hanumān again spoke to her having her countenance bathed in tears.

data.v: श्रुत्वैव तु वचो मह्यं क्षिप्रमेष्यति राघवः । चमूं प्रकर्षन्महतीं हर्यृक्षगणसंकुलाम् ।।
data.es: "On hearing me Rama will reach soon with a huge army of vanaras and bears.
data.anv: मह्यं my, वचः word, श्रुत्वैव तु after hearing, राघवः Rama, हर्यृक्षगणसङ्कुलाम् troops of vanaras and bears, महतीम् huge, चमूम् army, प्रकर्षन् leading, क्षिप्रम् at once, एष्यति will approach.
data.md: Hearing about you from me soon shall Rāghava come assisted by a large army of monkeys and bears.

data.v: अथ वा मोचयिष्यामि तामद्यैव हि राक्षसात् । अस्माद्दुःखादुपारोह मम पृष्ठमनिन्दिते ।।
data.es: "O beautiful lady, if you please, I shall redeem you today itself from grief. You may ride on my back, O blameless lady.
data.anv: अथवा or, वरानने O lady with a beautiful face, त्वाम् you, अद्यैव now itself, अस्मात् from this, दुःखात् from grief, मोचयिष्यामि I shall redeem you, अनिन्दिते O blameles one, मम my, पृष्ठम् back, उपारोह you may  ascend.
data.md: Or I shall release you even to-day from the grasp of that Räkşasa and these miseries. Do you place yourself on my back, O you of a blameless person.

data.v: त्वं हि पृष्ठगतां कृत्वा संतरिष्यामि सागरम् । शक्तिरस्ति हि मे वोढुं लङ्कामपि सरावणाम् ।।
data.es: "Placing you on my back I shall cross the ocean. Indeed, I have the capacity to carry the entire city of Lanka along with Ravana.
data.anv: त्वाम् you, पृष्ठगताम् placing you on my back, कृत्वा on doing so, सागरम् ocean, सन्तरिष्यामि I can cross over, सरावणाम् along with Ravana, लङ्कामपि even Lanka, वोढुम् to carry, मे to me, शक्ति capacity, अस्ति हि indeed I have.
data.md: And having you on my back I shall leap over the main. I am capable of carrying the city of Lankā even with Rāvana.

data.v: अहं प्रस्रवणस्थाय राघवायाद्य मैथिलि । प्रापयिष्यामि शक्राय हव्यं हुतमिवानलः ।।
data.es: "O Mythili Just as oblations offered to the sacred fire goes to Indra, I shall offer you today to Rama waiting on the Prasravana mountain.
data.anv: मैथिलि O Mythili, अनलः sacred fire, हुतम्  put into fire, हव्यम् oblations, शक्राय by Indra, अहम् I, प्रस्रवणस्थाय to a person staying on Prasravan mountain, राघवाय to Rama, अद्यैव प्रापयिष्यामि I will take you today itself.
data.md: I shall restore you to-day, O Maithili, to Rāghava on the mount Prasravaņa, like to fire carrying to Indra, the sacrificial offerings.

data.v: द्रक्ष्यस्यद्यैव वैदेहि राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम् । व्यवसाय समायुक्तं विष्णुं दैत्यवधे यथा ।।
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, दैत्यवधे in the killing of demons, व्यवसायसमायुक्तम् making all out efforts, विष्णुं यथा like Visnu, सहलक्ष्मणम् together with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, अद्यैव right now, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: You shall behold to-day, O Vaidehi, Rama along with Lakşmaņa, making preparations (for the destruction of his enemy) like to Vişņu, engaged in the destruction of demons.

data.v: त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहमाश्रमस्थं महाबलम् । पुरंदरमिवासीनं नागराजस्य मूर्धनि ।।
data.es: Mighty Rama staying in asram ill be enthused to see you seated on my back like Lord Purandara (Indra) seated on the back of the lord of elephants (Airavata)
data.anv: त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहम् enthused in seeing you, आश्रमस्थम् staying in his asram, महाबलम् mighty, नागराजस्य of the king of elephants Airavatam, मूर्धनि on the back, आसीनम् seated, पुरन्दरमिव like the destroyer of citadels (Indra).
data.md: (And you shall observe) that highly powerful one, anxious to behold you and seated like to Purandara on the summit of that foremost of mountains.

data.v: पृष्ठमारोह मे देवि मा विकाङ्क्षस्व शोभने । योगमन्विच्छ रामेण शशाङ्केनेव रोहिणी ।।
data.es: "O god like lady climb up my back. Do not be reluctant. Join Rama just as Rohini unites with the Moon, O beautiful one
data.anv: देवि O god like lady, मम my, पृष्ठम् back, आरोह climb up, शोभने O beautiful one, मा विकाङ्क्षस्व do not be reluctant, रोहिणी Rohini, शशाङ्केनेव like joining with the Moon, रामेण with Rama, योगम् union, अन्विच्छ you may become.
data.md: Do you place yourself on my back, O worshipful dame, do you not neglect it, O beautiful lady, and be thus reconciled to Rāma like to Rohini restored to the Moon.

data.v: कथयन्तीव चन्द्रेण सूर्येणेव सुवर्चला । मत्पृष्ठमधिरुह्य त्वं तराकाशमहार्णवम् ।।
data.es: "Climb on my back and cross the ocean through space in the flaming light, conversing with Moon and Sun.
data.anv: त्वम् you, मत्पृष्ठम् my back, अधिरुह्य after climbing up, चन्द्रेण with the Moon, महार्चिषा  flaming light, सूर्येण with the Sun, कथयन्तीव conversing, आकाशमहार्णवौ sky and ocean, तर cross.
data.md: By the time, that we will take in talking thus, you shall reach Rāma like Rohiņi restored to the Moon. Do you therefore place yourself on my back and I shall cross the ocean sailing by the aetherial way.

data.v: न हि मे संप्रयातस्य त्वामितो नयतोऽङ्गने । अनुगन्तुं गतिं शक्ताः सर्वे लङ्कानिवासिनः ।।
data.es: "O beautiful lady it is not possible for all the inhabitants of Lanka together to follow me while I carry you from this place.
data.anv: अङ्गने O beautiful lady, त्वाम् you, इतः from the place, नयतः while carrying, सम्प्रयातस्य joined together, मे my, गतिम् speed, अनुगन्तुम् to follow me, सर्वे all, लङ्कानिवासिनः the inhabitants of Lanka, न शक्ताः not possible for any one.
data.md: O fair one, carrying you from this place, none among the inhabitants of Lankä shall be able to follow me.

data.v: यथैवाहमिह प्राप्तस्तथैवाहमसंशयम् । यास्यामि पश्य वैदेहि त्वामुद्यम्य विहायसं ।।
data.es: "O Vaidehi just as I reached here I shall beyond doubt take you on my back in the same way across the sky without any difficulty. See.
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, यथैवाहमिह just as I reached here, प्राप्तस्तथैव in the same way I reached, अहम I, त्वामुद्यम्य taking you on my back, यास्यामि will go, विहायसम् across the sky, नसंशयः no doubt, पश्य you may see.
data.md: In the same way I have come here I shall return by the welkin, O Vaidehī placing three on my back.

data.v: मैथिली तु हरिश्रेष्ठाच्छ्रुत्वा वचनमद्भुतम् । हर्षविस्मितसर्वाङ्गी हनूमन्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: When Mythili heard the wonderful proposal from Hanuman, the best of vanaras, she experienced immense joy in every limb of her body and said:
data.anv: मैथिली तु Mythili also, हरिश्रेष्ठात् from the best of vanaras, अद्भुतम् wonderful, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, हर्षविस्मितसर्वाङ्गी experienced immense joy in every limb of her body, अथ then, हनुमन्तम् Hanuman, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those surprising words from that best of monkeys, Maithilī, having her entire frame worked up with joy, again bespake Hanumān.

data.v: हनूमन्दूरमध्वनं कथं मां वोढुमिच्छसि । तदेव खलु ते मन्ये कपित्वं हरियूथप ।।
data.es: "Hanuman how do you intend to carry me to such a distant place? Indeed, it is your monkey nature, I suppose.
data.anv: हनुमन् Hanuman, दूरम् distant, अध्वानम् path, माम् me, वोढुम् carry, कथम् how, इच्छसि you intend, हरियूथप O leader of vanaras, ते you, कपित्वम् monkey nature, तदेव खलु indeed that is, मन्ये I think.
data.md: Hanumān, how darest you take me to such a long distance? O lord of monkey hosts, this attests to your monkey-hood.

data.v: कथं वाल्पशरीरस्त्वं मामितो नेतुमिच्छसि । सकाशं मानवेन्द्रस्य भर्तुर्मे प्लवगर्षभ ।।
data.es: "O bull among monkeys you have such a small body. How can you intend to carry me from here to my husband, the lord of men"?
data.anv: प्लवगर्षभ O bull among monkeys, अल्पशरीरः small body, त्वम् you, इतः from here, मे my, भर्तुः to my husband, मानवेन्द्रस्य lord of men, सकाशम् presence of, नेतुम् to carry, कथं वा how is it, इच्छसि you intend.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, little-bodied as you are, how do you desire, to take me hence to my husband the lord of men?

data.v: सीताया वचनं श्रुत्वा हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । चिन्तयामास लक्ष्मीवान्नवं परिभवं कृतम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Sita's new belittling statement about him, Hanuman, the illustrious son of the Windgod reflected:
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, लक्ष्मीवान् illustrious one, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा on hearing, नवम् new, परिभवम् कृतम् insult hurled, चिन्तयामास he thought.
data.md: Hearing the words of Sītā, the graceful son of the Wind-god Hanumān reflected aside-This is my first insult.

data.v: न मे जानाति सत्त्वं वा प्रभावं वासितेक्षणा । तस्मात्पश्यतु वैदेही यद्रूपं मम कामतः ।।
data.es: 'Blackeyed Sita is not aware of my strength or my power. Therefore let her see the real (huge) form that I can assume at my free will'.
data.anv: असितेक्षणा blackeyed, वैदेही Vaidehi, मे my, सत्त्वं वा strength, प्रभावं वा my power, न जानाति she is not aware, तस्मात् therefore, कामतः freely, मम my, यत् that real, रूपम् form, पश्यतु see.
data.md: The lotus-eyed dame is not cognizant of my prowess or strength. Vaidehi should therefore learn that I can assume shapes at will.

data.v: इति संचिन्त्य हनुमांस्तदा प्लवगसत्तमः । दर्शयामास वैदेह्याः स्वरूपमरिमर्दनः ।।
data.es: Thinking thus, Hanuman, the noble monkey, crusher of enemies, started revealing his real form to Vaidehi.
data.anv: प्लवगसत्तमः the noble monkey, अरिमर्दनः crusher of enemies,हनुमान् Hanuman, इति in that way, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking that way, तदा then, स्वरूपम् his real form, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दर्शयामास he revealed.
data.md: Thinking thus, Hanumān, the foremost of the monkeys and the slayer of foes, showed himself to Sītā, in his true shape.

data.v: स तस्मात्पादपाद्धीमानाप्लुत्य प्लवगर्षभः । ततो वर्धितुमारेभे सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् ।।
data.es: The wise bull among monkeys, jumped down from the tree and started growing in size in order to instil confidence in Sita.
data.anv: धीमान् wise, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, सः he, तस्मात् पादपात् from the tree, अप्लुत्य jumping down, ततः from there, सीताप्रत्ययकारणात् in order to instil confidence in Sita, वर्धितुम् to grow in size, आरेभे started.
data.md: And leaping down from the tree, that best of monkeys began to increase himself to create Sītā's confidence.

data.v: मेरुमन्दारसंकाशो बभौ दीप्तानलप्रभः । अग्रतो व्यवतस्थे च सीताया वानरर्षभः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the foremost of the vanaras resembling mount Meru or Mandara stood there glowing like blazing fire in front of Sita.
data.anv: वानरोत्तमः foremost among vanaras, मेरुमन्दरसङ्काशः like mount Meru or Mandara, दीप्तानलप्रभः glowing like blazing fire, बभौ appeared, सीतायाः Sita's, अग्रतः in front, व्यवतस्थे च and stood there.
data.md: His person appeared like the hill Mandara and the flaming fire. And that best of monkeys having a copper-coloured countenance, thunderlike nails and teeth and mountain-like huge body, appeared before Sītā and said.

data.v: हरिः पर्वतसंकाशस्ताम्रवक्त्रो महाबलः । वज्रदंष्ट्रनखो भीमो वैदेहीमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Resembling a mountain in size, with a red face, with teeth and nails strong like diamond, the vanara in dreadful form said to Vaidehi:
data.anv: पर्वतसङ्काशः resembling a mountain, ताम्रवक्त्रः one who has a red face, महाबलः very strong, वज्रदंष्ट्रनखः teeth and nails as strong as diamonds, भीम: dreadful, हरिः vanara, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: His person appeared like the hill Mandara and the flaming fire. And that best of monkeys having a copper-coloured countenance, thunderlike nails and teeth and mountain-like huge body, appeared before Sītā and said.

data.v: सपर्वतवनोद्देशां साट्टप्राकारतोरणाम् । लङ्कामिमां सनथां वा नयितुं शक्तिरस्ति मे ।।
data.es: "I have the capacity to carry away this entire Lanka uprooted with its mountains, gardens, forts, ramparts and gateways along with the king.
data.anv: सपर्वतवनोद्देशाम् filled with mountains and gardens, साट्टप्राकारतोरणाम् forts,  ramparts and gateways, सनाथाम् along with its king, इमाम् this, लङ्कां वा Lanka itself, नयितुम्  carried away, मे my, शक्ति: capacity, अस्ति is there.
data.md: I am capable of carrying this Lankā with her lord, the mountains, forests gardens, buildings, walls and gate-ways.

data.v: तदवस्थाप्य तां बुद्धिरलं देवि विकाङ्क्षया । विशोकं कुरु वैदेहि राघवं सहलक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: "O queen it is enough. Give up this unworthy attitude. Be stable. O Vaidehi, rid Lakshmana and Rama of grief".
data.anv: देवि queen, तत् so, विकाङ्क्ष्या with unworthy attitude, अलम् enough, बुद्धि: intellect, अवस्थाप्यताम् be stable, वैदेहि Vaidehi, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, राघवम् Rama, विशोकम् rid of sorrow, कुरु do.
data.md: Do you therefore confide in me, O worshipful dame, and be not suspicious. And O Vaidehi, do you remove Rāma's grief as well as Laksmana's.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वाचलसंकाशमुवाच जनकात्मजा । पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षी मारुतस्यौरसं सुतम् ।।
data.es: Seeing the son of Maruta in dreadful form, the broad lotus petaleyed daughter of Janaka with eyes as large as lotus petals replied :
data.anv: पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षी with eyes large like lotus petals, जनकात्मा daughter of Janaka, भीमसङ्काशम् dreadful to viewers, मारुतस्य Maruta's, औरसं सुतम् own son, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, उवाच said.
data.md: Beholding the Wind-god's own begotten son, Hanumān, resembling a huge mountain, Sītā, the daughter of Janaka, having eyes resembling lotus-petals, said.

data.v: तव सत्त्वं बलं चैव विजानामि महाकपे । वायोरिव गतिं चापि तेजश्चाग्निरिवाद्भुतम् ।।
data.es: "O great monkey I have understood your strength and power. Your speed is like the Windgod's and your power is astonishing and splendid.
data.anv: महाकपे O great monkey, तव your, सत्त्वम् strength, बलं चैव and power, वायोरिव like the Windgod's, गतिम् speed, आग्नेरिव like fire's, अद्भुतम् astonishing, तेजश्च splendour, विजानामि I have understood
data.md: O great monkey, I know your strength and bravery, they air-like motion and your wonderful fire-like energy.

data.v: प्राकृतोऽन्यः कथं चेमां भूमिमागन्तुमर्हति । उदधेरप्रमेयस्य पारं वानरपुंगव ।।
data.es: "O chief of vanaras how could an ordinary person be capable of reaching this land on far off shore of the immeasurable ocean?
data.anv: वानरपुङ्गव O chief of vanaras, प्राकृतः an ordinary one, अन्यः other, अप्रमेयस्य of an immeasurable one, उदधेः ocean's, पारम् far off shore, इमाम् this, भूमिम् this land, आगन्तुम् reach, कथम् how, अर्हति fit.
data.md: What ordinary man can come here crossing the incomparable ocean.

data.v: जानामि गमने शक्तिं नयने चापि ते मम । अवश्यं साम्प्रधार्याशु कार्यसिद्धिरिहात्मनः ।।
data.es: "I know you are capable of carrying me on your journey. I am sure about the quick success of your mission which has been carried out after careful planning.
data.anv: गमने in making the journey, मम me, नयने in  taking, शक्तिम् power, जानामि I know, महात्मनः of the great soul, कार्यसिददि success of the mission, अवश्यम् surely, आशु immediately, सम्प्रधार्या after planning properly
data.md: O lord of monkey hosts, I understand that you are capable of returning and you shall be able to carry me. But I should consider now how the work might be accomplished.

data.v: अयुक्तं तु कपिश्रेष्ठ मया गन्तुं त्वया सह । वायुवेगसवेगस्य वेगो मां मोहयेत्तव ।।
data.es: "O sinless and foremost monkey going with you is not proper for me. Your windlike speed will render me unconscious.
data.anv: अनघ sinless one, कपिश्रेष्ठ foremost monkey, त्वया by you, मम my, गन्तुम् to go with, अयुक्तम् not proper, वायुवेगसवेगस्य of a person with the speed of the wind, तव your, वेगः speed, माम् me, मोहयेत् will render me unconscious.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, I should not go with you. Perhaps I might lose my sense with your air-like velocity.

data.v: अहमाकाशमासक्ता उपर्युपरि सागरम् । प्रपतेयं हि ते पृष्ठाद्भयाद्वेगेन गच्छतः ।।
data.es: "When you fly over the ocean in the sky speedily I may tumble down from your back by your speed out of fear.
data.anv: सागरम् उपर्युपरि above the ocean, आकाशम् sky, अहम् I, वेगेन speedily, गच्छतः when you go, ते your, पृष्ठात् from the back, भयात् out of fear, आपन्ना when I reach, प्रपतेयम् I may tumble down.
data.md: When moving terribly you shall proceed high up in the welkin, perhaps I shall then fall down.

data.v: पतिता सागरे चाहं तिमिनक्रझषाकुले । भयेयमाशु विवशा यादसामन्नमुत्तमम् ।।
data.anv: तिमिनक्रझषाकुले filled with whales, crocodiles and fish, सागरे in the ocean, पतिता fallen in, अहम् I, विवशा helpless, आशु immediately, यादसाम् of aquatic animals, उत्तमम् very good, अन्नम् food, भवेयम् I will be.
data.md: No sooner I shall fall down into the ocean infested with fish and other animals than I shall be an excellent food to them.

data.v: न च शक्ष्ये त्वया सार्धं गन्तुं शत्रुविनाशन । कलत्रवति संदेहस्त्वय्यपि स्यादसंशयम् ।।
data.es: "O destroyer of foes, it is not possible for me to go with you. Further, when you are burdened with a woman you will also fall into danger (because of me), no doubt.
data.anv: शत्रुविनाशन O destroyer of foes, त्वया सार्थम् along with you, गन्तुम् to go, न शक्ष्ये च I have no power, कलत्रवति when burdened with a woman, त्वय्यपि with you also, संदेहः doubt, स्यात् may be, असंशयः there is no doubt.
data.md: O slayer of foes, I shall not be able to accompany you. For seeing you carry a woman, they shall surely suspect you.

data.v: ह्रियमाणां तु मां दृष्ट्वा राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः । अनुगच्छेयुरादिष्टा रावणेन दुरात्मना ।।
data.es: "When I am seen (while being carried away) by the demons of fearsome valour they will pursue you, ordered by the wicked Ravana.
data.anv: ह्रियमाणाम् while I am, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, भीमविक्रमाः of fearsome valour, राक्षसाः demons, दुरात्मना by evilminded, रावणेन by Ravana, आदिष्टाः ordered, अनुगच्छेयुः they will pursue
data.md: And finding me stolen, those terribly powerful Rākşasas commanded by the vicious-souled Rāvana, shall follow you.

data.v: तैस्त्वं परिवृतः शूरैः शूलमुद्गर पाणिभिः । भवेस्त्वं संशयं प्राप्तो मया वीर कलत्रवान् ।।
data.es: "O heroic monkey as the warriors armed with spears and maces surround you and attack, your life will be in danger, because of me.
data.anv: त्वम् you, शूलमुद्गरपाणिभिः by those wielding spears and mace, तैः by them, शूरैः by warriors, परिवृतः surrounded, वीर O hero, मया by me, कलत्रवान् one who has a wife, त्वम् you, संशयम् doubt, प्राप्तः have been, भवेः  you.
data.md: O hero, carrying me and encircled by those heroic Rākṣasas with maces and darts in their hands, you shall be beset with dangers.

data.v: सायुधा बहवो व्योम्नि राक्षसास्त्वं निरायुधः । कथं शक्ष्यसि संयातुं मां चैव परिरक्षितुम् ।।
data.es: "The demons are in large number and they will be armed with weapons. You are unarmed. How can you fight and protect me?
data.anv: व्योम्नि in the sky, सायुधाः will be armed with weapons, राक्षसाः demons, बहवः many, त्वम् you, निरायुधः unarmed, संयातुम् to fight, माम् me, परिरक्षितुं च and safeguard, कथम् how, शक्ष्यसि you will be capable?
data.md: And on the sky the Rākşasas shall be armed with weapons and you shall be without any. How shall you be able to fight and protect me at the same time.

data.v: युध्यमानस्य रक्षोभिस्ततस्तैः क्रूरकर्मभिः । प्रपतेयं हि ते पृष्ठद्भयार्ता कपिसत्तम ।।
data.es: "O noble monkey while you are engaged in fighting with those demons of wicked deeds, I may drop down out of fear.
data.anv: कपिसत्तम O noble monkey, तव your, क्रूरकर्मभिः by those of wicked deeds, तैः by them, रक्षोभिः by the demons, युध्यमानस्य for you while engaged in fighting, भयार्ता out of fear, ते your, पृष्ठात् from the back, प्रपतेयं हि I will drop down.
data.md: When you shall be engaged in conflict with those Rākşasas of terrible deeds, I, O foremost of monkeys, stricken with fear, shall fall down from your back.

data.v: अथ रक्षांसि भीमानि महान्ति बलवन्ति च । कथंचित्साम्पराये त्वां जयेयुः कपिसत्तम ।।
data.es: "O noble monkey the massive, fearsome and powerful demons may defeat you in the fight in any way.
data.anv: कपिसत्तम O noble monkey, अथ then, भीमानि fearsome, महान्ति massive, बलवन्ति च powerful, रक्षांसि demons, सांपराये in the fight, कथञ्चित् in any case, त्वाम् you, जयेयुः win over.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys those terrible and powerful Rākşasas shall be able to defeat you a little. And when you shall be defeated in battle I shall fall down and those vicious Rākṣasas shall carry me away from your hands or destroy me.

data.v: अथ वा युध्यमानस्य पतेयं विमुखस्य ते । पतितां च गृहीत्वा मां नयेयुः पापराक्षसाः ।।
data.es: "Or else, while you are engaged in fighting and turn your attention the other way I might fall down and the sinful ogres may bear me away.
data.anv: अथवा or else, युध्यमानस्य for you while engaged in the fighting, ते for you, विमुखस्य while you turn your attention other way, पतेयम् I may fall down, पतिताम् when I have fallen down, माम् me, गृहीत्वा taking hold, पापराक्षसाः wretched rakshasas, नयेयुः may take me away.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys those terrible and powerful Rākşasas shall be able to defeat you a little. And when you shall be defeated in battle I shall fall down and those vicious Rākṣasas shall carry me away from your hands or destroy me.

data.v: मां वा हरेयुस्त्वद्धस्ताद्विशसेयुरथापि वा । अव्यवस्थौ हि दृश्येते युद्धे जयपराजयौ ।।
data.es: "They may snatch me away from your hands or cut me to pieces. Success or defeat is uncertain in a war.
data.anv: त्वत् हस्तात् from your hand, माम् me, हरेयुः they may take one away, अथापि वा or rather, विशसेयुः may cut me, युद्धे in the fight, जयपराजयौ success or failure, अव्यवस्थौ not sure, दृश्येते हि they appear.
data.md: Victory or defeat is uncertain in a battle. I shall thus be distressed by those Rākşasas setting up terrible roars and they endeavours shall be fruitless, O best of monkeys.

data.v: अहं वापि विपद्येयं रक्षोभिरभितर्जिता । त्वत्प्रयत्नो हरिश्रेष्ठ भवेन्निष्फल एव तु ।।
data.es: "In such a case, caught and intimidated by the demons I may die. Then your efforts will be wasted.
data.anv: रक्षोभिः caught by the ogres, अभितर्जिता very much threatened, अहम् I, विपद्येयं वापि or else I may die, हरिश्रेष्ठ best of monkeys, त्वत्प्रयत्नः your effort, निष्फल एव will be wasteful, तु indeed, भवेत् may be.
data.md: Victory or defeat is uncertain in a battle. I shall thus be distressed by those Rākşasas setting up terrible roars and they endeavours shall be fruitless, O best of monkeys.

data.v: कामं त्वमपि पर्याप्तो निहन्तुं सर्वराक्षसान् । राघवस्य यशो हीयेत्त्वया शस्तैस्तु राक्षसैः ।।
data.es: "It may be that you can kill all the demons but by such an act the fame of Rama will be diminished. (He cannot give his strength a trial)
data.anv: त्वम् you, सर्वराक्षसान् all the ogres, निहन्तुम् to slay, पर्याप्तः अपि कामम् it may be you can do the task, त्वया by you, शस्तै by those killed, राक्षसैः by demons, राघवस्य Rama's, यशः fame, हीयेत् will diminish.
data.md: You are capable of destroying the Rākṣasas very easily (I admit)—but Rama's fame shall then be souled if do you bring about their destruction.

data.v: अथ वादाय रक्षांसि न्यस्येयुः संवृते हि माम् । यत्र ते नाभिजानीयुर्हरयो नापि राघवः ।।
data.es: "Or else, the ogres will carry me and conceal me in a secret place which the vanaras or Rama and Lakshmana may not know.
data.anv: अथवा or else, रक्षांसि the ogres, माम् me, आदाय after taking, यत्र where, ते हरयः those of you vanaras, राघवौ अपि and even Rama and Lakshmana, नाभिजानीयुः may not know, संवृते in a secret place, न्यसेयु: they may hide.
data.md: Or the Rākşasas taking me away shall keep me in such a secret place, that neither the monkeys nor Rāghava shall be able to ascertain my where abouts.

data.v: आरम्भस्तु मदर्थोऽयं ततस्तव निरर्थकः । त्वया हि सह रामस्य महानागमने गुणः ।।
data.anv: ततः then, मदर्थः for my sake, तव your, आरम्भस्तु effort, निरर्थकः futile, त्वया सह along with you, रामस्य Rama, आगमने coming here, महान् great, गुणः merit.
data.md: All your preparations for me, shall thus be useless. And mighty shall be the result of Rāma's coming with you.

data.v: मयि जीवितमायत्तं राघवस्य महात्मनः । भ्रातॄणां च महाबाहो तव राजकुलस्य च ।।
data.es: "O strongarmed Hanuman your life and the life of the great self Rama, of his brother, and relatives of your king is dependent upon my survival.
data.anv: महाबाहो strongarmed one, महात्मनः of the great self, राघवस्य Rama's, भ्रात्रूणाम् of his brothers, तव your, राजकुलस्य of the relatives of your king, जीवितम् life, मयि in me, आयत्तम् is dependent.
data.md: O large armed one, the life of Rāghava of unmitigated prowess, those of his brothers and of your royal race are all subject to me.

data.v: तौ निराशौ मदर्थे तु शोकसंतापकर्शितौ । सह सर्वर्क्षहरिभिस्त्यक्ष्यतः प्राणसंग्रहम् ।।
data.es: "Both Rama and Lakshmana who are emaciated with sorrow and suffering on account of me will give up their lives along with vanaras and bears.
data.anv: मदर्थम् for my sake, शोकसन्तापकर्शितौ emaciated with sorrow and suffering, तौ they both, निराशौ with no hope of finding me, सर्वर्क्षहरिभिः सह along with all vanaras and bears, प्राणसङ्ग्रहम् the five elements of which life is made, त्यक्ष्यतः will give up.
data.md: When they shall give up their hopes of releasing me, they, worn out with grief and anxiety shall renounce their lives along with the monkeys and bears.

data.v: भर्तुर्भक्तिं पुरस्कृत्य रामादन्यस्य वानर । नाहं स्प्रष्टुं पदा गात्रमिच्छेयं वानरोत्तम ।।
data.es: "O chief of vanaras I cherish my devotion towards Rama alone and not touch the body of any other man.
data.anv: वानरपुङ्गव O chief of vanaras, वानर vanara, भर्तुः husband's, भक्तिम् devotion, पुरस्कृत्य after cherishing, रामात् from Rama, अन्यस्य other, पुंसः man's, शरीरं तु body, न स्पृशामि I do not touch.
data.md: O monkey, being guided by my love for my husband, I do not like willingly to touch any body's person but Rāma's.

data.v: यदहं गात्रसंस्पर्शं रावणस्य गता बलात् । अनीशा किं करिष्यामि विनाथा विवशा सती ।।
data.es: "I had no control over myself. I was helpless and my husband was not present when I had to bear the touch of Ravana's limbs. What can I do?
data.anv: अहम् I, बलात् by force, रावणस्य Ravana's, गात्रसंस्पर्शम् touch of his body, गता यत् that I had to experience, अनीशा having no control over my self, विवशा सती a helpless woman, विनाथा without my husband, किं करिष्यामि what can I do?
data.md: When Rāvaņa, by force touched my person, I had no other help, for I was then without me lord and therefore was subject to another person.

data.v: यदि रामो दशग्रीवमिह हत्वा सराक्षसं । मामितो गृह्य गच्छेत तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत् ।।
data.es: "It will be proper if Rama comes here, kills Ravana along with all his relations and takes me away.
data.anv: रामः Rama, सबान्धवम् along with his relations, दशग्रीवम् Ravana, इह here, हत्त्वा after killing, माम् me, इतः from here, गृह्य taking, गच्छेत यदि and if he goes, तत् then, तस्य his, सदृशम् proper, भवेत् it will be.
data.md: If Rāma can take me away from here, destroying the Ten-necked one with all the Rākşasas-he shall then perform the worthy action.

data.v: श्रुता हि दृष्टाश्च मया पराक्रमा; महात्मनस्तस्य रणावमर्दिनः । न देवगन्धर्वभुजंगराक्षसा; भवन्ति रामेण समा हि संयुगे ।।
data.es: "I have seen and heard about Rama's conquest of enemies and his valiant deeds in war. Indeed, gods gandharvas, nagas or even demons cannot match him in war.
data.anv: रणावमर्दिनः of the crusher of enemies, महात्मनः great self, तस्य his, पराक्रमाः valiant deeds, मया by me, श्रुताः heard, दृष्टाश्च witnessed, संयुगे in war, देवगन्धर्वभुजङ्गराक्षसाः whether gods, gandharvas, nagas or demons, रामेण by Rama, समाः equal, नहि not indeed.
data.md: I have heard of and myself seen the prowess of the highly-souled (Rāma) unconquerable in a battle. There is none among the celestials, Gandharvas, Nāgas and the Rākşasas who can match him in a conflict.

data.v: समीक्ष्य तं संयति चित्रकार्मुकं; महाबलं वासवतुल्यविक्रमम् । सलक्ष्मणं को विषहेत राघवं; हुताशनं दीप्तमिवानिलेरितम् ।।
data.anv: चित्रकार्मुकम् wielder of a powerful bow, महाबलम् endowed with great strength, वासवतुल्यविक्रमम् equal to Vasava in valour, सलक्ष्मणम् along with Lakshmana, अनिलेरितम् whipped by wind, दीप्तम् blazing, हुताशनमिव like the fire, तं राघवम् him, Rama, सयति in war, समीक्ष्य facing, कः who, विषहेतः can withstand.
data.md: Beholding that highly powerful Rāghava, in a conflict, like to Vāsava in prowess, holding a wonderful bow and followed by Lakşmaņa, who can withstand his prowess resembling the flaming fire?

data.v: सलक्ष्मणं राघवमाजिमर्दनं; दिशागजं मत्तमिव व्यवस्थितम् । सहेत को वानरमुख्य संयुगे; युगान्तसूर्यप्रतिमं शरार्चिषम् ।।
data.es: "O chief of vanaras who can withstand Rama accompanied by Lakshmana, the conqueror of enemies? His arrows resemble the rays of the Sun at the time of the deluge, steady like the elephants who support the quarters of the earth.
data.anv: वानरमुख्य chief of vanaras, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, आजिमर्दनम् crusher of enemies in war, मत्तम् intoxicated, दिशागजमिव like the elephant supporting quarter of the earth, व्यवस्थितम् steady, शरार्चिषम् arrows of rays, युगान्तसूर्यप्रतिमम् resembling the Sun at the at the time of the deluge, राघवम् Rama, संयुगे in a war, कः who, सहेत can withstand.
data.md: O foremost of monkeys, who can withstand Rāghava in a conflict, followed by Lakşmaņa moving like infuriated an elephant and showering shafts like to the rays of the sun at the time of Dissolution?

data.v: स मे हरिश्रेष्ठ सलक्ष्मणं पतिं; सयूथपं क्षिप्रमिहोपपादय । चिराय रामं प्रति शोककर्शितां; कुरुष्व मां वानरमुख्य हर्षिताम् ।।
data.md: O best of monkeys do you speedily bring here my dear one along with Lakşmaņa and the lord of monkey hosts. O heroic monkey, do you soon satisfy me, who am stricken with grief in consequence of my long separation from Rāma.

data.v: ततः स कपिशार्दूलस्तेन वाक्येन हर्षितः । सीतामुवाच तच्छ्रुत्वा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: Satisfied with the words of Sita, the tiger among monkeys, who was eloquent in speech said:
data.anv: ततः then, वाक्यविशारदः eloquent in speech, सः कपिशार्दूलः tiger among monkeys, तत् वाक्यम् those words, श्रुत्वा hearing, तेन वाक्येन by those words, तोषितः contented with, सीताम् to Sita, उवाच said.
data.md: Hearing those words, that foremost of monkeys, skilled in speech, was greatly delighted and again addressed Sītā in the following words,

data.v: युक्तरूपं त्वया देवि भाषितं शुभदर्शने । सदृशं स्त्रीस्वभावस्य साध्वीनां विनयस्य च ।।
data.es: "O queen O lady of auspicious appearance your words are most appropriate to and characteristic of a modest virtuous woman.
data.anv: शुभदर्शने whose appearance is auspicious, देवि queen, त्वया you, भाषितम् spoken, युक्तरूपम् is in accordance with your nature, स्त्रीस्वभावस्य of feminine nature, साध्वीनाम् of virtuous women, विनयस्य च and of the modesty, सदृशम् appropriate.
data.md: O worshipful lady, O you of an auspicious presence, what you had said, speaks well for a feminine nature and the modesty of a chaste damsel.

data.v: स्त्रीत्वं न तु समर्थं हि सागरं व्यतिवर्तितुम् । मामधिष्ठाय विस्तीर्णं शतयोजनमायतम् ।।
data.es: "It may not be possible for a woman to cross on my back the vast ocean stretching over a hundred yojanas. It is not possible for a woman.
data.anv: माम् me, अधिष्ठाय after climbing up, विस्तीर्णम् vast, शतयोजनम् of hundred yojanas, आयतम् wide, सागरम् the ocean, व्यतिवर्तितुम् to cross, स्त्रीत्वम् for a woman, न समर्थं हि is not possible.
data.md: And because you are a female, you are not capable of crossing on my back, the main extending over a thousand leagues.

data.v: द्वितीयं कारणं यच्च ब्रवीषि विनयान्विते । रामादन्यस्य नार्हामि संस्पर्शमिति जानकि ।।
data.es: "O humble lady the second reason given by you, 'I ought not to touch a person other than Rama' is well said and worthy of you, being the wife of the great soul. Who else can speak such words?
data.anv: विनयान्विते O lady with humility etc., जानकि Janaki, रामात् from Rama, अन्यस्य of others, संस्पर्शम् touch, नार्हिमि I do not want, यत् that which, द्वितीयम् second, कारणम् reason, ब्रवीषि you said, एतत् that, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great soul, पत्न्याः of the wife, ते to you, सदृशम् appropriate, देवि O queen, त्वाम् your, ऋते excepting, अन्या other than, का who else, ईदृशम् such, वचनम् word, ब्रूयात् will speak.
data.md: The second argument—I shall not touch any other person's body than Rāma's, which you have produced, O Janaki! O you gifted with modesty! truely become you, who are the spouse of that high-souled one. Who else than you, O worshipful one, can give expression to such words?

data.v: एतत्ते देवि सदृशं पत्न्यास्तस्य महात्मनः । का ह्यन्या त्वामृते देवि ब्रूयाद्वचनमीदृशम् ।।
data.es: "O humble lady the second reason given by you, 'I ought not to touch a person other than Rama' is well said and worthy of you, being the wife of the great soul. Who else can speak such words?
data.anv: विनयान्विते O lady with humility etc., जानकि Janaki, रामात् from Rama, अन्यस्य of others, संस्पर्शम् touch, नार्हिमि I do not want, यत् that which, द्वितीयम् second, कारणम् reason, ब्रवीषि you said, एतत् that, तस्य his, महात्मनः of the great soul, पत्न्याः of the wife, ते to you, सदृशम् appropriate, देवि O queen, त्वाम् your, ऋते excepting, अन्या other than, का who else, ईदृशम् such, वचनम् word, ब्रूयात् will speak.
data.md: The second argument—I shall not touch any other person's body than Rāma's, which you have produced, O Janaki! O you gifted with modesty! truely become you, who are the spouse of that high-souled one. Who else than you, O worshipful one, can give expression to such words?

data.v: श्रोष्यते चैव काकुत्स्थः सर्वं निरवशेषतः । चेष्टितं यत्त्वया देवि भाषितं मम चाग्रतः ।।
data.es: "O queen Kakutstha Rama will hear from me fully all that has been said and done by you in my presence without any omission.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Rama the scion of the Kakutstha family, सर्वं all, देवि queen, त्वया your, यत् what ever, चेष्टितम् is done, मम my, अग्रतः presence, भाषितं च you have spoken, सर्वम् all, निरवशेषतः without omission, श्रोष्यते च will hear.
data.md: Truly shall Kākutstha hear from the beginning to the end, O worshipful dame, of your actions before me, and all you had said.

data.v: कारणैर्बहुभिर्देवि राम प्रियचिकीर्षया । स्नेहप्रस्कन्नमनसा मयैतत्समुदीरितम् ।।
data.es: "O queen my heart is drenched with love for Rama and desires to please him for many reasons. Therefore these words have been spoken by me.
data.anv: देवि O queen, बहुभिः with many, कारणैः with reasons, रामप्रियचिकीर्षया desiring to please Rama, स्नेहप्रस्कन्नमनसा mind is sprinkled with love, मया by me, एतत् this, समुदीरितम् uttered.
data.md: For many reason, I gave vent to such words, O lady, I am anxious to compass Rāma's end, and my heart is melted with affection.

data.v: लङ्काया दुष्प्रवेशत्वाद्दुस्तरत्वान्महोदधेः । सामर्थ्यादात्मनश्चैव मयैतत्समुदाहृतम् ।।
data.es: "Crossing the ocean and entering Lanka are difficult. But I accomplished it. Hence my proposal.
data.anv: लङ्कायाः of Lanka, दुष्प्रवेशत्वात् difficult to enter, महोदधेः of the ocean, दुस्तरत्वात् difficult to cross, आत्मनः of my self, सामर्थ्याश्चैव because of my capacity, मया by me, एतत् all this, समुदीरितम् pronounced.
data.md: It is very difficult to enter this city of Lankā, it is equally hard to cross over the main—but I am capable of doing all these, and hence I gave utterance to all those words.

data.v: इच्छामि त्वां समानेतुमद्यैव रघुबन्धुना । गुरुस्नेहेन भक्त्या च नान्यथा तदुदाहृतम् ।।
data.es: "I offered to take you today itself out of my love and devotion to Rama with a desire to unite you with him and not with any other intention.
data.anv: गुरुस्नेहेन out of love for my master, भक्त्या च and devotion, त्वाम् you, रघुबन्धुना with Rama, अद्यैव today itself, समानेतुम् to take, इच्छामि desirous of, एतत् all this, अन्यथा any other, न उदाहृतम् not mentioned otherwise.
data.md: I wish to take you even to-day to the descendant of Raghu. It is for my devotion to him and regard for you that I said so and for nothing else.

data.v: यदि नोत्सहसे यातुं मया सार्धमनिन्दिते । अभिज्ञानं प्रयच्छ त्वं जानीयाद्राघवो हि यत् ।।
data.es: "O blameless lady If you wish not to accompany me you may give me a token of identification to let Rama know about my coming here and seeing you".
data.anv: अनिन्दिते O blameless lady, मया सार्थम् along with me, यातुम् to go, नोत्सहसे यदि if not desiring, यत् that, राघवः Rama, जानीयात् coming and seeing you, अभिज्ञानम् to let him know, त्वम् you, प्रयच्छ you may give me a token of identity.
data.md: If you do not wish to go with me, O you of a blameless person, do you give me such a token as might create Rāghava's confidence.

data.v: एवमुक्ता हनुमता सीता सुरसुतोपमा । उवाच वचनं मन्दं बाष्पप्रग्रथिताक्षरम् ।।
data.es: Having heard Hanuman, Sita, a child of god, said these words in a low tone. Choked with tears, 'Carry this token of identity to my dear husband':
data.anv: हनुमता by Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता having been addressed, सुरसुतोपमा resembling a god's daughter, सीता Sita, बाष्पप्रग्रथिताक्षरम् words choked with tears, वचनम् word, मन्दम् in low tone, उवाच said, त्वं तु you also, मम my, प्रियम् dear, श्रेष्ठम् best, इदम् thus, अभिज्ञानम् token of identity, ब्रूयाः said.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Hanumān, Sītā resembling the daughter of a celestial, spoke, gently, words with their letters strung on the vapour of grief,

data.v: इदं श्रेष्ठमभिज्ञानं ब्रूयास्त्वं तु मम प्रियम् । शैलस्य चित्रकूटस्य पादे पूर्वोत्तरे तदा ।।
तापसाश्रमवासिन्याः प्राज्यमूलफलोदके । तस्मिन्सिद्धाश्रमे देशे मन्दाकिन्या अदूरतः ।।
data.es: 'Long ago we were staying at Siddhasrama. This hermitage was situated to the northeast at the foot of Chitrakuta mountain which was not far from the river Mandakini. It had abundant roots, fruits and water. You sported with me in the gardens which were fragrant with many types of flowers and ponds. You sat down on my lap with wet clothes in the hermitage'.
data.anv: पुरा earlier, चित्रकूटस्य शैलस्य on the mountain of Chitrakuta, पूर्वोत्तरे in the northeast, पादे on foot, प्राज्यमूलफलोदके with abundant roots fruits and water, तस्मिन् in that, सिद्धाश्रमे Siddhasrama, देशे in a region, मन्दाकिन्याध्यविदूरतः not far from Mandakini river, तस्य of him, नानापुष्पसुगन्धिषु many kinds of fragrant flowers, उपवनषण्डेषु in gardens, सलिले in water, विहृत्य  after sporting, क्लिन्नः wet, तापसाश्रमवासिन्याः hermitages of ascetics, मम me, अङ्के the body, समुपाविशः you were seated.

data.v: तस्योपवनषण्डेषु नानापुष्पसुगन्धिषु । विहृत्य सलिलक्लिन्ना तवाङ्के समुपाविशम् ।।
पर्यायेण प्रसुप्तश्च ममाङ्के भरताग्रजः ।।
data.es: 'Totally exhausted I slept on your lap for a long time, and in turn you slept on my lap later.
data.anv: अहमपि I too, परिश्रमात् due to exhaustion, राघवाङ्के on Rama's lap, चिरम् for long time, प्रसुप्ता च I slept, पर्यायेण in turn, भरताग्रजः Bharata's elder brother, मम my, अङ्के on the lap, प्रसुप्तः slept.

data.v: ततो मांससमायुक्तो वायसः पर्यतुण्डयत् । तमहं लोष्टमुद्यम्य वारयामि स्म वायसं ।।
data.es: 'Then a crow greedy of flesh began to peck my bossom with its beak. I took a clod of earth and warded him off.
data.anv: ततः then, मांससमायुक्तः it brought meat, वायसः crow, पर्यतुण्डयत् went round with its beak and pecked, अहम् I, लोष्टम् clod of earth, उद्यम्य by lifting, तम् him, वायसम् that crow, वारयामि स्म I presented him.
data.md: A crow, at that time, longing to feed on my flesh, tore my breast with its beak. And I threatened it with a pebble. But it continued tearing my breast as if it sat there to feed on my flesh and therefore did not fly off.

data.v: दारयन्स च मां काकस्तत्रैव परिलीयते । न चाप्युपरमन्मांसाद्भक्षार्थी बलिभोजनः ।।
data.es: 'The crow was an eater of offerings, hungry for food began to peck me again and again for flesh.He did not stop.
data.anv: सः काकः that crow, माम् me, दारयन् while pecking, तत्रैव there itself, परिलीयते waited, भक्षार्थि hungry for food, सः he, बलिभोजनः eater of offerings, मांसात् flesh, न उपारमच्चापि was not giving up.
data.md: A crow, at that time, longing to feed on my flesh, tore my breast with its beak. And I threatened it with a pebble. But it continued tearing my breast as if it sat there to feed on my flesh and therefore did not fly off.

data.v: उत्कर्षन्त्यां च रशनां क्रुद्धायां मयि पक्षिणे । स्रंसमाने च वसने ततो दृष्टा त्वया ह्यहम् ।।
data.es: 'My upper cloth was slipping. I was trying to pull up my waist string angrily when you saw me.
data.anv: मयि I, पक्षिणि by the crow, क्रुद्धायाम् when I was angry, वसने when the cloth, स्रस्यमाने च was slipping, रशनाम् waist string, उत्कर्षन्त्यां च as I was pulling up, ततः then, त्वया by you, अहम् I, दृष्टा seen.
data.md: Being enraged with that bird, as I tried to tighten the cloth around my waist, it gave way a little, and you, rising up from your seat and looking at me, did laugh over it. And I was greatly enraged with your laughter and ashamed, and, being wounded by the crow, I approached you.

data.v: त्वया विहसिता चाहं क्रुद्धा संलज्जिता तदा । भक्ष्य गृद्धेन कालेन दारिता त्वामुपागता ।।
data.es: 'Then you made fun of me, and I became angry. I was abashed. Torn by the voracious bird I sought your shelter.
data.anv: तदा then, क्रुद्धा enraged, अहम् I, त्वया your, अपहसिता made fun of me, संलज्जिता  embarassed, भक्षगृध्नेन by the voracious bird, काकेन by the crow, दारिता torn, त्वाम् you, उपागता  sought.

data.v: आसीनस्य च ते श्रान्ता पुनरुत्सङ्गमाविशम् । क्रुध्यन्ती च प्रहृष्टेन त्वयाहं परिसान्त्विता ।।
data.es: 'Exhausted, I sat on your lap again. Seeing my angry face you pacified me. You were happy (to see me draw close).
data.anv: श्रान्ता exhausted, आसीनस्य when you sat, ते your, उत्सङ्गम् lap, पुनः again, आविशम् settled again, क्रुध्यन्ती seeing me angry, अहम् I, प्रहृष्टेन happily, त्वया by you, परिसान्त्विता you pacified me.
data.md: Thereupon, tired as I was, I sat on your lap, and, exercised with ire, I was consoled by you laughing.

data.v: बाष्पपूर्णमुखी मन्दं चक्षुषी परिमार्जती । लक्षिताहं त्वया नाथ वायसेन प्रकोपिता ।।
data.es: 'O lord when I was angered by the crow and my face was filled with tears, you marked me wiping my eyes.
data.anv: नाथ O lord, वायसेन by the crow, प्रकोपिता angered, बाष्पपूर्णमुखी face filled with tears, मन्दम् slowly, चक्षुषी eyes, परिमार्जती while wiping, अहम् I was, त्वया you, लक्षिता marked.
data.md: Now I, having my countenance bathed in tears, gently rubbed my eyes. And I was seen by you, O my lord, in that wise, greatly enraged with the crow.

data.v: आशीविष इव क्रुद्धः श्वसान्वाक्यमभाषथाः । केन ते नागनासोरु विक्षतं वै स्तनान्तरम् । कः क्रीडति सरोषेण पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना ।।
data.es: 'O Sita with a beautiful lap like an elephant trunk by whom is your bosom wounded? Who is sporting with an angry fivehooded snake?
data.anv: भीरु timid, ते you, स्तनान्तरम् from the breasts, केन who, नखाग्रैः with the tip of the nails, दारितम् scratched, सरोषेण furious, पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना fivehooded serpent, कः who, क्रीडति sported.
data.md: O you having thighs like the trunk of an elephant, by whom has your breast been wounded? Who wants to play with an angry five-hooded serpent?

data.v: वीक्षमाणस्ततस्तं वै वायसं समवैक्षथाः । नखैः सरुधिरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मामेवाभिमुखं स्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'Then looking around, you saw the crow facing me with sharp, bloodstained claws.
data.anv: निरीक्षमाणः seeing all over, सरुधिरैः with blood, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, नखैः nails, तामेव of her, अभिमुखम् in front of, स्थितम् stood, वायसम् crow, सहसा at once, समवैक्षथाः glanced.
data.md: Thereupon, casting his looks around, he espied the crow, sitting in my front with its claws besmeared with blood.

data.v: पुत्रः किल स शक्रस्य वायसः पततां वरः । धरान्तरचरः शीघ्रं पवनस्य गतौ समः ।।
data.es: 'This crow was the best of birds. He was surely Indra's son who had covered a long distance with great speed and his speed was like the Windgod's.
data.anv: पतताम् among birds, वरः foremost, सः वायसः that crow, शक्रस्य Indra's, पुत्रः son, किल moving about, धरान्तरगतः all over the earth, शीघ्रम् swiftly, गतौ flying, पवनस्य windgod's speed, समः equal.
data.md: That crow, best of birds, was the son of the lord of the celestials in disguise. And gifted with air-like velocity, he speedily entered inside the earth.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्महाबाहुः कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः । वायसे कृतवान्क्रूरां मतिं मतिमतां वर ।।
data.es: 'Then you, the strongarmed and best among the wise, your eyeballs rolling in fury, made up your mind about the cruel crow.
data.anv: महाबाहो longarmed one, मतिमताम् very wise one, वर reverred, त्वम् you, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः anguished, ततः then, तस्मिन् its, वायसे the crow's, क्रूराम् cruel, मतिम् in your mind, कृथाः decision took.
data.md: Thereupon that large-eyed hero, best of the intelligent, with his eyes whirling with ire, resolving to destroy that crow.

data.v: स दर्भसंस्तराद्गृह्य ब्रह्मणोऽस्त्रेण योजयः । स दीप्त इव कालाग्निर्जज्वालाभिमुखो द्विजम् ।।
data.es: 'Taking out a blade of darbha grass from your mat, you invoked the weapon of Brahma by reciting the mantra. Then you discharged it which blazed like the fire of death and went spearheading towards the crow.
data.anv: सः he, संस्तरात् from your mat, दर्भम् a blade of grass, गृह्य took out, ब्राह्मेण अस्त्रेण by the mantra of the weapon of Brahma, योजयत् chanted, सः he, दीप्तः blazed, कालाग्निरिव like the fire of the demon's day, द्विजम् bird, अभिमुखः towards the direction, जज्वाल hurled.
data.md: And taking a blade of Kusa off his seat, he tied it to a Brahma weapon. And that blade, facing the bird, appeared with its flaming face, like the fire that would destroy the world.

data.v: चिक्षेपिथ प्रदीप्तां तामिषीकां वायसं प्रति । अनुसृष्टस्तदा कालो जगाम विविधां गतिम् । त्राणकाम इमं लोकं सर्वं वै विचचार ह ।।
data.es: 'Then that crow flew to many places seeking asylum all over the universe chased by the blade of grass.
data.anv: तदा then, काकः that crow, अनुसृष्टः one who was followed, विविधाम् many, गतिम् places, जगाम went, लोककामः the entire universe desiring safety, इमम् this, सर्वम् all, लोकम् worlds, विचचार ह went round.
data.md: Being thus pursued, that crow, in order to save himself, traversed various regions.

data.v: स पित्रा च परित्यक्तः सुरैः सर्वैर्महर्षिभिः । त्रीँल्लोकान्संपरिक्रम्य त्वामेव शरणं गतः ।।
data.es: 'Then the crow went round all the three worlds, having been rejected by his father Indra, including all the sages and gods. Refused by all he came back to Rama seeking shelter.
data.anv: सः he, पित्रा च by the father, समहर्षिभिः even the great sages, सुरैश्च and gods, परित्यक्तः abandoned, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, सम्परिक्रम्य went round also, त्रातारम् saviour, नाधिगच्छति was not found.
data.md: And being then renounced by his father (Indra) and the great ascetics, he, ranging the three worlds, at last resorted to his (Rāma's) shelter.

data.v: तं त्वं निपतितं भूमौ शरण्यः शरणागतम् । वधार्हमपि काकुत्स्थ कृपया पर्यपालयः । न शर्म लब्ध्वा लोकेषु त्वामेव शरणं गतः ।।
data.es: 'Seeing the crow fallen on the ground, O Kakutstha, you who are a saviour of those who seek refuge saved him out of compassion, even though he deserved to be killed.
data.anv: अरिन्दम destroyer of enemies, त्रस्तः trembling, पुनरेव again, त्वत्सकाशम् that crow, आगतः came back, शरण्यः for protection, सः काकुत्स्थ: to Rama, शरणागतम् seeking protection, भूमौ on earth, निपतितम् fell down, तम् him, वाधर्हमपि that which deserved to be slayed, कृपया in compassion, पर्यपालय: saved.
data.md: And, placing himself on the earth, he sought his shelter, and Kākutstha, out of mercy, saved him, albeit worthy of being killed.

data.v: परिद्यूनं विषण्णं च स त्वमायान्तमुक्तवान् । मोघं कर्तुं न शक्यं तु ब्राह्ममस्त्रं तदुच्यताम् ।।
data.es: 'Rama, you saw the crow in pain and despondency who returned to you and said that it is not possible to make Brahma's weapon ineffectual.You may tell now. (what should be done.)
data.anv: सः Rama, परिद्यूनम् pained, विषण्णम् despondent, आयान्तम् he reached, तम् him, अब्रवीत् said, ब्राह्मम् अस्त्रम् Brahma weapon, मोघम् in vain, कर्तुम् to do, न शक्यं तु not possible, तत् that, उच्यताम् tell.
data.md: And he spoke to him, greatly famished, of a pale countenance and lying on the earth, It is impossible to render this Brahma weapon fruitless. Therefore, do you speak (as to what is to be done).

data.v: ततस्तस्याक्षि काकस्य हिनस्ति स्म स दक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama since a divine weapon cannot be withdrawn, it did strike his right eye'.
data.anv: राघव Rama, अस्त्रम् weapon, मोघम् divine one, कर्तुम् to withdraw, न शक्यम् not possible, इत्येव therefore, भवान् you, तस्य काकस्य that crow, दक्षिणम् अक्षि right eye, हिनस्ति स्म struck.
data.md: He then destroyed the right eye of the crow. Having given up his eye, he saved himself.
