data.es: Chaste and beautiful Sita said, "How do I know about the ogresses who assume many fierce forms?"
data.anv: अथ then, महासाध्वी a chaste lady, सर्वाङ्गसुन्दरी a lady of beautiful limbs, सीता Sita, तदा then, अब्रवीत् said, भीमरूपाणाम् of fierce form, रक्षसाम् of ogresses, विज्ञाने in knowing, गतिः direction, मम to me, का what?
data.md: Thereat, the chaste Sītā, having all her parts perfect, answered, “What is my power to read Rākṣasas capable of wearing forms at will? ”

data.v: यूयमेवास्य जानीत योऽयं यद्वा करिष्यति । अहिरेव अहेः पादान्विजानाति न संशयः ।।
data.es: "You alone can know about who he is and what he is about. A serpent alone knows the movement (footprints) of another serpent. There is no doubt about it.
data.anv: अयम् this, यः whoever, यद्वा what, करिष्यति he is about, यूयमेव you alone, अभिजानीत you may find out, अहेः of a serpent, पादान् feet, अहिरेव a serpent alone, विजानाति  knows, संशयः doubt, न no.
data.md: You know who he is and what he does. Serpents, without doubt, know the way of serpents.

data.v: अहमप्यस्य भीतास्मि नैनं जानामि कोऽन्वयम् । वेद्मि राक्षसमेवैनं कामरूपिणमागतम् ।।
data.es: "I am also scared of him. I do not know who he is. I think he is a demon, who came here assuming a form of his choice.
data.anv: अहमपि I am also, अस्य at him, भीता अस्मि I am scared of,  एनम् him, को नु who he is, अयम् this person, न जानामि I do not know, एनम् him, आगतम् came, कामरूपिणम् who has assumed his desired form in various ways, राक्षसमेव demon only, वेद्मि I think.
data.md: And, furthermore, I am very much frightened, nor know I who that one is. I take him to be a Rākşasa, who has come here through his capacity to put on any shape.

data.v: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षस्यो विद्रुता द्रुतम् । स्थिताः काश्चिद्गताः काश्चिद्रावणाय निवेदितुम् ।।
data.es: LIstening to Vaidehi's words the ogresses divided themselves and fled in all directions. While some stood there, others went to report to Ravana.
data.anv: वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा after listening to, राक्षस्यः ogresses, दिशः in all directions, विद्रुताः ran, काश्चित् some, स्थिताः stood there, काश्चित् some, रावणाय to Ravana, निवेदितुम् to report, गताः fled.
data.md: Hearing Vaidehi's words, the Raksasis swiftly took to their heels. Some remained, and some departed to inform Rāvana of the matter.

data.v: रावणस्य समीपे तु राक्षस्यो विकृताननाः । विरूपं वानरं भीममाख्यातुमुपचक्रमुः ।।
data.es: The uglyfaced ogresses went to the presence of Ravana and reported about the frightening form of the vanara.
data.anv: विकृताननाः uglyfaced, राक्षस्यः shedemons, रावणस्य to Ravana, समीपे presence, विरूपम्  disfigured, भीमम् frightening, वानरम् vanara, आख्यातुम् to report, उपचक्रमुः started.
data.md: And before Rāvana, the Rākṣasīs of deformed visage informed him of the hideous and dreadful monkey.

data.v: अशोकवनिका मध्ये राजन्भीमवपुः कपिः । सीतया कृतसंवादस्तिष्ठत्यमितविक्रमः ।।
data.es: "Your majesty an extremely powerful and frightening Vanara had a dialogue with Sita. He is stationed in the midst of Ashoka garden.
data.anv: राजन् O king, सीतया with Sita, कृतसंवादः had a dialogue, भीमवपुः fearsome figure, अमितविक्रमः very powerful, कपिः vanara, अशोकवनिकामध्ये in the midst of Ashoka garden, तिष्ठति is stationed.
data.md: O king, in the heart of the aśoka wood there is a monkey of a terrific body, who, possessed of immeasurable might, stay, after having carried on a conversation with Jānakī.

data.v: न च तं जानकी सीता हरिं हरिणलोचणा । अस्माभिर्बहुधा पृष्टा निवेदयितुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: "The deereyed Sita is not willing to disclose to us his identity even when we questioned her.
data.anv: हरिणलोचना deereyed, जानकी Janaki, सीता Sita, अस्माभिः by us, पृष्टा questioned, तम् about him, निवेदयितुम् to disclose, न इच्छति not willing.
data.md: Nor, albeit questioned by us many a time and oft, dose Janaka's daughter, Sītā, having the eyes of a deer, intend to tell us who the monkey is.

data.v: वासवस्य भवेद्दूतो दूतो वैश्रवणस्य वा । प्रेषितो वापि रामेण सीतान्वेषणकाङ्क्षया ।।
data.es: "He may be an envoy of Indra or Kubera or of Rama sent with an intent to trace Sita.
data.anv: वासवस्य Vasava's, दूतः envoy, वैश्रवणस्य Vaisravana's, दूतो वा is he an envoy, सीतान्वेषणकाङ्क्षया or one who has come to trace Sita, रामेण by Rama, प्रेषितो वापि or sent, भवेत् may be.
data.md: He may be the emissary of Vāsava, or of Vaiśravaņa; or he may have been sent by Rāma himself from eagerness to get at the whereabouts of Sita.

data.v: तेन त्वद्भूतरूपेण यत्तत्तव मनोहरम् । नानामृगगणाकीर्णं प्रमृष्टं प्रमदावनम् ।।
data.es: "Your beautiful pleasure garden filled with a variety of beasts has been ruined by this wonderful figure.
data.anv: अद्भुतरूपेण by a person of wonderful form, तेन  by him, मनोहरम् delightful, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् filled with various kinds of animals, यत् such, तव your, प्रमदावनम् beautiful pleasure garden, प्रमृष्टम् ruined.
data.md: And he it is that, wearing a wonderful form, has destroyed your charming arbour of the interior, filled with beasts of various kinds-And quarter there is none which has not been destroyer by him; and only that place where the exalted Jänakī is, remain uninjured by him.

data.v: न तत्र कश्चिदुद्देशो यस्तेन न विनाशितः । यत्र सा जानकी सीता स तेन न विनाशितः ।।
data.es: There is not a single place that has not been ruined by him there. Only the place where Janaka's daughter, Sita is resting has not been touched.
data.anv: तेन by him, यः whichever, न विनाशितः not ruined, उद्देशः place, तत्र there, कश्चित् even one, न not, सा that, जानकी Janaki, सीता Sita, यत्र wherever, सः that place, तेन by him, न विनाशितः not ruined.
data.md: And he it is that, wearing a wonderful form, has destroyed your charming arbour of the interior, filled with beasts of various kinds-And quarter there is none which has not been destroyer by him; and only that place where the exalted Jänakī is, remain uninjured by him.

data.v: जानकीरक्षणार्थं वा श्रमाद्वा नोपलभ्यते । अथ वा कः श्रमस्तस्य सैव तेनाभिरक्षिता ।।
data.es: "It is not clear whether he spared that place for protecting Janakai or he stopped due to exhaustion. What is fatigue for him? It must be to save her that she is spared by him.
data.anv: जानकीरक्षणार्थं वा is it to protect Janaki, श्रमाद्वा or is it because he was tired, नोपलभ्यते we are not able to understand, अथवा or else, तस्य his, श्रमः tiresomeness, कः what, तेन by him, सैव she alone, अभिरक्षिता is spared.
data.md: Whether for preserving Jānakī, or from fatigue—it dose not appear. But what is his fatigue? She it is that has been preserved by him.

data.v: चारुपल्लवपत्राढ्यं यं सीता स्वयमास्थिता । प्रवृद्धः शिंशपावृक्षः स च तेनाभिरक्षितः ।।
data.es: "He has spared the simsupa tree with lovely, tender leaves and flowers which is a chosen resort by Sita.
data.anv: सीता Sita, चारुपल्लवपुष्पाढ्यम् a tree with lovely tender leaves and flowers, यम् whom, स्वयम् personally, आस्थिता she resorted, सः that, प्रवृद्धः large, शिंशुपावृक्षः simsupa tree, तेन by him, अभिरक्षितः is saved from destruction.
data.md: And that overgrown Sinsapă tree, affluent with elegant foliage, under which Sītā herself has (always rested), has been spared by him.

data.v: तस्योग्ररूपस्योग्रं त्वं दण्डमाज्ञातुमर्हसि । सीता संभाषिता येन तद्वनं च विनाशितम् ।।
data.es: "Your highness should take severe action on that person of fierce appearance with whom Sita dared to speak, and by whom the garden is ruined.
data.anv: येन whomsoever, सीता Sita, सम्भाषिता had dialogue, तत् वनं च that garden also, विनाशितम् has been ruined, तस्य his, उग्ररूपस्य of a fierce form, त्वम् you, उग्रम् severe, दण्डम् punishment, आज्ञातुम् to order, अर्हसि is proper
data.md: It behove you to order sharp chastisement to be inflicted on that one of a fierce form, who, having carried on converse with Sītā, has laid your wood waste. Who, O Sovereign of the Rākşasas, that has not his life served from him, converse with Sītā, who has captivated your heart?"

data.v: मनःपरिगृहीतां तां तव रक्षोगणेश्वर । कः सीतामभिभाषेत यो न स्यात्त्यक्तजीवितः ।।
data.es: "O lord of the demon clan Who dares to talk to Sita if he has not given up all hope of life, since she is desired by you".
data.anv: रक्षोगणेश्वर O lord of the demon clan, मनः परिगृहीताम् one who is desired by you, तां सीताम् that Sita, यः whoever, त्यक्तजीवितः given up hope of life, न स्यात् if not, कः who, अभिभाषेत he will dare to talk.
data.md: It behove you to order sharp chastisement to be inflicted on that one of a fierce form, who, having carried on converse with Sītā, has laid your wood waste. Who, O Sovereign of the Rākşasas, that has not his life served from him, converse with Sītā, who has captivated your heart?"

data.v: राक्षसीनां वचः श्रुत्वा रावणो राक्षसेश्वरः । हुतागिरिव जज्वाल कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः ।।
data.es: On listening to the report of the ogresses, Ravana, the lord of demons flared up like blazing flame of a sacrificial fire, his eyeballs rolling in rage.
data.anv: राक्षसेश्वरः lord of ogres, रावणः Ravana, राक्षसीनाम् shedemons, वचः words, श्रुत्वा after hearing, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः his eyeballs rolling in anger, हुताग्निरिव like sacrificial fire into which offering is made,जज्वाल flared.
data.md: Hearing the speeches of the Rākṣasīs, Rāvaņa, lord of Raksasas, with his eyes rolling in rage, flamed up like the fire of a funeral pyre.

data.v: आत्मनः सदृशाञ्शूरान्किंकरान्नाम राक्षसान् । व्यादिदेश महातेजा निग्रहार्थं हनूमतः ।।
data.es: Then powerful Ravana commanded heroic demons called kinkaras who vied in strength to catch Hanuman.
data.anv: महातेजाः powerful, हनूमतः Hanuman's, निग्रहार्थम् to catch, आत्मनः his, सदृशान् equals, शूरान् heroes, किङ्करान्नाम called kinkaras, राक्षसान् demons, व्यादिदेश commanded.
data.md: And that highly energetic one ordered his heroic servants, resembling himself, to punish Hanuman.

data.v: तेषामशीतिसाहस्रं किंकराणां तरस्विनाम् । निर्ययुर्भवनात्तस्मात्कूटमुद्गरपाणयः ।।
data.es: Eighty thousand powerful kinkaras (a clan of demons), largebellied, with large teeth and of dreadful appearance, swift in action, armed with hammers and clubs marched from there, resolved to capture Hanuman.
data.anv: तरस्विनाम् of swiftmoving ones, तेषां किङ्कराणाम् of the kinkaras, अशीतिसाहस्रम् eighty thousand, महोदराः largebellied, महादंष्ट्राः largetoothed, घोररूपाः dreadfullooking, महाबलाः powerful, युद्धाभिमनसः ready to fight in war, सर्वे all, कूटमुद्गरपाणयः hammers and clubs, हनुमद्ग्रहणोद्यताः resolved to capture Hanuman, तस्मात् from that, भवनात् building, निर्ययुः came out.
data.md: And from that mansion speedily issued eighty thousand of those retainers, carrying in their hands maces and mallets. (Kūța-hammer. The commentator, however, says that it means a weapon resembling a hammer.)

data.v: महोदरा महादंष्ट्रा घोररूपा महाबलाः । युद्धाभिमनसः सर्वे हनूमद्ग्रहणोन्मुखाः ।।
data.es: Eighty thousand powerful kinkaras (a clan of demons), largebellied, with large teeth and of dreadful appearance, swift in action, armed with hammers and clubs marched from there, resolved to capture Hanuman.
data.anv: तरस्विनाम् of swiftmoving ones, तेषां किङ्कराणाम् of the kinkaras, अशीतिसाहस्रम् eighty thousand, महोदराः largebellied, महादंष्ट्राः largetoothed, घोररूपाः dreadfullooking, महाबलाः powerful, युद्धाभिमनसः ready to fight in war, सर्वे all, कूटमुद्गरपाणयः hammers and clubs, हनुमद्ग्रहणोद्यताः resolved to capture Hanuman, तस्मात् from that, भवनात् building, निर्ययुः came out.
data.md: Having huge bellies, and large teeth, of dreadful form, and possessed of unwieldy strength, all eager to engage in the conflict and take Hanuman.

data.v: ते कपिं तं समासाद्य तोरणस्थमवस्थितम् । अभिपेतुर्महावेगाः पतङ्गा इव पावकम् ।।
data.es: The kinkaras rushed towards the leader of vanaras who stood near the archway like the moths rushing towards the flame.
data.anv: ते they, तोरणस्थम् near the archway, अवस्थितम् stood ready, कपीन्द्रम् leader of vanaras, समासाद्य having approached, महावेगाः swift ones, पतङ्गाः moths, पावकम् इव like rushing into the flame, अभिपेतुः rushed.
data.md: Having come near that monkey staying at the main entrance, those swelling spirits rushed on, even as insects rush into a flame.

data.v: ते गदाभिर्विचित्राभिः परिघैः काञ्चनाङ्गदैः । आजघ्नुर्वानरश्रेष्ठं शरैरादित्यसंनिभैः ।।
data.es: They assailed Hanuman with iron maces, crowbars edged with gold and shining arrows resembling the Sun.
data.anv: ते they, विचित्राभिः with wonderful ones, गदाभिः with iron maces, काञ्चनाङ्गदैः edged with gold, परिघैः with crowbars, आदित्यसन्निभैः resembling the Sun, शरैश्च with arrows, वानरश्रेष्ठम् best of vanaras, आजघ्नुः assailed.
data.md: And equipped with variegated maces, and bludgeons, and golden Angadas, (A bracelet worn on the upper arm) and arrows resembling the Sun, they approached that foremost of monkeys.

data.v: हनूमानपि तेजस्वी श्रीमान्पर्वतसंनिभः । क्षितावाविध्य लाङ्गूलं ननाद च महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: Gigantic Hanuman, illustrious and brilliant, roared and waved his tail striking it with force on the ground causing loud sound.
data.anv: तेजस्वी brilliant, श्रीमान् illustrious one, पर्वतसन्निभः resembling a mountain, हनुमानपि Hanuman also, लाङ्गूलम् tail, क्षितौ on the ground, आविध्य waved, महास्वनम् causing loud sound, ननाद च roared.
data.md: And the graceful and energetic Hanumān also, resembling a hill, flourishing his tail over the ground, sent up tremendous roars.

data.v: तस्य संनादशब्देन तेऽभवन्भयशङ्किताः । ददृशुश्च हनूमन्तं संध्यामेघमिवोन्नतम् ।।
data.es: Terrified on hearing the roar, the kinkaras looked at the towering Hanuman who seemed like a cloud in twilight (red in colour).
data.anv: ते they, तस्य his, सन्नादशब्देन with the sound of hearing, भयशङ्किता: errified, अभवन् seemed, सन्ध्यामेघमिव like a cloud in twilight, उन्नतम् towering, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, ददृशुश्च saw.
data.md: They were struck with affright at his roars; and they beheld Hanumān elevated as an evening cloud.

data.v: स्वामिसंदेशनिःशङ्कास्ततस्ते राक्षसाः कपिम् । चित्रैः प्रहरणैर्भीमैरभिपेतुस्ततस्ततः ।।
data.es: Obeying their king's commnad, putting aside their fear, the kinkaras freely attacked the vanara from all directions with dreadful weapons.
data.anv: ततः then, ते they, राक्षसाः demons, स्वामिसन्देशनिःशङ्का: on account the king's command putting aside their fear, चित्रैः with dreadful, प्रहरणैः with weapons, कपिम् the vanara, अभिपेतुः attacked him.
data.md: And now knowing for certain that the monkey had been despatched by his master, the Rākṣasas commenced assailing him with various kinds of dire arms.

data.v: स तैः परिवृतः शूरैः सर्वतः स महाबलः । आससादायसं भीमं परिघं तोरणाश्रितम् ।।
data.es: Extremely powerful Hanuman surrounded by heroes all over, on his part went to the archway and picked up a terrific iron beam.
data.anv: सुमहाबलः exceesively powerful one, सः he, Hanuman, शूरैः with heroes, तैः with those, सर्वतः all over, परिवृतः surrounded, तोरणाश्रितम् near the  archway, भीमम् terrific, आयसम् a weapon made of iron, परिघम् iron beam, आससाद picked up.
data.md: Environed on all sides by those heroes, that exceedingly powerful one, staying by the main entrance, look up a terrific bolt.

data.v: स तं परिघमादाय जघान रजनीचरान् ।।
स पन्नगमिवादाय स्फुरन्तं विनतासुतः । विचचाराम्बरे वीरः परिगृह्य च मारुतिः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the mighty hero, seized the iron beam and struck the kinkaras, just as Garuda, the son of Vinata shoots up a struggling serpent and starts taking strides in the sky with the weapon in his hand (like Indra with his thunderbolt did with demons).
data.anv: सः he, तं परिघम् that iron beam, आदाय took hold, रजनीचरान् nightrangers, जघान struck them, वीरः hero, सः मारुतिः that Maruti, विनतासुतः just as Vinatha's son, स्फुरन्तम् shoots, पन्नगम् serpent, आदाय seized, परिगृह्य took hold, अम्बरे in the sky, विचचार started moving.

data.v: स हत्वा राक्षसान्वीरः किंकरान्मारुतात्मजः । युद्धाकाङ्क्षी पुनर्वीरस्तोरणं समुपस्थितः ।।
data.es: The great Windgod's son killed the kinkaras, and returned to the archway desiring further combat.
data.anv: वीरः hero, सः मारुतात्मजः that Windgod's son, वीरान् heroes, किङ्करान् kinkaras, राक्षसान् ogres, हत्वा having killed, पुनः again, युद्धाकाङ्क्षी desiring further combat, तोरणम् archway, समुपाश्रितः reached.
data.md: And having slain those Rākṣasas, who where the retainers of Rāvaņa, the heroic offspring of the Wind-god-foremost of heroes-desirous of fight, stood at the gate.

data.v: ततस्तस्माद्भयान्मुक्ताः कतिचित्तत्र राक्षसाः । निहतान्किंकरान्सर्वान्रावणाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.es: Then a few surviving ogres took to their heels after getting over that shock and reported to Ravana of the destruction of the kinkaras in the combat
data.anv: ततः then, तत्र that, तस्मात् from fear, भयात् out of fear, मुक्ताः relieved, कतिचित् some, राक्षसाः ogres, सर्वान् all, किङ्करान् kinkaras, निहतान् killed, रावणाय to Ravana, न्यवेदयन् reported.
data.md: Then certain Räkşasas, getting off from the field in fear, informed Rāvana of the destruction of all his servants.

data.v: स राक्षसानां निहतं महाबलं; निशम्य राजा परिवृत्तलोचनः । समादिदेशाप्रतिमं पराक्रमे; प्रहस्तपुत्रं समरे सुदुर्जयम् ।।
data.es: The mighty demon king having heard about the killing of the formidable army of ogres, his eyes rolling in rage, commanded the son of Prahasta, who is difficult to conquer and matchless in war.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे द्विचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysecond sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: स he, राजा king, राक्षसानाम् of ogres, महत् mighty, बलम् army, निहतम् killed, निशम्य after hearing, परिवृत्तलोचनः with his eyes rolling, पराक्रमे in valour, अप्रतिमम् matchless, समरे in war, सुदुर्जयम् difficult to conquer, प्रहस्तपुत्रम् son of Prahasta, समादिदेश commanded.
data.md: Hearing that a mighty host of the Rākṣasas had been slain, the king, with his eyes whirling in ire, ordered Prahasta's son of incomparable prowess, and invincible in battle.

data.v: ततः स किंकरान्हत्वा हनूमान्ध्यानमास्थितः । वनं भग्नं मया चैत्यप्रासादो न विनाशितः । तस्मात्प्रासादमप्येवमिमं विध्वंसयाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: Having slain the kinkaras, Hanuman stood and reflected, ' I have ruined the garden and not the palatial buildings that are like temples (Chaityas)'. Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided in his mind to show his strength and jumped on to the top of the palatial building that appeared like the peak of mount Meru.
data.md: Having slaughtered the servants, Hanumān, having reflected awhile, thought, “I have broken down the wood; but have not destroyed the edifice dedicated to the deities of the Rākşasas.”

data.v: इति संचिन्त्य हनुमान्मनसा दर्शयन्बलम् । चैत्यप्रासादमाप्लुत्य मेरुशृङ्गमिवोन्नतम् । आरुरोह हरिश्रेष्ठो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Having slain the kinkaras, Hanuman stood and reflected, ' I have ruined the garden and not the palatial buildings that are like temples (Chaityas)'. Then Hanuman, son of the Windgod, decided in his mind to show his strength and jumped on to the top of the palatial building that appeared like the peak of mount Meru.
data.anv: ततः then, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, किङ्करान् kinkaras, हत्त्वा having slain, ध्यानम् reflected, आस्थितः resumed, मया by me, वनम् garden, भग्नम् destroyed, चैत्यप्रासादः the Chaitya palace, न विनाशितः not ruined, तस्मात् therefore, अद्य now, अहम् I, भीमम् fearsome, प्रासादम् building, एवम् in this way, विध्वंसयामि I will destroy, कपिश्रेष्ठः foremost of vanaras, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, मनसा in his mind, इति thus, सञ्चिन्त्य thinking, बलम् strength, दर्शयन्  showed, मेरुशृङ्गमिव like the peak of mount Meru, उन्नतम् tall, चैत्यप्रासादम् Chaitya palace, उत्ल्पुत्य jumped, आरुरोह climbed
data.md: Therefore, this very day will I demolish this structure. Hanumān, son to the Wind-god, foremost of monkeys, Hanumān, son to the Wind-god, displaying his strength, bounded to the Caitya (A building designed for deities) building, elevated like a summit of Meru.

data.v: संप्रधृष्य च दुर्धर्षश्चैत्यप्रासादमुन्नतम् । हनूमान्प्रज्वलँल्लक्ष्म्या पारियात्रोपमोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: Having destroyed the fine palace building, the indomitable Hanuman was blazing with glory like the mountain Pariyatra. (one of the seven Kula mountains viz., Mahendra, Malaya, Sahya, Shuktiman, Riksha, Vindhya and Pariyatra)
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, दुर्धर्षम् indomitable, उत्तमम् fine, चैत्यप्रासादम् palace building, सम्प्रधृष्य च  having surrounded लक्ष्म्या with glory, प्रज्वलन् blazing, पारियात्रोपमः like mountain Pariyatra, अभवत् appeared
data.md: Having broken down that superb edifice, the irrepressible Hanuman, flaming in auspiciousness, resembled (the mountain) Pāriyatra.

data.v: स भूत्वा तु महाकायो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । धृष्टमास्फोटयामास लङ्कां शब्देन पूरयन् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, son of Maruti, enlarged his body to a huge size and patted himself wildly making loud noise that echoed the entire Lanka.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः Maruti's son, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, सुमहाकायः with a huge body, भूत्वा assuming, शब्देन by the sound, लङ्काम् entire Lanka, पूरयन् echoed, धृष्टम् wildly, अस्फोटयामास patted.
data.md: And attaining mighty proportions, Hanumān, son to the Wind-god, brandished his tail, filling Lankā with sounds.

data.v: तस्यास्फोटितशब्देन महता श्रोत्रघातिना । पेतुर्विहंगा गगनादुच्चैश्चेदमघोषयत् ।।
data.es: By the highly frightening sound caused by Hanuman patting, the birds from the sky fell down making a loud noise and Hanuman proclaimed in a loud voice as follows:
data.anv: सानुनादिना by the frightening echoing sound, महता with great, तस्य his, अस्फोटितशब्देन by the sound of the patting, विहङ्गाः birds, गगनात् from the sky, पेतुः fell down, उच्चैः with a loud noise, इदम् thus, अघोषयत् च proclaimed.
data.md: At the sounds of his flourishing, as well as with those resounding ones set up by himself, birds began to drop down from the sky.

data.v: जयत्यतिबलो रामो लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः । राजा जयति सुग्रीवो राघवेणाभिपालितः ।।
data.es: "Victory to Rama, the mighty and powerful, Victory to Lakshmana. Victory to king Sugriva who is ruled by Rama."
data.anv: अतिबलः mighty, रामः Rama, जयति is victorious, महाबलः powerful, लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also, राघवेण by Rama, अभिपालितः ruled, राजा king, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, जयति is victorious.

data.v: दासोऽहं कोसलेन्द्रस्य रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । हनुमाञ्शत्रुसैन्यानां निहन्ता मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: "I, son of the Windgod, destroyer of hostile armies, am a servant of Rama, the lord of Kosala kingdom, a man of unwearied action.
data.anv: शत्रुसैन्यानाम् of the enemy army, निहन्ता killer, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, अहम् I am, कोसलेन्द्रस्य of the lord of Kosala kingdom, अक्लिष्टकर्मणः a man of unwearied action, रामस्य Rama's, दासः servant.

data.v: न रावणसहस्रं मे युद्धे प्रतिबलं भवेत् । शिलाभिस्तु प्रहरतः पादपैश्च सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: Even a thousand Ravanas will not match me in strength when I pound stones and trees in a thousand ways.
data.anv: सहस्रशः a thousand ways, शिलाभिः with stones, पादपैश्च with even trees, प्रहरतः while I pound, मे to me, युद्धे in war, रावणसहस्रम् a thousand Ravanas, प्रतिबलम् match in strength, न भवेत् will not.

data.v: अर्दयित्वा पुरीं लङ्कामभिवाद्य च मैथिलीम् । समृद्धार्थो गमिष्यामि मिषतां सर्वरक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: "I shall destroy the city of Lanka and pay my respects to Mythili right under the nose of all demons. I will return with my purpose accomplished.
data.anv: सर्वरक्षसाम् all ogres, मिषताम् as they gaze, लङ्कां पुरीम् city of Lanka, अर्दयित्वा shall destroy, मैथिलीम् to Mythili, अभिवाद्य च and pay respects, समृद्धार्थः having accomplished my purpose, गमिष्यामि I will return.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा विमानस्थश्चैत्यस्थान्हरिपुंगवः । ननाद भीमनिर्ह्रादो रक्षसां जनयन्भयम् ।।
data.es: Having made proclamations that way from the top of the Vimana (palace) the monkey leader roared making terrific sound frightening the ogres.
data.anv: हरियूथपः monkey leader, विमानस्थः standing on the vimana, चैत्यस्थान् of the palace, एवम् that way, उक्त्वा having said, भीमनिर्ह्रादः making terrific sound, रक्षसाम् to the ogres, भयम् fear, जनयन् while creating, ननाद roared.
data.md: Having spoken thus, that one of a prodigious person, seated on the Caitya, emitted tremendous roars, striking terror into the Raksasa.

data.v: तेन शब्देन महता चैत्यपालाः शतं ययुः । गृहीत्वा विविधानस्त्रान्प्रासान्खड्गान्परश्वधान् । विसृजन्तो महाक्षया मारुतिं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: Hearing the terrific sound, a hundred gigantic guards of the palace set forth, holding different kinds of weapons like darts, swords and axes and hurled at Maruti surrounding him.
data.anv: महता with terrific, तेन शब्देन by that sound, शतम् hundred, चैत्यपालाः guards of the palace, विविधान् many, अस्त्रान् weapons, प्रासान् darts, खङ्गान् swords, परश्वथान् axes, गृहीत्वा after picking, ययुः marked, महाकायाः those of huge bodies, विसृजन्तः hurling, मारुतिम् Maruti, पर्यवारयन् surrounded.
data.md: In consequence of that mighty cry, an hundred guards attached to the Caitya sallied out, taking various weapons-bearded darts, scimitars and axes; and they surrounded the Wind-god's offspring, as he went on increasing his body.

data.v: आवर्त इव गङ्गायास्तोयस्य विपुलो महान् । परिक्षिप्य हरिश्रेष्ठं स बभौ रक्षसां गणः ।।
data.es: The demons surrounding the great monkey looked like a big whirlpool of the water of the river Ganga.
data.anv: सः that, रक्षसां गणः horde of ogres, हरिश्रेष्ठम् best of vanaras, परिक्षिप्य having surrounded, गङ्गायाः of the river Ganga, तोयस्य of the water, महान् huge, विपुलः big, आवर्त इव like a whirlpool, बभौ looked.
data.md: Those numbers of Rākşasa, encountering that best of monkeys, resumbled an extensive and mighty whirlpool in the Gangā.

data.v: ततो वातात्मजः क्रुद्धो भीमरूपं समास्थितः ।।
प्रासादस्य महांस्तस्य स्तम्भं हेमपरिष्कृतम् । उत्पाटयित्वा वेगेन हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । ततस्तं भ्रामयामास शतधारं महाबलः ।।
data.es: Thereupon the infuriated son of the Windgod, assumed a fearsome form, uprooted a pillar of the palace decked with gold and holding that hundred edged pillar whirled it round swiftly.
data.anv: ततः then, वातात्मज son of the Windgod, क्रुद्धः infuriated, भीमम् fearsome, रूपम् form, समास्थितः assumed, महान् great, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, महाबलः mighty, हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्य प्रासादस्य of that palace, हेमपरिष्कृतम् decked with gold, स्तम्भं pillar, उत्पाटयित्वा uprooted, ततः then, शतधारम् holding a hundred edged, तम् that, वेगेन swiftly, भ्रामयामास whirled round.
data.md: Thereat, the Wind-god's son, the mighty Hanumān, (Mārutatmaja-son to the Wind-god, left out on the score of redundency) waxing enraged, violently uprooting a huge pillar of the edifice, plated with gold, and having an hundred borders, began to whirl it (in the air). (The reader is powerfully reminded of a like feat of Manoah's son-'the Herculean Samson') And the fire generated there thus, burnt down the entire edifice.

data.v: स राक्षसशतं हत्वा वज्रेणेन्द्र इवासुरान् । अन्तरिक्षस्थितः श्रीमानिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Glorious and mighty Hanuman quickly went into her mouth and got out and stood in the sky and said:.
data.anv: श्रीमान् glorious one, महाबलः mighty, सः he, आशु immediatly, तद्वक्त्रम् her mouth, अभिपत्य got in, निष्पत्य च and got out, अन्तरिक्षे in the sky, स्थितः stood, इदम् this, वचनम् word, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: मादृशानां सहस्राणि विसृष्टानि महात्मनाम् । बलिनां वानरेन्द्राणां सुग्रीववशवर्तिनाम् ।।
data.es: "Thousands of huge and mighty monkeys, equal to me, loyal to king Sugriva, are coming under the orders and have been recruited from the entire earth. They are the best among monkeys.
data.anv: महात्मनाम् huge, बलिनाम् of mighty, सुग्रीववशवर्तिनाम् of those loyal to Sugriva, मादृशानाम् of people like me, वानरेन्द्राणाम् of the best of  vanara leaders, सहस्राणि in thousands, विसृष्टानि are despatched, वयम् we, अन्ये others, वानराश्च and vanaras, कृत्स्नाम् entire, वसुधाम् the earth, अटन्ति we are wandering.
data.md: Thousands of strong, high-souled and foremost monkeys like myself, having been created, and remaining under the command of Sugriva, including ourselves as well as other monkeys—are ranging all over the world.

data.v: शतैः शतसहस्रैश्च कोटीभिरयुतैरपि । आगमिष्यति सुग्रीवः सर्वेषां वो निषूदनः ।।
data.es: "Sugriva will come here with hundreds of thousands of crores of vanaras who would be fighting with their teeth and nails as weapons.
data.anv: ईद्दृग्विधैः endowed with such warriors, दन्त अपितु नखायुधै: by those using teeth and nails as weapons, शतैः in hundreds, अयुतैः in ayuta (ten thousand), शतसहस्रैः a hundred thousand, कोटीभिः in crores, हरिभिः with vanaras also, वृतः surrounded, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, सर्वेषाम् of all of them, वः you, निषूदनः killer, आगमिष्यति would come here.
data.md: Surrounded with monkeys of this sort, having nails and teeth for their arms, in hundreds and thousands and koțis and ayutas, come our Sugrīva, the slayer of all (foes).

data.v: नेयमस्ति पुरी लङ्का न यूयं न च रावणः । यस्मादिक्ष्वाकुनाथेन बद्धं वैरं महात्मना ।।
data.es: "You have established great enmity with the noble lord of Ikshvaku dynasty. Neither this Lanka will endure nor you, nor even Ravana will be traced.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे त्रिचत्वारिशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortythird sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: यस्मात् since, महात्मना with great self, इक्ष्वाकुनाथेन with the lord of Ikshvaku dynasty, वैरम् enmity, बद्धम् is bound, इयम् this, लङ्कापुरी city of Lanka, नास्ति will not be found, यूयम् even you, न not, रावणः च and Ravana, न also.
data.md: Neither this city of Lanka, nor you, nor yet Rāvaņa, shall exist, having created hostility with that high-souled hero of the Ikşvāku race.

data.v: संदिष्टो राक्षसेन्द्रेण प्रहस्तस्य सुतो बली । जम्बुमाली महादंष्ट्रो निर्जगाम धनुर्धरः ।।
data.md: Commanded by the lord of Rākṣasas, Prahasta's son, the powerful Jambumali, having large teeth, went out bow in hand.

data.v: रक्तमाल्याम्बरधरः स्रग्वी रुचिरकुण्डलः । महान्विवृत्तनयनश्चण्डः समरदुर्जयः ।।
data.md: He wore a red wreath and attire, with a rings; and he was huge, and terrible, with his eyes whirling, invincible in encounter.

data.v: धनुः शक्रधनुः प्रख्यं महद्रुचिरसायकम् । विस्फारयाणो वेगेन वज्राशनिसमस्वनम् ।।
data.md: He impetuously stretched a graceful bow, resembling the bow of Sakra, and roaring like vajra and the thounderbolt. (For distinction between the two, vide ante).

data.v: तस्य विस्फारघोषेण धनुषो महता दिशः । प्रदिशश्च नभश्चैव सहसा समपूर्यत ।।
data.es: All directions including the intermediate directions and the sky were filled with that loud sound produced by his twang.
data.anv: तस्य his, धनुषः bow's, महता by the huge, विष्फारघोषेण by the twang, दिशः all directions, प्रदिशश्चैव and intermediate directions, नभश्चैव heavens also, सहसा at once, समपूर्यत were filled.
data.md: The entire welkin, and all sides and quarters, were suddenly filled with the mighty sounds of that bow as it was being stretched.

data.v: रथेन खरयुक्तेन तमागतमुदीक्ष्य सः । हनूमान्वेगसंपन्नो जहर्ष च ननाद च ।।
data.es: Seeing him coming in a chariot drawn by donkeys, Hanuman who was swift to act was glad (to have an opportunity to fight) and made a loud noise.
data.anv: खरयुक्तेन drawn by donkeys, रथेन by the chariot, आगतम् reached, तम् him, उदीक्षय after seeing, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, वेगसम्पन्नः who was endowed with speed, जहर्ष च felt glad, ननाद च and made a loud noise.
data.md: Seeing him approaching in a car yoked with asses, Hanumān endowed with vigour both rejoiced and shouted.

data.v: तं तोरणविटङ्कस्थं हनूमन्तं महाकपिम् । जम्बुमाली महाबाहुर्विव्याध निशितैः शरैः ।।
data.es: Strongarmed Jambumali with his sharp arrows hit great Hanuman who stood on top of the exit archway.
data.anv: महाबाहुः strongarmed one, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, तोरणविटङ्कस्थम् who stood on top of the exit archway, महाकपिम् great monkey, तं हनुमन्तम् that Hanuman, निशितैः with sharp, शरैः with arrows, विव्याध hit hard.
data.md: Thereat, the highly energetic Jambumālī pierced with whetted shafts that mighty monkey, Hanumāna, who as seated on an awry plank at the gate serving as a perch for pigeons. (This is all that I can make of the commentator's gloss on toranavitanka.)

data.v: अर्धचन्द्रेण वदने शिरस्येकेन कर्णिना । बाह्वोर्विव्याध नाराचैर्दशभिस्तं कपीश्वरम् ।।
data.es: Jambumali released a crescentshaped arrow on the face, one earshaped (barbed) arrow on the head and ten iron arrows into the arms of the lord of monkeys.
data.anv: अर्धचन्द्रेण with a crescentshaped arrow, वदने on the face, एकेन with one, कर्णिना ear shaped arrow, शिरसि on the head, दशभिः ten, नाराचैः iron arrows, बाह्वोः into the arms, तं कपीश्वरम् that lord of monkeys, विव्याध hit.
data.md: He pierced that lord of monkey's face with half-moon (shaped) arrows, his head with one having its head made like a hook and his arms with ten nārācas. (Iron arrows).

data.v: तस्य तच्छुशुभे ताम्रं शरेणाभिहतं मुखम् । शरदीवाम्बुजं फुल्लं विद्धं भास्कररश्मिना ।।
data.es: His red face struck by an arrow appeared like a fullblown lotus in autumn season hit by the rays of the Sun.
data.anv: शरेण by an arrow, अभिहतम् struck, ताम्रम् reddish, तत् his, मुखम् face, शरदि in autumn, भास्करश्मिना with Sun's radiance, विद्धम् hit, फुल्लम् blown, अम्बुजमिव like a lotus, शुशुभे appeared.
data.md: And pierced by the arrows, his coppery face looked beautiful like a blown autumnal red lotus shot at by the solar rays.

data.v: चुकोप बाणाभिहतो राक्षसस्य महाकपिः । ततः पार्श्वेऽतिविपुलां ददर्श महतीं शिलाम् ।।
data.es: Struck by the shafts of the ogre, the great monkey was enraged and happened to see a huge, heavy rock lying beside him on the ground.
data.anv: बाणाभिहतः struck by the shafts, महाकपिः great monkey, राक्षसस्य of the demon, चुकोप enraged, ततः then, पार्श्वे lying beside, अतिविपुलाम् huge, महतीम् on the ground, शिलाम् rock, ददर्श he saw.

data.v: तरसा तां समुत्पाट्य चिक्षेप बलवद्बली । तां शरैर्दशभिः क्रुद्धस्ताडयामास राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman with all vehemence lifted the rock and hurled it at the giant which he angrily smashed with ten arrows.
data.anv: बली a powerful one, ताम् that boulder, तरसा with vehemence, समुत्पाट्य having lifted, बलवत् with his strength, चिक्षेप hurled, राक्षसः giant, क्रुद्धः angrily, ताम् that rock, दशभिः with ten, शरैः with arrows, ताडयामास smashed.

data.v: विपन्नं कर्म तद्दृष्ट्वा हनूमांश्चण्डविक्रमः । सालं विपुलमुत्पाट्य भ्रामयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, a strong, powerful and fierce warrior pulled out a sala tree and whirled it. Seeing that his attempt has failed.
data.anv: चण्डविक्रमः who had fierce power, वीर्यवान् a warrior, हनुमान् Hanuman, तत् that कर्म action, विपन्नम् failed, दृष्ट्वा seeing, विपुलम् huge, सालम् sala tree, उत्पाट्य pulled out, भ्रामयामास whirled.
data.md: And the enraged Rākṣasa opposed it by ten shafts. Witnessing his action rendered fruitless, the energetic Hanumān of terrific prowess, uprooting a large Sāla, began to whirl it in the air).

data.v: भ्रामयन्तं कपिं दृष्ट्वा सालवृक्षं महाबलम् । चिक्षेप सुबहून्बाणाञ्जम्बुमाली महाबलः ।।
data.es: Gigantic Jambumali seeing the mighty Hanuman whirling the sala tree fired many arrows at him.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, सालवृक्षम् sala tree, भ्रामयन्तम् after whirling, महाबलम् mighty, कपिम् monkey, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, सुबहून् many, बाणान् arrows, चिक्षेप fired.
data.md: Seeing the exceedingly strong monkey whirling the Sāla tree, the highly powerful Jambumālī dischanged a many shafts.

data.v: सालं चतुर्भिर्चिच्छेद वानरं पञ्चभिर्भुजे । उरस्येकेन बाणेन दशभिस्तु स्तनान्तरे ।।
data.es: He struck the sala tree with four arows, the arm of Hanuman with five arrows, chest with one, the hollow of the chest with ten more arrows.
data.anv: सालम् sala tree, चतुर्भिः with four, चिच्छेद cut off, वानरम् vanara, पञ्चभिः with five, भुजे on his arm, उरसि on his chest, एकेन बाणेन with one arrow, स्तनान्तरे in the hollow of the chest, दशभिः with ten.
data.md: He severed the Sāla by means of four shafts, and wounded the monkey in the arm with five, in the chest, with one, and with ten, between the teast.

data.v: स शरैः पूरिततनुः क्रोधेन महता वृतः । तमेव परिघं गृह्य भ्रामयामास वेगितः ।।
data.es: Hanuman filled with arrows all over his body, seized an iron spear (which he made use of in the initial battle) and impetuously spun it in intense anger.
data.anv: शरैः arrows, पूरिततनु: the body was filled, सः that, महता intense, क्रोधेन with anger, वृतः endowed, वेगितः speedily, तं परिघमेव the same iron spear, गृह्य seized, भ्रामयामास started whirling.
data.md: With his body covered all over with shafts, (Hanumān) getting into a furious passion, taking up the same bolt, again began to swing it with rapidity.

data.v: अतिवेगोऽतिवेगेन भ्रामयित्वा बलोत्कटः । परिघं पातयामास जम्बुमालेर्महोरसि ।।
data.es: Hanuman of immeasurable strength hurled the iron spear after turning it round and round at high speed on the broad chest of Jambumali.
data.anv: बलोत्कटः of immeasurable strength, अतिवेगः a hero of great speed, परिघम् iron spear, अतिवेगेन with great speed, भ्रामयित्वा after turning round and round, जम्बुमालेः on Jambumali, महोरसि on the broad chest, पातयामास hurled.
data.md: That terrific one gifted with exceeding impetuosity, having whirled the bolt with wondrous rapidity, let it light upon Jambumāli's spacious breast.

data.v: तस्य चैव शिरो नास्ति न बाहू न च जानुनी । न धनुर्न रथो नाश्वास्तत्रादृश्यन्त नेषवः ।।
data.es: Neither his head could be discerned nor his arms, knees, nor bow, chariot nor donkeys. Nothing was seen.
data.anv: तत्र there, तस्य his, शिरः चैव even head, नास्ति not there, बाहू shoulders, न not, जानुनी knees, न not, धनुः bow, न not, रथः chariot, न not, अश्वाः donkeys, horses, नादृश्यन्तः not there to discern, इषवः न nothing was seen.
data.md: And (non) there was neither seen there his head, nor his arms, nor his thighs, nor his bow, nor his car, nor his steeds, nor his arrows at that place.

data.v: स हतस्तरसा तेन जम्बुमाली महारथः । पपात निहतो भूमौ चूर्णिताङ्गविभूषणः ।।
data.es: Mighty Jambumali killed by that blow dropped down dead at once with his ornaments reduced to powder.
data.anv: तेन by that blow, हतः killed, महाबलः mighty, जम्बुमाली Jambumali, सहसा inconsiderately, निहतः having been killed, चूर्णिताङ्गविभूषणः with his ornaments reduced to powder, भूमौ on the floor, पपात fell down.
data.md: That mighty car-warrior, Jambumālī, speedily slain, fell down to the earth, like a tree whose trunk has been crushed.

data.v: जम्बुमालिं च निहतं किंकरांश्च महाबलान् । चुक्रोध रावणः श्रुत्वा कोपसंरक्तलोचनः ।।
data.es: Ravana's eyes became bloodshot in anger when he heard about the death of Jambumali and of the strong army of kinkaras.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, जम्बुमालिं च even Jambumali, निहतम् being klled, महाबलान् of great strength, किंकरांश्च and kinkaras also, श्रुत्वा hearing, कोपसंरक्तलोचनः bloodshot eyes, चुक्रोध got enraged.
data.md: Hearing Jambumāli as well as his exceedingly powerful servants slaughtered, Rāvana became transported with anger, and his eyes became reddened in wrath.

data.v: स रोषसंवर्तितताम्रलोचनः; प्रहस्तपुत्रे निहते महाबले । अमात्यपुत्रानतिवीर्यविक्रमा;न्समादिदेशाशु निशाचरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: When the mighty son of Prahasta was killed, infuriated Ravana, his eyes red and rolling, commanded the highly valiant sons of ministers.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे चतुश्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfourth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: महाबले who had great strength, प्रहस्तपुत्त्रे Prahasta's son, निहते killed, सः निशाचरेश्वरः demon king, रोषसंवर्तितताम्रलोचनः his eyes red and rolling in anger, आशु quickly, अतिवीर्यविक्रमान् highly valiant wariors, अमात्यपुत्रान् sons of ministers, समादिदेश commanded.
data.md: On the mighty-son of Prahasta having been slain, the lord of the night-rangers, with his reddened eyes rolling in rage, speedily commanded the of his counsellors, endowed with vast energy and prowess, (to encounter Hanumān in battle). sons

data.v: ततस्ते राक्षसेन्द्रेण चोदिता मन्त्रिणः सुताः । निर्ययुर्भवनात्तस्मात्सप्त सप्तार्चिवर्चसः ।।
data.md: Then ordered by the lord of Rākşasas, the sons of his counsellors, seven (in number) in splendour reseinbling fire, issued forth that mansion.

data.v: महाबलपरीवारा धनुष्मन्तो महाबलाः । कृतास्त्रास्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठाः परस्परजयैषिणः ।।
हेमजालपरिक्षिप्तैर्ध्वजवद्भिः पताकिभिः । तोयदस्वननिर्घोषैर्वाजियुक्तैर्महारथैः ।।
तप्तकाञ्चनचित्राणि चापान्यमितविक्रमाः । विस्फारयन्तः संहृष्टास्तडिद्वन्त इवाम्बुदाः ।।
जनन्यस्तास्ततस्तेषां विदित्वा किंकरान्हतान् । बभूवुः शोकसंभ्रान्ताः सबान्धवसुहृज्जनाः ।।
data.es: Their mothers and relatives and their friends were struck with grief when they learnt about the kinkaras killed.
data.anv: ततः then, तेषाम् their, सबान्धवसुहृज्जनाः with friends and relatives, जनन्यस्तु mothers, किंकरान् kinkaras, हतान् killed, विदित्वा having known, कसम्भ्रान्ताः were agitated with grief, बभूवुः became.

data.v: ते परस्परसंघर्षास्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाः । अभिपेतुर्हनूमन्तं तोरणस्थमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: The barnished golden ornaments worn by them were shining as they brushed shoulders with one another (eager to fight first) to attack Hanuman who stood waiting at the main archway.
data.anv: तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणाः barnished ornaments of gold, ते they, परस्परसङ्घर्षात् by dashing against each other, तोरणस्थम् at the main archway, अवस्थितम् stood, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, अभिपेतुः attacked.
data.md: And vieing with each other in eagerness, those (warriors) decked in ornaments of polished gold, confronted Hanumān staying at the gate.

data.v: सृजन्तो बाणवृष्टिं ते रथगर्जितनिःस्वनाः । वृष्टिमन्त इवाम्भोदा विचेरुर्नैरृतर्षभाः ।।
data.es: They went roaring with their chariots rattling, sending forth torrents of arrows like the stormy clouds thundering.
data.anv: रथगर्जितनिस्वनाः the rattling of the chariots mixed with the roaring of the warriors, ते they, नैऋताम्बुदाः the clouds of demons, बाणवृष्टिम् torrent of arrows, सृजन्तः sent forth, वृष्टिमन्तः thundering, अम्भोदाः इव like the storm clouds, विचेरुः went about.
data.md: And with their cars sending roars, the Rākşasas, pouring showers of shafts, ranged (the field), resembling clouds during the rainy season.

data.v: अवकीर्णस्ततस्ताभिर्हनूमाञ्शरवृष्टिभिः । अभवत्संवृताकारः शैलराडिव वृष्टिभिः ।।
data.es: Later, Hanuman covered with showers of arrows scattered all over appeared like the king of mountains shot with showers of rain.
data.anv: ततः then, ताभिः by them, शरवृष्टिभिः by the shower of arrows, अवकीर्णः scattered all over, हनुमान् Hanuman, वृष्टिभिः with shower of rain, संवृताकारः covered, शैलराडिव like the king of mountains, अभवत् appeared.
data.md: Covered with those arrowy showers, Hanuman had his person concealed, like the monarch of mountains hidden by a downpour.

data.v: स शरान्वञ्चयामास तेषामाशुचरः कपिः । रथवेगांश्च वीराणां विचरन्विमलेऽम्बरे ।।
data.es: Then the monkey moving fast in the clear sky rendered the arrows of the giant heroes and speeding chariots futile.
data.anv: आशुचरः moving fast, सः कपिः that monkey, विमले in the clear, अम्बरे  sky, विचरन् moving, तेषां वीराणाम् of the heroes, शरान् by the arrows, रथवेगं च and the speed of their chariot, मोघयामास rendered futile.
data.md: That swift-speeding monkey, coursing the cloudless sky, evaded those shafts of those heroes, as well as the impetuosity of their cars.

data.v: स तैः क्रीडन्धनुष्मद्भिर्व्योम्नि वीरः प्रकाशते । धनुष्मद्भिर्यथा मेघैर्मारुतः प्रभुरम्बरे ।।
data.es: Sporting in the sky with the giants who held bows in their hands, Hanuman shone like the powerful Windgod sporting in the sky surrrounded by rambling dark clouds.
data.anv: व्योम्नि in the sky, धनुष्मद्भिः with those bows in their hands, तैः by them, क्रीडन् while sporting, सः वीरः that hero, अम्बरे in the sky, धनुष्मद्भिः armed with rainbow, मेघैः by the clouds, प्रभुः god, मारुतः यथा like the wind, प्रकाशते shining.
data.md: That hero, playing pranks with those bowmen, appeared like the masterful Wind playing tricks with the bow-bearing clouds. (i.e. having the iris.)

data.v: स कृत्वा निनदं घोरं त्रासयंस्तां महाचमूम् । चकार हनुमान्वेगं तेषु रक्षःसु वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Valiant Hanuman making terrific sound and frightening the army of ogres marched swiftly.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् valiant one, सः he, घोरम् terrific, निनदम् sound, कृत्वा making, ताम् that, महाचमूम् great army, त्रासयन् frightening, तेषु रक्षस्सु those ogres, वेगम् speed, चकार created.
data.md: Sending up a dreadful shout, and thereby filling that vast host with fright, the energetic Hanumān rushed on that Rākşasa army.

data.v: तलेनाभिहनत्कांश्चित्पादैः कांश्चित्परंतपः । मुष्टिनाभ्यहनत्कांश्चिन्नखैः कांश्चिद्व्यदारयत् ।।
data.es: The scorcher of enemies, Hanuman hit some ogres with his palm, some with his feet and some with his fist and pierced some with his nails.
data.anv: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, कांश्चित् some, तलेन with palm, अभ्यहनत् hit, कांश्चित् some, पादैः with feet, कांश्चित् some, मुष्टिना with fist, अभ्यहनत् struck, कांश्चित् some, नखैः with nails, व्यदारयत् pierced .
data.md: That subduer of enemies slew some with slaps, and some he rived with nails, and some he killed by blows, and others with (the pressure of) his chest. And some dropped down on the ground at the very same spot at the sounds that he emitted.

data.v: प्रममाथोरसा कांश्चिदूरुभ्यामपरान्कपिः । केचित्तस्यैव नादेन तत्रैव पतिता भुवि ।।
data.es: The monkey strangled some with his chest and some between his thighs. A few fell down dead on the ground hearing his roaring noise.
data.anv: कपिः monkey, कांश्चित् some, उरसा with his chest, अपरान् and others, ऊरुभ्याम् with his thighs, प्रममाथ strangled, केचित् a few, तस्य his, निनादेन by the roar, तत्रैव there itself, भुवि on the ground, पतिताः fell down.

data.v: ततस्तेष्ववपन्नेषु भूमौ निपतितेषु च । तत्सैन्यमगमत्सर्वं दिशो दशभयार्दितम् ।।
data.es: Struck by fear on seeing Hanuman, the seven sons of ministers dropped down dead on the ground, and their army fled in all the ten directions.
data.anv: तेषु when they (sons of minister), अवसन्नेषु were annexed, भूमौ on the ground, निपतितेषु च when fallen dead on the ground, ततः then, सर्वम् all, तत् that, सैन्यम् army, भयार्दितम् struck with fear, दश दिशः in all ten directions, अगमत् fled.
data.md: And on their being slain or falling on the earth, that army, afflicted with affright, began to fly in all directions.

data.v: विनेदुर्विस्वरं नागा निपेतुर्भुवि वाजिनः । भग्ननीडध्वजच्छत्रैर्भूश्च कीर्णाभवद्रथैः ।।
data.es: The elephants trumpeted discordantly out of fear, the horses fell down on the ground and even the chariots with seats, parasols and flag staffs broken were strewn all over the ground.
data.anv: नागाः elephants, विस्वरम् discordantly, विनेदुः trumpeted in fear, वाजिनः horses, भुवि on ground, निपेतुः fell down, भूश्च the earth also, भग्ननीडध्वजच्छत्रैः with broken seats, parasols, flag staffs, रथैः by chariots, कीर्णा अभवत् strewn all over.
data.md: The elephants roared in frightful tones, and the steeds fell down on the earth. And the Earth was covered with broken boxes, flag-staffs, and umbrellas, (belonging to the cars), as also with the cars themselves.

data.v: स तान्प्रवृद्धान्विनिहत्य राक्षसा;न्महाबलश्चण्डपराक्रमः कपिः । युयुत्सुरन्यैः पुनरेव राक्षसै;स्तदेव वीरोऽभिजगाम तोरणम् ।।
data.es: Having killed the ogres who were old and strong, the valiant and mighty Hanuman, wishing to slay the other ogres advanced towards the archway.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चचत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वीरः hero, महाबलः mighty one, चण्डपराक्रमः whose valiance was fierce, सः कपिः that Hanuman, प्रवृद्धान् the ogres who were old and grew stronger, तान् राक्षसान् those gaints, विनिहृत्य slayed, अन्यैः others, राक्षसैः by ogres, युयुत्सुः desiring to wage war, पुनरेव once again, तम् that, तोरणमेव archway, अभिजगाम went forth.
data.md: Having slain those overgrown Rākşasas, that exceedingly powerful and heroic monkey of terrific power, desirous of again coping with other Rākşasas, retraced his steps to the selfsame entrance.

data.v: हतान्मन्त्रिसुतान्बुद्ध्वा वानरेण महात्मना । रावणः संवृताकारश्चकार मतिमुत्तमाम् ।।
data.es: Coming to know that the seven sons of the ministers were slain by the great vanara, Ravana, who had concealed his feelings of agony thought of a good plan.
data.anv: रावणः Ravana, महात्मना the great, वानरेण by the vanara, मन्त्रिसुतान् sons of the ministers, हतान् killed, बुद्द्वा knowing, संवृताकारः who had concealed his agony, उत्तमाम् good, मतिम् thought, चकार formulated.
data.md: Learning that the sons of the counsellors had been slain by the high-souled monkey, the Tennecked one suppressing the apprehension that was in his heart, restored the balance of his mind.

data.v: स विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ दुर्धरं चैव राक्षसं । प्रघसं भासकर्णं च पञ्चसेनाग्रनायकान् ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana, eager to capture Hanuman, commanded his five army Generals called Virupaksha, Yupaksha, Durdhara, Praghasa and Bhaskarna, who were great warriorstatesmen valiant and, equal to wind in speed.
data.anv: सः दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, वीरान् warriors, नयविशारदान् skilled in statecraft, हनुमद्ग्रहणव्यग्रान् eager to capture Hanuman, युथि in battle, वायुवेगसमान् equal to wind in speed, विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ Virupaksha and Yupaksha, दुर्धरम् Durdhara, राक्षसं चैव also a giant, प्रघसम् Praghasa, भासकर्णं च Bhaskarna and, सेनाग्रनायकान् army Generals पञ्च five,सन्दिदेश commanded.
data.md: He directed five of the foremost leaders of his forces, the heroic Virūpaksa Yupakşa, the Rāks asa Durdharsa, Praghasa, and Bhasakarma, versed in polity, endowed with the speed of the Wind in conflict and alert on every occasion, to take Hanumān captive.

data.v: संदिदेश दशग्रीवो वीरान्नयविशारदान् । हनूमद्ग्रहणे व्यग्रान्वायुवेगसमान्युधि ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana, eager to capture Hanuman, commanded his five army Generals called Virupaksha, Yupaksha, Durdhara, Praghasa and Bhaskarna, who were great warriorstatesmen valiant and, equal to wind in speed.
data.anv: सः दशग्रीवः the tenheaded Ravana, वीरान् warriors, नयविशारदान् skilled in statecraft, हनुमद्ग्रहणव्यग्रान् eager to capture Hanuman, युथि in battle, वायुवेगसमान् equal to wind in speed, विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ Virupaksha and Yupaksha, दुर्धरम् Durdhara, राक्षसं चैव also a giant, प्रघसम् Praghasa, भासकर्णं च Bhaskarna and, सेनाग्रनायकान् army Generals पञ्च five,सन्दिदेश commanded.
data.md: He directed five of the foremost leaders of his forces, the heroic Virūpaksa Yupakşa, the Rāks asa Durdharsa, Praghasa, and Bhasakarma, versed in polity, endowed with the speed of the Wind in conflict and alert on every occasion, to take Hanumān captive.

data.v: यात सेनाग्रगाः सर्वे महाबलपरिग्रहाः । सवाजिरथमातङ्गाः स कपिः शास्यतामिति ।।
data.es: "O Army generals march with a large, strong army with horses, chariots and elephants and punish the vanara.
data.anv: सेनाग्रगाः O Army generals, सर्वे all, महाबलपरिग्रहाः accompanied by large, strong army, सवाजिरथमातङ्गाः along with horses, chariots and elphants, यात march, सः कपिः that vanara, शास्यताम्  punish, इति thus.
data.md: You generals, do youtaking mighty host with steeds, elephants and cars, chastise that monkey.

data.v: यत्तैश्च खलु भाव्यं स्यात्तमासाद्य वनालयम् । कर्म चापि समाधेयं देशकालविरोधितम् ।।
data.es: "Go to that forestdweller and make all efforts to impose on him punishment appropriate to time and place (keeping in view the harm he has done).
data.anv: तम् him, वनालयम् a forestdweller, आसाद्य after reaching, यत्नैः च with all efforts, भाव्यम् should be engaged, देशकालाविरोधिनम् that which is not against time and space, कर्म चापि even action, समाधेयम् should be done.
data.md: And coming to that dweller of the woods, youhad better act heedfully, and should accomplish this work in consonance with place and season.

data.v: न ह्यहं तं कपिं मन्ये कर्मणा प्रतितर्कयन् । सर्वथा तन्महद्भूतं महाबलपरिग्रहम् । भवेदिन्द्रेण वा सृष्टमस्मदर्थं तपोबलात् ।।
data.es: "Judging again and again from all actions, I do not think he is an ordinary monkey. He is a being endowed with great strength.
data.anv: अहम् I, कर्मणा by his actions, प्रतितर्कयन् judging again and again,तम् him, कपिम् monkey, न मन्ये I do not think, सर्वथा by all its actions, तत् that, महाबलपरिग्रहम् endowed with great strength, महत् great, भूतम् a being.
data.md: Having regard to his acts, I do not take him to be a monkey. He is a great being endowed with extraordinary prowess every way.

data.v: सनागयक्षगन्धर्वा देवासुरमहर्षयः । युष्माभिः सहितैः सर्वैर्मया सह विनिर्जिताः ।।
तैरवश्यं विधातव्यं व्यलीकं किंचिदेव नः । तदेव नात्र संदेहः प्रसह्य परिगृह्यताम् ।।
नावमन्यो भवद्भिश्च हरिः क्रूरपराक्रमः । दृष्टा हि हरयः शीघ्रा मया विपुलविक्रमाः ।।
वाली च सह सुग्रीवो जाम्बवांश्च महाबलः । नीलः सेनापतिश्चैव ये चान्ये द्विविदादयः ।।
data.es: "Earlier I have seen monkeys of immense prowess, like Vali and Sugriva as well as Jambavan, the bear. Also I have seen the army general, Nila, Dvivida and others. They do not have such tremendous splendour or movement valour, intellect and strength and energy. They did not have such ability to change form at their will.
data.anv: पूर्वम् earlier, मया by me, विपुलविक्रमाः of immense prowess, हरयः monkeys, सहसुग्रीवः with Sugriva, वाली च and Vali, महाबलः mighty, जाम्बवांश्च and Jambavan, सेनापतिः army chief, नीलः Nila, द्विविदादयः Dvivida and others, अन्ये च and others, ये those, दृष्टाः हि have seen, तेषाम् for them, गतिः movement, एवम् that way, भीमा tremendous, न not, तेजः splendour, पराक्रमः valour, न not, मतिः intellect, न not, बलोत्साहौ strength and energy, रूपपरिकल्पनम् ability to change form at will.
data.md: This monkey of deliberate prowess should not be disregarded by you. I have seen (There is a word sighra, soon-in this Śloka, of which I fail to perceive the relation) monkeys of immense prowess, Vāli with Sugrīva and the exceedingly powerful Jāmbavāna, and Nīla the general, and others with Dwivida at their head.

data.v: नैव तेषां गतिर्भीमा न तेजो न पराक्रमः । न मतिर्न बलोत्साहो न रूपपरिकल्पनम् ।।
data.md: Their speed is not dreadful, nor their energy, nor their prowess, nor their intelligence, nor their strength, nor their courage, nor their capacity to change shapes.

data.v: महत्सत्त्वमिदं ज्ञेयं कपिरूपं व्यवस्थितम् । प्रयत्नं महदास्थाय क्रियतामस्य निग्रहः ।।
data.es: "It should be understood that he has taken the form of a monkey. You have to put in extraordinary effort to capture him by acting in a suitable manner.
data.anv: इदम् this, कपिरूपम् a monkey form, व्यवस्थितम् concluded, महत् great, सत्त्वम्  being, ज्ञेयम् It should be understood, महत् extraordinary, प्रयत्नम् effort, आस्थाय by putting up, अस्य his, निग्रहः capture, क्रियताम् do.
data.md: Therefore you should know him as some great being staying in the form of a monkey. Exerting yourself to the uttermost, do you chastise him.

data.v: कामं लोकास्त्रयः सेन्द्राः ससुरासुरमानवाः । भवतामग्रतः स्थातुं न पर्याप्ता रणाजिरे ।।
data.es: "Even Indra, suras, asuras and humans and the three worlds together are incompetent to stand before you in a battlefield.
data.anv: सेन्द्राः including Indra, ससुरासुरमानवाः suras, asuras and humans together, त्रयः all the three, लोकाः worlds, रणाजिरे in the battlefield, भवताम् your, अग्रतः in front, स्थातुम् to stand, न पर्याप्ताः not competent, कामम् indeed.
data.md: These three worlds combined, with Indra, celestials and mortals, are incapable of long staying before you in the field of battle.

data.v: तथापि तु नयज्ञेन जयमाकाङ्क्षता रणे । आत्मा रक्ष्यः प्रयत्नेन युद्धसिद्धिर्हि चञ्चला ।।
data.es: "Even then, you should safeguard yourself with great effort adopting warstrategies in an intelligent manner to be victorious, for success in war is uncertain.
data.anv: तथापि तु even then, रणे in a war, जयम् victory, आकाङ्क्षता while desiring, नयज्ञेन by carefully adopting war strategies in an intelligent manner, प्रयत्नेन making effort, आत्मा your own self, रक्ष्यः should be protected, युद्धसिद्धिः victory in war, चञ्चला हि is uncertain.
data.md: Still a person versed in polity, albeit anxious to secure victory in battle, should carefully preserve self, as success in war is unstable.

data.v: ते स्वामिवचनं सर्वे प्रतिगृह्य महौजसः । समुत्पेतुर्महावेगा हुताशसमतेजसः ।।
data.es: Taking King's order, the strong and swift warriors, resplendent as the flame of sacrificial fire sallied forth with their army on chariots, on the back of rutting elephants, some on swift horses equipped with sharp weapons of many kinds.
data.anv: महौजसः very strong, हुताशसमतेजसः resplendant as sacrificial fire, ते सर्वे all of them, स्वामिवचनम् king's words, प्रतिगृह्य accepting, महावेगाः who were swift, रथैः with chariots, मत्तै intoxicated, मातङ्गै: with elephants, महाजवैः of great speed, वाजिभिश्च with horses, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, विविधैः many kinds, शस्त्रै: with weapons, सर्वे all, बलैः strong army, उपचिताः collecting,समुत्पेतुः sallied forth together

data.v: रथैश्च मत्तैर्नागैश्च वाजिभिश्च महाजवैः । शस्त्रैश्च विविधैस्तीक्ष्णैः सर्वैश्चोपचिता बलैः ।।
data.es: Taking King's order, the strong and swift warriors, resplendent as the flame of sacrificial fire sallied forth with their army on chariots, on the back of rutting elephants, some on swift horses equipped with sharp weapons of many kinds.
data.anv: महौजसः very strong, हुताशसमतेजसः resplendant as sacrificial fire, ते सर्वे all of them, स्वामिवचनम् king's words, प्रतिगृह्य accepting, महावेगाः who were swift, रथैः with chariots, मत्तै intoxicated, मातङ्गै: with elephants, महाजवैः of great speed, वाजिभिश्च with horses, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, विविधैः many kinds, शस्त्रै: with weapons, सर्वे all, बलैः strong army, उपचिताः collecting,समुत्पेतुः sallied forth together
data.md: Thereupon, they, possessed of the energy of fire, accepting the words of their master, rushed forth vehemendy, accompanied with cars, mad elephants, fleet steeds, sharp and whetted weapons, and forces of all kinds.

data.v: ततस्तं ददृशुर्वीरा दीप्यमानं महाकपिम् । रश्मिमन्तमिवोद्यन्तं स्वतेजोरश्मिमालिनम् ।।
data.es: The heroic giants caught sight of the vanara, who was blazing encircled as though he was by the rays of his own glory, looking like the rising Sun. He was endowed with extraordinary agility, intelligence, and tremendous strength standing, waiting at the archway.
data.anv: ततः then, वीराः heroes, स्वतेजोरश्मिमालिनम् shining like the Sungod with his own effulgence, उद्यन्तम् a rising one, रश्मिमन्तमिव like the Sun, दीप्यमानम् shining, तोरणस्थम् standing at the archway, महोत्साहम् extraordinary agility, महासत्त्वम् intelligent,महाबलम् endowed with tremendous strength, तं महाकपिम् him the vanara, ददृशुः saw.
data.md: Then those heroes saw that effulgent mighty monkey, shining in his native splendour, like to the risen sun, possessed of great strength and immense speed, and magnanimity of mind, seated at the gate.

data.v: तोरणस्थं महावेगं महासत्त्वं महाबलम् । महामतिं महोत्साहं महाकायं महाबलम् ।।
तं समीक्ष्यैव ते सर्वे दिक्षु सर्वास्ववस्थिताः । तैस्तैः प्रहरणैर्भीमैरभिपेतुस्ततस्ततः ।।
data.es: Having observed the tremendous strength, intelligence and swiftness in action of Hanuman, the generals of the army positioned at all directions and assailed him with dreadful weapons.
data.anv: सर्वे all, महामतिम् highly intelligent, महावेगम् very swift, महाकायम् having a huge body, महाबलम् tremendous strength, तम् him, समीक्ष्यैव having observed, सर्वासु in all, दिक्षु directions, अवस्थिताः positioned, ततस्ततः here and there, भीमैः with dreadful, स्तैस्तै: with different, प्रहरणैः with weapons, अभिपेतुः attacked.
data.md: And soon as they saw him, they, frightened at his appearance, assailed him with their respective terrible weapons.

data.v: तस्य पञ्चायसास्तीक्ष्णाः सिताः पीतमुखाः शराः । शिरस्त्युत्पलपत्राभा दुर्धरेण निपातिताः ।।
data.es: Durdhara pierced into the head of Hanuman with five sharp arrows and polished steel shafts with yellow tips (gold) shining like red lotus petals. They were like petals of lilies thrown on the head of Hanuman (causing no pain).
data.anv: तीक्ष्णाः sharp, शिताः sharp, पीतमुखाः steel shafts with polished yellow tips (of gold), उत्पलपत्राभाः shining like petals of lilies, आयसाः steel shafts made of iron, पञ्च five, शराः arrows, दुर्धरेण by Durdhara, तस्य his, शिरसि  on his head, निपातिताः pierced.
data.md: And Durdhasa discharged at Hanumān's head five white iron (This may rather look an incongruous mixture of images; but the iron arrows may have been silvered over) arrows with yellow heads, and possessing the lustre of lotus-leaves.

data.v: स तैः पञ्चभिराविद्धः शरैः शिरसि वानरः । उत्पपात नदन्व्योम्नि दिशो दश विनादयन् ।।
data.es: With five arrows pierced in the head of the vanara, Hanuman leaped into the sky with terrible roar, which resounded in all the ten directions.
data.anv: वानरः vanara, तैः them, पञ्चभिः by those five, शरैः with arrows, शिरसि on the head, अविद्धः pierced in, नदन् roared, दशदिशः the ten directions, विनादयन् making a loud noise, व्योम्नि in the sky, उत्पपात leaped.
data.md: Having been pierced in the head with those shafts, the monkey, roaring, leapt into the sky inaking the ten cardinal points resound.

data.v: ततस्तु दुर्धरो वीरः सरथः सज्जकार्मुकः । किरञ्शरशतैर्नैकैरभिपेदे महाबलः ।।
data.es: Then the powerful, hero, Durdhara, mounted on his chariot, fastened his bowstring and hit Hanuman with hundreds of sharp arrows.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, महाबलः powerful, वीरः hero, दुर्धरः Durdhara, सरथः with his the chariot, सज्यकार्मुकः with his string fastened, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, शरशतैः hundreds of arrows, किरन् while hitting, अभिपेदे attacked.
data.md: Then the exceedingly powerful and heroic Durdhara mounted on a car, with his bow stringed, came forward showering innumerable arrows by hundreds.

data.v: स कपिर्वारयामास तं व्योम्नि शरवर्षिणम् । वृष्टिमन्तं पयोदान्ते पयोदमिव मारुतः ।।
data.es: The great monkey kept away the showering arrows like the wind prevents raincloud from showering rain drops at the end of monsoon.
data.anv: सः कपिः that vanara, व्योम्नि in the sky, शरवर्षिणम् showering of arrows, तम् on him, पयोदान्ते at the end of the rainy season, वृष्टिमन्तम् showering rain drops, पयोदम् a cloud, मारुतः इव like the wind, वारयामास prevented.
data.md: Thereat, even as the wind drive away rainpouring clouds at the end of the rainy season, the monkey, remaining in the sky, resisted (his antagonist) as he kept on pouring his shafts.

data.v: अर्द्यमानस्ततस्तेन दुर्धरेणानिलात्मजः । चकार निनदं भूयो व्यवर्धत च वेगवान् ।।
data.es: When the son of the Windgod was attacked by Durdhara, he again grew in size
data.anv: तेन by him, दुर्धरेण by Durdhara, अर्ध्यमानः attacked, अनिलात्मजः son of the Windgod, ततः then, कदनम् battle, चकार fought, वेगवान् swift hero, भूयः again, व्यवर्धत  grew in size.
data.md: And sore beset by Durdhara, the Wind-god's son again emitted cries, and that puissant one also increased himself.

data.v: स दूरं सहसोत्पत्य दुर्धरस्य रथे हरिः । निपपात महावेगो विद्युद्राशिर्गिराविव ।।
data.es: Hanuman suddenly leaped far off into the air at high speed and fell on Durdhara's chariot just like a thunderous lightning falls on a mountain.
data.anv: सः हरिः that vanara, दूरं far off, सहसा at once, उत्पत्य leaped, महावेगः in high speed, गिरौ on the mountain, विद्युद्राशिरिव like flashes of lightning, दुर्धरस्य Durdhara's, रथे on the chariot, निपपात fell on.
data.md: Then darting far up in the air, the monkey suddenly descended on the car of Durdhara with extreme vehemence, like to a mass of lightning alighting on a mountain.

data.v: ततस्तं मथिताष्टाश्वं रथं भग्नाक्षकूवरम् । विहाय न्यपतद्भूमौ दुर्धरस्त्यक्तजीवितः ।।
data.es: Having lost his chariot, the horses yoked to it killed, its axle and pole broken to pieces, Durdhara fell down dead from the chariot.
data.anv: ततः then, सः he, मथिताष्टाश्वम् eight horses killed, भग्नाक्षकूबरम् with its axle and wooden frame (to which the yoke is fixed) broken, रथम् chariot, विहाय left, त्यक्तजीवितः devoid of life, भूमौ on the ground, न्यपतत् fell.
data.md: Thereat his eight steeds getting mangled, and the wheels and pole of his car having been broken, Durdhara leaving the car, fell down to the earth, deprived of life.

data.v: तं विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ दृष्ट्वा निपतितं भुवि । संजातरोषौ दुर्धर्षावुत्पेततुररिंदमौ ।।
data.es: Seeing the body of Durdhara fallen on the ground, enraged Virupaksha and Yupaksha, the unassailable crushers of enemies leaped towards him.
data.anv: दुर्धर्षौ  unassailable warriors, अरिन्दमौ  crushers of enemies, विरूपाक्षयूपाक्षौ Virupaksha and Yupaksha, भुवि on the ground, निपतितम् fallen, तम् him, दृष्ट्वा seeing, सञ्जातरोषौ enraged, उत्पेतुः leaped at him.
data.md: Seeing him down on the earth, those irrepressible subduers of enemies, Virūpaksa and Yupaksa, waxing wroth, sprang up.

data.v: स ताभ्यां सहसोत्पत्य विष्ठितो विमलेऽम्बरे । मुद्गराभ्यां महाबाहुर्वक्षस्यभिहतः कपिः ।।
data.es: As the strongarmed vanara stood stationed in the clear white sky both the generals leaped into the sky and hit him all of a sudden with two iron hammers.
data.anv: विमले in a clear white, अम्बरे in the sky, विष्ठितः stood, महाबाहुः greatarmed one, सः कपिः that vanara, ताभ्याम् by both of them, सहसा all of a sudden, उत्पत्य having leapt, मुद्गराभ्याम् with two iron hammers, वक्षसि on the chest, अभिहतः  hit.
data.md: And springing up suddenly, they by means of maces, dealt blows on the chest of the monkey, who was staying in the unclouded sky.

data.v: तयोर्वेगवतोर्वेगं विनिहत्य महाबलः । निपपात पुनर्भूमौ सुपर्णसमविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman, an equal to Garuda in valour fell down while resisting the swift generals.
data.anv: महाबलः powerful, सुपर्णसमविक्रमः equal to Suparna (Garuda) in valour, वेगवतोः of those two who were swift in action, तयोः of both of them, वेगम् speed, विनिहत्य resisting, पुनः again, भूमौ on the ground, निपपात fell.
data.md: Thereat resisting the furious rush of those gifted with ebullient erergy, that exceedingly powerful one descended to the earth with the violence of the Fair-feathered (bird).* (Suparna-a name of Garuda.)

data.v: स सालवृक्षमासाद्य समुत्पाट्य च वानरः । तावुभौ राक्षसौ वीरौ जघान पवनात्मजः ।।
data.es: Then the son of the Windgod seized a sala tree uprooted it, lifted it and smashed the two giant generals with it.
data.anv: वानरः vanara, सः पवनात्मजः that son of the Windgod, सालवृक्षम् sala tree, आसाद्य seized, तम् that, उत्पाट्य च and uprooted, तौ उभौ both of them, वीरौ generals, राक्षसौ two giants,जघान slew.
data.md: Then getting at and uprooting a sāla tree, that monkey, the Wind-god's offspring, slew both of those heroic Rākşasas.

data.v: ततस्तांस्त्रीन्हताञ्ज्ञात्वा वानरेण तरस्विना । अभिपेदे महावेगः प्रसह्य प्रघसो हरिम् ।।
data.es: Finding all the three generals dead, swift Praghasa advanced towards the Vanara and attacked him. Valiant Bhasakarna also lifted a trident and attacked him. Both were famous for swift and violent action in war
data.anv: ततः then, तरस्विना by the swift, वानरेण by the vanara, तान् त्रीन् those three, हतान् killed, ज्ञात्वा after knowing, प्रघसः Praghasa, महावेगः endowed with swift action, प्रसह्य violently, अभिपेदे attacked, वीर्यवान् courageous, भासकर्णश्च with Bhasakarna, सङ्कृद्धः angry one, शूलम् trident, आदाय by lifting.

data.v: भासकर्णश्च संक्रुद्धः शूलमादाय वीर्यवान् । एकतः कपिशार्दूलं यशस्विनमवस्थितौ ।।
पट्टिशेन शिताग्रेण प्रघसः प्रत्यपोथयत् । भासकर्णश्च शूलेन राक्षसः कपिसत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Praghasa fought back the glorious tiger among vanaras with a sharp crowbar on one side and Bhaskarana attacked with a spear from the other.
data.anv: यशस्विनम् renowned, कपिशार्दूलम् tiger among monkeys, एकतः on one side, अवस्थितम् तम् stationed, प्रघसः Praghasa, शिताग्रेण with sharp weapon, पट्टिसेन iron crowbar, कपिसत्तमम् foremost of the monkeys, प्रत्ययोधयत् fought back, भासकर्णः Bhaskarna, राक्षसः giant, शूलेन with spear.

data.v: स ताभ्यां विक्षतैर्गात्रैरसृग्दिग्धतनूरुहः । अभवद्वानरः क्रुद्धो बालसूर्यसमप्रभः ।।
data.es: Attacked by both the generals, the fur on the vanara's body was smeared with blood from his wounded limbs, shining like the rising Sun smeared with blood became furious.
data.anv: ताभ्याम् by both of them, विक्षतैः with wounded ones, गात्रैः with his limbs, असृग्दिग्धतनूरुहः his fur smeared with blood, सः वानरः that vanara, बालसूर्यसमप्रभः was shining like the rising Sun, क्रुद्धः angry, अभवत् became.
data.md: And with his limbs wounded by them, and his hair wetted with blood, that monkey resembling in splendour the infant sun, grew furiously enraged.

data.v: समुत्पाट्य गिरेः शृङ्गं समृगव्यालपादपम् । जघान हनुमान्वीरो राक्षसौ कपिकुञ्जरः ।।
data.es: Hanuman, a courageous and mighty elephant among the monkeys uprooted a mountain peak along with its animals, serpents and trees and killed both the demon generals.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जरः a mighty elephant among the monkeys, वीरः courageous, हनुमान् Hanuman, समृगव्यालपादपम् along with animals serpents and trees, गिरेः शृङ्गम् mountain peak, समुत्पाट्य having uprooted, राक्षसौ both the giants,जघान  killed.
data.md: That elephantine monkey, the heroic Hanumān, uprooting a mountain-peak with beasts, snakes, and trees (in it), slew those Raksasas; and, crushed by that mountainsummit, they were reduced to powder.

data.v: ततस्तेष्ववसन्नेषु सेनापतिषु पञ्चसु । बलं तदवशेषं तु नाशयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: When the five army chiefs were killed, Hanuman began to destoy the remaining army force.
data.anv: ततः then, तेषु those, पञ्चसु all the five, सेनापतिषु army chiefs, अवसन्नेषु when they died, वानरः vanara, तत् that, अवशेषम् remaining, बलम् army, नाशयामास destroyed.
data.md: On those five generals having fallen, the monkey slew the remaining forces.

data.v: अश्वैरश्वान्गजैर्नागान्योधैर्योधान्रथै रथान् । स कपिर्नाशयामास सहस्राक्ष इवासुरान् ।।
data.es: The vanara pitted horses against horses, elephants against elephants, warriors against warriors and chariots against chariots as Indra destroyed demons.
data.anv: सः कपिः that vanara,सहस्राक्षः thousandeyed Indra, असुरानिव as he did (destroyed) demons, अश्वैः with horses, अश्वान् horses, गजैः with elephants, नागान् elephants, योधैः with warriors, योधान् warriors, रथैः with chariots, रथान् chariots, नाशयामास destroyed.
data.md: As the thousand-eyed Deity destroyed Asuras, the monkey destroyed steeds with steeds, elephants with elephants, warriors with warriors, and cars with cars.

data.v: हतैर्नागैश्च तुरगैर्भग्नाक्षैश्च महारथैः । हतैश्च राक्षसैर्भूमी रुद्धमार्गा समन्ततः ।।
data.es: There was no path (one could not move forward) with elephants, and horses killed and with broken axles of great chariots and smashed chariots spread all over the way.
data.anv: हतैः with killed ones, नागैः with elephants, तुरगैः with horses, भग्नाक्षैः with broken axles, महारथैश्च by great chariots, हतैः with smashed ones, राक्षसैः with giants, भूमिः the ground, समन्ततः all over, रुद्धमार्गा the path was obstructed
data.md: And with horses and elephants, swift steeds, with broken wheels and mighty cars, and Raksasas slain, all the ways were blocked up.

data.v: ततः कपिस्तान्ध्वजिनीपतीन्रणे; निहत्य वीरान्सबलान्सवाहनान् । तदेव वीरः परिगृह्य तोरणं; कृतक्षणः काल इव प्रजाक्षये ।।
data.es: Then the heroic monkey having killed the army generals and their army and destroyed their vehicles in war came back to the archway after reviewing and stood like the timespirit bent upon the destruction of humanity.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्चत्वारिंशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fortysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, वीरः the hero, कपिः monkey, वीरान् the generals, सबलान्  along with that army, सवाहनान् their vehicles, तान् those, ध्वजिनीपतीन् army chiefs, रणे in war, निहत्य having killed, समीक्ष्य after reviewing, तोरणम् archway, परिगृह्य after holding, प्रजाक्षये  bent upon destruction of humanity, कालः इव like timespirit, कृतक्षणः celebrated.
data.md: Having destroyed in battle the heroic generals with all their forces and vehicles, that hero in the same way rested at the gate like Kāla himself engaged in destroying people when he has gained respite. Having destroyed in battle the heroic generals with all their forces and vehicles, that hero in the same way rested at the gate like Kāla himself engaged in destroying people when he has gained respite.

data.v: सेनापतीन्पञ्च स तु प्रमापिता;न्हनूमता सानुचरान्सवाहनान् । समीक्ष्य राजा समरोद्धतोन्मुखं; कुमारमक्षं प्रसमैक्षताक्षतम् ।।
data.es: Hearing the sad news of death of the five army generals including their followers and destruction of their vehicles, King (Ravana) gave a suggestive look at prince Aksha who was inclined to fight the war.
data.anv: राजा the king, सानुचरान् with the followers,सवाहनान् and their vehicles, पञ्च five, सेनापतीन् generals of the army, हनुमता by Hanuman, प्रमापितान् killed, समीक्ष्य seeing, समरोद्धतोन्मुखम् inclined to fight the war, अग्रतः in front of him, कुमारम् the prince, अक्षम् Aksha, प्रसमैक्षत turned his attention to.
data.md: Hearing that the five generals had been slain by Hanumān alone with their vehicles and followers, the king, gazing at prince Aksa, who was ready and eager to go to battle, commanded him to take the field.

data.v: स तस्य दृष्ट्यर्पणसंप्रचोदितः; प्रतापवान्काञ्चनचित्रकार्मुकः । समुत्पपाताथ सदस्युदीरितो; द्विजातिमुख्यैर्हविषेव पावकः ।।
data.es: Spurred by the mere glance of Ravana, the glorious Aksha with his wonderful bow inlaid with gold sprang up from the royal assembly just as flame rises from firesanctuary when oblations are poured in by reputed brahmins.
data.anv: अथ and then, तस्य his, दृष्ट्यर्पणसम्प्रचोदितः spurred by the glance of the king, प्रतापवान् glorious, सः that, काञ्चनचित्रकार्मुकः holding a marvellous bow inlaid with gold, सदसि  the royal assembly, द्विजातिमुख्यैः by the reputed brahmins, हविषा with oblations, उदीरितः kindled, पावकः इव like the firesanctuary, समुत्पपात sprang up.
data.md: That puissant one of a bow decked with gold, on being commanded (by Rāvana) with a glance started up, like to fire on being fed by clarified butter by foremost regenerate persons on the sacrificial ground.

data.v: ततो महद्बालदिवाकरप्रभं; प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालसंततम् । रथां समास्थाय ययौ स वीर्यवा;न्महाहरिं तं प्रति नैरृतर्षभः ।।
data.es: Ascending a glittering chariot inlaid with pure gold Aksha, the courageous bull among giants looking splendid like the rising Sun, marched forth towards the great vanara.
data.anv: ततः then, वीर्यवान् courageous, सः नैरृतर्षभः that bull among giants, बालदिवाकरप्रभम् splendid like the rising Sun, प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालसन्ततम् glittering like the stretch of pure gold, महत् great, रथम् chariot, समास्थाय having ascended, तम् him, महाहरिं प्रति towards the great vanara, ययौ marched.
data.md: That best of Naiſtas (Rākṣasas) possessed of prowess, ascending a car resembling the infant sun in effulgence, and surrounded all round with networks of burnished gold, sallied forth in quest of that mighty monkey.

data.v: ततस्तपःसंग्रहसंचयार्जितं; प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालशोभितम् । पताकिनं रत्नविभूषितध्वजं; मनोजवाष्टाश्ववरैः सुयोजितम् ।।
data.es: The chariot was (strong as it was) gained by his austerities of high order. It was overlaid with pure gold armour, fixed with flags, and staff, studded with precious gems, yoked to the best of eight horses and endowed with the speed of mind.
data.anv: ततः then, तपः सङ्ग्रहसञ्चयार्जितम् gained by the austerities of high order, प्रतप्तजाम्बूनदजालशोभितम् overlaid with the pure gold armour, पताकिनम् having a flag, रत्नविभूषितध्वजम् with flag staff studded with precious gems, मनोजवाष्टाश्ववरैः with eight choice horses endowed with the speed of mind, सुयोजितम् yoked.

data.v: सुरासुराधृष्यमसंगचारिणं; रविप्रभं व्योमचरं समाहितम् । सतूणमष्टासिनिबद्धबन्धुरं; यथाक्रमावेशितशक्तितोमरम् ।।
data.es: (The chariot) was unassailable to suras or asuras.It moved without touching the ground, it could fly in air and had the splendour of the Sun. It was equipped readily with quivers, eight swords, javelins and clubs placed in right order.
data.anv: सुरासुराधृष्यम् unassailable to suras and asuras, असङ्गचारिणम् moved without touching the ground, रविप्रभम् with the spledour of Sun,व्योमचरम् that which can fly in air, समाहितम् equipped readily, सतूणम् with quivers, अष्टासि निबद्धबन्धुरम् with eight swords (readily placed)fastened, यथाक्रमावेशितशक्तितोमरम्  javelins and clubs placed in right place in order.

data.v: विराजमानं प्रतिपूर्णवस्तुना; सहेमदाम्ना शशिसूर्यवर्वसा । दिवाकराभं रथमास्थितस्ततः; स निर्जगामामरतुल्यविक्रमः ।।
data.es: Prince Aksha, whose courage was equal to that of gods, shone like the Sun. He ascended the splendid chariot decked with golden garlands shining like Sun and Moon, equipped with all weapons, bows and shields etc, he went out.
data.anv: ततः then, अमरतुल्यविक्रमः equal to gods in courage, सः he, सहेमदाम्ना with a golden garland, शशिसूर्यवर्चसा bright as Moon and Sun, प्रतिपूर्णवस्तुना equipped with all weapons, bows and shields etc, विराजमानम् glowing, दिवाकराभम् shining like the Sun, रथम् chariot, आस्थितः ascended, निर्जगाम went out.

data.v: स पूरयन्खं च महीं च साचलां; तुरंगमतङ्गमहारथस्वनैः । बलैः समेतैः स हि तोरणस्थितं; समर्थमासीनमुपागमत्कपिम् ।।
data.es: Seated on the chariot he (Aksha) sallied forth along with the army filling the entire earth and mountains with the sounds of horses, elephants and rumblings of big chariots and reached the portal where the great vanara stood.
data.anv: सः he, तुरङ्गमातङ्गमहारथस्वनैः with the sounds of horses, elephants and chariot, खं च and sky, साचलाम् including mountains, महीं च and earth, पूरयन् while filling, समेतैः together, बलैः सह with army, तोरणस्थितम् stood at the gate, समर्थम् efficient one, आसीनम् seated, महाकपिम् great vanara, उपागमत् reached.
data.md: And filling the firmament and the earth containing mountains with sounds proceeding from steeds, elephants and mighty cars, he, accompanied by his forces, presented himself before the capable monkey, who was seated at the gate.

data.v: स तं समासाद्य हरिं हरीक्षणो; युगान्तकालाग्निमिव प्रजाक्षये । अवस्थितं विस्मितजातसंभ्रमः; समैक्षताक्षो बहुमानचक्षुषा ।।
data.es: The lioneyed Aksha saw the vanara who appeared like the cosmic fire at the time of dissolution of the universe. The prince was astonished and struck with awe (at the majestic form of the Vanara) and looked at him with great respect.
data.anv: हरीक्षणः who had eyes like that of a lion, सः अक्षः that Aksha, प्रजाक्षये at the time of destruction of the universe, अवस्थितम् appeared, कालाग्निम् इव like the cosmic fire at the time of dissolution, तम् him, हरिम् vanara,, समासाद्य  reached, विस्मितजातसम्भ्रमः astonished with awe, बहुमानचक्षुषा with great respect, समैक्षत saw.
data.md: Coming before the monkey, Akşa, having the gaze of a lion, with eyes betokening regard, gazed at Hanumān resembling the Fire on the occasion of the universal dissolution at the end of a Yuga, intent on destroying creatures, and who was seated and was influenced alike by surprise and regard.

data.v: स तस्य वेगं च कपेर्महात्मनः; पराक्रमं चारिषु पार्थिवात्मजः । विचारयन्खं च बलं महाबलो; हिमक्षये सूर्य इवाभिवर्धते ।।
data.es: Aksha, the mighty prince judging the speed and prowess of the monkey with his own in confronting enemies and the strength of the monkey, began to swell up in spirit like the glow of the Sun at the end of winter.
data.anv: महाबलः mighty, पार्थिवात्मजः  prince, सः he, महात्मनः  great self, तस्य कपेः of the monkey, वेगं च and speed, अरिषु at the enemies, पराक्रमं च prowess, स्वम् his, बलं च even strength, विचारयन् judging, हिमक्षये at the end of winter, सूर्य इव like the Sun, अभिवर्धते  began to swell up in spirit
data.md: And seriously considering the impetuosity of the high-souled monkey as well as his prowess in relation to a foe, as also his own strength, he increased in strength) like the Sun on the expiration of a Yuga.

data.v: स जातमन्युः प्रसमीक्ष्य विक्रमं; स्थिरः स्थितः संयति दुर्निवारणम् । समाहितात्मा हनुमन्तमाहवे; प्रचोदयामास शरैस्त्रिभिः शितैः ।।
