data.md: I am incapable of being slain with weapons even by the celestials and the Asuras themselves. This boon I also (like yourself) happen to have received from the Great-father.

data.v: राजानं द्रष्टुकामेन मयास्त्रमनुवर्तितम् । विमुक्तो अहमस्त्रेण राक्षसैस्त्वतिपीडितः ।।
data.es: "Wishing to see the king I honoured this astra and not otherwise. Even though I was tormented by the ogres and released by the astra I submitted to you as I have a small work assigned by the king.
data.anv: राजानम् king, द्रष्टुकामेन to see, मया by me, अस्त्रम् this astra, अनुवर्तितम् is honoured, राक्षसैः by ogres, अभिपीडितः तु even pressed, अहम् I, अस्त्रेण by astra, विमुक्तो हि though released, केनचित् by some mission, राजकार्येण pertaining to the king, तव to your, अन्तिकम् presence, सम्प्राप्तः अस्मि have come.
data.md: It is because I was desirous of seeing the king that I have suffered this weapon to restrain me. Although the Rākşasas have brought me (hither thus), yet I am free from any weapon (restraining me).

data.v: दूतोऽहमिति विज्ञेयो राघवस्यामितौजसः । श्रूयतां चापि वचनं मम पथ्यमिदं प्रभो ।।
data.es: Know that I am a messenger of the highly powerful Rama. O lord please listen to these beneficial words of mine meant for your welfare.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftieth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अहम् I, अमितौजसः of highly powerful, राघवस्य Rama's, दूतः इति messenger thus, विज्ञेयः it may be known, प्रभो O lord, पथ्यम् good, इदम् this, मम वचनम् my word, श्रूयतां चापि listen.
data.md: I come near you on a certain business of Rāma. Knowing me for a messenger of Rāghava endowed with measureless prowess, do you, O lord, listen to my words, calculated to work your profit.

data.v: तं समीक्ष्य महासत्त्वं सत्त्ववान्हरिसत्तमः । वाक्यमर्थवदव्यग्रस्तमुवाच दशाननम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the best of monkeys, looking at the very powerful Ravana spoke slowly these highly meaningful words.
data.anv: सत्त्ववान् courageous, हरिसत्तमः best of monkeys, महासत्त्वम् very powerful, तं दशाननम् the tenheaded, समीक्ष्य after observing, अव्यग्रम् slowly, अर्थवत् meaningful, वाक्यम् these words, तत् such, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Seeing the Ten-necked one of mighty energy, that foremost of monkeys, endued with strength, calmly spoke to him words containing sense,

data.v: अहं सुग्रीवसंदेशादिह प्राप्तस्तवालयम् । राक्षसेन्द्र हरीशस्त्वां भ्राता कुशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "By the command of Rama I am here as a messenger. He is keeping well. He is well and wishes you well.
data.anv: देवि O queen, वैदेहि Vaidehi, अहम् I am, रामस्य Rama's, सन्देशात् by order, तव your, दूतः messenger, आगतः reached, कुशली is well, रामः Rama, त्वां च and you, कुशलम् welfare, अब्रवीत् wished you.
data.md: I have come to you at you command of Sugriva, O lord of Raksasas. Your brother, the king of monkeys, enquires after your welfare.

data.v: भ्रातुः शृणु समादेशं सुग्रीवस्य महात्मनः । धर्मार्थोपहितं वाक्यमिह चामुत्र च क्षमम् ।।
data.es: "The great Sugriva who is like your brother sends you a message pertinent to this world and the other world, that which is beneficial and consistent with righteousness and propriety (धर्म and अर्थ). Listen:
data.anv: महात्मनः the great self, भ्रातुः brother, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, समादेशम् message, इह च pertinent to this world and, अमुत्र च in the other world, क्षमम् that which is beneficial, धर्मार्थोपहितम् consistent with righteousness and propriety, वाक्यम् words, शृणु you may listen.
data.md: Listen to the desire of your brother, the highsouled Sugrīva, and his words fraught with righteous sense and capable of working one's good here and hercafter.

data.v: राजा दशरथो नाम रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान् । पितेव बन्धुर्लोकस्य सुरेश्वरसमद्युतिः ।।
data.es: "There was an illustrious king called Dasaratha in Ikshvaku race, a master of chariots, elephants and horses. He was highly meritorious and renowned.
data.anv: रथकुञ्जरवाजिमान् with chariots, elephants and horses, पुण्यशीलः foremost in merits, महाकीर्तिः renowned, इक्ष्वाकूणाम् in Ikshvaku race, महायशाः illustrious, दशरथो नाम called Dasaratha, राजा king.
data.md: King Dasaratha, master of cars and elephants and steeds, is the friend of all like to their father, and is furnished with the splendour of the sovereign of celestials.

data.v: ज्येष्ठस्तस्य महाबाहुः पुत्रः प्रियकरः प्रभुः । पितुर्निदेशान्निष्क्रान्तः प्रविष्टो दण्डकावनम् ।।
data.es: "His eldest son, a highly effulgent one, named Rama who was dear to the king, accepting his father's orders went into exile with brother Lakshmana and wife Sita also accepting a righteous path and entered Dandaka forest.
data.anv: तस्य his, ज्येष्ठः पुत्रः eldest son, महाबाहुः strongarmed, प्रियकरः very dear, प्रभुः a lord, महातेजाः highly effulgent one, रामो नाम named Rama, धर्म्यम् righteous, पन्थानम् आस्थितः has entered a path, पितुः father's, निर्देशात् by order, निष्क्रान्तः went in exile, भ्रात्रा by his brother, लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, सीतया चापि by Sita also, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered.
data.md: His eldest son, mighty-armed, and masterful, the darling (of his sire), has, in accordance with his father's order, entered the forest of Dandaka with his brother Lakşmaņa and his wife Sītā.

data.v: लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा सीतया चापि भार्यया । रामो नाम महातेजा धर्म्यं पन्थानमाश्रितः ।।
data.es: "His eldest son, a highly effulgent one, named Rama who was dear to the king, accepting his father's orders went into exile with brother Lakshmana and wife Sita also accepting a righteous path and entered Dandaka forest.
data.anv: तस्य his, ज्येष्ठः पुत्रः eldest son, महाबाहुः strongarmed, प्रियकरः very dear, प्रभुः a lord, महातेजाः highly effulgent one, रामो नाम named Rama, धर्म्यम् righteous, पन्थानम् आस्थितः has entered a path, पितुः father's, निर्देशात् by order, निष्क्रान्तः went in exile, भ्रात्रा by his brother, लक्ष्मणेन with Lakshmana, भार्यया with his wife, सीतया चापि by Sita also, दण्डकावनम् Dandaka forest, प्रविष्टः entered.

data.v: तस्य भार्या वने नष्टा सीता पतिमनुव्रता । वैदेहस्य सुता राज्ञो जनकस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Sita, daughter of king Janaka of Videha kingdom, loyally followed her husband, Rama. She was lost in the forest.
data.anv: वैदेहस्य of Videha, महात्मनः  of the great self, जनकस्य Janka's, राज्ञः  king's, सुता daughter, पतिम् husband, अनुव्रता follwing, तस्य his, भार्या wife, सीता Sita, वने in the forest, नष्टा lost.
data.md: His name is Rāma, and he is exceedingly energetic, and ever abide on the path of virtue. His spouse, the celebrated Sītā, daughter to Vaideha, the high-souled king Janaka, either died or was carried off in Janasthāna.

data.v: स मार्गमाणस्तां देवीं राजपुत्रः सहानुजः । ऋश्यमूकमनुप्राप्तः सुग्रीवेण च संगतः ।।
data.es: "Searching for the divine lady the prince reached mount Rshyamuka along with his brother and there he met Sugriva.
data.anv: तां देवीम् that divine lady, मार्गमाणः searching, सहानुजः along with his brother, सः राजपुत्रः that prince, ऋश्यमूकम् to Rshyamuka, अनुप्राप्तः reached, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, समागतः united.
data.md: Seeking for that exalted lady, the king's son, accompanied by this younger brother, arriving at Rşyamūka, met with Sugrīva.

data.v: तस्य तेन प्रतिज्ञातं सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् । सुग्रीवस्यापि रामेण हरिराज्यं निवेदितम् ।।
data.es: "Sugriva promised Rama to undertake search for Sita and Rama assured Sugriva of securing him the kingdom of the monkeys.
data.anv: तेन by him, तस्य his, सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणम् to search, प्रतिज्ञातम् is promised, रामेणापि even by Rama also, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, हरिराज्यम् kingdom of monkeys, निवेदितम् assured.
data.md: And Sugrīva promised that he would undertake the search for Sītă, and Rāma (on his part promised) that he would confer on Sugrīva the kingdom of the monkeys.

data.v: ततस्तेन मृधे हत्वा राजपुत्रेण वालिनम् । सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये हर्यृक्षाणां गणेश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Then prince Rama killed Vali in battle and made Sugriva, king of the vanaras and bears and restored the kingship of Sugriva.
data.anv: ततः then, तेन by him, राजपुत्रेण by the prince, वालिनम् Vali, मृधे in battle, हत्वा after killing, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हर्यृऋक्षाणाम् kingdom of apes and bears, गणेश्वरः lord of the troops, राज्ये in kingdom, स्थापितः was established.
data.md: And, thereupon, slaying Vāli in battle, the king's son established Sugrīva as the lord of the monkeys.

data.v: स सीतामार्गणे व्यग्रः सुग्रीवः सत्यसंगरः । हरीन्संप्रेषयामास दिशः सर्वा हरीश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Sugriva, who is true to his word and a faithful warrior, king of monkeys anxiously sent vanaras in all directions for searching Sita.
data.anv: सत्यसङ्गरः one who is a faithful warrior, हरीश्वरः  king of monkeys, सः सुग्रीवः that Sugriva, सीतामार्गणे in searching Sita, व्यग्रः was anxious, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, हरीन् vanaras, सम्प्रेषयामास sent.
data.md: And, thereupon, the lord of monkeys, Sugrīva, true to his vow, eager for searching Sītā, despatched monkeys in all directions.

data.v: तां हरीणां सहस्राणि शतानि नियुतानि च । दिक्षु सर्वासु मार्गन्ते अधश्चोपरि चाम्बरे ।।
data.es: "This is Sita whom thousands of vanaras are searching in all directions.
data.anv: कपीनाम् of vanaras, सुबहूनि many, सहस्राणि thousands, अयुतानि च 10,000 soldiers सर्वासु all over, दिक्षु in directions, याम् whom, मार्गन्ते are searching, सा इयम् that Sita here, मया by myself, आसादिता she is found.
data.md: And thousands and hundreds and niyutas of monkeys are exploring all sides, below and above in the sky.

data.v: वैनतेय समाः केचित्केचित्तत्रानिलोपमाः । असंगगतयः शीघ्रा हरिवीरा महाबलाः ।।
data.es: "Some of the very powerful heroes equal to Garuda, equal to the Windgod (in swiftness) have gone (in quest of Sita) without touching the earth.
data.anv: तत्र there, महाबलाः very powerful, केचित् some, हरिवीराः heroic vanaras, वैनतेयसमाः like Vainateya (Garuda), केचित् a few, अनिलोपमाः are like the Windgod, शीघ्राः swiftfooted warriors, असङ्गगतयः went without touching the earth.
data.md: Some are like Vinata's offspring, (Garuda) and some like the Wind; their Course is incapable of being resisted; and those heroic monkeys are endued with strength and celerity.

data.v: अहं तु हनुमान्नाम मारुतस्यौरसः सुतः । सीतायास्तु कृते तूर्णं शतयोजनमायतम् । समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वैव तां दिदृक्षुरिहागतः ।।
data.es: "I, Maruta's son, Hanuman by name too came swiftly leaping across a hundred yojanas across the ocean searching for Sita.
data.anv: मारुतस्य Maruta's, औरसः सुतः own son, हनुमान्नाम Hanuman by name, अहं तु I too, सीतायाः कृते for Sita, तूर्णम् swiftly, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयतम् broad, समुद्रम् ocean, लङ्घयित्वैव  leaping, ताम् her, दिदृक्षुः  desirous of seeing, इह here, आगतः came.
data.md: I, Hanumān my name, am the son of the Wind-god. For Sitã, I, desirous of seeing her, have come hither, bounding over the main measuring a full hundred Yojanas. And as I was roving, I came to see Janaka's daughter in your house.

data.v: तद्भवान्दृष्टधर्मार्थस्तपः कृतपरिग्रहः । परदारान्महाप्राज्ञ नोपरोद्धुं त्वमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "While I was roaming I saw Janaka's daughter Sita at your house.You are a knower of the truth of righteousness. You are very wise and carrried out great austerities. It does not behove you to abduct another man's wife.
data.anv: भ्रमता while roaming, मया by myself, ते your, गृहे in house, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, दृष्टा saw, भवान् you, दृष्टधर्मार्थः knower of the truth of righteousness, तपः कृतपरिग्रहः carried out great austerities, तत् such, महाप्राज्ञ very wise person, त्वम् you, परदारान् another man's wife, उपरोद्धुम् to abduct, न अर्हसि  it does not behove you.
data.md: You are cognisant of righteousness and interest, and had attained prosperity through your asceticism. Therefore, O eminently wise one, you ought not to confine another's wife.

data.v: न हि धर्मविरुद्धेषु बह्वपायेषु कर्मसु । मूलघातिषु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.es: "Indeed, respectable people and wise men like you should not indulge in actions opposed to righteousness as it will strike at the very root of your existence.
data.anv: भवद्विधाः respectable people like you, बुद्धिमन्तः wise men, धर्मविरुद्धेषु acts which are unrighteous, बह्वपायेषु indulge in such actions, मूलघातिषु  striking at the very root, कर्मसु in actions, न सज्जन्ते हि do not involve indeed.
data.md: Actions opposed to righteousness, and bringing on countless evils, and causing extermination, ill become persons of your sort.

data.v: कश्च लक्ष्मणमुक्तानां रामकोपानुवर्तिनाम् । शराणामग्रतः स्थातुं शक्तो देवासुरेष्वपि ।।
data.es: "Who, even among gods and asuras can withstand the arrows released by Lakshmana in obedience to the infuriated Rama's orders?
data.anv: लक्ष्मणमुक्तानाम् released by Lakshmana, रामकोपानुवर्तिनाम् following Rama's wrath, शराणाम् of those arrows, अग्रतः in front, स्थातुम् to stand, देवासुरेष्वपि even among gods and asuras, कः who, शक्त: has power.
data.md: Who is there even among celestials and Asuras that is competent to stay before the shafts shot by Lakşmaņa and Rāma in wrath?

data.v: न चापि त्रिषु लोकेषु राजन्विद्येत कश्चन । राघवस्य व्यलीकं यः कृत्वा सुखमवाप्नुयात् ।।
data.es: "O king there is none in these three worlds who can enjoy happiness by displeasing Rama.
data.anv: राजन् O king, यः whoever, राघवस्य Rama's, व्यलीकम् displeasure, कृत्वा after doing, सुखम् happiness, अवाप्नुयात् can experience, त्रिषु in the three, लोकेषु in worlds, कश्चन who, न विद्येत may not be there.
data.md: There is none, O king, in all the three worlds, that is capable of attaining ease, after inflicting injury on Rāghava.

data.v: तत्त्रिकालहितं वाक्यं धर्म्यमर्थानुबन्धि च । मन्यस्व नरदेवाय जानकी प्रतिदीयताम् ।।
data.es: "Think that my advice is beneficial to you for you present, past and future. It is righteous. It will provide you material wealth too. Hence return Sita to the lord of the people.
data.anv: तत् that, त्रिकालहितम् good for all three times, past present and future, धर्म्यम् is righteous, अर्थानुबन्धि च and provide you material wealth, वाक्यम् these words, मन्यस्व think, नरदेवाय to the lord of the people, जानकी Janaki, प्रतिदीयताम् return.
data.md: Treading the path of virtue and profit, do you pay heed to my speech fraught with good for three times; (Present, past, and future) and do you return Jānaki to that foremost of men.

data.v: दृष्टा हीयं मया देवी लब्धं यदिह दुर्लभम् । उत्तरं कर्म यच्छेषं निमित्तं तत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: "I have actually spotted the divine lady here which was most difficult. Rama will plan the remaining course of action.
data.anv: मया by me, इयं देवी this divine lady, दृष्टा हि indeed seen, यत् such, दुर्लभम् difficult, इह here, लब्धम् attained, उत्तरम् in future, यत् such, कर्म action, शेषम् remaining, तत्र there, राघवः Rama, निमित्तम् may plan.
data.md: Seen have I this exalted lady, which was difficult to compass. As for what remain to be done, Rāma himself shall bring it about.

data.v: लक्षितेयं मया सीता तथा शोकपरायणा । गृह्य यां नाभिजानासि पञ्चास्यामिव पन्नगीम् ।।
data.es: "I have seen Sita immersed in deep sorrow. You do not realise that by abducting her you are keeping a fivehooded female serpent in your house.
data.anv: तथा like that, शोकपरायणा immersed in deep sorrow, इयं सीता this Sita, मया by me, लक्षिता is seen, पञ्चास्याम् five hooded, पन्नगीमिव like a female serpent, याम् whom, गृह्य after abducting, नाभिजानासि you do not realise.
data.md: That Sītā I have beheld overwhelmed with grief, whom, albeit resembling a five-hooded serpent in your mansion, you know not.

data.v: नेयं जरयितुं शक्या सासुरैरमरैरपि । विषसंसृष्टमत्यर्थं भुक्तमन्नमिवौजसा ।।
data.es: "Just as food mixed with venom cannot be digested by the great fire (fire of hunger), it is not possible to keep Sita even by gods and demons. (Sita is like food mixed with poison. Ravana cannot digest her with all his power.)
data.anv: अत्यर्थम् excessive, विषसंसृष्टम् mixed with poison, भुक्तम् eaten, अन्नमिव like food, इयम् this, सासुरैः including asuras, अमरैरपि even gods, ओजसा absorb, जरयितुम् to weaken, न शक्या not possible.
data.md: And even as food thoroughly mixed with poison, being taken, is incapable of being digested, this one is incapable of being subdued even by the celestials and Asuras.

data.v: तपःसंतापलब्धस्ते योऽयं धर्मपरिग्रहः । न स नाशयितुं न्याय्य आत्मप्राणपरिग्रहः ।।
data.es: "You have acquired the merit of righteousness by prolonged hardships experienced during your penance. It is not proper to forfeit your own life in this way.
data.anv: तपस्सन्तापलब्ध: obtained by the the virtue of austerity, ते to you, यः that, अयम् this, धर्मपरिग्रहः accumlation of righteousness, आत्मप्राणपरिग्रहः at the cost of your life, सः that, नाशयितुम् to destroy, न न्याय्यः not proper.
data.md: It is not proper to destroy religious merit reaped by undergoing extreme mortification, as well as access of life attained by the same means). (By such an iniquitous act as this.)

data.v: अवध्यतां तपोभिर्यां भवान्समनुपश्यति । आत्मनः सासुरैर्देवैर्हेतुस्तत्राप्ययं महान् ।।
data.es: "You know you will not be killed by asuras or gods. In that case also this (keeping Sita with you) may be the prime cause of your death.
data.anv: भवान् your self, तपोभिः with austerities, आत्मनः of yourself, सासुरैः including asuras, देवैः by devas, याम् whom, अवध्यताम् not to be killed, समनुपश्यसि you see, तत्रापि even then, अयम् this, महान् great, हेतुः cause.
data.md: You deem yourself by virtue of your asceticism incapable of being destroyed by the celestials and Asuras; and herein your great merit (incident to they austerities) is the cause.

data.v: सुग्रीवो न हि देवोऽयं नासुरो न च मानुषः । न राक्षसो न गन्धर्वो न यक्षो न च पन्नगः ।।
data.es: "Sugriva is not an demon, nor a danava nor gandharva, nor a yaksha nor even a pannaga. Therefore how can you save your life from Sugriva?
data.anv: अयं सुग्रीवः this Sugriva, न हि not indeed, असुरः च an asura, राक्षसः च न not a demon, दानवः न not danava, गन्धर्वः न not a gandharva, यक्षः न not a yaksha, पन्नगश्च न not a pannga, राजन् O king, तस्मात् therefore, प्राणपरित्राणम् to protect your life, कथम् how, करिष्यसि you will do.

data.v: मानुषो राघवो राजन्सुग्रीवश्च हरीश्वरः । तस्मात्प्राणपरित्राणं कथं राजन्करिष्यसि ।।
data.md: But Sugrīva is not a god or a Yakṣa or a Rākşasa. Rāghava, O king, is a mortal and Sugrīva is the lord of monkeys. How can you, O king, save your-life from them.

data.v: न तु धर्मोपसंहारमधर्मफलसंहितम् । तदेव फलमन्वेति धर्मश्चाधर्मनाशनः ।।
data.es: "The fruit of dharma does not accrue to one who has reached the culmination of adharma. Unrighteousness will destroy the fruits of righteousness.
data.anv: धर्मोपसंहारम् exceeding rigteousness, अधर्मफलसंहितम् yields results of unrighteousness, न तु not, तत् that, फलमेव result itself, अन्वेति follows, धर्मश्च righteousness, अधर्मनाशनः will destroy unrighteousness.
data.md: He that, confiding in his strength, commit himself to foul proceedings, cannot count upon his righteous deeds, but his evil ones follow him.

data.v: प्राप्तं धर्मफलं तावद्भवता नात्र संशयः । फलमस्याप्यधर्मस्य क्षिप्रमेव प्रपत्स्यसे ।।
data.es: "There is no doubt you have earned merit through righteousness (dharma destroys adharma and yields sweet fruit ultimately). But now you will quickly reap the result of your unrighteousness also.
data.anv: भवता by you, धर्मफलम् merits earned through righteousness, प्राप्तं तावत् you reaped, अत्र here, संशयः no doubt, न not, अस्य of this, अधर्मस्य of unrighteousness, फलमपि result also, क्षिप्रमेव quickly, प्रपत्स्यसे reap
data.md: Virtue destroy vice, (yet vice like yours destroy all virtue). (The parenthetical part is the commentator's filling in of the deficiency in the sentiment) You, without doubt, had obtained the fruit of your righteousness, and the fruit also of this iniquity you shall reap without delay.

data.v: जनस्थानवधं बुद्ध्वा बुद्ध्वा वालिवधं तथा । रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च बुध्यस्व हितमात्मनः ।।
data.es: "You know about the killing of all ogres at Janasthana and of Vali also. You know about the alliance of Rama and Sugriva. You may decide on a proper course of action for the sake of your own welfare.
data.anv: जनस्थानवधम् killing of all ogres at Janasthana, बुद्ध्वा after realising, तथा that way, वालिवधम् killing of Vali, बुद्ध्वा after realising, रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च alliance of Rama and Sugriva also, आत्मनः your own, हितम् benefit, बुध्यस्व know (Judge and adopt suitable course of action.)
data.md: And taking to heart the carnage in Janasthāna and the slaying of Vāli as well as the friendship of Rāma with Sugrīva, do you understand yours own good.

data.v: कामं खल्वहमप्येकः सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम् । लङ्कां नाशयितुं शक्तस्तस्यैष तु विनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: " Alone, I can destroy this entire Lanka teeming with horses, chariots and elephants. Indeed I have the energy but not the mandate of Sri Rama.
data.anv: अहम् I, एकोऽपि all alone also, सवाजिरथकुञ्जराम् full of horses, chariots and elephants, लङ्काम् Lanka, नाशयितुम् to destroy, कामम् indeed, शक्तः खलु I have the energy, एषः this, तु indeed, निश्चयः resolution, न not.
data.md: I, alone that I am, can at my will destroy Lankā with her steeds and elephants and cars; but he whose envoy I am has not yet decided on this point.

data.v: रामेण हि प्रतिज्ञातं हर्यृक्षगणसंनिधौ । उत्सादनममित्राणां सीता यैस्तु प्रधर्षिता ।।
data.es: "Rama made a vow in the presence of bears and vanaras that he would exterminate the arrogant enemy troops by whom Sita is abducted and assaulted.
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, हर्यृक्षगणसन्निधौ in the presence of bears and vanaras, यैः by those, सीता Sita, प्रधर्षिता is troubled, अमित्राणाम् of enemy troops, उत्सादनम् exterminate, प्रतिज्ञातं हि indeed made a vow.
data.md: Rāma has in presence of the tawny-eyed (ones) forsooth promised the annihilation of the foe by whom Sītā has been sore oppressed.

data.v: अपकुर्वन्हि रामस्य साक्षादपि पुरंदरः । न सुखं प्राप्नुयादन्यः किं पुनस्त्वद्विधो जनः ।।
data.es: "Indra, the destroyer of enemy citadels cannot live happily if he offends Rama. What to speak of persons like you?
data.anv: रामस्य to Rama, अपकुर्वन् while offending, साक्षात् personally, पुरन्दरः अपि even the destroyer of enemy citadel, Indra, सुखम् happiness, नप्राप्नुयात् will not have, त्वद्विधः people like you, किं पुनः what to say again.
data.md: On wronging Rāma, Purandara himself cannot escape scot-free, what shall I say of persons like you?

data.v: यां सीतेत्यभिजानासि येयं तिष्ठति ते वशे । कालरात्रीति तां विद्धि सर्वलङ्काविनाशिनीम् ।।
data.es: "Sita who is under your custody is no ordinary lady. She is indeed the dark night of dissolution, destroyer of entire Lanka. Know this.
data.anv: याम् whom, सीता इति as Sita, अभिजानासि know, या इयम् whosoever, ते वशे under your custody, तिष्ठति stays, ताम् her, सर्वलङ्काविनाशिनीम् destroyer of the entire Lanka, कालरात्रीति the dark night of dissolution, विद्धि you may know.
data.md: Her-whom you know as Sītā staying in yours abode-know her for the Fatal Night that shall bring destruction down on all Lankā.

data.v: तदलं कालपाशेन सीता विग्रहरूपिणा । स्वयं स्कन्धावसक्तेन क्षममात्मनि चिन्त्यताम् ।।
data.es: "Stop holding the noose of death in Sita's form whom you yourself have placed on your shoulders. Think of your own welfare.
data.anv: तत् therefore, सीताविग्रहरूपिणा in the form of Sita, स्वयम् personally, स्कन्धावसक्तेन on your shoulder, कालपाशेन by the noose of death, अलम् enough, आत्मनि for your sake, क्षेमम् welfare, चिन्त्यताम् think over.
data.md: Therefore, beware of yourself turning about your neck the fatal noose in the shape of Sītā! Do you rather study your welfare.

data.v: सीतायास्तेजसा दग्धां रामकोपप्रपीडिताम् । दह्यमनामिमां पश्य पुरीं साट्टप्रतोलिकाम् ।।
data.es: "Visualize this city of Lanka including its marketplaces and main streets as burnt by Sita's power of chastity and Rama's anger.
data.anv: Sita's, तेजसा by the glowing fire, दग्धाम् burnt, रामकोपप्रपीडिताम् pressed by Rama's wrath, दह्यमानाम् being burnt, साट्टप्रतोलिकाम् including its marketplaces and streets, इमाम् of this, पुरीम् city, पश्य see.
data.md: You shall behold this city crowned with edifices and stalls, in flames fed by the wrath of Rāma, and consumed by the energy of Şītā.

data.v: स सौष्ठवोपेतमदीनवादिनः; कपेर्निशम्याप्रतिमोऽप्रियं वचः । दशाननः कोपविवृत्तलोचनः; समादिशत्तस्य वधं महाकपेः ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana who was of matchless strength, hearing the unpleasant words of advice and warning expressed skilfully with dignity by the great Hanuman, enraged Ravana, his eyes rolling in anger ordered the execution of Hanuman.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे एकपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfirst sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: अप्रतिमः unequal in strength, सः दशाननः that tenheaded one, अदीनवादिनः of Hanuman who expressed his opinion with all dignity, कपेः of a vanara, सौष्ठवोपेतम् in an extremely skilful manner, अप्रियम् unplesant, वचः words, निशम्य after hearing, कोपविवृत्तलोचनः eyes rolling in anger, तस्य his, महाकपेः of great Hanuman, वधम् death, समादिशत् ordered.
data.md: Hearing the distasteful yet excellent speech of the bold and matchless monkey, the ten-necked one, with his eyes whirling in wrath, ordered the destruction of that mighty monkey.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा वानरस्य महात्मनः । आज्ञापयद्वधं तस्य रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः ।।
data.es: On hearing the demon's haughty words, oppressed, pitiable Sita replied slowly in a sorrowful tone.
data.anv: महात्मनः of the great, तस्य वानरस्य of  vanara's, तत् वचनम् the speech, श्रुत्वा on hearing, रावणः Ravana, क्रोधमूर्छितः overwhelmed with anger, तस्य his, वधम् slaying, आज्ञापयत् ordered.
data.md: Hearing the words of the high-souled monkey, Răvaņa, bereft of his senses by wrath, ordered that he should be put to death.

data.v: वधे तस्य समाज्ञप्ते रावणेन दुरात्मना । निवेदितवतो दौत्यं नानुमेने विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Vibhishana did not approve of the killing of Hanuman, who had declared that he was an envoy (of Sri Rama) when the wicked Ravana ordered his murder.
data.anv: दुरात्मना by the wicked self, रावणेन by Ravana, तस्य his, वधे killing, समाज्ञप्ते when ordered, विभीषणः Vibhishana, दौत्यम् message, निवेदितवतः who had  declared (the purpose of his visit), नानुमेने did not approve.
data.md: On the death of that one who had proclaimed his own position of being an envoy, having been ordered by the wicked-minded Ravana, Vibhisana did not agree (with the decision).

data.v: तं रक्षोऽधिपतिं क्रुद्धं तच्च कार्यमुपस्थितम् । विदित्वा चिन्तयामास कार्यं कार्यविधौ स्थितः ।।
data.es: Vibhishana who stood by the right course of action, having realised that the lord of demons was angry pondered over his duty.
data.anv: कार्यविधौ the right course of action, स्थितः stood, तम् him, रक्षोधिपतिम् lord of demons, क्रुद्धम् angry, उपस्थितम् approached near, तत् that, कार्यं च mission also, विदित्वा having known, कार्यम् action, चिन्तयामास  pondered.
data.md: And knowing that the lord of Rākşasas was wroth and that affair (The destruction of Hanuman) was at hand, Vibhisana, resolved to act according to justice, began to reflect as to what was to be done.

data.v: निश्चितार्थस्ततः साम्नापूज्य शत्रुजिदग्रजम् । उवाच हितमत्यर्थं वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ।।
data.es: Then Vibhishana, who was skilled in speech having decided about his duty addressed his reverential elder brother, a conqueror of enemies in soothing, words in a meaningful, wholesome manner.
data.anv: ततः then, निश्चितार्थः decided about action, शत्रुजित् winner of enemies, वाक्यविशारदः skilled in speech, पूज्यम् reverential, अग्रजम् to his elder brother, अत्यर्थम् profound, हितम् wholesome, वाक्यम् words, साम्ना by soothing words, उवाच addressed.

data.v: राजन्धर्मविरुद्धं च लोकवृत्तेश्च गर्हितम् । तव चासदृशं वीर कपेरस्य प्रमापणम् ।।
data.es: "Mighty king killing this Hanuman is contrary to righteousness of kings. This is deplorable diplomacy and also unbecoming of you.
data.anv: वीर warrior, अस्य his, कपेः monkey's, प्रमापणम् killing, राजधर्मविरुद्धं च contrary to righteousness of kings, लोकवृत्तेश्च to fair diplomacy, गर्हितम् depreciable, तव च and your, असदृशम् unbecoming act.
data.md: The taking the monkey's life, O king, is opposed to morality and repugnant to social usage; and it is also unworthy of yourself.

data.v: असंशयं शत्रुरयं प्रवृद्धः; कृतं ह्यनेनाप्रियमप्रमेयम् । न दूतवध्यां प्रवदन्ति सन्तो; दूतस्य दृष्टा बहवो हि दण्डाः ।।
data.es: This enemy has done a lot of harm, no doubt. Indeed he has done terrible and unpleasant deeds. (Yet) the wise have recommended many alternate punishments, while prohibiting their killing.
data.anv: अयम् this, शत्रुः enemy, प्रवृद्धः has grown, असंशयम् no doubt, अनेन by him, अप्रमेयम् incomparable, अप्रियम् unpleasant act, कृतं हि indeed has been done, सन्तः wise, दूतवध्याम् killing of an emissary, न प्रवदन्ति do not approve, दूतस्य emissary's, बहवः  many, दण्डाः punishments, दृष्टाः हि indeed have recommended.
data.md: Surely this is an overgrown enemy; and he has perpetrated immense injury (to us). But say the good, envoys are not to be slain, albeit many are the punishments that have been assigned for messengers.

data.v: वैरूप्यामङ्गेषु कशाभिघातो; मौण्ड्यं तथा लक्ष्मणसंनिपातः । एतान्हि दूते प्रवदन्ति दण्डा;न्वधस्तु दूतस्य न नः श्रुतोऽपि ।।
data.es: "Mutilation of limbs, flogging, shaving of the head, and deforming limbs etc. these punishments have been prescribed for an emissary. Never has killing of an emissary been heard.
data.anv: अङ्गेषु in limbs, वैरूप्यम् deforming, कशाभिघातः flogging, मौण्ड्यम् shaving the head, तथा similarly, लक्षणसन्निपातः disfigurement, एतान् such of those, दूते for an emissary, दण्डान् punishments, प्रवदन्ति elders have prescribed, दूतस्य for emissary, वधस्तु killing of, श्रुतः heard, नास्ति never.
data.md: Disfigurement of the body, strips, shaving of the head, one of these or all combined, these are said to be the punishments that should be inflicted on envoys. But I have not heard of the punishment of death being a penalty of the envoy. as

data.v: कथं च धर्मार्थविनीतबुद्धिः; परावरप्रत्ययनिश्चितार्थः । भवद्विधः कोपवशे हि तिष्ठे;त्कोपं नियच्छन्ति हि सत्त्ववन्तः ।।
data.es: "You are wellversed in dharma and artha. Learned men first decide what is right or wrong (before imposing punishment). How are you swayed by unjust anger? Indeed courageous persons (like you) should control anger.
data.anv: धर्मार्थविनीतबुद्धिः wellversed in dharma and artha, परावरप्रत्ययनिश्चितार्थः  who decides about the good and bad, भवद्विधः learned one like you, कोपवशे charged with anger, कथम् how, तिष्ठेत् (are you) swayed, सत्त्ववन्तः courageous ones, कोपम् anger, नियच्छन्ति हि indeed control.
data.md: Why dose one like you, having one's intelligence rendered meek respects righteousness and profit, and capable of proceeding on certain decisions on the merits or otherwise of things, come under the sway of passion? Those possessed of power never give way to anger.

data.v: न धर्मवादे न च लोकवृत्ते; न शास्त्रबुद्धिग्रहणेषु वापि । विद्येत कश्चित्तव वीरतुल्य;स्त्वं ह्युत्तमः सर्वसुरासुराणाम् ।।
data.es: "Heroic Ravana there is hardly any one who is equal to you in the knowledge of dharma, in the practice of worldly affairs and in grasping subtle truths of sastras. Indeed you are supreme among suras and asuras.
data.anv: वीर O hero, धर्मवादे in the discussion on dharma, तव your, तुल्यः equal, कश्चित् any one, न विद्येत does not exist, लोकवृत्ते in the practice worldly affairs, न not, शास्त्रबुद्धिग्रहणेषु चापि in grasping the subtle truths in sastras, न no, त्वम् you, सर्वसुरासुराणाम् among all suras and asuras, उत्तमः हि indeed superior.
data.md: Neither in religious discussion, nor in social concernis, nor in appropriating the right sense of the scriptures, is there any that can approach you, O hero-Verily you are the foremost among celestials and Asuras.

data.v: न चाप्यस्य कपेर्घाते कंचित्पश्याम्यहं गुणम् । तेष्वयं पात्यतां दण्डो यैरयं प्रेषितः कपिः ।।
data.es: "I do not see any use in killing this monkey. Pronounce punishment on those who have sent this vanara.
data.anv: अस्य at this, कपेः monkey's, घाते in killing, अहम् I, किञ्चित् गुणम् even little use, न पश्यामि not see, अयम् he, दण्डः punishment, यैः by those, अयं कपिः this vanara, प्रेषितः have been sent, तेषु at them, पात्यताम् you may pronounce.
data.md: Nor do I see any good that may likely accrue to us from the slaying of this monkey. Let your vengeance descend those that have despatched the monkey.

data.v: साधुर्वा यदि वासाधुर्परैरेष समर्पितः । ब्रुवन्परार्थं परवान्न दूतो वधमर्हति ।।
data.es: "Whether he is soft or harsh, he has been sent by others. He is speaking on other's behalf and is dependent on them. An emissary does not deserve to be killed.
data.anv: साधुर्वा may be soft, असाधुर्यदि वा or hard, एषः he, परैः by others, समर्पितः sent, परार्थम् by others, ब्रुवन् while speaking, परवान् he is dependent, दूतः emissary, वधम् killing, न अर्हति does not deserve.
data.md: Whether honest or otherwise, this one has been commissioned by others. Advocating interest not his own and identifying himself with another, an envoy dose not merit the being put to death.

data.v: अपि चास्मिन्हते राजन्नान्यं पश्यामि खेचरम् । इह यः पुनरागच्छेत्परं पारं महोदधिः ।।
data.es: "O king If he is killed, I do not see any one who can cross this great ocean and come by air to reach this place.
data.anv: राजन् O king, अपि च and even so, अस्मिन् when he, हते is killed, यः whoever, महोदधेः ocean, परं पारम् to the other side, पुनः again, इह here, आगच्छेत् who can come, अन्यम् other, खेचरम् who can come through sky and reach, न पश्यामि I do not see.

data.v: तस्मान्नास्य वधे यत्नः कार्यः परपुरंजय । भवान्सेन्द्रेषु देवेषु यत्नमास्थातुमर्हति ।।
data.es: "You who can conquer citadels of enemies should not direct your efforts to kill an envoy.You are fit to make efforts against enemies like gods including Indra.
data.anv: परपुरञ्जय O hero who can conquer citadels of enemies, तस्मात् therefore, अस्य him, वधे in killing, यत्नः effort, न कार्यः should not be made, भवान् you, सेन्द्रेषु including Indra, देवेषु among gods, यत्नम् effort, आस्थातुम् to make, अर्हति you are fit.
data.md: O king, if this one be slain, no other skyranger whatever would show himself tous. Threfore, O captor of hostile capitals, do not seek to slay this one. You should spend yourself on celestials with Indra (at their head).

data.v: अस्मिन्विनष्टे न हि दूतमन्यं; पश्यामि यस्तौ नरराजपुत्रौ । युद्धाय युद्धप्रियदुर्विनीता;वुद्योजयेद्दीर्घपथावरुद्धौ ।।
data.es: "O lover of war if Hanuman is slain I do not see any one who can incite those two illmannered sons of the king who are prevented from reaching this faroff land.
data.anv: युद्धप्रिय O lover of war, अस्मिन् if he, विनष्टे is slain, दुर्विनीतौ those two illmannered, दीर्घपथावरुद्धौ those two who are obstructed, तौ नरराजपुत्रौ those princes, यः who ever, युद्धाय for war, उद्योजयेत् can incite, अन्यम्  another, दूतम् emissary, न पश्यामि हि I donot see indeed.
data.md: On his being killed, another see I not who, O you that love warfare, can move those haughty sons of a king to take up arms against you.

data.v: पराक्रमोत्साहमनस्विनां च; सुरासुराणामपि दुर्जयेन । त्वया मनोनन्दन नैरृतानां; युद्धायतिर्नाशयितुं न युक्ता ।।
data.es: "O delighter of demons even the gods and demons who are endowed with valour and energy cannot win you. You are invincible. It is not proper for you to lose chances of a good war.
data.anv: नैतानाम् for rakshasas, मनोनन्दन delighter, पराक्रमोत्साहमनस्विनां च endowed with valour, energy, सुरासुराणामपि even if gods or demons, दुर्जयेन by the invincible one, त्वया you, युद्धायतिः chances of war, नाशयितुम् to lose, न युक्ता not proper.
data.md: Invincible to the gods and Asuras themselves gifted with prowess, high spirits and intelligence, you had in battle oftentimes put to the rout the chiefs of celestials and monarchs.

data.v: हिताश्च शूराश्च समाहिताश्च; कुलेषु जाताश्च महागुणेषु । मनस्विनः शस्त्रभृतां वरिष्ठाः; कोट्यग्रशस्ते सुभृताश्च योधाः ।।
data.es: "You have with you wellwishers, courageous ones, who have good qualities born in a good race, who are noble, sensible people, wielders of weapons and wellpaid warriors in crores.
data.anv: ते to you, हिताश्च wellwishers, शूराश्च courageous, समाहिताश्च wellestablished, महागुणेषु with good qualities, कुलेषु in such races, जाताः born, मनस्विनः intellectuals, शस्त्रभृताम् among wielders of weapons, वरिष्ठाः foremost, सुभृताश्च wellpaid warriors, योधाः warriors, कोट्यग्रतः  in your presence.

data.v: तदेकदेशेन बलस्य ताव;त्केचित्तवादेशकृतोऽपयान्तु । तौ राजपुत्रौ विनिगृह्य मूढौ; परेषु ते भावयितुं प्रभावम् ।।
data.es: By your order let some strong soldiers from one contingency go and capture the two sons of the king, to exhibit your power over the enemy.
data.anv: तत् so, तव your, आदेशकृतः those who obey you, केचित् some, बलस्य army's, एकदेशेन with one part, मूढौ two foolish ones, तौ those two, राजपुत्रौ two sons of a king, विनिगृह्य capture, परेषु among your enemies, ते your, प्रभावम् power, भावयितुम् to exhibit, अभियान्तु they may march out for war.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवो महाबलः । देशकालहितं वाक्यं भ्रातुरुत्तममब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The tenheaded Ravana heard his brother, the greatsoul Vibhishana's timely advice which was in keeping with the laws of the land and replied.
data.anv: दशग्रीवः tennecked one, महात्मनः greatsoul, भ्रातुः brother's, तस्य his, देशकालहितम् in keeping with the laws of the land, तत् वचनम् that word, श्रुत्वा after hearing, उत्तरम् in return, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing those words of his, the high-souled ten-necked one spoke to his brother a speech consonant to season and place,

data.v: सम्यगुक्तं हि भवता दूतवध्या विगर्हिता । अवश्यं तु वधादन्यः क्रियतामस्य निग्रहः ।।
data.es: "Indeed, you have spoken very well.Killing of emissary is censured (in sastras). Surely we will impose suitable punishment other than killing.
data.anv: भवता by you, सम्यक् very well, उक्तं हि indeed spoken, दूतवध्या killing of emissary, विगर्हिता is censured, वधात् other than killing, अन्यः other, निग्रहः punishment, अस्य his, अवश्यम् surely, क्रियताम् may be done.
data.md: Properly had you spoken, to slay a messenger is improper. But let him be punished with any chastisement save slaying.

data.v: कपीनां किल लाङ्गूलमिष्टं भवति भूषणम् । तदस्य दीप्यतां शीघ्रं तेन दग्धेन गच्छतु ।।
data.es: "The tail is dear to the monkeys and it is an ornament for them. Set fire to it at once and let him go with his burning tail.
data.anv: कपीनाम् for the monkeys, लाङ्गूलम् tail, इष्टम् is dear, भूषणम् is an ornament, भवति किल indeed is, अस्य his, तत् that, शीघ्रम् at once, दीप्यताम् may be set fire to, दग्धेन with the burning, तेन by that, गच्छतु  let go.
data.md: Certainly the tail is a darling ornament to a monkey. Therefore let his tail be set on fire anon; and this having been consumed, let him go away.

data.v: ततः पश्यन्त्विमं दीनमङ्गवैरूप्यकर्शितम् । समित्रा ज्ञातयः सर्वे बान्धवाः ससुहृज्जनाः ।।
data.es: "Then all his friends, relatives and his kinsmen will see his disfigured and handicapped form. The demon king having ordered thus, the monkey was taken by the ogres round the junctions of the roads all over the city with his tail on fire.
data.anv: ततः then, पश्यन्त्विमं let them see, समित्रज्ञातय: including his friends and relatives, बान्धवाः  kith and kin, ससुहृज्जनाः persons close to him, दीनमङ्गवैरूप्यकर्शितम् disfigured and deformed by such handicap, प्रदीप्तेन by the flamimg, लाङ्गूलेन by the tail, रक्षोभिः by the demons, सचत्वरम् the road junctions, सर्वम् all over, पुरम् the city, परिणीयताम् take him round, राक्षसेन्द्रः demon king, आज्ञापयत् ordered.
data.md: Then shall his best friends and kindred and acquaintances see him crest-fallen, with his person deformed.

data.v: आज्ञापयद्राक्षसेन्द्रः पुरं सर्वं सचत्वरम् । लाङ्गूलेन प्रदीप्तेन रक्षोभिः परिणीयताम् ।।
data.es: "Then all his friends, relatives and his kinsmen will see his disfigured and handicapped form. The demon king having ordered thus, the monkey was taken by the ogres round the junctions of the roads all over the city with his tail on fire.
data.anv: ततः then, पश्यन्त्विमं let them see, समित्रज्ञातय: including his friends and relatives, बान्धवाः  kith and kin, ससुहृज्जनाः persons close to him, दीनमङ्गवैरूप्यकर्शितम् disfigured and deformed by such handicap, प्रदीप्तेन by the flamimg, लाङ्गूलेन by the tail, रक्षोभिः by the demons, सचत्वरम् the road junctions, सर्वम् all over, पुरम् the city, परिणीयताम् take him round, राक्षसेन्द्रः demon king, आज्ञापयत् ordered.
data.md: The lord of Rākşasas ordered, With his tail in flames, let this one be taken all round Lankā containing terraces.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसाः कोपकर्कशाः । वेष्टन्ते तस्य लाङ्गूलं जीर्णैः कार्पासिकैः पटैः ।।
data.es: "Obeying the orders of the king, the brutally angry demons wrapped his tail with tatters of cotton.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् that, वचनम् word, श्रुत्वा having heard, कोपकर्शिताः brutally angry, राक्षसाः demons, जीर्णैः tatters, कार्पासकैः of cotton, पटैः  with tatters, लाङ्गूलम् his tail, वेष्टयन्ति स्म wrapped.
data.md: Hearing his words, the Raksasas, cruel through wrath, cover up his (Hanumān's) tail with worn pieces of cotton cloth.

data.v: संवेष्ट्यमाने लाङ्गूले व्यवर्धत महाकपिः । शुष्कमिन्धनमासाद्य वनेष्विव हुताशनः ।।
data.es: While the tail was being swathed, the great vanara grew in size like wild fire fed with dry firewood.
data.anv: लाङ्गूले while that tail, संवेष्ट्यमाने was being swathed, महाकपिः great vanara, वनेषु  in the woods, शुष्कम् dried, इन्धनम् firewood,आसाद्य caught, हुताशनः इव like the fire, व्यवर्धत grew in size.
data.md: Thereat, even as fire in a forest increase on getting dry fuel, the mighty monkey grew in dimensions on his tail being wrapped up.

data.v: तैलेन परिषिच्याथ तेऽग्निं तत्रावपातयन् ।।
लाङ्गूलेन प्रदीप्तेन राक्षसांस्तानपातयत् । रोषामर्षपरीतात्मा बालसूर्यसमाननः ।।
data.es: The demons soaked the tail and set fire to it. His face burning in anger shone like the rising Sun and his mind seized with indignation, he struck them with the burning tail.
data.anv: अथ and then, ते those, तैलेन with oil, परिषिच्य having soaked, तत्र there, अग्निम् in fire, अभ्यपातयन् threw fire at his tail, बालसूर्यसमाननः his face looking like the rising Sun, रोषामर्षपरीतात्मा overtaken with anger and indignation, प्रदीप्तेन burning, लाङ्गूलेन by the tail, तान् राक्षसान् those demons, अपातयत् struck.
data.md: Having soaked (the cloth) in oil, they set fire to it. Thereat with his soul overpowered with rage and hatred, and his countenance like the risen sun, he lashed them with his flaming tail.

data.v: स भूयः संगतैः क्रूरै राकसैर्हरिसत्तमः । निबद्धः कृतवान्वीरस्तत्कालसदृशीं मतिम् ।।
data.es: When the cruel demons collected together and bound him once again the heroic Hanuman thought what was appropriate to the moment.
data.anv: वीरः hero, सः हरिसत्तमः that great monkey, सङ्गतैः (ogres) collected around him, क्रूरैः cruel, राक्षसैः with ogres, भूयः again, निबद्धः bound, तत्कालसदृशीम् appropriate to the moment, मतिम् thought, कृतवान् thought over thus.

data.v: कामं खलु न मे शक्ता निबधस्यापि राक्षसाः । छित्त्वा पाशान्समुत्पत्य हन्यामहमिमान्पुनः ।।
data.es: 'Even though these ogres are not capable, they have bound me. Indeed I will leap (into the air) once again and sever my bonds and kill them.
data.anv: रक्षसाः ogres, निबद्धस्यापि even if they bind, मे me, न शक्ताः are not able, कामं खलु indeed, अहम् I, पुनः again, पाशान् bonds, छित्त्वा after severing, समुत्पत्य leap, इमान् these, हन्याम् I will kill.
data.md: That hero (being bound), entertained a purpose in harmony with the season. "Albeit bound, the Rākşasas cannot forsooth cope with me. Snapping these bonds, I shall, darting up, again slaughter these."

data.v: सर्वेषामेव पर्याप्तो राक्षसानामहं युधि । किं तु रामस्य प्रीत्यर्थं विषहिष्येऽहमीदृशम् ।।
data.es: 'I am strong enough to destroy all the demons in a battle. I am enduring this humiliation in order to make Rama happy. In this way I will get a chance to see Lanka once again.
data.anv: युधि in battle, अहम् I, सर्वेषामेव for all of them, राक्षसानाम् for the ogres, पर्याप्तः enough, किन्तु but, रामस्य Rama's, प्रीत्यर्थम् for his pleasure, अहम् I, ईदृशम् such, लङ्का Lanka, पुनरेव once again, चारयितव्या going about, भवेत् will be, इति in this way, विषहिष्ये I will tolerate.
data.md: I can slay all these Rākşasas in battle; but I suffer this (maltreatment) for not marring the (pure delight) Rāma shall derive from my deed.

data.v: लङ्का चरयितव्या मे पुनरेव भवेदिति । रात्रौ न हि सुदृष्टा मे दुर्गकर्मविधानतः । अवश्यमेव द्रष्टव्या मया लङ्का निशाक्षये ।।
data.es: 'Indeed I saw Lanka at night for which I could not acquire proper knowledge about the fortification of the city. Surely it should be seen by me now after the night has passed.
data.anv: लङ्का Lanka, दुर्गकर्मविधानतः acquiring knowledge of the fortification of the city, रात्रौ in the night, सुदृष्टा well observed, न हि not indeed, निशाक्षये at the end of the night, मया by me, अवश्यमेव surely, द्रष्टव्या should be seen.
data.md: I shall once more range around Lankā. Let this be so. At night I could not satisfactorily examine the fortifications.* (Another meaning is:-lts places inaccessible on account of works.)

data.v: कामं बन्धैश्च मे भूयः पुच्छस्योद्दीपनेन च । पीडां कुर्वन्तु रक्षांसि न मेऽस्ति मनसः श्रमः ।।
data.es: 'Let the demons torture me freely by setting fire to my tail. Let them bind me. I am not exhausted.
data.anv: भूयः again, बद्धस्य bound, मे for me, पुच्छस्य tail, उद्दीपनेन च by burning the same, रक्षांसि demons, कामम् surely, पीडाम् torment, कुर्वन्तु they may as they wish, मे me, मनसः mind, श्रमः exhausted, नास्ति not experienced.
data.md: For certain, by me is to be beheld Lankā when night has departed. Let them bind me anew. The Rākşasas pain me by setting fire to my tail; but my mind dose not tire.

data.v: ततस्ते संवृताकारं सत्त्ववन्तं महाकपिम् । परिगृह्य ययुर्हृष्टा राक्षसाः कपिकुञ्जरम् ।।
data.es: Then the ogres set forth joyfully capturing the very powerful elephant among the monkeys, the great vanara who had contracted his body.
data.anv: ततः then, ते राक्षसाः those ogres, हृष्टाः joyfully, संवृताकारम् contracted, सत्त्ववन्तम् very powerful, कपिकुञ्जरम् elephant among monkeys, महाकपिम् great vanara, परिगृह्य after capturing, ययुः set forth.
data.md: Then the Raksasas, rejoicing greatly, went off, taking that mighty monkey endowed with strength, an elephant (in prowess) among monkeys. And blowing conchs and trumpets, and bruiting it abroad by various actions, (Publishing Hanuman's penalty) those Raksasas of cruel deeds took (Hanumān) about the city (of Lankā).

data.v: शङ्खभेरीनिनादैस्तैर्घोषयन्तः स्वकर्मभिः । राक्षसाः क्रूरकर्माणश्चारयन्ति स्म तां पुरीम् ।।
data.es: The cruel demons started blowing conches and beating drums. They paraded him in the city announcing their deeds.
data.anv: क्रूरकर्मणः cruel in action, राक्षसाः ogres, तम् him, शङ्खभेरीनिनादैश्च by sounding conches and beating drums, स्वकर्मभिः with their actions, घोषयन्तः while announcing, तां पुरीम् that city, चारयन्ति स्म paraded him.

data.v: हनुमांश्चारयामास राक्षसानां महापुरीम् । अथापश्यद्विमानानि विचित्राणि महाकपिः ।।
संवृतान्भूमिभागांश्च सुविभक्तांश्च चत्वरान् । रथ्याश्च गृहसंबाधाः कपिः शृङ्गाटकानि च ।।
चत्वरेषु चतुष्केषु राजमार्गे तथैव च । घोषयन्ति कपिं सर्वे चारीक इति राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: All the demons went forth through cross roads, altars built on four pillars and royal roads announcing that he (Hanuman) was a spy.

श्वसनेन च संयोगादतिवेगो महाबलः । कालाग्निरिव जज्वाल प्रावर्धत हुताशनः ।।
data.es: The windgod's association made the fire spread at great speed. It appeared like fire at the time of dissolution.
data.anv: हुताशनः consumer of oblations, Firegod, श्वसनेन by the wind, संयोगात् by association, अतिवेगः at great speed, महाबलः mighty, प्रावर्धत grew, कालाग्निरिव like the fire at the time of dissolution, जज्वाल burnt.
data.md: And assisted by the wind, that highly powerful and vehement one (Fire) flaimed up, like fire at the wreck of all, and the fire attained energy.

data.v: प्रदीप्तमग्निं पवनस्तेषु वेश्मसु चारयत् ।।
data.es: Combined with the wind the fire began to spread, burning the houses with great speed.
data.anv: पवनः wind, प्रदीप्तम् burning, अग्निम् fire, तेषु in those, वेश्मसु in houses, आचारयत्  spread, श्वसनसंयोगात् combining with wind, हुताशनः fire, अतिवेगः at high speed, अभूत् spread.

data.v: तानि काञ्चनजालानि मुक्तामणिमयानि च । भवनान्यवशीर्यन्त रत्नवन्ति महान्ति च ।।
data.es: The palatial structures with windows of golden meshwork, embedded with pearls and gems and other precious stones tumbled.
data.anv: काञ्चनजालानि golden meshwork, मुक्तामणिमयानि च with pearls and gems embedded, रत्नवन्ति filled with precious gems, महान्ति च big ones, तानि भवनानि those buildings, अवशीर्यन्त were demolished.
data.md: The wind spreading the flaming fire all round those dwellings, those mansions furnished with golden networks; and containing pearls and gems; enjewelled and magnificent, were shorn of their splendour.

data.v: तानि भग्नविमानानि निपेतुर्वसुधातले । भवनानीव सिद्धानामम्बरात्पुण्यसंक्षये ।।
वज्रविद्रुमवैदूर्यमुक्तारजतसंहितान् । विचित्रान्भवनाद्धातून्स्यन्दमानान्ददर्श सः ।।
data.es: Hanuman saw many colourful molten minerals mixed with diamonds, corals vaiduryas, pearls and silver flowing (dropping) from every mansion.
data.anv: सः he, वज्रविद्रुमवैढूर्यमुक्तारजतसंहितान् mixed with diamonds, corals, Vaiduryas, pearls and silver, विचित्रान् colourful ones, भवनात् from the mansion, स्यन्दमानान् molten, धातून् minerals, ददर्श he saw.
data.md: And he (Hanuman) saw various kinds of metals, mixed with diamonds, and coral, and lapises and pearls and silver, running down in streams from the mansions.

data.v: नाग्निस्तृप्यति काष्ठानां तृणानां च यथा तथा । हनूमान्राक्षसेन्द्राणां वधे किंचिन्न तृप्यति ।।
data.es: Just as fire is not satisfied with dry sticks and grass Hanuman was not satisfied with the dead demons.
data.anv: अग्निः fire, काष्ठानाम्  with dry logs, तृणानाम्  blades of grass, न तृप्यति is not satisfied, राक्षसेन्द्राणाम् of demon kings, विशस्तानाम् dead ones, न तृप्यति is not satisfied.
data.md: And as Fire is not cloyed with wood and straw, Hanumān never at all felt satiety on slaying those foremost of Räkşasas. And the Earth could not contain the Rākşasas slain by Hanumăn.

data.v: हुताशनज्वालसमावृता सा; हतप्रवीरा परिवृत्तयोधा । हनूमातः क्रोधबलाभिभूता; बभूव शापोपहतेव लङ्का ।।
data.es: With the Fire god spreading flames all over, heroes dead, retreating troops shattered by Hanuman's anger, Lanka appeared as though it was cursed.
data.anv: हुताशनज्वालसमावृता engulfed in the flames spread by the Firegod, हतप्रवीराः with its heroes dead, परिवृत्तयोधा with the retreating troops, हनूमतः Hanuman's, क्रोधबलाभिभूता by Hanuman's power of anger, सा लङ्का that Lanka, शापोपहतेव as if cursed, बभूव became.
data.md: And with the flames encircling her, and her foremost heroes fallen, and her warriors destroyed, Lankā, overcome by the might of Hanumān's wrath, became as if she had been blighted by an imprecation.

data.v: ससंभ्रमं त्रस्तविषण्णराक्षसां; समुज्ज्वलज्ज्वालहुताशनाङ्किताम् । ददर्श लङ्कां हनुमान्महामनाः; स्वयम्भुकोपोपहतामिवावनिम् ।।
data.es: Highly sensitive Hanuman saw the city of Lanka filled with perplexed, scared and sorrowful demons, Lanka succumbed to the flames of firegod and looked as if it was hit by the anger of Brahma, the selfborn god.
data.anv: महामनाः a highly sensitive person, हनुमान् Hanuman, ससम्भ्रमत्रस्तविषण्णराक्षसाम् with demons perplexed, scared and sorrowful, समुज्वलज्ज्वालहुताशनाङ्किताम् succumbed to the flames of the burning firegod, लङ्काम् Lanka, स्वयम्भूकोपोपहताम् hit by the anger of Brahma (at the time of dissolution of the universe), अवनिम् इव like the earth, लङ्काम् Lanka, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Then the mighty-minded Hanumān beheld the Rākşasas in terror and trepidation and cast down, and Lankā marked by fire and bright flames, even as the Self-sprung eye the world destroyed by his rage.

data.v: स राक्षसांस्तान्सुबहूंश्च हत्वा; वनं च भङ्क्त्वा बहुपादपं तत् । विसृज्य रक्षो भवनेषु चाग्निं; जगाम रामं मनसा महात्मा ।।
data.es: Great Hanuman, sought Rama's presence in his mind after killing many demons, breaking down many trees of the garden, and setting fire to the mansions of demons.
data.anv: महात्मा a great self, सः he, सुबहून् many of them, तान् राक्षसान् the demons, हत्वा having killed, बहुपादपम् having many trees, तत् वनं च that garden also, भङ्क्त्वा after breaking, रक्षोभवनेषु in the mansions of demons, अग्निम् fire, विसृज्य after setting, मनसा in his mind, रामम् Rama, जगाम reached.
data.md: And destroying many a Rākṣasa, felling many trees in the forest and setting fire to the houses of the Raksasas, the high-souled (monkey) became engaged in thoughts touching Rāma.

data.v: लङ्कां समस्तां संदीप्य लाङ्गूलाग्निं महाकपिः । निर्वापयामास तदा समुद्रे हरिसत्तमः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman, having burnt the entire city of Lanka, put out the fire on his tail in the ocean. Beholding the burning city, the destroyed gardens and the panic stricken ogres, he began to think:
data.anv: लङ्कां समस्तां the entire city of Lanka, सन्दीप्य having burnt, महाबलः powerful, तदा then, लाङ्गूलाग्निं fire on his tail, समुद्रे in the ocean, निर्वापयामास put off, वानरः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman, सन्दीप्यमानाम् having been lit, विध्वस्ताम् destroyed, त्रस्तरक्षोगणाम् panic stricken ogres, लङ्कां पुरीम् Lanka city, आवेक्ष्य  seeing, चिन्तयामास began to think.
data.md: And having consumed ihe city of Lankä, the great monkey quenched the fire of his tail in the Ocean.

data.v: संदीप्यमानां विध्वस्तां त्रस्तरक्षो गणां पुरीम् । अवेक्ष्य हानुमाँल्लङ्कां चिन्तयामास वानरः ।।
data.es: Powerful Hanuman, having burnt the entire city of Lanka, put out the fire on his tail in the ocean. Beholding the burning city, the destroyed gardens and the panic stricken ogres, he began to think:
data.anv: लङ्कां समस्तां the entire city of Lanka, सन्दीप्य having burnt, महाबलः powerful, तदा then, लाङ्गूलाग्निं fire on his tail, समुद्रे in the ocean, निर्वापयामास put off, वानरः vanara, हनुमान् Hanuman, सन्दीप्यमानाम् having been lit, विध्वस्ताम् destroyed, त्रस्तरक्षोगणाम् panic stricken ogres, लङ्कां पुरीम् Lanka city, आवेक्ष्य  seeing, चिन्तयामास began to think.
data.md: Beholding Lankā burnt down and devastated and the demons terrified, the monkey Hanumān began to reflect.

data.v: तस्याभूत्सुमहांस्त्रासः कुत्सा चात्मन्यजायत । लङ्कां प्रदहता कर्म किंस्वित्कृतमिदं मया ।।
data.es: Overtaken by great fear, Hanuman felt a sense of selfreproach seeing Lanka reduced to ashes, and said, ' Lanka is burnt. What a heinous action has been perpetrated by me'.
data.anv: तस्य to him, सुमहान् very great, त्रासः fear, अभूत् overtook, आत्मनि in himself, कुत्सा च self reproach, अजायत was felt, लङ्काम् Lanka, प्रदहता while burning, मया by me, इदम् this, किंस्वित् what a heinous, कर्म action, कृतम् perpetrated.
data.md: And worked up with fear and remorse, he reflected, “What a mighty iniquity have I perpetrated by burning down Lankā of my own accord.

data.v: धन्यास्ते पुरुषश्रेष्ठ ये बुद्ध्या कोपमुत्थितम् । निरुन्धन्ति महात्मानो दीप्तमग्निमिवाम्भसा ।।
data.es: 'Blessed indeed are the highsouled men, who in their wisdom restrain their own anger as one would put off burning fire with water.
data.anv: उत्थितम् rising, कोपम् anger, बुद्ध्या by their wisdom,दीप्तम् burning अग्निम् fire, अम्भसा इव with water, ये those, निरुन्धन्ति will restrain, महात्मानः highsouled men, ते they, पुरुषश्रेष्ठाः best among men, धन्याः blessed.
data.md: Blessed are those high-souled ones who control their wrath by dint of their own good sense, like to fire quenched by water.

data.v: यदि दग्धा त्वियं लङ्का नूनमार्यापि जानकी । दग्धा तेन मया भर्तुर्हतं कार्यमजानता ।।
data.es: 'If this Lanka is burnt, even noble Janaki is burnt, my master's work is spoilt by me unknowingly.
data.anv: इयम् this, लङ्का Lanka, दग्धा यदि if it burnt, आर्या noble lady, जानक्यपि even Janaki, दग्धा is burnt, तेन therefore, अजानता unknowingly, मया by me, भर्तुः master's, कार्यम् mission, हतम् spoilt.
data.md: Forsooth has the worshipful Jảnaki been burnt, since the whole city of Lankā has been devastated with fire. And she being burnt, foolishly have I spoilt the work of my master.

data.v: यदर्थमयमारम्भस्तत्कार्यमवसादितम् । मया हि दहता लङ्कां न सीता परिरक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'My very mission is foiled. Sita has not been protected by me for no part of Lanka has escaped unburnt.
data.anv: यदर्थम् on account of what, अयम् this, आरम्भ: effort, तत् कार्यम् that work, अवसादितम् is foiled, लङ्काम् Lanka, दहता while burning, मया by me, सीता Sita, न परिरक्षिता हि not protected.
data.md: I have defeated the great object for which I have laboured so much. In burning down Lankā, I have not saved Sītā.

data.v: ईषत्कार्यमिदं कार्यं कृतमासीन्न संशयः । तस्य क्रोधाभिभूतेन मया मूलक्षयः कृतः ।।
data.anv: इदं कार्यम् this work, ईषत्कार्यम् a small work, कृतम् is done, आसीन्न was, क्रोधाभिभूतेन over powered by anger, मया by me, तस्य its, मूलक्षयः the very root of my achievement is defeated, कृतः done, संशयः doubt, न no.
data.md: To have burnt down Lankā is assuredly a trifle, but in my ire I have lost my great object. Forsooth has Janaki been consumed, since I behold no spot in Lankā which is not made desolate with fire-in fact the whole city has been reduced to ashes.

data.v: विनष्टा जानकी व्यक्तं न ह्यदग्धः प्रदृश्यते । लङ्कायाः कश्चिदुद्देशः सर्वा भस्मीकृता पुरी ।।
data.es: 'Surely Janaki has perished in Lanka, for not even a little place is left unburnt. The entire city is reduced to ashes.
data.anv: नूनम् surely, जानकी Janaki, विनष्टा lost, लङ्कायाम् in Lanka, कश्चित् even a little, उद्धेशः place, अदग्धः unburnt, न प्रदृश्यते हि indeed not seen, सर्वाः entire, पुरी city, भस्मीकृता is reduced to ashes.
data.md: To have burnt down Lankā is assuredly a trifle, but in my ire I have lost my great object. Forsooth has Janaki been consumed, since I behold no spot in Lankā which is not made desolate with fire-in fact the whole city has been reduced to ashes.

data.v: यदि तद्विहतं कार्यं मया प्रज्ञाविपर्ययात् । इहैव प्राणसंन्यासो ममापि ह्यतिरोचते ।।
data.es: 'If my work has been destroyed by my perversity of judgement, I will give up my life now and here itself'.
data.anv: मम my, प्रज्ञाविपर्ययात् stupidity, तत् this, कार्यम् work, विहतं यदि if it has been foiled, ममापि foil me also, इहैव here itself, प्राणसन्यासः give up life, अद्य now, रोचते is proper.
data.md: As I have committed such an injury under the influence of my perverse understanding, it behave me to relinquish my life here.

data.v: किमग्नौ निपताम्यद्य आहोस्विद्वडवामुखे । शरीरमाहो सत्त्वानां दद्मि सागरवासिनाम् ।।
data.es: 'Shall I end my life by jumping into fire just now, or else into the mouth of submarine fire? Should I offer my body to the living creatures of the ocean as their food?
data.anv: अद्य today, अग्नौ in fire, निपतामि shall I jump, आहोस्वित् alas बडबामुखे in the mouth of submarine fire, आहो alas शरीरम् body, सागरवासिनाम् सत्त्वानाम् to those aquatic creatures living in the ocean दद्मि I would offer.
data.md: I shall jump into this flame or into a submarine fire, or I shall resign my mortal frame to the animals that infest the ocean.

data.v: कथं हि जीवता शक्यो मया द्रष्टुं हरीश्वरः । तौ वा पुरुषशार्दूलौ कार्यसर्वस्वघातिना ।।
data.es: 'Having spoilt the entire work how can I show my face to the king of monkeys? How is it possible to see both the tigers among men?
data.anv: कार्यसर्वस्वघातिना after completely spoiling the work, मया by me, जीवता with life, हरीश्वरः king of monkeys, द्रष्टुम् to see, कथं वा how to, शक्यः possible, पुरुषशार्दूलौ two tigers among men, तौ वा or both those (Rama and Lakshmana.)
data.md: For, living, I shall not be able to face that lord of monkeys, and how shall I, having spoilt their work utterly, show myself to those foremost of men?

data.v: मया खलु तदेवेदं रोषदोषात्प्रदर्शितम् । प्रथितं त्रिषु लोकेषु कपितमनवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'On account of my mistake of yielding to anger, I have exhibited the unstable monkeynature and made it well established in the three worlds.
data.anv: मया by me, रोषदोषात् due to the mistake committed angerily, त्रिषु लोकेषु in all the three worlds, प्रथितम् wellknown, अनवस्थितम् Instability, तत् that, इदम् this, कपित्वम् monkeynature, प्रदर्शितं खलु indeed exhibited.
data.md: I have through my culpable passion furnished an illustration of the reckless monkey-nature, which is well known over the three worlds.

data.v: धिगस्तु राजसं भावमनीशमनवस्थितम् । ईश्वरेणापि यद्रागान्मया सीता न रक्षिता ।।
data.es: 'Fie upon my hasty action commited due to lack of selfcontrol. I did not save Sita eventhough the entire situation was under my control. (I had the capacity to save her. But I failed due to anger.)
data.anv: अनीशम् having no control, अनवस्थितम् unstable, राजसम् excitable, भावम् nature, धिक् अस्तु fie upon, यत् that which, ईश्वरेणापि even though I am powerful, मया by me, रागात् out of passion, सीता Sita, न रक्षिता is not protected.
data.md: Fie on this activity, born of (the quality of) passion, which is the source of incompetence and rashness; since although capable, I did not protect Sita.

data.v: विनष्टायां तु सीतायां तावुभौ विनशिष्यतः । तयोर्विनाशे सुग्रीवः सबन्धुर्विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If the two princes know about Sita's loss they will die and when they are dead Sugriva would perish along with all his relatives.
data.anv: सीतायाम् When Sita, विनष्टायाम् is lost, तौ उभौ those two, विनशिष्यतः will die, तयोः of those two, विनाशे when they are dead, सबन्धुः including all relatives, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, विनशिष्यति will perish.
data.md: On Sītā having met with destruction, both of them (Rāma and Lakşmaņa) shall cease to exist; and on their ceasing to exist, Sugrīva shall die along with his friends.

data.v: एतदेव वचः श्रुत्वा भरतो भ्रातृवत्सलः । धर्मात्मा सहशत्रुघ्नः कथं शक्ष्यति जीवितुम् ।।
data.es: 'How will the loving righteous brother, Bharata along with Satrughna survive after hearing this?
data.anv: एतदेव this alone, वचः word, श्रुत्वा having heard, भ्रातृवत्सलः a loving brother, धर्मात्मा righteous one, सहशत्रुघ्नः along with Satrughna, भरतः Bharata, जीवितुम् to live, कथम् how, शक्ष्यति he can.
data.md: Hearing these tidings, how shall the righteous Bharata, attached to his brother (Rāma), along with Satrughna, live?

data.v: इक्ष्वाकुवंशे धर्मिष्ठे गते नाशमसंशयम् । भविष्यन्ति प्रजाः सर्वाः शोकसंतापपीडिताः ।।
data.es: 'When the righteous Ikshvaku race perishes the people would be tormented by grief and remorse. There is no doubt.
data.anv: धर्मिष्ठे when the righteous, इक्ष्वाकुवंशे Ikshvaku race, नाशम् will perish, गते when it happens, सर्वाः all, प्रजाः people, असंशयम् there is no doubt, शोकसन्तापपीडिताः tormented by grief and remorse, भविष्यन्ति would be.
data.md: And on the virtuous Ikşvāku race being extinct, without doubt, all the subjects shall be overwhelmed with grief.

data.v: तदहं भाग्यरहितो लुप्तधर्मार्थसंग्रहः । रोषदोषपरीतात्मा व्यक्तं लोकविनाशनः ।।
data.es: 'I have failed in seeking dharma and artha. It is evident is that I am a destroyer of the world because I was overtaken by anger. How unfortunate I am'
data.anv: तत् then, भाग्यरहितः unfortunate, लुप्तधर्मार्थसङ्ग्रहः failed to secure dharma and artha, रोषदोषपरीतात्मा overwhelmed with anger, अहम् I, व्यक्तम् this is evident, लोकनाशनः  destroyer of the whole world.
data.md: Therefore, I of crust luck has had my harvest of virtue and profit taken away; and being under the influence of baleful passion, I am the cause of the destruction of creatures.

data.v: इति चिन्तयतस्तस्य निमित्तान्युपपेदिरे । पूरमप्युपलब्धानि साक्षात्पुनरचिन्तयत् ।।
data.es: When Hanuman was thus bemoaning, good omens as in the past appeared before him. He started reflecting once again:
data.anv: तस्य when he, इति thus, चिन्तयतः while he was bemoaning, साक्षात् directly witnessed, पूर्वमपि earlier, उपलब्धानि experienced, निमित्तानि omens, उपपेदिरे पुनः once again  appeared, अचिन्तयत् he reflected upon them again.
data.md: As he was reflecting thus, he bethought him of auspicious omens which he had witnessed since.

data.v: अथ वा चारुसर्वाङ्गी रक्षिता स्वेन तेजसा । न नशिष्यति कल्याणी नाग्निरग्नौ प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: 'On the other hand a beautiful and auspicious lady like Sita will be protected by her own splendour and will not perish as fire cannot extinguish fire. (Sita is pure like fire. Here the great sage Valmiki is suggesting the future incident in which Sita emerged safe from 'Agnipariksha' or fireordeal.)
data.anv: अथवा or else, चारुसर्वाङ्गी lady of beautiful limbs, स्वेन by her own, तेजसा by splendour, रक्षिता is protected, कल्याणी auspicious lady, न नशिष्यति will not perish, अग्निः fire, अग्नौ at fire, न प्रवर्तते cannot actbe effective.
data.md: Or it may be that one of charming limbs has been preserved by her proper energy. The blessed one may not have met with her end, for fire dose burn fire.

data.v: न हि धर्मान्मनस्तस्य भार्याममिततेजसः । स्वचारित्राभिगुप्तां तां स्प्रष्टुमर्हति पावकः ।।
data.es: 'Fire cannot touch that lady who is protected by her own chastity and who is wedded to the righteous man of immasureable glory.
data.anv: धर्मात्मनः of the righteous one, अमिततेजसः of a man of immeasureable glory, तस्य his, भार्याम् wife, स्वचारित्राभिगुप्ताम् protected by her own chastity, ताम् her, पावकः fire, स्प्रष्टुम् to touch, नार्हति हि cannot.
data.md: Fire should not touch the spouse of that virtuous one of immeasurable energy, who is protected by her own character.

data.v: नूनं रामप्रभावेन वैदेह्याः सुकृतेन च । यन्मां दहनकर्मायं नादहद्धव्यवाहनः ।।
data.es: 'Fire, the consumer of oblations who has the property of burning has not burnt me and this is surely on account of Rama's power and Vaidehi's merits.
data.anv: दहनकर्मा fire who consumes, अयम् this, हन्यवाहनः the consumer of oblations, माम् me, नादहत् did not burn, इति यत् and this is, नूनम् surely, रामप्रभावेण by Rama's power, वैदेह्याः Vaidehi's, सुकृतेन च by her merits also.
data.md: And that bearer of sacrificial offerings has not burnt me, is owing to Rāma's power and the virtue of Vaidehi.

data.v: त्रयाणां भरतादीनां भ्रातॄणां देवता च या । रामस्य च मनःकान्ता सा कथं विनशिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'To Bharata, Lakshmana and Satrughna she is a goddess and she is dear to Rama's heart, how would she perish?
data.anv: या such lady, भरतादीनाम् of Bharata and others, त्रयाणाम् of all the three, देवताः च is treated as a goddess, रामस्य Rama's, मनः कान्ता dear to his heart, सा she, कथम् how, विनशिष्यति will she be destroyed?
data.md: Why should she that is a very goddess to the three brothers, Bharata and the others, and that has enchanted the mind of Rāma, meet with destruction?

data.v: यद्वा दहनकर्मायं सर्वत्र प्रभुरव्ययः । न मे दहति लाङ्गूलं कथमार्यां प्रधक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'If not so, the firegod who never fails in burning has not burnt my tail. How will he burn noble Sita?'
data.anv: यद्वा or if, सर्वत्र everywhere, प्रभुः lord, अव्ययः that which never fails, अयम् this, दहनकर्मा burning firegod, मे my, लङ्गूलम् tail, न दहति has not burnt, आर्याम् noble Sita, कथम् how, प्रधक्ष्यति will he burn.
data.md: When that everywhere unspent Lord, having burning for his office, has not consumed my tail, why should he burn the exalted lady?

data.v: तपसा सत्यवाक्येन अनन्यत्वाच्च भर्तरि । अपि सा निर्दहेदग्निं न तामग्निः प्रधक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'By virtue of her power of asceticism, power of truthfulness and exclusive devotion towards her husband, she may consume the fire. Fire will not burn her'.
data.anv: तपसा by asceticism, सत्यवाक्येन by adhering to truth, भर्तरि towards her husband, अनन्यत्वाच्च completeexclusive devotion, सा she, अग्निम् fire, निर्दहेत् अपि may even burn, ताम् her, अग्निः fire, न प्रधक्ष्यति is not capable of burning.
data.md: By virtue of her asceticism, veracity, and devotion to her lord she it is that can consume Fire, but Fire cannot burn her.

data.v: स तथा चिन्तयंस्तत्र देव्या धर्मपरिग्रहम् । शुश्राव हनुमान्वाक्यं चारणानां महात्मनाम् ।।
data.es: As Hanuman was thinking so, he heard the words of the great charanas who were praising the queen's power of righteousness.
data.anv: तत्र there, तथा so, देव्याः queen's, धर्मपरिग्रहम् power of righteousness, चिन्तयन् while thinking, सः हनुमान् that Hanuman, महात्मनाम् of the great ones, चारणानाम् of charanas (heavenly birds moving in the sky), वाक्यम् word, शुश्राव heard.
data.md: And as Hanumān was thinking of the magnitude of that revered lady's religious merit, he heard the converse there of high-souled Caranas.

data.v: अहो खलु कृतं कर्म दुर्विषह्यं हनूमता । अग्निं विसृजताभीक्ष्णं भीमं राक्षससद्मनि ।।
data.es: 'Oh Hanuman has indeed accomplished the marvellous task of spreading the terrific fire on the demons buildings.
data.anv: राक्षसवेश्मनि in the demons buildings, आभीक्ष्णम् excessively, भीमम् terrific, अग्निम् fire, विसृजता spreading, हनूमता by Hanuman, दुष्करम् marvellous, कर्म task, कृतं खलु has been done verily, अहो Oh
data.md: Ah! hard is the feat that Hanumān has forsooth achieved. He has created a terrific and fierce conflagration in the abode of the Rākşasa.

data.v: दग्धेयं नगरी लङ्का साट्टप्राकारतोरणा । जानकी न च दग्धेति विस्मयोऽद्भुत एव नः ।।
data.es: 'The city with its towering markets, ramparts and portals is burnt, but Janaki is not. It is really wonderful, strange
data.anv: साट्टप्राकारतोरणा with towering markets ramparts and portals, इयम् this, नगरी city, सर्वा entirely, दग्धा is burnt, जानकी च and Janaki, न दग्धा is not burnt, इति thus, नः for us, अद्भुतः wonderful, विस्मयः एव It is surprising.
data.md: The females of Rākşasa accompanied by boys and old folks, are flying amain; and in consequence of the hubbub it seems as if (Lankā) is in lamentation through her mountaincaverns. Burnt is this city of Lankā with her turrets, walls and gate-ways; and we are astonished that Jānakī is not burnt.

data.v: स निमित्तैश्च दृष्टार्थैः कारणैश्च महागुणैः । ऋषिवाक्यैश्च हनुमानभवत्प्रीतमानसः ।।
data.es: With omens that proved to be right and for good reasons and from the words of the sages (charanas), Hanuman felt happy.
data.anv: सः हनूमान् that Hanuman, दृष्ठार्थैः with proofs having seen, निमित्तै: with omens, महागुणैः  good tidings, कारणैश्च and by reasons, ऋषिवाक्यैश्च by the sages words, प्रीतमानसः happy at heart, अभवत् became.
data.md: And what through the auspicious omens that he had witnessed, and what through the speech of the saints, Hanumān was delighted (beyond measure).

data.v: ततः कपिः प्राप्तमनोरथार्थ;स्तामक्षतां राजसुतां विदित्वा । प्रत्यक्षतस्तां पुनरेव दृष्ट्वा; प्रतिप्रयाणाय मतिं चकार ।।
data.es: Hanuman, having fulfilled his desires and knowing that Sita is not hurt, thought of departing after meeting Sita once again (to testify that she is really safe).इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चपञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the fiftyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, कपिः Hanuman, प्राप्तमनोरथार्थः with his desires fulfilled, तां राजसुताम् the princess, अक्षताम् not hurt, विदित्वा after knowing, ताम् her, पुनरेव once again, प्रत्यक्षतः directly, दृष्ट्वा after seeing, प्रतिप्रयाणाय for departing, मतिम् thought, चकार entertained.
data.md: Then the monkey, with his end attained, knowing that the king's daughter was unhurt, became bent upon returning after seeing her once again.

data.v: ततस्तु शिंशपामूले जानकीं पर्यवस्थिताम् । अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्दिष्ट्या पश्यामि त्वामिहाक्षताम् ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman offered salutations to Janaki, stationed at the foot of the simsupa tree, and said, "Luckily I see you unscathed."
data.anv: ततः then, शिंशुपामूले under the simsupa tree, पर्युपस्थिताम् stationed, जानकीम् Janakai, अभिवाद्य offered salutation, अब्रवीत् said, दिष्ट्या luckily, अक्षताम् unscathed, त्वाम् you, इह here, पश्यामि I see you.
data.md: Then seeing Jānakī seated at the foot of the Śinsapa tree, (Hanumān) saluting her said, “By luck it is that I see you unhurt."

data.v: ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः । भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं हनूमन्तमभाषत ।।
data.es: Sita again and again looked at Hanuman who was about to start. She made him understand her words conveying her love for Rama.
data.anv: ततः then, सीता Sita, प्रस्थितम् ready to start, तम् him, पुनः पुनः again and again, वीक्षमाणा looking at, भर्तृस्नेहान्वितम् conveying her love to Rama, वाक्यम् word, सौहार्दात् goodhearted, अनुमानयत् she made him understand.
data.md: And gazing at him once and again as he prepared to go away, Sītā froin affection honoured the speech which had been uttered (by Hanuman) out of attachment to his master.

data.v: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने । पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः ।।
data.es: "O slayer of enemy heroes if you alone can accomplish this task the fame of doing this will be yours.
data.anv: परवीरघ्न slayer of enemy heroes, अस्य कार्यस्य this task, परिसाधने to accomplish, त्वम् you, एक एव alone are, पर्याप्तः कामम् are competent, ते to you, फलोदयः fruit, यशस्यः of the accomplishment.
data.md: Or you alone, O destroyer of hostile heroes, are quite enough for the fulfilment of this purpose; and you shall reap, in the shape of fame, the fruit of your achievement.

data.v: बलैस्तु संकुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः । मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तस्य तत्सादृशं भवेत् ।।
data.es: "If Kakutstha (Rama), slayer of the enemy army fills the entire Lanka with his arrows and takes me, then his action will be worthy of him.
data.anv: परबलार्दनः slayer of enemy army, काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, लङ्काम् Lanka, शरैः with arrows, सङ्कुलाम् an agitated place, कृत्वा does, माम् me, नयेद्यदि if he takes, तत् that, तस्य his action, सदृशम् agreeable, भवेत् will be.
data.md: Truly it shall be his becoming work, if Kākutstha, the repressor of enemy's host, can take me away, enveloping the city Lankā with his army.

data.v: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः । भवत्याहवशूरस्य तत्त्वमेवोपपादय ।।
data.es: "You may make arrangement in such a manner that, that great self, the hero in war makes his victorious march which is worthy of him."
data.anv: तत् that, महात्मनः of the great self, आहवशूरस्य of the hero in war, तस्य his, अनुरूपम् worthy of him, विक्रान्तम् victorious, यथा in such a way, भवेत् will be, तथा in that way, त्वम् you, उपपादय you may make arrangement.
data.md: Do you, therefore, adopt such means that the high-souled heroic warrior may have an opportunity of putting forth prowess.

data.v: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम् । निशम्य हनुमांस्तस्या वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard the meaningful, courteous and logical words of Sita, Hanuman replied:
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, अर्थोपहितम् meaningful, प्रश्रितम् courteous, हेतुसंहितम् logical, तत् those, वाक्यम् words, निशम्य having heard, शेषम् the rest, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said, उत्तरं in reply.
data.md: Hearing those words fraught with sense and reason and informed with affection, Hanumān, by way of reply said mildly.

data.v: क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थो हर्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः । यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीञ्शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Kakutstha Rama, accompanied by vanaras and bears will reach here soon and conquer the enemies in war and relieve your grief.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थ: Kakutstha, हर्यृक्षप्रवरैः with vanaras and bears, क्षिप्रम् at once, एष्यति he will hasten, यः he, युधि in war, अरीन् enemies, विजित्य winning over, ते your, शोकम् grief, व्यपनयिष्यति will relieve.
data.md: Soon shall Käkutstha come, surrounded by the foremost monkeys and bears; and, vanquishing the foe in fight, shall remove your grief.

data.v: एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीमभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Questioned thus by Vaidehi, Hanuman, son of the Windgod started describing Rama's physique as it is.
data.anv: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः thereafter, रामम् Rama, यथातत्त्वम् as it is, आख्यातुम् to describe, उपचक्रमे he started telling.
data.md: Having thus solaced Vaidehi's daughter, Hanumān, son to the Wind-god again spoke to Vaidehi, saying.

data.v: ततः स कपिशार्दूलः स्वामिसंदर्शनोत्सुकः । आरुरोह गिरिश्रेष्ठमरिष्टमरिमर्दनः ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman, the crusher of enemies, a tiger among vanaras anxious to see his lord ascended the mount Arishta.
data.anv: ततः then, अरिमर्दनः crusher of foes, सः he, कपिशार्दूलः a tiger among vanaras, स्वामिसन्दर्शनोत्सुकः anxious to see his lord, अरिष्टम् Arishta, गिरिश्रेष्ठम् excellent mountain, आरुरोह ascended.

data.v: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभिर्नीलाभिर्वनराजिभिः । सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च वंशैश्च बहुभिर्वृतम् ।।
data.es: Mount Arishta was full of blue forestranges with choicest tall padmaka trees. With clouds hanging on the slopes of mountain peaks, it appeared as though the mountain was wrapped in an upper garment.
data.anv: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभि: by those choicest tall padmaka trees, नीलाभिः by dark ones, वनराजिभिः with forest ranges, शृङ्गान्तरविलम्बिभिः hanging down from the spaces between the peaks of mountain, अम्भोदैः the rainy clouds, सोत्तरीयमिव as if covered with an upper garment.

data.v: लतावितानैर्विततैः पुष्पवद्भिरलंकृतम् । नानामृगगणाकीर्णं धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम् ।।
data.es: It was spread with creepers filled with beautiful flowers and herds of animals. The colourful minerals flowing down decorated the mountain.
data.anv: विततैः with those spread out, पुष्पवद्भिः with those filled with flowers, लतावितानैः with creepers stretched all over, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् crowded with herds of animals, धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम् decorated with colourful minerals dropping down.

data.v: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतं शिलासंचयसंकटम् । महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिंनरोरगसेवितम् ।।
data.es: There were many streams of water flowing and rocks making it difficult for the streams to flow. The mountain was inhabited by sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas, and uragas.
data.anv: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतम् full of waterfalls, शिलासञ्चयसङ्कटम् with heaps of rocks making (the streams' flow difficult), महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिन्नरोरगसेवितम् attended with sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas.

data.v: लतापादपसंबाधं सिंहाकुलितकन्दरम् । व्याघ्रसंघसमाकीर्णं स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम् ।।
data.es: The clusters of creepers, and trees bearing tasty fruits and roots were uprooted. There were caves inhabited by lions. Herds of tigers were scattered all over (by the impetus of Hanuman's pressure on the mountain).
data.anv: लतापादपसङ्घातम् with clusters of creepers and trees, सिंहाध्युषितकन्दरम् caves inhabited by lions, व्याघ्रसङ्घसमाकीर्णम् herds of tigers scattered all over, स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम् full of trees bearing tasty roots and fruits.

data.v: तमारुरोहातिबलः पर्वतं प्लवगोत्तमः । रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण प्रहर्षेणाभिचोदितः ।।
data.es: Anxious to see Rama soon, the son of the Windgod ascended the mountain happily.
data.anv: पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण anxious to see Rama soon, प्रहर्षेण with joy, अभिचोदितः  prompted, तं पर्वतम् that mountain, आरुरोह ascended.

data.v: तेन पादतलाक्रान्ता रम्येषु गिरिसानुषु । सघोषाः समशीर्यन्त शिलाश्चूर्णीकृतास्ततः ।।
data.es: Crushed under Hanuman's feet the rocks making a loud noise on the beautiful mountain ranges rolled down, reduced to powder.
data.anv: ततः then, रम्येषु in delightful ones, गिरिसानुषु on mountain ranges, तेन by him, पादतलाक्रान्ताः crushed by his feet, शिलाः rocks, सघोषाः making loud sound, चूर्णीकृताः reduced to powder, समशीर्यन्त rolled down.
data.md: And on the lovely level of that mountain, the crags, crushed with sounds under the tread of that one burning to behold Rāma and wrought up with excess of joy, were scattered all round.

data.v: स तमारुह्य शैलेन्द्रं व्यवर्धत महाकपिः । दक्षिणादुत्तरं पारं प्रार्थयँल्लवणाम्भसः ।।
data.es: On ascending the king of mountains, desiring to reach the northern shore of the saltwater ocean from the Southern shore, he enlarged his body (in preparation to leap).
data.anv: सः महाकपिः that great Hanuman, लवणाम्भसः of the saltwater ocean, दक्षिणात् from the South, उत्तरं पारम् towards northern shore, प्रार्थयन् desiring, तं शैलेन्द्रम् that king of mountains, आरुह्य having ascended, व्यवर्धत started enlarging body.
