data.anv: ते हरयः those joyful monkeys, कपिः monkeys, अङ्गदम् Angada, वानरम् vanaras, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, पुरतः in front, कृत्वा having, रामदर्शनकांक्षिणः eager to have a look at Rama, आजग्मुः reached.
data.md: And placing Angada and Hanumān before them those monkeys proceeded to behold Rāma.

data.v: तेऽङ्गदप्रमुखा वीराः प्रहृष्टाश्च मुदान्विताः । निपेतुर्हरिराजस्य समीपे राघवस्य च ।।
data.es: Angada the chief along with the heroic monkeys very joyfully and exuberantly descended close to Sugriva, the king of monkeys and Rama.
data.anv: अङ्गदप्रमुखाः Angada, the chief of the army of monkeys, ते वीराः the heroes, प्रहृष्टाश्च very joyfully, मुदा exuberant, अन्विताः descended, हरिराजस्य to the king of monkeys, राघवस्य च and Rama, समीपे near, निपेतुः landed.
data.md: Those heroes headed by Angada, delighted and intoxicated, descended before Rāghava and the lord of the monkeys.

data.v: हनूमांश्च महाबहुः प्रणम्य शिरसा ततः । नियतामक्षतां देवीं राघवाय न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: Then the strongarmed Hanuman with his head bowed down offered salutations and reported, 'Divine lady Sita with her constant devotion to Sri Rama is sound in body'.
data.anv: ततः then, महाबाहुः strongarmed, हनुमान् Hanuman, शिरसा with head bowed down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, देवीम् divine lady, नियताम् with her constant devotion, अक्षताम् sound in body, राघवाय to Rama, न्यवेदयत् reported.
data.md: And the mighty-armed Hanumān, lowering his head, related to Rāghava, Sītā's spiritual and physical well-being.

data.v: निश्चितार्थं ततस्तस्मिन्सुग्रीवं पवनात्मजे । लक्ष्मणः प्रीतिमान्प्रीतं बहुमानादवैक्षत ।।
data.es: Sugriva and Lakshmana glanced at Hanuman respectfully with affection thinking surely Hanuman alone has succeeded.
data.anv: ततः then, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, तस्मिन् पवनात्मजे that son of the Windgod, निश्चितार्थम् surely, प्रीतम् very affectionately, सुग्रीवम् and Sugriva, बहुमानात् respectfully, अवैक्षत glanced.
data.md: And being confirmed thus by the Wind-god's son, Laksmana, greatly pleased, respectfully looked towards Sugriva.

data.v: प्रीत्या च रममाणोऽथ राघवः परवीरहा । बहु मानेन महता हनूमन्तमवैक्षत ।।
data.md: And Rāghava too, the slayer of foes, worked up with joy, cast respectful looks towards Hanuman.

data.v: ततः प्रस्रवणं शैलं ते गत्वा चित्रकाननम् । प्रणम्य शिरसा रामं लक्ष्मणं च महाबलम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter the vanaras arrived at the Prasrvana mount, with wonderful forests and bowed down to Sri Rama and mighty Lakshaman and Sugriva placing their leader, heir apparent in front. Then they began telling the story of Sita and her state.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, ते they, चित्रकाननम् wonderful forest of Chitra, प्रस्रवणम् शैलम् to Prasravana mount, युवराजम् heir apparent, पुरस्कृत्य placing in front with respect, गत्वा having arrived, रामम् to Rama, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, शिरसा bowed down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिवाद्य च offered obeisance, अथ and then, सीतायाः  regarding Sita's, प्रवृत्तिम् state, प्रवक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमुः began.
data.md: Thereupon getting at the Mount Prasravana surrounded by a variegated forest, lowering their heads to the mighty Rāma and Lakşmaņa, placing before them their prince (Angada) and bowing to Sugrīva, the monkeys began to relate the story of Sītā.

data.v: युवराजं पुरस्कृत्य सुग्रीवमभिवाद्य च । प्रवृत्तमथ सीतायाः प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमुः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the vanaras arrived at the Prasrvana mount, with wonderful forests and bowed down to Sri Rama and mighty Lakshaman and Sugriva placing their leader, heir apparent in front. Then they began telling the story of Sita and her state.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, ते they, चित्रकाननम् wonderful forest of Chitra, प्रस्रवणम् शैलम् to Prasravana mount, युवराजम् heir apparent, पुरस्कृत्य placing in front with respect, गत्वा having arrived, रामम् to Rama, महाबलम् mighty, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, शिरसा bowed down, प्रणम्य offered salutations, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, अभिवाद्य च offered obeisance, अथ and then, सीतायाः  regarding Sita's, प्रवृत्तिम् state, प्रवक्तुम् to tell, उपचक्रमुः began.
data.md: Thereupon getting at the Mount Prasravana surrounded by a variegated forest, lowering their heads to the mighty Rāma and Lakşmaņa, placing before them their prince (Angada) and bowing to Sugrīva, the monkeys began to relate the story of Sītā.

data.v: रावणान्तःपुरे रोधं राक्षसीभिश्च तर्जनम् । रामे समनुरागं च यश्चापि समयः कृतः ।।
data.es: The monkeys in Rama's presence narrated all about Sita's detention in Ravana's Ashoka garden, the ogresses threatening her and the time limit fixed by Ravana (for her survival).
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते हरयः those vanaras, रावणान्तः पुरे in the chambers of Ravana, रोधम् detention, राक्षसीभिः ogresses, तर्जनं च threatening, रामे to Rama, समनुरागं च her devotion, यः that which, अयम् thus, समयः time limit, कृतः set, एतत् all that, रामसन्निधौ in Rama's presence, आख्यान्ति told.

data.v: एतदाख्यान्ति ते सर्वे हरयो राम संनिधौ । वैदेहीमक्षतां श्रुत्वा रामस्तूत्तरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: And they described to Ráma, the confinement of Sītā in Rāvana's seraglio, the remonstrances of the she-demons, her unflinching attachment in her lord and the time appointed (by the Rākṣasa for her destruction). And hearing of Vaidehi's well-being Rāma said.

data.v: क्व सीता वर्तते देवी कथं च मयि वर्तते । एतन्मे सर्वमाख्यात वैदेहीं प्रति वानराः ।।
data.es: Hearing of Sita alive and not harmed, Rama asked the vanaras, 'How is Sita? How is she disposed to me? Tell me everything'.
data.anv: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अक्षताम् not harmed, श्रुत्वा hearing, रामस्तु Rama too, उत्तरम् responded, अब्रवीत् asked, देवी divine lady, सीता Sita, क्व tell me, वर्तते she is, मयि to me, कथम् how, वर्तते is she, वानराः vanara, वैदेहीं प्रति her disposition towards, एतत् all that, सर्वम् every thing, मे to me, आख्यात asked.
data.md: O monkeys where live the worshipful Sītā? And how is her attachment to me? Do you relate everything to me.

data.v: रामस्य गदितं श्रुत्व हरयो रामसंनिधौ । चोदयन्ति हनूमन्तं सीतावृत्तान्तकोविदम् ।।
data.es: On hearing the words from Rama, the vanaras requested Hanuman who was aware of Sita's position to tell Rama all about her.
data.anv: हरयः vanaras,रामस्य Rama's, गदितम् words spoken, श्रुत्वा hearing, सीतावृत्तान्तकोविदम् who was aware of Sita's position, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, रामसन्निधौ in the presence of Rama, चोदयन्ति requested to tell.
data.md: Hearing those painful words of Răma, the monkeys desired Hanumān, conversant with the whereabouts of Sītā, to describe every thing to him.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु वचनं तेषां हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । उवाच वाक्यं वाक्यज्ञः सीताया दर्शनं यथा ।।
data.es: Sita who was like the daughter of the gods heard the son of the Windgod for her benefit and replied:
data.anv: महात्मनः great soul, तस्य his, वायुसूनोः son of the Windgod, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, सुरसुतोपमा like the daughter of gods, सीता Sita, आत्महितम् for her benefit, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Hearing their words, Hanuman, the Windgod's son, versed in the art of speech, lowering his head in Sītā's name and towards the southern direction (where she lives) began to relate how he succeeded in beholding Sītā.

data.v: समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वाहं शतयोजनमायतम् । अगच्छं जानकीं सीतां मार्गमाणो दिदृक्षया ।।
data.es: "Having crossed the sea consisting of a hundred yojanas in quest of Vaidehi, I found her.
data.anv: अहम् I, शतयोजनम् a hundred yojanas, आयतम् wide, समुद्रम् ocean, लङ्घयित्वा having crossed, जानकीम् Janaki,सीताम् Sita, मार्गमाणः searching, दिदृक्षया with the intention of seeing, आगच्छम् reached.

data.v: तत्र लङ्केति नगरी रावणस्य दुरात्मनः । दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य तीरे वसति दक्षिणे ।।
data.es: "On the southern shore of the ocean is situated the city of Lanka , ruled by the evilminded Ravana.
data.anv: तत्र there, दक्षिणस्य समुद्रस्य on the southern side of the sea, दक्षिणे तीरे of the southern shore, दुरात्मनः evilminded, रावणस्य Ravana's, लङ्केति in Lanka, नगरी city, वसति there is.

data.v: तत्र दृष्टा मया सीता रावणान्तःपुरे सती । संन्यस्य त्वयि जीवन्ती रामा राम मनोरथम् ।।
data.es: "There in the inner palace of Ravana, I saw your lovely wife Sita, with all her hopes pinned on you, giving up all other desires.
data.anv: रामा Rama, तत्र there, रावणान्तः पुरे in the inner palace of Ravana, सती your wife, त्वयि your, मनोरथम्  her hopes, सन्न्यस्य giving up desires, जीवन्ती living, राम lovely, सीता Sita, मया by me, दृष्टा seen.

data.v: दृष्टा मे राक्षसी मध्ये तर्ज्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः । राक्षसीभिर्विरूपाभी रक्षिता प्रमदावने ।।
data.es: "I found her in the beautiful garden guarded by hideous ogresses threatening her again and again৷৷
data.anv: प्रमदावने in that beautiful garden, विरूपाभिः hideous, राक्षसीभिः rakshasas, रक्षिता guarded, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, तर्ज्यमाना threatening, मे I, राक्षसीमध्ये in the midst of ogresses, दृष्टा saw.
data.md: And I saw there Sītā, in the inner appartment of Ravana. Centring all her thoughts in you, breathes that damsel, O Rama. I saw her reviled by the she demons again and again. She is being guarded in that garden by the grim-visaged Raksasis.

data.v: दुःखमापद्यते देवी तवादुःखोचिता सती । रावणान्तःपुरे रुद्ध्वा राक्षसीभिः सुरक्षिता ।।
data.md: And that worshipful came, O hero, ever used to happiness, is now stricken with grief in your absence. Confined in Ravana's inner apartment, well protected by those she-demons, wearing a single braid of hair and poorly, she is engaged only in thoughts touching you.

data.v: एकवेणीधरा दीना त्वयि चिन्तापरायणा । अधःशय्या विवर्णाङ्गी पद्मिनीव हिमागमे ।।
रावणाद्विनिवृत्तार्था मर्तव्यकृतनिश्चया । देवी कथंचित्काकुत्स्थ त्वन्मना मार्गिता मया ।।
इक्ष्वाकुवंशविख्यातिं शनैः कीर्तयतानघ । स मया नरशार्दूल विश्वासमुपपादिता ।।
data.es: "O sinless one O tiger among men To inspire confidence in her I praised the glory of your Ikshvaku dynasty.
data.anv: अनघ sinless one, नरशार्दूल tiger among men, इक्ष्वाकुवंशविख्यातिम् all about the glory of Ikshvaku race, शनैः slowly, कीर्तयता praised, मया by me, सा she, विश्वासम् confidence, उपपादिता to inspire.

data.v: ततः संभाषिता देवी सर्वमर्थं च दर्शिता । रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च श्रुत्वा प्रीतिमुपागता ।।
data.es: "I created a little confidence in the fawneyed lady by pacifying her and explaining her with great difficulty the alliance of Rama and Sugriva on hearing which she became happy.
data.anv: मृगशाबाक्षी fawneyed woman, कथञ्चित् little, विश्वासम् confidence, उपपादिता pacified, ततः then, संभाषिता चैव after conversing only, सर्वम् everything, अर्थं च with difficulty, दर्शिता presented, रामसुग्रीवसख्यं च alliance of Rama and Sugriva, श्रुत्वा after hearing, प्रीतिम् happy, उपागता became.

data.v: नियतः समुदाचारो भक्तिश्चास्यास्तथा त्वयि । एवं मया महाभागा दृष्टा जनकनन्दिनी । उग्रेण तपसा युक्ता त्वद्भक्त्या पुरुषर्षभ ।।
data.es: "O bull among men I saw Janaki,the delight of Janaka, a formidable lady filled with devotion to you and richly endowed with austerity.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ bull among men, उग्रेण formidable, तपसा austerity, त्वद्भक्त्या devotion to you, युक्ता filled with, महाभागा prosperous, जनकनन्दिनी delight of Janaka, मया by me, एवम् that way, दृष्टा seen.
data.md: O great man, O you best of men, I beheld the daughter of Janaka in this plight, engaged in hard austerities and ever devoted to you.

data.v: अभिज्ञानं च मे दत्तं यथावृत्तं तवान्तिके । चित्रकूटे महाप्राज्ञ वायसं प्रति राघव ।।
data.es: "O wise one, with your ring given her, she told me an anecdote of a crow that took place at Chitrakuta.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञ very wise, चित्रकूटे in Chitrakuta, तव your, अन्तिके provided me, वायसं प्रति with an anecdote of a crow, यथा so also, वृत्तम् told, अभिज्ञानम् as an identification for you, मे to me, दत्तम् presented.
data.md: O you of great intelligence, O Raghava, offering me (this jewel) as a token, she wanted me to relate to you, the occurrence at the mount Citrakūța regarding the crow.

data.v: विज्ञाप्यश्च नर व्याघ्रो रामो वायुसुत त्वया । अखिलेनेह यद्दृष्टमिति मामाह जानकी ।।
data.es: (She said)'O son of the Windgod you should let Rama, the tiger among men know all that you have seen here.
data.anv: वायुसुत son of the Windgod, नरव्याघ्रः tiger among men, रामः Rama, त्वया your, इह here, यत् that which, दृष्टम् seen, अखिलेन should tell, विज्ञाप्यः should let him know, इति thus, जानकी Janaki, माम् me, आह told.
data.md: And Jānakī addressing me said'O Windgod's son, do you describe everything of what you have seen here, to Rāma. And relating everything before Sugrīva, do you present him with this jewel which has been preserved by me with great care.

data.v: इदं चास्मै प्रदातव्यं यत्नात्सुपरिरक्षितम् । ब्रुवता वचनान्येवं सुग्रीवस्योपशृण्वतः ।।
data.es: 'Within hearing of Sugriva, tell him about your efforts. Present this(signet) to Rama carefully preserved by me.
data.anv: सुग्रीवस्य while Sugriva, उपशृण्वतः within hearing of, एवम् that way, वचनानि these words, ब्रुवता that I said, यत्नात् the efforts, सुपरिरक्षितः kept with great care, अयं च and I, अस्मै this, प्रदातव्यः be presented.

data.v: एष चूडामणिः श्रीमान्मया ते यत्नरक्षितः । मनःशिलायास्तिकलस्तं स्मरस्वेति चाब्रवीत् ।।
एष निर्यातितः श्रीमान्मया ते वारिसंभवः । एतं दृष्ट्वा प्रमोदिष्ये व्यसने त्वामिवानघ ।।
data.es: "O sinless Rama this wonderful Chudamani of mine has been carefully safeguarded. Seeing this is like seeing you when I am in distress.
data.anv: अनघ sinless, दिव्यः wonderful, एषः this, चूडामणिः Chudamani, मया of mine, सुपरिरक्षितः carefully safe guared, व्यसने in distress, एतम् this one, दृष्ट्वा seeing, त्वामिव like you here, प्रहृष्यामि look at it.
data.md: This jewel for the head I had preserved with care. In my misfortune, O sinless one, I used to inspire cheerfulness by a sight a sight of this, resembling yourself.

data.v: जीवितं धारयिष्यामि मासं दशरथात्मज । ऊर्ध्वं मासान्न जीवेयं रक्षसां वशमागता ।।
data.es: "I will hold on to life only for a month. Beyond, I will not survive. I swear by truth. You may tell this to Rama.
data.anv: दशरथात्मज Dasaratha's son, Rama, मासम् a month, जीवितम् life, धारयिष्यामि will hold on to life, मासात् after a month, ऊर्ध्वम् beyond that, न जीवेयम् I will not live, अहम् I, सत्येन on truth, ते to you, ब्रवीमि I am telling.
data.md: Breathe shall I only for a month, beyond that I shall never live, subject as I am to the demons.'

data.v: इति मामब्रवीत्सीता कृशाङ्गी धर्म चारिणी । रावणान्तःपुरे रुद्धा मृगीवोत्फुल्ललोचना ।।
data.es: "With her limbs emaciated through austerities detained in Ravana's inner palace, eyes wide open in fear, Sita said this to me:
data.anv: कृशाङ्गी enfeebled lady, धर्मचारिणी following righteous ways, रावणान्तःपुरे in the inner palace of Ravana, रुद्धा detained मृगीव like a doe, उत्फुल्ललोचना eyes wide open in fear, सीता Sita, माम् to me, इति this, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Thus was I accosted by Sītā, reduced to a skeleton, observing pious observances, shut up in Rāvana's inner apartment and having eyes like those of a hind.

data.v: एतदेव मयाख्यातं सर्वं राघव यद्यथा । सर्वथा सागरजले संतारः प्रविधीयताम् ।।
data.es: "O Rama I have spoken everything that has happened. We have to pay attention to the means of crossing the ocean."
data.anv: राघव Rama, यत् that which, यथा like that, एतत् happened, सर्वमेव every thing, मया by me, ख्यातम् has been said, सर्वथा ever, सागरजले water of the ocean, सन्तारः means to cross the ocean, प्रविधीयताम् pay attention to.
data.md: I have described to you everything, O Rāghava, do you make arrangements for bridging over the ocean.

data.v: तौ जाताश्वासौ राजपुत्रौ विदित्वा; तच्चाभिज्ञानं राघवाय प्रदाय । देव्या चाख्यातं सर्वमेवानुपूर्व्या;द्वाचा संपूर्णं वायुपुत्रः शशंस ।।
data.es: Coming to know that the two princes were sighing in relief, Hanuman presented the token of identification given by Sita to Rama, after having communicated in full the messsage of Sita in an orderly manner.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे पञ्चषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyfifth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: वायुपुत्रः son of the Windgod, तौ राजपुत्त्रौ the two princes Rama and Lakshmana, जाताश्वासौ sighing in relief, विदित्वा knowing, तत् that, अभिज्ञानम् identification, राघवाय to Rama, प्रदाय communicated, देव्या by Sita, आख्यातम् having spoken, सर्वमेव everything, सम्पूर्णम् completely, आनुपूर्व्यात् in an orderly manner, वाचा spoken, शशंस  Hanuman.
data.md: And considering those two princes greatly consoled, the Wind-god's son handed over that token to Rāghava and described everything from the beginning to the end.

data.v: एवमुक्तो हनुमता रामो दशरथात्मजः । तं मणिं हृदये कृत्वा प्ररुरोद सलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Thus addressed by Hanuman, Rama held the token (Chudamani) against his bosom and wept with Lakshmana.
data.anv: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, सलक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, दशरथात्मजः son of Dasaratha, रामः Rama, तं मणिम् that ornament, हृदये to the bosom, कृत्वा held, प्ररुरोद wept.
data.md: Being thus accosted by Hanumān, Rāma, the son of Dasaratha, placing that jewel on his breast, wept with Laksmana.

data.v: तं तु दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं राघवः शोककर्शितः । नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां सुग्रीवमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Seeing the precious jewel, Rama's eyes were filled with tears. Overwhelmed with grief, he spoke to Sugriva.
data.anv: तं मणिश्रेष्ठम् the precious jewel, दृष्ट्वा seeing, राघवः Rama, शोककर्शितः overcome with sorrow, अश्रुपूर्णाभ्याम् filled with tears, नेत्राभ्याम् both eyes, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Beholding that excellent jewel, Rāghava, stricken with grief, with eyes full of tears, spake to Sugriva, saying.

data.v: यथैव धेनुः स्रवति स्नेहाद्वत्सस्य वत्सला । तथा ममापि हृदयं मणिरत्नस्य दर्शनात् ।।
data.es: "Just as a cow fond of its calf begins to distil milk from its teats at the sight of the calf, so does my heart melt at the sight of this excellent jewel.
data.anv: वत्सला fond of its calf, धेनुः cow, वत्सस्य at the sight of calf, स्नेहात् out of love, यथैव in the same way, स्रवति distils milk from its teats, मम हृदयमपि my heart also, मणिरत्नस्य at this excellent jewel, दर्शनात् on seeing, तथा  so does.
data.md: Forsooth my heart melt on beholding this jewel as milk trickle down from the udders of a cow on beholding its calf.

data.v: मणिरत्नमिदं दत्तं वैदेह्याः श्वशुरेण मे । वधूकाले यथा बद्धमधिकं मूर्ध्नि शोभते ।।
data.anv: वधूकाले at the time of marriage, मूर्ध्नि to the head, आबद्धम् tied, यथा so, शोभते charming, इदम् this, मणिरत्नम् gem of ornament, मे श्वशुरेण my fatherinlaw, वैदेह्याः to Vaidehi, दत्तम् presented.
data.md: This jewel was conferred on Sītā by my father-in-law at the time of our wedding, and to enhance its beauty, she wore it on her head.

data.v: अयं हि जलसंभूतो मणिः प्रवरपूजितः । यज्ञे परमतुष्टेन दत्तः शक्रेण धीमता ।।
data.es: "This was found in water and was bestowed by Indra out of great joy on Janaka who had performed a grand sacrificial ceremony. So it was worshipped by elders of the family.
data.anv: जलसम्भूतः found in water, सज्जनपूजितः worshipped by elders of the family, अयं मणिः this jewel यज्ञे in sacrificial ceremony, परमतुष्टेन great joy, धीमता wise one, शक्रेण by Indra, दत्तः given.
data.md: And this jewel, obtained from the bed of the ocean, was conferred on him (Janaka) by the intelligent Sakra, greatly delighted for being adored in a sacrifice.

data.v: इमं दृष्ट्वा मणिश्रेष्ठं तथा तातस्य दर्शनम् । अद्यास्म्यवगतः सौम्य वैदेहस्य तथा विभोः ।।
data.es: "O noble Sugriva now when I see this excellent jewel, I get direct sight of my father and king of Videha (in the same way as I obtained the sight of Sita).
data.anv: सौम्य noble, अद्य now, इमम् this, मणिश्रेष्ठम् gem of jewel, दृष्ट्वा when I see, तातस्य father's, तथा so also, विभोः king, वैदेहस्य of Videha, दर्शनम् seeing, यथा as if, अवगतः get.
data.md: O gentle one, this bring back to my mind, the memory of my father, and father-in-law the king of Videha.

data.v: अयं हि शोभते तस्याः प्रियाया मूर्ध्नि मे मणिः । अद्यास्य दर्शनेनाहं प्राप्तां तामिव चिन्तये ।।
data.es: "This jewel was shining on the head of my beloved. Now its mere look makes me feel that I am seeing her.
data.anv: अयं मणिः this gem, मे प्रियायाः my beloved, मूर्ध्नि head, शोभते हि indeed shone, अद्य now, अस्य its, दर्शनेन mere look, ताम् her, प्राप्तामिव as if I am seeing, चिन्तये I think.
data.md: This excellent jewel appeared beautiful on the crown of my dear one, and methinks, on beholding it, I have as if got back my beloved spouse.

data.v: किमाह सीता वैदेही ब्रूहि सौम्य पुनः पुनः । परासुमिव तोयेन सिञ्चन्ती वाक्यवारिणा ।।
data.es: "O handsome Hanuman Sita is like water for a thirsty person. Tell me again and again what Sita said to you. Sprinkle on me (lifegiving) water of her words in the form of message.
data.anv: सौम्य O handsome (Hanuman), पिपासुम् for a thirsty one, तोयेन इव like water, वाक्यवारिणा in lifegiving water of words, सिञ्चन्ती sprinkle, वैदेही Vaidehi, सीता Sita, किम् what else, पुनः पुनः again and again, आह to speak, ब्रूहि asked.
data.md: Do you relate to me again and again, O gentle one what Vaidehi has said, as if sprinkling me with the water of her words like to one rendered senseless.

data.v: इतस्तु किं दुःखतरं यदिमं वारिसंभवम् । मणिं पश्यामि सौमित्रे वैदेहीमागतं विना ।।
data.es: "O Saumitri I see this jewel born (formed) under water but not her. What can be more sorrowful to me?
data.anv: सौमित्रे O Saumitri, वारिसम्भवम् found in water, इमं मणिम् this jewel, वैदेहीम् of Vaidehi, आगतां विना without her, यत् पश्यामि seeing this, इतः here, दुःखतरम् cause more sorrow, किम् what?
data.md: What greater grief can there be, O Saumitri, that I behold the jewel obtained from the ocean but not Vaidehi.?

data.v: चिरं जीवति वैदेही यदि मासं धरिष्यति । क्षणं सौम्य न जीवेयं विना तामसितेक्षणाम् ।।
data.anv: सौम्य O dear!, वैदेही Vaidehi, मासम् one month, धरिष्यति यदि if she lives, चिरम् for long, जीवति living, सौम्य O dear, ताम् her, असितेक्षणां विना without the (enchanting) black-eyed, क्षणम् for a moment, न जीवेयम् I cannot live
data.md: Truly dose Vaidehī live for a long time if she breathes for a month. But O hero, I cannot live blue eyes.

data.v: नय मामपि तं देशं यत्र दृष्टा मम प्रिया । न तिष्ठेयं क्षणमपि प्रवृत्तिमुपलभ्य च ।।
data.es: "Take me to the place you saw my beloved. Knowing where she is I cannot stay here even for a moment.
data.anv: मम my, प्रिया beloved, यत्र दृष्टा where you saw, मामपि me too, तं देशम् that place, नय take me, प्रवृत्तिम् where she is, उपलभ्य च and knowing, क्षणमपि even a moment, न तिष्ठेयम् not stay here.
data.md: Do you take me there where you had beheld iny dear spouse. I cannot live for a moment while I have received intelligence about her.

data.v: कथं सा मम सुश्रोणि भीरु भीरुः सती तदा । भयावहानां घोराणां मध्ये तिष्ठति रक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: "She is always very timid. How can my fairhipped beloved remain in the midst of dreadful and fearsome demons?
data.anv: सदा always, भीरुभीरुः सती very timid, मम सुश्रोणी my fairhipped beloved, भयावहानाम् fearsome forms, घोराणाम् dreadful ones, रक्षसाम् demons, मध्ये midst, कथम् how, तिष्ठति does she remain.
data.md: How live that timid damsel, having a beautiful waist, being terrified, amidst the terrible and grim Raksasis?

data.v: शारदस्तिमिरोन्मुखो नूनं चन्द्र इवाम्बुदैः । आवृतं वदनं तस्या न विराजति राक्षसैः ।।
data.es: "Her face resembling the autumnal Moon bereft of its stain, though covered with rainclouds does not shine so bright.
data.anv: तिमिरोन्मुक्तः bereft of brightness, अम्बुदैः by rainclouds, चन्द्रः इव like the Moon, राक्षसैः by demons, आवृतम् surrounded by, तस्याः her, वदनम् countenance, न विराजति not shine, नूनम् surely.
data.md: Truly her countenance is not appearing beautiful like to the autumnal moon, enveloped with clouds, although cleared off the darkness.

data.v: किमाह सीता हनुमंस्तत्त्वतः कथयस्व मे । एतेन खलु जीविष्ये भेषजेनातुरो यथा ।।
data.es: "O Hanuman Tell me now truly what has been told by her. I am eager to know. Indeed, it will keep me alive just as medicne does. (I shall survive on the strength of her message)
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, सीता Sita, किम् what, आह to go, अद्य now, तत्त्वतः truly, मे I am, कथय told by her, आतुरः eager, भेषजेन यथा just as medicine does, एतेन that alone, जीविष्ये खलु indeed, keep me alive.
data.md: Do you relate to me in sooth, O Hanuman, what Şītā has spoken to you. I shall live by these words, as the sick are cured by medicine.

data.v: मधुरा मधुरालापा किमाह मम भामिनी । मद्विहीना वरारोहा हनुमन्कथयस्व मे । दुःखाद्दुःखतरं प्राप्य कथं जीवति जानकी ।।
data.es: That lovely Sita who speaks sweetly, that fairhipped beautiful one who has been separated from me, my beloved, what did she say? Please narrate.इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्षष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: मधुरा lovely one, मधुरालापा one who speaks sweetly, वरारोहा fairhipped one, मद्विहीना separated from me, मम भामिनी my beloved, किम् what, आह did she say, मे to me, कथयस्व you may narrate.
data.md: O Hanumān, what has my dear wife, sweetspeeched, and highly beautiful, spoken to you, being separated form me? How breathes she going through a series of calamities?

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान्राघवेण महात्मना । सीताया भाषितं सर्वं न्यवेदयत राघवे ।।
data.es: Thus asked by Sri Rama, Hanuman repeated everything spoken by Sita to Rama.
data.anv: महात्मना great soul, राघवेण to Rama, एवम् that way, उक्तः spoken, हनुमान् Hanuman, सीतायाः Sita's, भाषितम् said, सर्वम् everything, राघवे to Rama, न्यवेदयत related.
data.md: Being thus addressed by the high-souled Rāghava, Hanumān, related to him all of what Sita had said,

data.v: इदमुक्तवती देवी जानकी पुरुषर्षभ । पूर्ववृत्तमभिज्ञानं चित्रकूटे यथा तथम् ।।
data.es: "O bull among men queen Janaki related to me as a token of identification an incident that had taken place at Chitrakuta in the past.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभ bull among men, देवी queen, जानकी Janaki, चित्रकूटे at Chitrakuta, पूर्ववृत्तम् incident of the past, अभिज्ञानम् as an identification, यथातथम् as it is, इदम् this, उक्तवती she said.
data.md: O foremost of men, the worshipful Jānaki, related as a token, all the incidents at the Mount Citrakūta from the beginning to the end.

data.v: सुखसुप्ता त्वया सार्धं जानकी पूर्वमुत्थिता । वायसः सहसोत्पत्य विरराद स्तनान्तरे ।।
data.es: "When she was lying on your lap happily she awoke early and a crow came swiftly and scratched on her breast.
data.anv: त्वया सार्धम् along with you, सुखसुप्ता lying down happily, जानकी Janaki, पूर्वम् earlier, उत्थिता woke up, वायसः a crow, सहसा swiftly, उत्पत्य got up, स्तनान्तरे on her breast, विददार scratched.
data.md: Sleeping happily with you, Janaki one day awoke before, and in the meantime, a crow wounded her breast with its beaks.

data.v: पर्यायेण च सुप्तस्त्वं देव्यङ्के भरताग्रज । पुनश्च किल पक्षी स देव्या जनयति व्यथाम् ।।
data.es: "O Bharata's brother, when Sita awoke from sleep you slept on her lap. The same crow again hurt her.
data.anv: भरताग्रज elder brother of Bharata, त्वम् you, पर्यायेण woke up, देव्यङ्के on her lap, सुप्तः slept, सः पक्षी that crow, पुनश्च again, देव्याः Sita's, व्यथाम् hurting, जनयति किल started hurting.
data.md: O Rāma, you wert then asleep on Sītā's lap and that crow again afflicted the worshipful dame.

data.v: ततः पुनरुपागम्य विरराद भृशं किल । ततस्त्वं बोधितस्तस्याः शोणितेन समुक्षितः ।।
data.anv: पुनः पुनः again and again, उपागम्य coming over her, भृशम् violently, विददार किल started scratching, ततः then, त्वम् you, तस्याः her, शोणितेन by blood, समुक्षितः wet by shedding, बोधितः किल woke you up.
data.md: And it again wounded her. And being bathed in blood and suffering terrible pangs, that worshipful dame aroused you.

data.v: वायसेन च तेनैव सततं बाध्यमानया । बोधितः किल देव्यास्त्वं सुखसुप्तः परंतप ।।
data.es: "O scorcher of enemies pained by the crow hurting her repeatedly, while you were sleeping happily, she woke you up and informed you about it.
data.anv: परन्तप scorcher of enemies, तेन by that, वायसेनैव by the crow, सततम् repeatedly, बाध्यमानया pained, देव्या by the divine lady, सुखसुप्तः sleeping happily, त्वम् you, बोधितः किल woke you up and informed you.
data.md: And it again wounded her. And being bathed in blood and suffering terrible pangs, that worshipful dame aroused you.

data.v: तां तु दृष्ट्वा महाबाहो रादितां च स्तनान्तरे । आशीविष इव क्रुद्धो निःश्वसन्नभ्यभाषथाः ।।
data.es: 'O strongarmed Rama, seeing my torn breasts, you became angry like a hissing serpent and hissing said :
data.anv: महाबाहुः strong armed, सः Rama, तदा then, स्तनयोः in the breasts, वितुन्नाम् wounded, माम् me, दृष्ट्वा on seeing, क्रुद्धः angered, आशीविष इव like a (hissing) snake, श्वसन् breathing hard, वाक्यम् these words, अभाषत spoke.
data.md: O slayer of foes, O you of mighty-arms, seeing her breast wounded, you, wroth like a serpent, didst speak saying.

data.v: नखाग्रैः केन ते भीरु दारितं तु स्तनान्तरम् । कः क्रीडति सरोषेण पञ्चवक्त्रेण भोगिना ।।
data.es: 'O Sita with a beautiful lap like an elephant trunk by whom is your bosom wounded? Who is sporting with an angry fivehooded snake?
data.anv: नागनासोरु lady whose thighs look like elephant's trunk, सीता Sita, स्तनान्तरम् your breasts, केन by whom, विक्षतं वै wounded, सरोषेण with the angry, पञ्चवक्त्रेण fivehooded, भोगिना by the serpent, कः who, क्रीडति sporting.
data.md: O timid damsel, who, with his nails, has wounded your breast? Who has played with an angry serpent having five faces?

data.v: निरीक्षमाणः सहसा वायसं समवैक्षताः । नखैः सरुधिरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्मामेवाभिमुखं स्थितम् ।।
data.es: 'Then looking around, you saw the crow facing me with sharp, bloodstained claws.
data.anv: ततः then, वीक्षमाणः while glancing, सरुधिरैः with blood stained, तीक्ष्णैः with sharp ones, नखैः with nails, मामेव me, अभिमुखम् facing me, स्थितम् standing, तं वायसम् that crow, समुदैक्षत वै he saw.
data.md: Casting your looks around you didst behold a crow facing the worshipful dame with sharpened nails besmeared with blood.

data.v: सुतः किल स शक्रस्य वायसः पततां वरः । धरान्तरचरः शीघ्रं पवनस्य गतौ समः ।।
data.es: 'This crow was the best of birds. He was surely Indra's son who had covered a long distance with great speed and his speed was like the Windgod's.
data.anv: पतताम् of the birds, वरः eminent, सः वायसः that crow, शक्रस्य Indra's, पुत्रः किल it is said that he is the son, धरान्तरगतः he covered a long distance, शीघ्रम् in great speed, गतौ in movement, पवनस्य Windgod's, समः matching.
data.md: That crow, the best of the birds, was Sakra's son. And it entered speedily into the earth with the velocity of the wind,

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्महाबाहो कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः । वायसे त्वं कृत्वाः क्रूरां मतिं मतिमतां वर ।।
data.es: 'Then you, the strongarmed and best among the wise, your eyeballs rolling in fury, made up your mind about the cruel crow.
data.anv: ततः then, मतिमताम् among the wise, वरः best, महाबाहुः strongarmed, कोपसंवर्तितेक्षणः with eye balls rolling in anger, तस्मिन् him, वायसे at the crow, क्रूराम् cruel, मतिम् mind, कृतवान् made up.
data.md: Thereupon, your eyes rolling with ire, you, O mighty armed hero, O foremost of the intelligent, did resolve to destroy that crow.

data.v: स दर्भं संस्तराद्गृह्य ब्रह्मास्त्रेण न्ययोजयः । स दीप्त इव कालाग्निर्जज्वालाभिमुखः खगम् ।।
data.es: 'Taking out a blade of darbha grass from your mat, you invoked the weapon of Brahma by reciting the mantra. Then you discharged it which blazed like the fire of death and went spearheading towards the crow.
data.anv: सः he, Rama, संस्तरात् from his darbha mat, दर्भम् darbha grass, गृह्य took out, ब्राह्मेण अस्त्रेण invoked the weapon of Brahma into it by reciting the mantra, योजयत् discharged, सः that, दीप्तः blazed, कालाग्निरिव like the fire of death, द्विजम् the bird, अभिमुखः towards, जज्वाल glowed.
data.md: Taking a kusa off your seat you did set it on Brahma weapon. And it flamed like to the fire of desolation before that crow.

data.v: स त्वं प्रदीप्तं चिक्षेप दर्भं तं वायसं प्रति । ततस्तु वायसं दीप्तः स दर्भोऽनुजगाम ह ।।
data.es: 'Then you threw the burning darbha grass at the crow and it chased him in the sky.
data.anv: सः he, प्रदीप्तम् glowing, तं दर्भम् that darbha, तं वायसं प्रति him, the crow in turn, चिक्षेप threw, ततः then, सः दर्भः that darbha, तं वायसम् that crow, अम्बरे in the sky, अनुजगाम ह followed.
data.md: You did let off that burning Kuśa towards that birds. And there upon that burning Kuća followed the crow.

data.v: स पित्रा च परित्यक्तः सुरैः सर्वैर्महर्षिभिः । त्रीँल्लोकान्संपरिक्रम्य त्रातारं नाधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: 'Then the crow went round all the three worlds, having been rejected by his father Indra, including all the sages and gods. Refused by all he came back to Rama seeking shelter.
data.anv: सः he, त्रीन् three, लोकान् worlds, सम्परिक्रम्य having gone round, पित्रा च and to his father also, समहर्षिभिः including the sages, सुरैश्च by gods, परित्यक्तः rejected, तमेव him alone, शरणं गतः went seeking refuge.
data.md: And being forsaken even by the celestials, who were terrified, and ransacking the three worlds it did not get a refuge.

data.v: तं त्वं निपतितं भूमौ शरण्यः शरणागतम् । वधार्हमपि काकुत्स्थ कृपया परिपालयः ।।
data.es: 'Seeing the crow fallen on the ground, O Kakutstha, you who are a saviour of those who seek refuge saved him out of compassion, even though he deserved to be killed.
data.anv: शरण्यः saviour, सः काकुत्स्थ: that Kakutstha, शरणागतम् one who sought refuge, भूमौ on the ground, निपतितम् fallen on the ground, तम् him, वधार्हमपि even though deserves to be killed, कृपया out of compassion, पर्यपालयत् saved.
data.md: Thereupon it again came to you, O subduer of foes. And seeking your shelter it laid itself low on the ground. And O Kākutstha, you didst save it albeit it was worthy of being slain.

data.v: मोघमस्त्रं न शक्यं तु कर्तुमित्येव राघव । ततस्तस्याक्षिकाकस्य हिनस्ति स्म स दक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: 'O Rama since a divine weapon cannot be withdrawn, it did strike his right eye'.
data.anv: राघव Rama, अस्त्रम् weapon, मोघम् divine one, कर्तुम् to withdraw, न शक्यम् not possible, इत्येव therefore, भवान् you, तस्य काकस्य that crow, दक्षिणम् अक्षि right eye, हिनस्ति स्म struck.
data.md: And thinking if improper to baffle the aim of the weapon, you didst, O Rāghava, destroy the right eye of the crow.

data.v: राम त्वां स नमस्कृत्वा राज्ञो दशरथस्य च । विसृष्टस्तु तदा काकः प्रतिपेदे खमालयम् ।।
data.es: 'That crow offered salutations to you Rama and king Dasaratha, thereafter took permission and went to his own dwelling.
data.anv: सः that crow, रामाय to Rama, राज्ञे to the king, दशरथाय च and to Dasaratha, नमस्कृत्य having offered salutations, तेन by him, वीरेण by the warrior, विसृष्टः permitted to leave, स्वम् his own, आलयम् dwelling, प्रतिपेदे went reached.
data.md: Thereupon bowing to you and the king Dasaratha, that crow, bidding adieu, went to its quarter.

data.v: एवमस्त्रविदां श्रेष्ठः सत्त्ववाञ्शीलवानपि । किमर्थमस्त्रं रक्षःसु न योजयसि राघव ।।
data.es: 'Even though you are an expert in the use of weapons, truthful and strong. (Yet) why are you not using weapons aganst the demons?'
data.anv: राघव Rama, एवम् in that way, अस्त्रविदाम् among the users of weapons, श्रेष्ठः expert, सत्यवान् truthful, बलवानपि even strong, रक्षस्सु demons, अस्त्रम् weapon, किमर्थम् why, न योजयसि you are not using?
data.md: O Rāghava, you are the foremost of those skilled in the use of weapons, powerful and gifted with an excellent character, why do you not discharge weapons towards the Rākşasas?

data.v: न नागा नापि गन्धर्वा नासुरा न मरुद्गणाः । तव राम मुखे स्थातुं शक्ताः प्रतिसमाधितुम् ।।
data.es: (Now Sita turns to Hanuman and says) "In war serpents, gandharvas, demons or Marutas cannot withstand the speed of Rama's arrows and hit back.
data.anv: समरे in war, रामस्य Rama's, वेगम् speed, प्रतिसमाधितुम् to hit back, नागाः serpents, न शक्ताः not able, गन्धर्वा अपि even gandharvas, न not, असुराः demons, न not, मरुद्गणाः marutas, न not.
data.md: The celestials, the Gandharvas, the Asuras, the Marutas-none of them is qualified, O Rāma, to equal you in conflict.

data.v: तव वीर्यवतः कच्चिन्मयि यद्यस्ति संभ्रमः । क्षिप्रं सुनिशितैर्बाणैर्हन्यतां युधि रावणः ।।
data.es: 'If you have any anxiety about me, you will certainly slay Ravana in the battle immediately with your sharp arrows'.
data.anv: वीर्यवतः very valiant one, तस्य his, मयि my, सम्भ्रमः anxiety, अस्ति यदि if he has, सुनिशितैः sharp, बाणैः arrows, रावणः Ravana, क्षिप्रम् immediately, युधि in battle, हन्यताम् will slay.
data.md: If you, gifted with great prowess, had any armed shafts, destroy Rāvana in conflict.

data.v: भ्रातुरादेशमादाय लक्ष्मणो वा परंतपः । स किमर्थं नरवरो न मां रक्षति राघवः ।।
data.es: "Or, why does the mighty hero, Lakshmana, who is a scorcher of enemies, not come to my rescue taking the orders from his brother?
data.anv: परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, महाबलः mighty, वीरः hero, लक्ष्मणो वा even Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother, आदेशम् order, आदाय after taking, कस्य हेतोः for what reason, माम् me, न परित्राति not rescue.
data.md: And obtaining the behests of his brother, why dose not Lakşmaņa, the subduer of foes and best of men, protect me, O Rāghava?

data.v: शक्तौ तौ पुरुषव्याघ्रौ वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ । सुराणामपि दुर्धर्षौ किमर्थं मामुपेक्षतः ।।
data.es: "Both Rama and Lakshmana are tigers among men who resemble wind and fire in power and have the unassailability of the gods. Wherefore are they disregarding me?.
data.anv: वाय्वग्निसमतेजसौ resembling wind and fire in power, पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, तौ they both, सुराणाम् even the gods, दुर्धर्षौ यदि अपि even though unassailable also, माम् me, किमर्थम् how is it, उपेक्षतः disregarding.
data.md: Those two best of men, gifted with the effulgence of Wind and Fire, and incapable of being repressed even by the celestials, are disregarding me.

data.v: ममैव दुष्कृतं किंचिन्महदस्ति न संशयः । समर्थौ सहितौ यन्मां नापेक्षेते परंतपौ ।।
data.es: "Perhaps I must have committed an atrocious sin. There is no doubt. For although both of them are scorchers of enemies, they deliver me not."
data.anv: ममैव mine alone, महत् atrocious, किञ्चित् some, दुष्कृतम् sin, अस्ति is committed, संशयः doubt, न no, यत् because, समर्थावपि although capable, परन्तपौ both scorchers of enemies, तौ both, माम् me, न आवेक्षेते not deliver.
data.md: Forsooth have I perpetrated a mighty iniquity since those two slayers of foes, being capable, do not protect me.

data.v: वैदेह्या वचनं श्रुत्वा करुणं साश्रुभाषितम् । पुनरप्यहमार्यां तामिदं वचनमब्रुवम् ।।
data.es: Hearing the piteous words of Vaidehi and beholding her eyes filled with tears, the Windgod's son, lustrous Hanuman replied thus:.
data.anv: अथ and then, महातेजाः lustrous, मारुतात्मजः Windgod's son, हनुमान् Hanuman, वैदेह्या Vaidehi's, साश्रु with tears, करुणम् piteous, भाषितम् spoken, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा having heard, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Hearing those sweet and piteous accents of Vaidehi I again spoke to that worshipful dame, saying. 'Forsooth can I swear by you, O worshipful dame, that Rāma is sorely stricken with grief in your absence. And Lakšmaņa too relent heavily beholding him laden with sorrow.

data.v: त्वच्छोकविमुखो रामो देवि सत्येन ते शपे । रामे दुःखाभिभूते च लक्ष्मणः परितप्यते ।।
data.es: "O godlike lady Rama is not averse to your misery. On my word this is true. Rama is immersed in sorrow. Even Lakshmana wails.
data.anv: देवि Devi, रामः Rama, त्वच्छोकविमुखः he is averse to your misery, सत्येन truly, ते your, शपे I vow, रामे when Rama, दुःखाभिपन्ने immersed in sorrow, लक्ष्मणः च even Lakshmana, परितप्यते wails.
data.md: Hearing those sweet and piteous accents of Vaidehi I again spoke to that worshipful dame, saying. 'Forsooth can I swear by you, O worshipful dame, that Rāma is sorely stricken with grief in your absence. And Lakšmaņa too relent heavily beholding him laden with sorrow.

data.v: कथंचिद्भवती दृष्टा न कालः परिशोचितुम् । इमं मुहूर्तं दुःखानामन्तं द्रक्ष्यसि भामिनि ।।
data.es: "I could find you with difficulty. This is not the time to wail. O blameless lady take it, your sorrow has come to an end at this moment.
data.anv: कथञ्चित् with difficulty, भवती your self, दृष्टा could be found, परिदेवितुम् wailing, कालः time, न not, अनिन्दिते blameless lady, इमम् this, मुहूर्तम् moment, दुःखानाम् all sorrrow, अन्तम् end, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: It dose not behove you to relent any more as I have succeeded in finding you out. You shall at this very moment behold the end of your grief.

data.v: तावुभौ नरशार्दूलौ राजपुत्रावरिंदमौ । त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ लङ्कां भस्मीकरिष्यतः ।।
data.es: "Both the mighty brothers, tigers among men, are eager to see you. Both the princes will reduce this Lanka into ashes.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रौ two tigers among men, महाबलौ mighty, त्वद्दर्शनकृतोत्साहौ eager to see you, उभौ both, तौ राजपुत्रौ those two princes, लङ्काम् this Lanka, भस्मीकरिष्यतः will reduce to ashes.
data.md: And those two princes, the foremost of men and slayers of foes, actuated with energy on hearing that I have seen you, shall reduce Lankā to ashes.

data.v: हत्वा च समरे रौद्रं रावणं सह बान्धवम् । राघवस्त्वां महाबाहुः स्वां पुरीं नयते ध्रुवम् ।।
data.es: "O largeeyed lady cruel Ravana along with his relatives will be killed by Rama in war and Rama will return to his city with you.
data.anv: विशालाक्षि O largeeyed lady, राघवः Rama, समरे in war, सहबान्धवम् along with relatives, क्रूरम् cruel, रावणम् Ravana, हत्वा after killing, स्वां पुरीं प्रति towards his city, त्वाम् you, नेष्यति he will be taking you.
data.md: And slaying in conflict the terrible Rāvaņa, with his kith and kin, Rāghava, in sooth, O excellent damsel, shall take you back to his own city.

data.v: यत्तु रामो विजानीयादभिज्ञानमनिन्दिते । प्रीतिसंजननं तस्य प्रदातुं तत्त्वमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "O unimpeachable lady give one more identification which would make him more happy".
data.anv: अनिन्दिते blameless lady, रामः Rama, यत् that which, अभिज्ञानम् knows, विजानीयात् to identify you, तस्य your, प्रीतिसञ्जननम् that which makes him more happy, भूयः one more, त्वम् you, दातुम् may give, अर्हसि is proper.
data.md: O you of a blameless person, do you confer on me such a token, as might be recognized by Ráma and conduce to his pleasure.

data.v: साभिवीक्ष्य दिशः सर्वा वेण्युद्ग्रथनमुत्तमम् । मुक्त्वा वस्त्राद्ददौ मह्यं मणिमेतं महाबल ।।
data.es: "O mighty Rama, she glanced at all directions and untied the end of her garment in which she had this best jewel worn on her hair preserved and gave it to me.
data.anv: महाबल mighty Rama, सा she, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, अभिवीक्ष्य glancing at, वेण्युद्ग्रथितम् that which is worn on her hair, उत्तमम् best one, एतं मणिम् this gem, वस्त्रात् from her cloth, मुक्त्वा untied, मह्यम् to me, ददौ gave.
data.md: Thereat, casting her looks around, she took out an excellent jewel from her cloth, worthy of being set on her braid and conferred it on me, O you of great strength.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य मणिं दिव्यं तव हेतो रघूत्तम । शिरसा संप्रणम्यैनामहमागमने त्वरे ।।
data.es: "O foremost among the Raghus I took that wonderful gem for your sake from the noble lady and offered her salutations, bowing my head, and returned quickly৷৷
data.anv: रघूद्वह foremost among the Raghus, दिव्यम् wonderful, मणिम् gem, तव हेतोः for your sake, प्रतिगृह्य took, आर्याम् from the noble lady, ताम् her, शिरसा bowing down, प्रणम्य after saluting, अहम् I, आगमने returned, त्वरे quickly.
data.md: O you, the most favourite of the Raghu race, taking for you that gem with my hands and bowing to her, I addressed myself speedily for departure.

data.v: गमने च कृतोत्साहमवेक्ष्य वरवर्णिनी । विवर्धमानं च हि मामुवाच जनकात्मजा । अश्रुपूर्णमुखी दीना बाष्पसंदिग्धभाषिणी ।।
data.es: Seeing Hanuman eager to leap, enlarging his body quickly, she appeared pitiable with her face filled with tears and throat choked.
data.anv: जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, उत्पातकृतोत्साहम् risen up eager to leap, वर्धमानम् enlarging, महावेगम् very swiftly, तं हरिपुङ्गवम् him the chief of vanaras, आवेक्ष्य looking at him, अश्रुपूर्णमुखी her face filled with tears, दीना pitiably, बाष्पगद्गदया throat choked with tears, गिरा with these words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Seeing that monkey-leader intent upon leaping up, and surcharged with energy, with his person enlarged, Janaka's daughter, with a tearful countenance, spake in woe-begone guise, her accents choked with the vapour of grief,

data.v: हनुमन्सिंहसंकाशौ तावुभौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । सुग्रीवं च सहामात्यं सर्वान्ब्रूया अनामयम् ।।
data.es: "O Hanuman the great communicate my welfare to both Rama and Lakshmana, to Sugriva, his ministers, elderly vanaras in righteous order.
data.anv: वानरश्रेष्ठः O great vanara, हनुमन् O Hanuman, सहितौ both, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः you may communicate, सहामात्यम् along with his ministers, सुग्रीवं च and Sugriva, वृद्धान् elders, सर्वान् all, वानरान् vanaras, त्वम् you, धर्मसंहितम् righteous manner, कुशलम् welfare, ब्रूयाः you may communicate
data.md: Addressing me with these words she again said-O Hanuman, do you relate my well-being to Rāma and Lakshamana of leonine prowess, and Sugrīva accompanied by his followers.

data.v: यथा च स महाबाहुर्मां तारयति राघवः । अस्माद्दुःखाम्बुसंरोधात्तत्समाधातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "You must pacify the strongarmed Rama in a manner by which he will help me to cross the ocean of grief and rlieve me.
data.anv: महाबाहुः strongarmed, सः राघवः that Rama, अस्मात् from this, दुःखाम्बुसंरोधात् relieve me from this ocean of grief, यथा that way, तारयति he helps me to cross, त्वम् you, समाधातुम् to pacify, अर्हसि you may.
data.md: Do you so describe as the large-armed Rāghava may save me from this ocean of grief.

data.v: इमं च तीव्रं मम शोकवेगं; रक्षोभिरेभिः परिभर्त्सनं च । ब्रूयास्तु रामस्य गतः समीपं; शिवश्च तेऽध्वास्तु हरिप्रवीर ।।
data.es: "Foremost vanara tell Rama about my intense grief as well as the threats of the demons. May your journey be happy.
data.anv: हरिप्रवीर foremost vanara, रामस्य to Rama, समीपम् near, गतः after going, मम my, इमम् this, तीव्रम् intense, शोकवेगम् of grief, एभिः by these, रक्षोभिः by the rakshasas, परिभर्त्सनं च threats also, ब्रूयाः you nararte, ते to you, अध्वा journey, शिवः happy, अस्तु let it be.
data.md: Do you narrate to Rāma this my terrible sorrow and the affliction by the she-demons. May good betide you, on your way, O foremost of the monkeys.'

data.v: एतत्तवार्या नृपराजसिंह; सीता वचः प्राह विषादपूर्वम् । एतच्च बुद्ध्वा गदितं मया त्वं; श्रद्धत्स्व सीतां कुशलां समग्राम् ।।
data.es: "O lion among kings noble Sita has spoken these words in grief: 'Make him know all this and tell him that Sita is faithful and safe in all respects.'इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे सप्तषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyseventh sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: पराजसिंह lion among kings, आर्या noble, सीता Sita, विषादपूर्वम् sorrowful words, एतत् वचः all these words, तव your, आह spoken, मया my, गदितम् reflecting, तत्  all this, बुद्ध्वा make him know, सीताम् Sita, समग्राम् in all respects, कुशलाम् safe, श्रद्धत्स्व have faith.
data.md: Thus the worshipful Sítă gave vent to these piteous accents. Hearing these words do you believe that it is all well with her.

data.v: अथाहमुत्तरं देव्या पुनरुक्तः ससंभ्रमम् । तव स्नेहान्नरव्याघ्र सौहार्यादनुमान्य च ।।
data.es: "O tiger among men In view of her regards for me and and her love for you she was confident and once again addressed me:
data.anv: नरव्याघ्र tiger among men, अथ and then, अहम् I, देव्या to Sita, तव your, स्नेहात् love, सौहार्दात् having affection, अनुमान्य confident, पुनः again, उत्तरम् addressed, ससम्भ्रमम् hurrying up, उक्तः said.
data.md: Thereupon, O foremost of men, out of your love and adoring me for your friendship, that worshipful dame-addressed me again, saying.

data.v: एवं बहुविधं वाच्यो रामो दाशरथिस्त्वया । यथा मामाप्नुयाच्छीघ्रं हत्वा रावणमाहवे ।।
data.es: 'You may appeal to Rama, the son of Dasaratha in many ways, that he should come quickly and slay Ravana in the battle and get me back.
data.anv: दाशरथिः Dasaratha's, रामः Rama, आहवे in battle, रावणम् Ravana, शीघ्रम् quickly, हत्वा slaying, माम् me, यथा so that, आप्नुयात् he will get me, तथा so that, एवम् in that way, बहुविधम् in many ways, वाच्यः you may appeal.
data.md: Do you thus speak every thing to Rāma, the son of Daśaratha, so that he might soon take me hence, slaying Ravana in battle.

data.v: यदि वा मन्यसे वीर वसैकाहमरिंदम । कस्मिंश्चित्संवृते देशे विश्रान्तः श्वो गमिष्यसि ।।
data.es: "O destroyer of enemies if you think of halting for a day you may do so in a solitary location and leave tomorrow.
data.anv: अरिन्दम O destroyer of enemies, वीर hero, मन्यसे यदि if you  think so, कस्मिंश्चित् some where, संवृते in a closed space, देशे in location, एकाहम् for one day, वस you may stay, विश्रान्तः rest, श्वः tomorrow, गमिष्यसि you may go.
data.md: O hero, O slayer of foes, if it please you, you may relieve yourself of the toil by living in a secret nook and then proceed to-morrow.

data.v: मम चाप्यल्पभाग्यायाः साम्निध्यात्तव वानर । अस्य शोकविपाकस्य मुहूर्तं स्याद्विमोक्षणम् ।।
data.es: "Your presence will relieve me of my suffering, if you stay here for a while.
data.anv: वानर vanara, तव your, सान्निध्यात् by the presence, अल्पभाग्यायाः of an unfortunate woman, मम to me, महतः great, अस्य शोकस्य from the suffering, मुहूर्तम् for a short while, मोक्षणम् relief, भवेत् चेत् will be.
data.md: Your vicinity, O monkey, for a while beguiles me of slender luck of my measureless grief.

data.v: गते हि त्वयि विक्रान्ते पुनरागमनाय वै । प्राणानामपि संदेहो मम स्यान्नात्र संशयः ।।
data.es: "O tiger among vanaras if you leave this place to come again, my life will be uncertain, (if your coming is uncertain). There is no doubt about it.
data.anv: हरिशार्दूल O tiger among vanaras, पुनरागमनाय for your visit once again, गते when you go, मम for me, प्राणानामपि and for my life, सन्देहः doubt, स्यात् will be, अत्र here, सन्देहः doubt, न no.
data.md: O you gifted with great prowess, yourself departing, I shall wait for your return, but doubt I very much whether I shall live till then.

data.v: तवादर्शनजः शोको भूयो मां परितापयेत् । दुःखाद्दुःखपराभूतां दुर्गतां दुःखभागिनीम् ।।
data.es: "My agony would be increased further by not seeing you. It would be inflamming my agony and I would be even more pained.
data.anv: वानर vanara, दुःखात् agonised, दुःखपरामृष्टाम् agony increased further, माम् me, तव your, अदर्शनजः not seeing you, शोकः sorrow, दीपयन्निव as if inflamming my agony, भूयः again, परितापयेत् it will trouble me.
data.md: Burnt I shall be with the fear of not beholding you again, wretched and stricken with grief as I am. And so I shall be, hereafter, overwhelmed with a mightier grief.

data.v: अयं तु वीरसंदेहस्तिष्ठतीव ममाग्रतः । सुमहांस्त्वत्सहायेषु हर्यृक्षेषु असंशयः ।।
data.es: "O heroic chief of vanaras I am doubtful as to whether vanaras and bears can extend help?
data.anv: वीर hero, हरीश्वर chief of vanaras, त्वत्सहायेषु your helpless, हर्यृक्षेषु among vanaras and bears, अयम् this, सुमहान् great, सन्देहः doubtful, मम अग्रतः in front of me, तिष्ठतीव dwells in my mind.

data.v: कथं नु खलु दुष्पारं तरिष्यन्ति महोदधिम् । तानि हर्यृक्षसैन्यानि तौ वा नरवरात्मजौ ।।
data.es: "How can the army of vanaras and bears, for that matter, princes Rama and Lakshmana negotiate the ocean, which is difficult to cross?
data.anv: तानि those, हर्यृक्षसैन्यानि army of vanaras and bears, तौ they both, Rama and Lakshmana, नरवरात्मजौ princes, दुष्पारम् difficult to cross, महोदधिम्  ocean, कथं नु how indeed, तरिष्यन्ति they can cross.
data.md: O hero, besides, I entertain a grave doubt about your assistants, the monkeys and bears. I do not know how shall the host of monkeys and bears and those two princes cross over the mighty main?

data.v: त्रयाणामेव भूतानां सागरस्यास्य लङ्घने । शक्तिः स्याद्वैनतेयस्य वायोर्वा तव वानघ ।।
data.es: "It is only three beings who have the capacity to leap over this ocean. Garuda, or you or the Windgod.
data.anv: अस्य of this, सागरस्य ocean's, लङ्घने to leap, वैनतेयस्य वा for Bainateya (Garuda) or, तव वा or you, मारुतस्य or Windgod वा or, त्रयाणाम् for these three, भूतानाम् living beings, शक्तिः energy, स्यात् have.
data.md: Three beings have the power to bound over the deep; Vinata's offspring, you, and the Windgod.

data.v: तदस्मिन्कार्यनियोगे वीरैवं दुरतिक्रमे । किं पश्यसि समाधानं ब्रूहि कार्यविदां वर ।।
data.es: "What means do you, being the foremost hero among the three who are capable performing this difficult task, foresee?
data.anv: वीर hero, तत् such, एवम् in that way, दुरतिक्रमे in a very difficult task, अस्मिन् in this, कार्यनिर्योगे the task, किम् what, समाधानम् means, पश्यसि you foresee, त्वम् you, कार्यविदाम् among those who are capable, वरः हि foremost.
data.md: Then in this business at hand hard to accomplish, what means do you, versed in business, see, whereby the end may be attained?

data.v: काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने । पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः ।।
data.es: "O slayer of enemy heroes if you alone can accomplish this task the fame of doing this will be yours.
data.anv: परवीरघ्न slayer of enemy heroes, अस्य कार्यस्य this task, परिसाधने to accomplish, त्वम् you, एक एव alone are, पर्याप्तः कामम् are competent, ते to you, फलोदयः fruit, यशस्यः of the accomplishment.
data.md: O slayer of hostile heroes, you alone are quite competent to perform this task; and you shall attain fame through your rising prowess.

data.v: बलैः समग्रैर्यदि मां हत्वा रावणमाहवे । विजयी स्वां पुरीं रामो नयेत्तत्स्याद्यशस्करम् ।।
data.es: "It would be worthy of Rama if he with his entire army emerges victorious over Ravana in a battle and takes me to his city.
data.anv: संयुगे in war, समग्रैः with  the entire, बलैः with army, रावणम् Ravana, जित्य after winning, माम् me, विजयी victorious , स्वपुरम् his own city, यायात् यदि if he can reach, तत् that, तस्य his, सदृशम् worthy of him, भवेत् will be.
data.md: But if Rāma, obtaining victory, can take me hence to his own city, it shall redound to his glory.

data.v: यथाहं तस्य वीरस्य वनादुपधिना हृता । रक्षसा तद्भयादेव तथा नार्हति राघवः ।।
data.es: 'Tell valiant Rama not to take me back the way Ravana, the demon abducted me out of fear. Which is not right.
data.anv: अहम् I am, रक्षसा by the demon, वीरस्य valiant one, उपधिना cheat, यथा like, हृता abducted, तथा that way, तद्भयादेव out of fear of, राघवः Rama, नार्हति not right.
data.md: It dose not behove the heroic Rāghava, to take me away by steal, like to Rāvaņa capturing me from the forest under a disguise.

data.v: बलैस्तु संकुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः । मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत् ।।
data.es: "If Kakutstha (Rama), slayer of the enemy army fills the entire Lanka with his arrows and takes me, then his action will be worthy of him.
data.anv: परबलार्दनः slayer of enemy army, काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, लङ्काम् Lanka, शरैः with arrows, सङ्कुलाम् an agitated place, कृत्वा does, माम् me, नयेद्यदि if he takes, तत् that, तस्य his action, सदृशम् agreeable, भवेत् will be.
data.md: Truly it shall be his becoming work, if Kākutstha, the repressor of enemy's host, can take me away, enveloping the city Lankā with his army.

data.v: तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः । भवत्याहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय ।।
data.es: "You may make arrangement in such a manner that, that great self, the hero in war makes his victorious march which is worthy of him."
data.anv: तत् that, महात्मनः of the great self, आहवशूरस्य of the hero in war, तस्य his, अनुरूपम् worthy of him, विक्रान्तम् victorious, यथा in such a way, भवेत् will be, तथा in that way, त्वम् you, उपपादय you may make arrangement.
data.md: Do you therefore initiate that work as become that high-souled hero and may display his prowess.

data.v: तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम् । निशम्याहं ततः शेषं वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रुवम् ।।
data.es: Having heard the meaningful, courteous and logical words of Sita, Hanuman replied:
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, अर्थोपहितम् meaningful, प्रश्रितम् courteous, हेतुसंहितम् logical, तत् those, वाक्यम् words, निशम्य having heard, शेषम् the rest, वाक्यम् word, अब्रवीत् said, उत्तरं in reply.
data.md: Hearing her reasonable, affectionate and pregnant speech, that hero, Hanumān, answered,

data.v: देवि हर्यृक्षसैन्यानामीश्वरः प्लवतां वरः । सुग्रीवः सत्त्वसंपन्नस्तवार्थे कृतनिश्चयः ।।
data.es: "O Devi the lord of monkeys, Sugriva heads the army of vanaras and bears. He is richly endowed with satvaguna and is determined to accomplish your cause and free you from sorrow.
data.anv: देवि Devi, हर्यृक्षसैन्यानाम् of the army of vanaras and bears, ईश्वरः lord, प्लवतां वरः foremost among monkeys, सत्त्वसम्पन्नः richly endowed with satvaguna, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, तव अर्धे for your sake, कृतनिश्चयः detemined to accomplish.
data.md: O noble lady, that lord and foremost of monkeys, Sugrīva gifted with strength, is determined on your behalf.

data.v: तस्य विक्रमसंपन्नाः सत्त्ववन्तो महाबलाः । मनःसंकल्पसंपाता निदेशे हरयः स्थिताः ।।
data.es: "Valiant, virtuous and powerful vanaras who can leap with the speed of mind are awaiting orders (of Sugriva).
data.anv: विक्रमसम्पन्नाः powerful, सत्त्ववन्तः virtuous, महाबलाः mighty, मनस्सङ्कल्पसम्पाताः who can leap with the speed of mind, हरयः vanaras, तस्य his, निदेशे at his command, स्थिताः awaiting.
data.md: He has under his command a number of mighty and courageous monkeys gifted with great prowess and quick-coursing like imagination.

data.v: येषां नोपरि नाधस्तान्न तिर्यक्सज्जते गतिः । न च कर्मसु सीदन्ति महत्स्वमिततेजसः ।।
data.es: "Their course cannot be impeded either upward, or downward or right or left. They are indeed very brilliant and would never fail in any task.
data.anv: येषाम् for those monkeys, गतिः movement, उपरि upward, न सज्जते  do not get impeded, अधस्तात्  downward, न not, तिर्यक्  horizontally, न not, अमिततेजसः very brilliant ones, महत्सु any kind, कर्मसु of task, न सीदन्ति do not care
data.md: Their course is never thwarted-whether going upwards or downwardsor moving tortuously. They are never exhausted in their actions—highly courageous and of measureless prowess.

data.v: असकृत्तैर्महाभागैर्वानरैर्बलसंयुतैः । प्रदक्षिणीकृता भूमिर्वायुमार्गानुसारिभिः ।।
data.es: "They have often circumambulated the earth including its oceans and mountains through the aerial path with great enthusiasm.
data.anv: महोत्साहैः by the enthusiastic, वायुमार्गानुसारिभिः following aerial path, तैः by them, असकृत् repeatedly, ससागरधराधरा with the oceans and mountains, भूमिः earth, प्रदक्षिणीकृता has been circumambulated.
data.md: And those great and powerful monkeys, coursing in the air, have again and again circumambulated the earth.

data.v: मद्विशिष्टाश्च तुल्याश्च सन्ति तत्र वनौकसः । मत्तः प्रत्यवरः कश्चिन्नास्ति सुग्रीवसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: "The vanaras under Sugriva who move in the forest are more powerful than me or equal to me. None is inferior to me.
data.anv: तत्र there, मद्विशिष्टाश्च more powerful than me, तुल्याश्च those equal to me, वनौकसः vanaras who move in the forest, सन्ति are, मत्तः to me, प्रत्यवरः inferior, कश्चित् not even one, सुग्रीवसन्निधौ under Sugriva, नास्ति not there.
data.md: Sugriva has many monkeys-my equal-and greater than I but none of inferior strength.

data.v: अहं तावदिह प्राप्तः किं पुनस्ते महाबलाः । न हि प्रकृष्टाः प्रेष्यन्ते प्रेष्यन्ते हीतरे जनाः ।।
data.es: "If I have managed to come here, why not the other powerful ones? The superior leaders are not sent (as messengers). Only ordinary ones like me are.
data.anv: अहं तावत् I have, इह here, अनुप्राप्तः reached, महाबलाः very powerful, ते to you, किं पुनः why not others, प्रकृष्टाः the best ones, न प्रेष्यन्ते हि will not be sent, इतरे others, जनाः ordinary ones, प्रेष्यन्ते हि will be sent.
data.md: While I have crossed over the main-what of these mighty heroes? The leading heroes are never sent on a mission but only those of inferior merit.

data.v: तदलं परितापेन देवि मन्युर्व्यपैतु ते । एकोत्पातेन ते लङ्कामेष्यन्ति हरियूथपाः ।।
data.es: "O noble lady therefore, give up your agony. Enough of your lamentation. The monkey troops will reach this place in one stride.
data.anv: देवि noble lady, तत् therefore, परितापेन with lamentation, अलम् enough, ते your, शोकः agony, व्यपैतु may be given up, ते those, हरियूथपाः monkey troops, एकोत्पातेन in one stride, लङ्काम् to Lanka, एष्यन्ति will reach.
data.md: No more of bewailing, O worshipful dame. Do you remove your grief. And with one leap these leaders of monkey-hosts shall reach Lankā.

data.v: मम पृष्ठगतौ तौ च चन्द्रसूर्याविवोदितौ । त्वत्सकाशं महाभागे नृसिंहावागमिष्यतः ।।
data.es: "Both the valiant Rama and Lakshmana, lions among men, looking brilliant like Sun and Moon will come to you riding on my back.
data.anv: महासत्त्वौ both great men, नृसिंहौ both lions among men, तौ च and both, मम my, पृष्ठगतौ on my back, उदितौ just risen, चन्द्रसूर्याविव like Sun and Moon, त्वत्सकाशम् to your presence, आगमिष्यतः will come.
data.md: O great damsel, these two princes, placing themselves on my back shall come to you like to the rising Sun and Moon.

data.v: अरिघ्नं सिंहसंकाशं क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम् । लक्ष्मणं च धनुष्पाणिं लङ्का द्वारमुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: "Very soon you would see the slayer of foes, who is an accomplished wielder of the bow (Rama) along with Lakshmana at the entrance of Lanka.
data.anv: लङ्काद्वारम् at the entrance of Lanka, उपागतम् reached, अरिघ्नम् slayer of foes, कृतात्मानम् an accomplished man, तं राघवम् that Rama, धनुष्पाणिम् wielder of bow, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, क्षिप्रम् very soon, द्रक्ष्यसि you will see.
data.md: You shall soon behold before Lanka's gate Rāghava the slayer of foes resembling a lion and Lakşmana with a bow in his hand.

data.v: नखदंष्ट्रायुधान्वीरान्सिंहशार्दूलविक्रमान् । वानरान्वानरेन्द्राभान्क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि संगतान् ।।
data.es: "You will soon see heroic vanaras whose weapons are their teeth, who are like lion and tiger in their valour. They are (mighty) like wellbred elephants.
data.anv: शैलाम्बुदनिकाशानाम् like rainclouds on the mountain, लङ्कामलयसानुषु Lanka's mountain Malaya, नर्दताम् roaring like lion, कपिमुख्यानाम् generals of monkey army, स्वनम् sounds, अचारत् making, श्रोष्यसि will hear.
data.md: You shall soon observe in a band the heroic monkeys, gifted with the strength of lions and tigers, and having nails and teeth for their weapons.

data.v: शैलाम्बुदन्निकाशानां लङ्कामलयसानुषु । नर्दतां कपिमुख्यानामचिराच्छोष्यसे स्वनम् ।।
data.es: "O respectable lady you would see many troops of vanara chiefs who resemble clouds hovering on the mountain peaks of Lankaroaring.
data.anv: आर्ये respectable lady, शैलाम्बुदनिकाशानाम् whose body is like clouds on mountain, नर्दताम् of the roaring, कपिमुख्यानाम् of the chiefs of vanaras, अनेकशः  in many ways, यूधानि troops, लङ्कामलयसानुषु on the  mountain of Lanka.
data.md: You shall soon bear the roaring of the leading monkeys on the summit of mount Malaya, resembling the muttering of the clouds.

data.v: निवृत्तवनवासं च त्वया सार्धमरिंदमम् । अभिषिक्तमयोध्यायां क्षिप्रं द्रक्ष्यसि राघवम् ।।
data.es: 'You will soon see Rama, the slayer of enemies crowned as king of Ayodhya with you, having duly completed the term of exile in the forest'.
data.anv: निवृत्तवनवासम् completing the exile in the forest, अरिन्दमम् slayer of enemies, अयोध्यायाम् in Ayodhya, त्वया सार्धम् along with you, अभिषिक्तम् crowned, राघवम् Rama, क्षिप्रम् soon, द्रक्ष्यसि will see.
data.md: You shall soon behold Rāghava, the slayer of foes, installed along with you on the throne of Ayodhya after returning from the forest.

data.v: ततो मया वाग्भिरदीनभाषिणी; शिवाभिरिष्टाभिरभिप्रसादिता । जगाम शान्तिं मम मैथिलात्मजा; तवापि शोकेन तथाभिपीडिता ।।
data.es: "Sita though afflicted heard from me that you were also in excessive grief on account of separation from her and from my soothing, auspicious and welcome words, she derived comfort and remained quiet"৷৷इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे अष्टषष्टितमस्सर्गः।।Thus ends the sixtyeighth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः then, तव your, शोकेनापि also in grief, तदा then, अभिपीडिता much grief, मैथिलात्मजा princess of Mithila, अदीनभाषिणा soothing words, मया of me, शिवाभिः auspicious also, इष्टाभिः welcome, मम my, वाग्भि: words, अभिप्रसादिता having spoken, शान्तिम् quiet, जगाम became.
data.md: That daughter of the king of Mithilā although heavily laden with sorrow in your absence was greatly comforted and pleased by my auspicious words boding the fulfilment of her desire.

data.v: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं यथावदभिभाषितम् । रामः प्रीतिसमायुक्तो वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Having heard Hanuman's words, full of love, Rama replied.
data.anv: रामः Rama, यथावत्:  in that manner, अभिभाषितम् : spoken , हनुमतः by Hanuman, वाक्यम्: words,श्रुत्वा: having heard, प्रीतिसमायुक्तः filled with love, उत्तरम: replied, वाक्यम्: words, अब्रवीत्: said
data.md: Hearing the words of Hanumän rehearsed properly, Rāma, exceedingly delighted, said.

data.v: कृतं हनुमता कार्यं सुमहद्भुवि दुष्करम् । मनसापि यदन्येन न शक्यं धरणीतले ।।
data.es: "Hanuman You have performed a mighty task indeed, which is difficult even to think of in this world and not possible for any one else on this earth."
data.anv: हनुमता: Hanuman, यत्: such , धरणीतले: on this earth, अन्येन:  by any one, मनसापि:  even to think, नशक्यम्: not possible, सुमहत्: mighty, भुवि: world, दुर्लभम्: difficult, कार्यम्: task, कृतम्: has performed.
data.md: By Hanumān has been performed a very great deed, rare on earth, and one incapable of being even conceived by any other in the world.

data.v: न हि तं परिपश्यामि यस्तरेत महार्णवम् । अन्यत्र गरुणाद्वायोरन्यत्र च हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "None else than Garuda or Vayu have I seen to have crossed this great ocean crossed by you, Hanuman."
data.anv: गरुडात्: by Garuda( the vehicle of Visnu ), वायोः by windgod, अन्यत्र:  anyone other than, हनूमतः by Hanuman, अन्यत्र:  none other than, यः this, महार्णवम्: great ocean, तरेत:  can  cross, हि: indeed, परिपश्यामि: not seen
data.md: Save Garuda and the Wind-god, and save also Hanumān, him find I not who cross the wide ocean.

data.v: देवदानवयक्षाणां गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम् । अप्रधृष्यां पुरीं लङ्कां रावणेन सुरक्षिताम् ।।
data.es: "Indeed, who has the strength to return alive after entering that city highly protected by Ravana. It is unimaginable even for devas, danavas, yakshas, gandharvas, uragas and rakshasas to cross."
data.anv: देवदानवयक्षाणाम्: for devas, danavas, yakshas, गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम्गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम् gandharvas ,uragas , rakshasas, अप्रधृष्याम्: unimaginable to  cross, रावणेन: by Ravana, सुरक्षिताम्: highly protected, पुरीम्: city, सत्त्वम्: strength, आश्रित्य:  resorted, प्रविष्टः enter, को नाम: who indeed, श्वसन्: life, निष्क्रमेत्: can return
data.md: Entering by main force the city of Larkā, incapable of being subjugated by the gods and Dänavas and Yaksas, the Gandharvas, serpents or Raksasas, and well protected by Ravana, who, living, come out (of it)?

data.v: प्रविष्टः सत्त्वमाश्रित्य जीवन्को नाम निष्क्रमेत् । को विशेत्सुदुराधर्षां राक्षसैश्च सुरक्षिताम् । यो वीर्यबलसंपन्नो न समः स्याद्धनूमतः ।।
data.es: "Except for Hanuman, who is abounding in valour and strength, it is not possible for others to enter the inaccessible Lanka highly protected by rakshasas."
data.anv: यः  he who , वीर्यबलसम्पन्नः abounding in valour and strength, हनूमतः Hanuman, नस्यात्: not possible , कः which सुदुराधर्षाम्: inaccessible, राक्षसैः by rakshasas, सुरक्षिताम्: highly protected, विशेत्: to enter
data.md: Who that is not the compeer of Hanuman in strength and prowess, even enters into (Lankā) hard to subdue, and carefully guarded by the Raksasas?

data.v: भृत्यकार्यं हनुमता सुग्रीवस्य कृतं महत् । एवं विधाय स्वबलं सदृशं विक्रमस्य च ।।
data.es: "Hanuman, with his mighty form and valour not only carried out a great task assigned by Sugriva but also what had to be done as duty."
data.anv: हनुमता: Hanuman, विक्रमस्य: by his valour, सदृशम्:  mighty form, स्वबलम्: own strength, विधाय: what ought to be done,  सुग्रीवस्य: Sugriva's, महत्: great, भृत्यकार्यम्: task assigned, कृतम्: carried out
data.md: Having put forth his strength commensurate with his prowess, Hanuman has also performed a great act befitting a servant on behold of Sugriva.* SO *Having seen Sītā, which was all that he had been commissioned to do by Sugrīva, Hanumān has destroyed Räkşasas and burnt Lankā; and this he did of himself like a good servant.

data.v: यो हि भृत्यो नियुक्तः सन्भर्त्रा कर्मणि दुष्करे । कुर्यात्तदनुरागेण तमाहुः पुरुषोत्तमम् ।।
data.es: "He, who carries out a formidable task entrusted to him by the master, with love is said to be the best among men."
data.anv: यः he who, भृत्यः servant, दुष्करे: formidable, कर्मणि: task, भर्त्रा: master, नियुक्तः entrusted by, सन्: bestow, तत्: that, अनुरागेण: with love, कुर्यात्: does, तम्: him, पुरुषोत्तमम्: the best among men, आहुः is said to be
data.md: That servant who, being entrusted with a hard task, after having accomplished it, do another work in pursuance of (the prescribed business), is the best of men.

data.v: नियुक्तो नृपतेः कार्यं न कुर्याद्यः समाहितः । भृत्यो युक्तः समर्थश्च तमाहुः पुरुषाधमम् ।।
data.es: An efficient servant does not only do what is asked but also does the work dear to the king. One who does not do so is said to be mediocre.
data.anv: यः he, भृत्यः is a servant, समर्थ: efficient, अभृत्य: not a servant, नियुक्तः told, नृपते: by king, प्रियम्:  dear, कार्यम्: work, परम्: other, नकुर्यात्: does not do, तम्: him, नरम्: mediocre, अहु: said to be
data.md: That servant who, entrusted with any work of the king do not, although competent, heedfully accomplish the same, has been called the worst.

data.v: तन्नियोगे नियुक्तेन कृतं कृत्यं हनूमता । न चात्मा लघुतां नीतः सुग्रीवश्चापि तोषितः ।।
data.es: "Having done the task assigned to him, Hanuman carried out what had to be done and accomplished without difficulty. This made Sugriva also happy."
data.anv: तत्: that, नियोगे:  assigned, नियुक्तेन:  which is favourable, हनूमता: Hanuman, कृत्यम्: had to be done, कृतम्:  having accomplished, आत्मा: on his own, लघुताम् :difficulty, न: not, नीतः  carried out  सुग्रीवश्चापि: even to Sugriva, तोषितः made happy
data.md: Anent the order (which he had received), Hanuman has done the work (and more). He has not been humbled,* and, further, he has pleased Sugriva. *By the Raksasas.

data.v: अहं च रघुवंशश्च लक्ष्मणश्च महाबलः । वैदेह्या दर्शनेनाद्य धर्मतः परिरक्षिताः ।।
data.es: "On Hanuman finding Vaidehi, I and, mighty Lakshmana and the whole of Raghu dynasty are now rightfully protected."
data.anv: वैदेह्या: Vaidehi's, दर्शनेन: by seeing, अद्य: now, अहं च: I am also, रघुवंशश्च: those of Raghu dynasty, महाबलः mighty, लक्ष्मणश्च: Lakshmana's, धर्मतः rightfully, परिरक्षिताः  protected.
data.md: And by seeing Vaidehī, (Hanumān) has, while reaping righteousness, saved me, the Raghu race, and the highly powerful Lakşmaņa.

data.v: इदं तु मम दीनस्या मनो भूयः प्रकर्षति । यदिहास्य प्रियाख्यातुर्न कुर्मि सदृशं प्रियम् ।।
data.es: "On the other hand, it is a pity that I am not able to please such a person who has spoken pleasing words. Further this causes grief to me."
data.anv: तु: on the other hand, प्रियाख्यातुः  who has spoken pleasing words, अस्य: to him, सदृशम्:  to see, प्रियम्: pleasing, यत् न कुर्मि:  not able to do to such person, इदम्: this, दीनस्य: piteous, मम: me, मनः mind भूयः further, प्रकर्षति: causing exceedingly
data.md: This pain my mind sore, that I cannot do a like benefit, returning this dear office of his.

data.v: एष सर्वस्वभूतस्तु परिष्वङ्गो हनूमतः । मया कालमिमं प्राप्य दत्तस्तस्य महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "To such a great one who attained success at this time, everything can be given. I give my embrace."

data.md: Embrace express the all (of the Deicy),* and, finding this occasion, I extend my embrace to the high-souled Hanumān. *The commentator explains this obscure passage after his own orthodox fashion. The gist is this. Delight is the essence of the Deity, and all His incarnations body forth this. Embrace is typical of this emotion.

data.v: सर्वथा सुकृतं तावत्सीतायाः परिमार्गणम् । सागरं तु समासाद्य पुनर्नष्टं मनो मम ।।
data.es: "By all means good work was done in searching for Sita. On the contrary, having succeeded, my mind is once again agitated when I think of (crossing) the ocean."
data.anv: सीतायाः Sita's, परिमार्गणम्: in searching, सर्वथा: by all means, सुकृतम्: good work, तु: but( on the contrary), सागरम्: ocean, समासाद्य : having succeeded, मम मनः my mind, पुनः again, नष्टम्: fear
data.md: Complete success has been attained anent the search of Sītā. But when I think of the ocean, my mind is again sunk in dejection.

data.v: कथं नाम समुद्रस्य दुष्पारस्य महाम्भसः । हरयो दक्षिणं पारं गमिष्यन्ति समाहिताः ।।
data.es: "How will all the monkeys together be able to cross to the southern shore of the vast ocean? It is difficult to cross."
data.anv: समागताः come together, हरय: monkeys, दुष्पारस्य: difficult to cross, महाम्भसः vast ocean, समुद्रस्य: ocean's, दक्षिणम्: southern, पारम्: shore, कथम्: how can, गमिष्यन्ति: be able to cross
data.md: How can the assembled monkeys go over to the southern shore of the vastly deep, difficult to cross?

data.v: यद्यप्येष तु वृत्तान्तो वैदेह्या गदितो मम । समुद्रपारगमने हरीणां किमिवोत्तरम् ।।
data.es: "This has been told to me by Vaidehi. How will the monkeys cross the ocean(enquired Vaidehi)."

data.md: This tidings you have related to me touching Vaidehī; but what are the monkeys to do next avout crossing the sea?

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा शोकसंभ्रान्तो रामः शत्रुनिबर्हणः । हनूमन्तं महाबाहुस्ततो ध्यानमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Agitated with sorrow, mighty armed Rama, the destroyer of enemies approached Hanuman and reflected (about the crossing of the ocean).
data.anv: शत्रुनिबर्हणः destroyer of enemy, महाबाहुः  mighty armed, रामः Rama , हनूमन्तम्: at Hanuman, इति: thus, उक्त्वा: said, शोकसंभ्रान्तः agitated with sorrow, ध्यानम्: reflected, उपागमत्: approaching
data.md: Having said this to Hanumān, that slayer of foes, the mighty-armed Rāma, agitated by anxiety, was then plunged in thought.

data.v: तं तु शोकपरिद्यूनं रामं दशरथात्मजम् । उवाच वचनं श्रीमान्सुग्रीवः शोकनाशनम् ।।
data.es: Glorious Sugriva spoke such words of advice to remove the agony of Rama,son of Dasaratha, who was filled with sorrow.
data.anv: श्रीमान्: glorious, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शोकपरिद्यूनम्: one who is filled with sorrow, दशरथात्मजम्: Dasaratha's son, तम्:  him, रामम्: at Rama, शोकनाशनम्: to remove the agony , वचनम्: words of advice, उवाच: spoke
data.md: Then the graceful Sugrīva spoke words capable of soothing sorrow, to Dasaratha's son, Rāma, who was wrought up with grief.

data.v: किं त्वं संतप्यसे वीर यथान्यः प्राकृतस्तथा । मैवं भूस्त्यज संतापं कृतघ्न इव सौहृदम् ।।
data.es: "Heroic Rama Why are you grieving like a common man? Give up your grief just like an ungrateful one gives up friendship."
data.anv: वीर: heroic, अन्यः like others , प्राकृतः common man, यथा: likewise, तथा: that way, त्वया: by you, किम्: why, तप्यते: give up grief, एवम्: that way, माभूः do not be, एवम: like this , कृतघ्नः ungrateful one, इव: like that, सन्तापम्: grief, त्यज: give up सौहृदम्: friendship
data.md: Why, O hero, does you grieve, like one that is base? Let not this be so. Chase away you grief, even as an ingrate resign amity.

data.v: संतापस्य च ते स्थानं न हि पश्यामि राघव । प्रवृत्तावुपलब्धायां ज्ञाते च निलये रिपोः ।।
data.es: "Raghava Having secured the information (of Sita) and known the location of the enemy's residence, I do not see the reason for your mourning."
data.anv: राघव: Raghava, प्रवृत्तौ: information , उपलब्धायाम्: having secured,ज्ञाते: knowing, चनिलयेरिपोः and the enemy's residence, सन्तापस्य: mourning, स्थानम्: location, नपश्यामिहि: I do not see the reason
data.md: Nor, O Rāghava, when the whereabouts of Sītă has been discovered, and when too the abode itself of the foe has been known, do I perceive the reason of your sorrow.

data.v: धृतिमाञ्शास्त्रवित्प्राज्ञः पण्डितश्चासि राघव । त्यजेमां पापिकां बुद्धिं कृत्वात्मेवार्थदूषणीम् ।।
data.es: "Raghava You are an intellectual, well versed in Sastras, wise and learned. Give up this sinful thought just as the one who is efficient gives up the one who violates subtle truth."

data.md: You, O Raghava, are intelligent, conversant with learning, wise, and judicious. Do you cast away this sorry way of thinking, even as a selfcontrolled (ascetic) caste away any course of thought interfering with the attainment of his purpose.

data.v: समुद्रं लङ्घयित्वा तु महानक्रसमाकुलम् । लङ्कामारोहयिष्यामो हनिष्यामश्च ते रिपुम् ।।
data.es: "If we cross over that ocean infested with huge crocodiles and ascend the fortress of Lanka, know that the enemy is killed."

data.md: Crossing over the ocean swarming with gigantic alligators, we shall enter Lankā and slay the enemy.

data.v: निरुत्साहस्य दीनस्य शोकपर्याकुलात्मनः । सर्वार्था व्यवसीदन्ति व्यसनं चाधिगच्छति ।।
data.es: "One who is despondent, dejected and overwhelmed with grief, will be dispirited in all matters. Not only that with worry he will meet with disaster."

data.md: Of a person that is dispirited and poor in pluck and that has his soul overwhelmed with grief, every interest droops, and he comes by misfortunes (one after another).

data.v: इमे हि समरे शूरा हरयः कामरूपिणः । तदलं विक्लवा बुद्धी राजन्सर्वार्थनाशनी ।।
पुरुषस्य हि लोकेऽस्मिञ्शोकः शौर्यापकर्षणः । यत्तु कार्यं मनुष्येण शौण्डीर्यमवलम्बता । शूराणां हि मनुष्याणां त्वद्विधानां महात्मनाम् ।।
विनष्टे वा प्रनष्टे वा शोकः सर्वार्थनाशनः । त्वं तु बुद्धिमतां श्रेष्ठः सर्वशास्त्रार्थकोविदः ।।
मद्विधैः सचिवैः सार्थमरिं जेतुमिहार्हसि । न हि पश्याम्यहं कंचित्त्रिषु लोकेषु राघव ।।
गृहीतधनुषो यस्ते तिष्ठेदभिमुखो रणे । वानरेषु समासक्तं न ते कार्यं विपत्स्यते ।।
अचिराद्द्रक्ष्यसे सीतां तीर्त्वा सागरमक्षयम् । तदलं शोकमालम्ब्य क्रोधमालम्ब भूपते ।।
निश्चेष्टाः क्षत्रिया मन्दाः सर्वे चण्डस्य बिभ्यति । लङ्गनार्थं च घोरस्य समुद्रस्य नदीपतेः ।।

किमुक्त्वा बहुधा चापि सर्वथा विजयी भवान् ।।
data.es: "Of what use is speaking many words. By all means you will be victorious. I see signs of it and feel highly delighted in my mind."।।इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेद्वितीयस्सर्गः।।This is the end of the second Sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic,the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.

data.md: To-day the Northern Phālguni (is in the ascendant); and to-morrow the moon shall be in conjunction with Hasta.* O Sugriva, shall we set our, surrounded by the entire host? *Hastā sprung from Punarvasu is the star of doom, portending death to Rāvana. The Northern Phālguni, is Sita's natal star. The expedition begun during the influence of this star, augurs deliverance to Vaidehi.
