data.v: फलमूलवता नील शीतकाननवारिणा । पथा मधुमता चाशु सेनां सेनापते नय ।।
data.es: "O Nila, the chief of the army Go fast with the army along the way which has plenty of fruits and roots, shady forests and cool water and sweet smelling honey".
data.anv: सेनापते O Chief of the army, नील Nila, फलमूलवता with abundance of fruits and roots, शीतकाननवारिणा shady forests with cool water, मधुमता with sweet smelling honey, पथा way, अशु you swiftly , सेनाम् army, नय leading
data.md: O Nīla, do you, O general, expeditiously take the army by a path furnished with fruits and roots, having cool waters of the woods, and replenished with honey.

data.v: दूषयेयुर्दुरात्मानः पथि मूलफलोदकम् । राक्षसाः परिरक्षेथास्तेभ्यस्त्वं नित्यमुद्यतः ।।
data.es: "Evilminded one, the lord of rakshasas will spoil the roots, fruits and water (on the way). Be ever alert and protect them".
data.anv: दुरात्मानः evil minded, राक्षसाः rakshasa, पथि lord, मूलफलोदकम् roots fruits and water, दूषयेयुः will spoil, त्वम् you, नित्यम् ever, उद्यतः be alert, तेभ्यः from them, परिरक्षेथाः protect
data.md: The wicked Raksasas vitiate* fruits, roots and water along the way. You, ever not the alert, should preserve these from the Rākṣasa. *By means of poison, etc.

data.v: निम्नेषु वनदुर्गेषु वनेषु च वनौकसः । अभिप्लुत्याभिपश्येयुः परेषां निहतं बलम् ।।
data.es: "O Vanaras You should even look for (the rakshasas) in the low lying lands, in inaccessible water sources, in forests and also beyond sight leaping up to the sky".
data.anv: वनौकसः inhabitants of woods, vanaras, निम्नेषु in low lying lands, वनदुर्गेषु in inaccessible water sources, वनेषु च and in forests, अभिप्लुत्य by leaping up to sky परेषाम् beyond sight, निहितम् placed, बलम् army, अभिपश्येयुः should even look for
data.md: And, bounding down into hollow places, mountain-fastnesses, and woods, let the rangers of the wilds, spy the posted detachments of the enemy.

data.v: सागरौघनिभं भीममग्रानीकं महाबलाः । कपिसिंहा प्रकर्षन्तु शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।।
data.es: "These hundreds and thousands of lionlike vanaras would walk in groups leading the army like the fierce tides of the ocean".
data.anv: शतशः hundred, अथ this, सहस्रशः thousands, महाबलाः very powerful, कपिसिंहाः lions among vanaras, सागरौघनिभम् like the tides of the ocean भीमम् fierce, अग्रानीकम् leading, प्रकर्षन्तु would walk in groups.
data.md: Therefore let the foremost monkeys gifted with prodigious prowess lead forth like a host of terrible ocean, the choice portion of the army, numbering hundreds and thousands.

data.v: गजश्च गिरिसंकाशो गवयश्च महाबलः । गवाक्षश्चाग्रतो यान्तु गवां दृप्ता इवर्षभाः ।।
data.es: "Gaja who is like a mountain in form, Gavaya, the mighty strong and Gavaksha would go like proud bulls that lead the cows".
data.anv: गिरिसङ्काशः one in the form of a mountain,गजश्च Gaja, महाबलः mighty strong, गवयश्च Gavaya, गवाक्षश्च and Gavaksha, दृप्तः proud, ऋषभः bulls,गवाम् इव like the cows,अग्रतः that go in front, यातु would go
data.md: And let Gaja resembling a hill, and the exceedingly powerful Gavaya, and that monkey, Gavaksa, master of the leaping ones,* like a haughty bull among kine, go in the van of the monkey-host. *i.e. monkeys.

data.v: यातु वानरवाहिन्या वानरः प्लवतां पतिः । पालयन्दक्षिणं पार्श्वमृषभो वानरर्षभः ।।
data.es: "Let the vanara called Rshaba the foremost among the leaping vanaras, take charge of the right side of the army".
data.anv: प्लवतां वरः foremost among the leaping animals, वानरर्षभाः bull among the vanaras, ऋषभः वानरः vanara called Rshaba, वानरवाहिन्याः army of vanaras, दक्षिणम् right, पार्श्वम् side, पालयन् take charge, यातु may be
data.md: And let that foremost of monkeys, Rşabha, go, protecting the right wing (of the army); and let Gandha, irresistible like an elephant with the fragrant temporal juice trickling down, and the vehement Gandhamādana, go,* protecting the left wing (of the monkey-army). *The verb is singular, instead of dual, as also the qualifying epithet, Pārsamadishthita. But the sense is clear. on

data.v: गन्धहस्तीव दुर्धर्षस्तरस्वी गन्धमादनः । यातु वानरवाहिन्याः सव्यं पार्श्वमधिष्ठितः ।।
data.es: "Let Gandhamadana, the unassailable and powerful vanara resembling the elephant in rut take charge of the left portion of the army".
data.anv: गन्धहस्तीव among the elephants in rut, दुर्धर्षः unassailable one, तरस्वी powerful, गन्धमादनः Gandhamadana, वानरवाहिन्याः the vanara army, वामम् left , पार्श्वम् portion, अधिष्ठितः rule, यातु would do
data.md: And let that foremost of monkeys, Rşabha, go, protecting the right wing (of the army); and let Gandha, irresistible like an elephant with the fragrant temporal juice trickling down, and the vehement Gandhamādana, go,* protecting the left wing (of the monkey-army). *The verb is singular, instead of dual, as also the qualifying epithet, Pārsamadishthita. But the sense is clear. on

data.v: यास्यामि बलमध्येऽहं बलौघमभिहर्षयन् । अधिरुह्य हनूमन्तमैरावतमिवेश्वरः ।।
data.es: "Like the lord of gods riding on Iravatam I would mount on Hanuman and reach the centre of the army encouraging the army."
data.anv: अहम् I, ईश्वरः lord of gods, ऐरावतमिव like the Iravatam, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, अधिरुह्य mounting on , बलौघम् for the army , अभिहर्षयन् encouraging, बलमध्ये in the centre of the army, यास्यामि would come
data.md: And, cheering the army, I myself, mounted on Hanumān, like the Lord (mounted) on Airāvata, shall march in the midst of the forces.

data.v: अङ्गदेनैष संयातु लक्ष्मणश्चान्तकोपमः । सार्वभौमेण भूतेशो द्रविणाधिपतिर्यथा ।।
data.es: "Let Lakshmana who is like Anthaka (one who excels death) ride on Angada, like the lord of wealth (Kubera) rides on the elephant Saarvabhauma (the elephant that guards the four quarters)".
data.anv: अन्तकोपमः like Anthaka, एषः in that way लक्ष्मणश्च Lakshmana also , भूतेशः lord of beings, द्रविणाधिपतिः lord of wealth, सार्वभौमेन यथा like Saarvabhauma(the elephant of Kubera), अङ्गदेन on Angada, संयातु follow
data.md: Like the lord of wealth and master of riches, mounted Sārvabhauma, let Lakşmaņa resembling the Destroyer, march forth, mounted on Angada.

data.v: जाम्बवांश्च सुषेणश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः । ऋक्षराजो महासत्त्वः कुक्षिं रक्षन्तु ते त्रयः ।।
data.es: "Let Rksharaja the mighty strong Jambavan and Sushena even Vegadarsi protect the rear side (of the army)".
data.anv: ऋक्षराजः Rksharaja, महासत्त्वः mighty strong, जाम्बवांश्च even Jambavan, सुषेणश्च and Sushena, वेगदर्शि Vegadarsi, वानरश्च ते those vanaras, त्रयः three, कुक्षिम् rear side, रक्षन्तु protect
data.md: And let that king of bears, the long-armed Jāmbavān, Sușeņa, and the monkey, Vegadarci, protect the rear (of the forces).

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सुग्रीवो वाहिनीपतिः । व्यादिदेश महावीर्यान्वानरान्वानरर्षभः ।।
data.es: Sugriva the bull among vanaras having heard the words of Raghava ordered the heroic vanaras (to start).
data.anv: राघवस्य Raghava's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा having heard, वाहिनीपतिः lord of vanaras, वानरर्षभः bull among vanaras, महावीर्यः highly heroic, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, वानरान् to vanaras, व्यादिदेश ordered
data.md: Hearing Rāghava's words, that foremost of monkeys and lord of the army, the exceedingly energetic Sugrīva, issued his orders.

data.v: ते वानरगणाः सर्वे समुत्पत्य युयुत्सवः । गुहाभ्यः शिखरेभ्यश्च आशु पुप्लुविरे तदा ।।
data.es: Then all the heroic monkeys who were eager for combat jumped down from the caves, mountain peaks and trees.
data.anv: तदा then, युयुत्सवः who were eager to combat, सर्वे all,ते of them, वानरगणाः vanara groups, समुत्पत्य jumped down, गुहाभ्यः from the caves, शिखरेभ्यश्च from mountain peaks, आशु from trees, पुप्लुविरे heroic monkeys
data.md: And anon those highly powerful monkeys issuing up from caves and mountain-summits, began to bound (on all sides).

data.v: ततो वानरराजेन लक्ष्मणेन च पूजितः । जगाम रामो धर्मात्मा ससैन्यो दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
data.es: There after righteous Rama who is well respected by the king of vanaras and also by Lakshmana, who is wellversed in polity once again spoke.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, वानरराजेन by the king of vanaras, लक्ष्मणेन च by Lakshmana, पूजितः one who is worshipped, धर्मात्मा righteous, रामः Rama, ससैन्यः along with the army, दक्षिणां दिशम् south direction, जगाम went
data.md: Then honoured by the monkey-king as well as Lakşmaņa, the righteous Rāma, understanding the import of things, again said.

data.v: शतैः शतसहस्रैश्च कोटीभिरयुतैरपि । वारणाभिश्च हरिभिर्ययौ परिवृतस्तदा ।।
data.es: Protected by hundreds and thousands, even crores of vanaras and surrounded by a myriad of vanaras Rama went.
data.anv: तदा then, वारणाभै protected by, शतैः hundreds, शतसहस्रैः hundred thousands, कोटिभिश्च even crores, अयुतैरपि a myriad, हरिभिः vanaras, परिवृतः ययौ surrounded by.
data.md: He marched, surrounded by hundreds and thousands, Koțis and Ayutas of monkeys resembling elephants.
